669163826.name: Give a chance to Barra Vieja
669163826.author: a TripAdvisor user
669163826.reviewBody:
The name doesn’t pay homage to this beautiful beach. Nothing like the crowded Costera Miguel Alemán.
Come to Barra Vieja and just enjoy the sea, the view, the place and the people.
Eat at the local restaurants, visit the “tortuguero”, the turtle rescue place “Amigos del Mar” to learn about the efforts and actions locals do to protect turtles.
Stay at Mareva, a beautiful hotel boutique owned by two awesome seniors or just walk around to enjoy the sand, the sun and the sea.
I have been here twice this year, having such a great time both times makes me come back for the summer.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

666696903.name: Family Vacation
666696903.author: a TripAdvisor user
666696903.reviewBody: Great place to visit if you want to get some peace and away from Chaos and traffice. Beto\'s Godoy best place to eat. Have a great variety of food authentic mexican. Pescado a la talla the best.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

647147051.name: Nice Beach
647147051.author: a TripAdvisor user
647147051.reviewBody: This beach is very clean and the water is very nice for swimming in the high sun that you get everyday in Acapulco. Always be careful of the under current that comes in and goes out. If you don\'tbog out to deep, this will not be an issue.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

617412615.name: Vacaciones and honeymoon
617412615.author: a TripAdvisor user
617412615.reviewBody: If u travel to Acapulco, you definitely have to visit Barra vieja and eat there the best red fish a la talla and the lobster are Amezing !!!! And get a massage on the beach along with driving 4x4 whelers.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

605704144.name: Beto Godoy
605704144.author: a TripAdvisor user
605704144.reviewBody: Over rated restaurant, just too expensive, old, dirty, rusty and with poor maintenance. You better go to a McDonalds or a Vips restaurant

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

591953861.name: Beach and Sea at it\'s best.
591953861.author: a TripAdvisor user
591953861.reviewBody: Many on-the-beach restaurants with home cooked food. Sun-shaded tables. Easy frolic in the sea but don\'t swim out as there is a serious current.  Unless you want to try and be rescued, This happened for a group of 4 swimmers while we were there, lots of excitement, then joy when rescued. You can get an Incredible massage on the beach, 300 pesos for half an hour. and WOW 4 hands for 400 pesos.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

588607260.name: This is a must.  Every visitor in Acapuco should spend a day at "Barra Vieja Beach".
588607260.author: a TripAdvisor user
588607260.reviewBody: "Barra Vieja Beach" is one of the most traditional sites that exist in Acapulco.\nIt is located between "Tres Palos Lagoon and the Pacific Ocean"; facing the Ocean,  it has the most traditional local sea food restaurantes.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

551305863.name: PARADISE!
551305863.author: a TripAdvisor user
551305863.reviewBody: If you are a beach lover and wish to GET AWAY from the crowds this is your place! We have been here several times over the years and its our fav! The town offers many beach bars, restaurants and places to kick back with a hammock and enjoy the day in or out of the sun! We love it and hope it does not turn into all high rises in the future- we love it the way it is! PARADISE! SALUD AMIGOS!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

549571487.name: Amazing beaches
549571487.author: a TripAdvisor user
549571487.reviewBody: This is an amazing beach lines with awesome restaurants. The waves are beautiful and the water is clean. Nice soft sand. Beautiful sunset!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

541876850.name: I love the sea
541876850.author: a TripAdvisor user
541876850.reviewBody: It\'s a great place to spend with your family far away from the civilization, and it\'s great to watch the sunset there

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

540150417.name: Romantic Sunset Dinner
540150417.author: a TripAdvisor user
540150417.reviewBody: Our guide and driver took us to a beautiful and romantic dinner at Esmirna Del Mar located on the beautiful beach of Barra Vieja. The sunsets here are divine and the pescado a la talla was just out of this world. Barra Vieja is amazing to spend the day in the sand, soaking the sun and enjoying some great fresh seafood. I definitely recommend this place!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

518893503.name: Love quiet and authentic Acapulco lifestyle
518893503.author: a TripAdvisor user
518893503.reviewBody: Meet and live first hand the authentic greeting from native Acapulco  people.  Food and service are great and never had a food problem at any of their restaurants. Also they have palapas and fro the smallest fee you get a long chair to sunbathe. Try the Pescado al mojo de ajo or Pescado a la talla, both are DELICIOUS!!  A flavour you wont find elsewhere.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

506924198.name: Great place to relax with a margarita in hand and soft smells of roasting fish wafting by
506924198.author: a TripAdvisor user
506924198.reviewBody: Barra Vieja is an off-the-beaten-path beach that will get you away from the crowds and the expensive prices found in Acapulco.  Its relaxing and conducive for soft talk, drinks, and great seafood with your friends.  The waves are too rough to get into, but you can stroll along the sand and get your feet wet while admiring the scenic Pacific ocean.  The food and the reduced crowds are the draw, however.  The downside is that it\'s a bit hard to get to, but if you have a car or can hire transportation, it\'s worth the trek.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

474987234.name: Great Open Ocean Views
474987234.author: a TripAdvisor user
474987234.reviewBody: Great beaches south of Acapulco Diamant\u00e9 area. Lots of food choices here. Fresh catch of the day. I highly recommend the red snapper(guachinango). They will prepare everything to your liking. A word of caution here the ocean is open here if you\'re not a good swimmer stick with the local swimming pools scattered throughout this area, next to the food courts.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

471132366.name: Nice beach for being Acapulco area
471132366.author: a TripAdvisor user
471132366.reviewBody: This is a nice many kilometers long Beach, as you can see in photos.\nIt is quite far from Acapulco (about 45mins drive depending on traffic). It has little food stalls and shacks in high season where you can get a bite.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

468093362.name: The best rural food
468093362.author: a TripAdvisor user
468093362.reviewBody: Everything is a catch of the day. I love the taste the rural ambiance and the best food. They mostly don\'t accept credit card but bringing dollar is acceptable

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

459715648.name: great place for outstanding fish
459715648.author: a TripAdvisor user
459715648.reviewBody: the best place of Acapulco for eating real fish: a whole red snapper just fished , grilled for you on the spot , a dream for fish lovers

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

458318515.name: Beautiful and secluded
458318515.author: a TripAdvisor user
458318515.reviewBody: We hired a driver and he recommended this beautiful place about 30 minutes south of Acapulco.  Beautiful restaurant with a swimming pool right on the long secluded beach.  My husband and I rented a 4 wheeler and rode for what seemed like miles without seeing a soul.  We then came back and enjoyed a wonderful lunch, after being taken into the kitchen to select the very fish out of a large plastic tub just caught and freshly prepared.  Wonderful!  The best garlic sea bass ever.  If you\'re in Acapulco, don\'t miss this place.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

456733179.name: Great!
456733179.author: a TripAdvisor user
456733179.reviewBody: Barra vieja is a must when going to Acapulco, it offers a different experience and great food, specially the pescado a la talla, definitely a must try!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

453211213.name: km 29 PECOS DEL MAR BARRA VIEJA
453211213.author: a TripAdvisor user
453211213.reviewBody: If you are looking for a piece of paradise in acapulco BARRA VIEJA is the place. We stop at PECOS DEL MAR km 29 is about half an hour from LA ISLA in Acapulco Diamante and the supermarket CHEDRAUI, take a table with hammocs in front of the sea and ask for PESCADO A LA TALLA probably one of the best red snapper you ever eat, is done in the grill usually comes with tortillas beans and rice. The simplicity of the place is what make Barra Vieja great. Dont expect to find Big fancy Hotel .... here is only palm shadows,hammoc,horses or moto bikes for rent where you can go to meet the river joinning the sea about 15 minutes by motor bike,in the afternoon thiey realease baby turtels to the sea in the next beach call PLAYA TORTUGUERO enjoy ......

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

451362001.name: Quiet Beach- Baby Turtles
451362001.author: a TripAdvisor user
451362001.reviewBody: We stopped here on a private tour to release baby turtles! It was a beautiful, quiet beach! Seemed like it went on for miles. It would be a great place to spend the day, have lunch or even a drink or 2! I highly recommend releasing the baby turtles. It doesn\'t sound like much but both me and the bf were pretty excited to do so and had fun doing it. we got to both release 3 turtles each. It sounds like it was a slow day. Normally guests only gets to release 1-2 turtles. We were there for about 45 mins and would have stayed all day if we could have. This will differently be a spot to hang out next time we are in Acapulco (with more time).

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

448129149.name: Try pescado a la talla
448129149.author: a TripAdvisor user
448129149.reviewBody: Great food, not so many sellers and beatiful beach. Ask for pescado a la talla and quedadillas. Avoid sitting next to a track where horses and four wheel motorcycle cross, because they blow over a lot of sand

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

447480468.name: The best beach in Acapulco
447480468.author: a TripAdvisor user
447480468.reviewBody: I love this beach because is almost alone and you can enjoy the sea without many people, the waves are really relaxing, the sand is very soft and the restaurants nearby have very good food. You can go to this place taking a bus from acapulco to punta diamante and then other to barra vieja.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

440638699.name: Isolated Beach and Great Food!
440638699.author: a TripAdvisor user
440638699.reviewBody: If you love seafood this is the place to go. Freshest red snapper we have ever had made to order and prepared to your liking. Beach front family owned restaurant on the beach! Isolated beach with less of the tourist crowd.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

412427312.name: Great seafood, a simple place.
412427312.author: a TripAdvisor user
412427312.reviewBody: A simple place to eat the best "pescado a la talla" located in front of a nice beach, but it is not for swimming, or even entering the sea if you are not an experienced swimmer, since it is an open sea beach.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

400228153.name: Sun, beach, & fun
400228153.author: a TripAdvisor user
400228153.reviewBody: Barra Vieja Beach is for the people that wants tranquility,  rustic, good sea food and fun (horse back riding, 4 wheelers, surf) we visited this site after 2 full days in the old Acapulco.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

397466519.name: Beach
397466519.author: a TripAdvisor user
397466519.reviewBody: Horseback riding and act\'s are available to explore this never ending beach southward.Good for surfing. Be careful of the undertow. Awesome sunsets!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

372883745.name: Great Beach!
372883745.author: a TripAdvisor user
372883745.reviewBody: Nice beach for a little surfing or just relaxing - my husband did the first and I of course did the latter. Not a lot people - a plus. Great seafood restaurants all around!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

372467799.name: Many beach restaurants to eat fish
372467799.author: a TripAdvisor user
372467799.reviewBody: There are many restaurants to eat fresh fish and at the end of the road, just off the shore of "Gody restaurant" there are safe and affordable boats to sail in the "Laguna de Tres Palos"

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

356345798.name: Nice and not crowded beach.
356345798.author: a TripAdvisor user
356345798.reviewBody: Is a nice place to visit, quiet than Acapulco beach, but the waves are very strong, making the beach dangerous, a good point is you can find many traditional restaurants, where to taste "Pescado a la talla" very good a traditional plate from Acapulco. Be aware with the ATV, you can freely rent one in the beach, they are running everywhere and can be dangerous.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

347345833.name: Very nice
347345833.author: a TripAdvisor user
347345833.reviewBody: Nice secluded beach.  Sometimes there are nude sunbathers but not real often.  Very few vendors.  Reasonable prices.   Don\'t stay too late in the day as the transportation is iffy

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

345283927.name: Amazing views and deserted!
345283927.author: a TripAdvisor user
345283927.reviewBody: Fantastic beach with amazing views. Deserted when I visited.  Its quite rough though so no good for weak swimmers.  There is also the turtles sanctuary located on this beach that is well worth a visit.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

343214459.name: Gaviotas
343214459.author: a TripAdvisor user
343214459.reviewBody: We went to spent the evening near the sea, the ambient and the food were excellent, the service is great in Acapulco; food can vary on quality by each location; but the sunset in this area is amazing; the specialty in this zone: Pescado ZARANDEADO spicy and garlic lovers will be on Paradise.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

342845920.name: One of the nicest beaches anywhere.
342845920.author: a TripAdvisor user
342845920.reviewBody: This has got to be one of the best surf beaches in the world. Today, with perfect glassy waves I have seen only 2 people surfing.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

341922812.name: Long & Lovely Beach
341922812.author: a TripAdvisor user
341922812.reviewBody: I stopped off at one of the many restaurants on the beach with some friends after a boat tour through the mangrove bayous. The beach was wide and extended in both directions. There was a fairly strong rip current when we were there, but it was swimmable. I wish I could remember the name of the restaurant, but it was primarily palapas all along the beach and back for about 30 metres. The food, service, and beverages were delightful. The wandering vendors had good selections and were not at all assertive. All in all it was a very pleasant experience.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

339956778.name: Best Fish ever......
339956778.author: a TripAdvisor user
339956778.reviewBody: The beach is not so nice and it can be a little dangerous to swimm there but there is a famous fish you have to try "Pescado a la Talla" I would recomend the place "Cira la Morena II" it\'s really amazing the place is very simple at the beach but it\'s really worth.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

338904090.name: Typical Mexican pacific coast
338904090.author: a TripAdvisor user
338904090.reviewBody: It is at the end of the peninsula Diamente and it is full of little restaurants that serve mainly fish. The tables are on the sand and you literally eat on the ocean. When you order your fish make sure to specify that you do not want the blackened barbecued fish otherwise it will be totally over cooked. It\'s worth the excursion.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

338285110.name: Beautiful beach
338285110.author: a TripAdvisor user
338285110.reviewBody: Long drive from downtown Acapulco. Went to Tres Maries for lunch. Fish is wonderful. Huge waves. Very relaxing. Don\'t recommend swimming.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

336822070.name: Great beach and best food in Acapulco
336822070.author: a TripAdvisor user
336822070.reviewBody: Pity I can\'t remember the name of the restaurant we went to but it was so good!  It had a sand floor and hammocks hanging from the poles around the eating area. Very much a family place.  We had a massive platter of Red Snapper, Octopus and Shrimp and with drinks for three it was about 900 peso\'s.  Best tasting food we had in the entire two weeks we were in Acapulco.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

334992401.name: INCREDIBLE RELAX PLACE
334992401.author: a TripAdvisor user
334992401.reviewBody: I really love Barra Vieja, it\'s always such a nice place where to relax, sunbath and have fresh food.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

322685904.name: This place has a soul
322685904.author: a TripAdvisor user
322685904.reviewBody: Lovely place, it feels untouched even though there are caba\u00f1as and restaurants along the beach. The waves are strong, not suited for small children. The food, especially fish, is delicious and fresh. The prices are very reasonable. If you want to get away from it all yet not be too far from the nearest airport (Acapulco) , it\u00b4s a great place.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

310360302.name: Barra vieja is a classic
310360302.author: a TripAdvisor user
310360302.reviewBody: This is part of the old style, ypu will not find luxury but you will find the best sea food (Pescado a la talla)

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

300827390.name: Great spot, but not the place to go if you want to swim in the ocean
300827390.author: a TripAdvisor user
300827390.reviewBody: It is a nice stop when in Acapulco. You will find great local food, very cheap. However, the beach is not good for swimming, specially with childrens.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

286816862.name: far from Aca, nothing special
286816862.author: a TripAdvisor user
286816862.reviewBody: it is a long way to get there, close from Airport, the restaurants are very common, a Little wild, not very clean, the only thing that it is worthy is the fish, they prepare it very well, you can take your wine or drinks and pay a fee to drink them with the food

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

274906493.name: Pescado a la Talla
274906493.author: a TripAdvisor user
274906493.reviewBody: So beautiful to walk eat end relax on the hamacas and coconut bread so good and coconut water so good too..a day to relax by the sea

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

273634774.name: barra vieja my favorite place to relaxe
273634774.author: a TripAdvisor user
273634774.reviewBody: Living in Acapulco you need a place to relaxe and for my family and myself barra vieja is the place.Fresh seafood and particular "PESCADO A LA TALLA " is my favorite, regardless witch restaurante we choose.In over 2o years I have never had a bad meal or experience.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

273592887.name: One of the best quite places in Acapulco
273592887.author: a TripAdvisor user
273592887.reviewBody: This area is very nice to get away from all the corud in Acapulco and is famous for the Fish "a la talla" (piece or file).\nThere are several restaurants, the one I like themost because of the installations is DON ALEJO, they accept credit card and they have nice pools and nice beach area.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

272595662.name: Breakfast
272595662.author: a TripAdvisor user
272595662.reviewBody: Had the buffet, price was good, food was good, service was good. Had choice of eating inside or out. We took the inside for the AC. I will go back for sure.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

266684483.name: A Great Escape
266684483.author: a TripAdvisor user
266684483.reviewBody: Barra Vieja is like a step back in time, absolutely beautiful surroundings, ocean with waves slapping hard against the coast line, balmy breezes blowing, and great little cafes located one right after the other with great food.  Highly recommend El Zorritas! You can rent quads on the beach or horse back ride or just chill in a hammock.  Good time with friends can be had here.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

265561399.name: Memo\'s
265561399.author: a TripAdvisor user
265561399.reviewBody: Memo will catch and his wife will cook the best fresh fish! Great beach location and hopefully Acapulco will come back as a tourist destination!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

262927002.name: Bambuddha Rocks
262927002.author: a TripAdvisor user
262927002.reviewBody: Barra Vieja Beach is a gem. Don\'t miss Bambuddha for the most amazing, spiritual, beautiful place in Mexico!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

259340144.name: Beautiful,but lonely beach
259340144.author: a TripAdvisor user
259340144.reviewBody: So sad to see these once busy beaches so empty.we did eat at one of many. Places,food was ok they are really hurting.felt safe.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

255233923.name: Clean, friendly and the food is really good too.
255233923.author: a TripAdvisor user
255233923.reviewBody: There is a nice restaurant or choose to sit right down on the beach, it\'s all very clean, great staff and good food. It is worth the drive to visit.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

241787588.name: Smooth
241787588.author: a TripAdvisor user
241787588.reviewBody: Clean beaches, friendly people, quiet place and very low tide! Perfect for families, to swim for hours.\n\nIt is a secure place, at least from me, danger free and I enjoyed it.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

226440142.name: Big Fish
226440142.author: a TripAdvisor user
226440142.reviewBody: Was there five years ago had their fish it was wonderful. We went this year, and end up on the same place and it was as excellent food as the first time.  Will go back any time.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

213351133.name: Great beach with restaurant and bar at close hand.
213351133.author: a TripAdvisor user
213351133.reviewBody: Great beach - close to the bar.  The beach is in the main costal road.  There are outdoor restaurant and bars nearby for a relaxing afternoon.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

209614282.name: So close to Acapulco but so far from civilization
209614282.author: a TripAdvisor user
209614282.reviewBody: We had a fantastic time in Barra Vieja. A local friend recommended this place, he said it\'s much quieter that Coyuca, and indeed, we were alone on the beach, ate amazing seafood, their pescado a la talla is truly amazing! We also took a boat ride to see the lagoon, there were quite a few species of birds and we saw a few crocodiles. They also give you time to hop in and swim in the sweet water of the lagoon. I have to say, this is what I expected from my holidays at the Pacific Ocean, peace, natural beauty and wilderness.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

205471234.name: We love it there
205471234.author: a TripAdvisor user
205471234.reviewBody: OMG.....you can walk that beach forever, and while walking you can find a fabulous restaurant, both far and near...

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

201538881.name: Awesome beach
201538881.author: a TripAdvisor user
201538881.reviewBody: Barra Vieja is one of the greatest beaches in Acapulco. It\'s known for its "pescado a la talla". You have a variety of places to stay and for us there is a very special one which name is "La Guitarra", in this place you can ask for Maribel and she is gonna attend you very well. One of the greatest sunsets in my life. It\'s a must.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

200753129.name: Marvelous view
200753129.author: a TripAdvisor user
200753129.reviewBody: Is where the lake and the sea join and the sun sets, breath taking only problem is that you can only swim at the lake because it\'s open sea but it\'s worth wile to go there, food is excellent, the fish is very fresh as in they fish it every day

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

193768867.name: Popular beach
193768867.author: a TripAdvisor user
193768867.reviewBody: I took sunbath in this peaceful and popular beach. Fishing is one great activity you can do here in this beach. We were all fully packed and went on to this beach just to explore it and had a really wonderful time. It is a 40-minute drive from the Acapulco. It is a great beach if you want to be lonely, calm and peaceful. It is safer and much cheaper than the Acapulco. There are many clubs and resorts here in this beach. Waters are good and level of waves is mild and OK. Pescado a la Talla is the local food there, try asking for it, and taste it. It is quite awesome and this beach is worth spending time.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

176177852.name: fishing the best
176177852.author: a TripAdvisor user
176177852.reviewBody: we got there every byear, for 26 years, and catch fish then take to our friends house in Acapulco and feed all the neighbors!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

167722844.name: Nice. Laid Back!!
167722844.author: a TripAdvisor user
167722844.reviewBody: I enjoyed my afternoon at Barra Vieja Beach. I ate at the popular Alejos restaurant, the food is amazing and they make a better Coco Loco than Las Brisas La Concha Beach Club (yes, this is true!!) There is horseback riding and if you talk to the security guys he will keep the hagglers away so can enjoy seaside dining peacefully

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

165042861.name: Excellent fish
165042861.author: a TripAdvisor user
165042861.reviewBody: Enjoy fresh fish while spending a wonderful day at the beach.The service is just excellent.Very affordable.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

164415852.name: Great place to eat at the NEW & STYLISH Mishol Beach Club
164415852.author: a TripAdvisor user
164415852.reviewBody:
Beto Godoy=Classic but old;   MISHOL = NEW STYLISH & DELICIOUS

We were passing trough and stop when we saw the building of the hotel. Believe me, this is the kind places that you dream of, remember, and wish to come back again and again. It is more than enough to say that I instantly became a fan of Mishol, amazing beach club and food.

Beto Godoy started over 50 years ago, I used to come with all my family. Barra vieja still has very nice and private beaches but in the last years a few new places started to race up and call for a new style and different offers... more modern.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

162338460.name: Used to be Great, then good, now...
162338460.author: a TripAdvisor user
162338460.reviewBody:
Prices are triple as last time, food was Ok and service was awful.

Traffic on the way back to Acapulco(Ave de las Naciones) was a nightmare

122637115.name: Best Pescado a la Talla ever

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

122250548.name: Excellent place to eat Red Snapper
122250548.author: a TripAdvisor user
122250548.reviewBody:
Took one of the classic VW bug taxi's down here. As noted by others, if you get to the lagoon you have passed it. There are large sail like signs pointing out the different restaurants.  We went to the Con Su Amiga Tomasita, recommended by our driver. We ordered barbecued whole red snapper. (you personally pick out your fish, they  weight it, and charge accordingly). This was the best red snapper we had thus far, even better than those served at an unnamed fancy restaurant and Puerto Marquez.  Note restrooms are @ rural standards.
The beach is endless with Palm trees end to end.

Best to use a rent car or have the taxi wait  for you. I did not see many cabs around.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

120212094.name: AMAZING
120212094.author: a TripAdvisor user
120212094.reviewBody: If you go to Acapulco you MUST eat here!  The food and view are amazing

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

95532959.name: nice
95532959.author: a TripAdvisor user
95532959.reviewBody: nice place to spend your day and enjoy,food and atmoshere was enjoyable

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

6649461.name: Turtle camp at Barra Vieja
6649461.author: a TripAdvisor user
6649461.reviewBody:
In Jan. 2007, we visited the turtle camp at Barra Vieja, on our way back from a boat tour of the nearby Laguna de Tres Palos. The beach is simply gorgeous! And the turtle camp is very interesting. It is located along the main coastal highway, Carretera Acapulco Pinotera, kilometer 32. The turnoff/sign is shown in the first picture.

They find endangered sea turtle nests and bring the eggs to the camp, to incubate in a protected area safe from poachers and predators. When the baby turtles hatch, they make sure the hatchlings at least make it into the water, by taking them down to the ocean and releasing them in large groups so some have a chance of survival. 

The baby turtles were adorable! We wished we were there later in the day, so we could participate in the 5:30 release. There is no charge to visit the turtle camp, but they do ask for a donation to assist with their conservation work. We were happy to support such a good cause.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

5418602.name: A quiet, rustic Mexican beach
5418602.author: a TripAdvisor user
5418602.reviewBody:
When you've had your fill of the crowds and peddlers on the main Acapulco beaches, nead to Barra Vieja Beach.  Rent a car, drive until you think you've gone too far.  You'll come to a small settlement with houses on the left and restuarants/shops on the right. (If you get to the lagoon, you've gone to far.)  Pull up by any of the restaurants (more like open-air kitchens), park, and head to the beach.  There you'll find a thatch-roofed, sand-floored area with hammocks, tables, and chairs.  The owners will bring you a menu and periodically check on you, refilling your order.  I think we paid 200 NMP (about $20.00, including tip) for many drinks, snacks, and the privilege of setting under their canopy the entire day.

The beach is rustic and empty.  Be careful of the surf as it is the Pacific and the currents were quite strong.

Also, make sure you either speak Spanish or can eat whatever you order -- there is no English here!  Enjoy!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

918263.name: Loved Barra Vieja
918263.author: a TripAdvisor user
918263.reviewBody: We drove to Barra Vieja actually to get away from the spring breakers and we\'re so glad we did!!  We\'ll go there from now on... there were very few people... only natives.  We rode horses on the beach, 4-wheelers, had massages on the beach, drank pina coladas, had full service... the best ceviche, shrimp cocktail, fish, quesadillas.... all at our own table right on the beach under a straw hut... very quiet.  We watched 2 beautiful sunsets.  Paradise!  I hesitate telling anyone about it... I hope it stays secluded.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Barra Vieja, Km 12

657898559.name: Best area of acapulco, it\'s safe
657898559.author: a TripAdvisor user
657898559.reviewBody: Great area with a lot of restaurants, supermarkets and places for dance; a safe place in Acapulco and this is very important nowadays

625005979.name: I live in Acapulco and Punta Diamante is the one place modern and actual.
625005979.author: a TripAdvisor user
625005979.reviewBody: If you are in the mode for shopping and fun you find it here , all in one place. Do not forget the wast selection of fine dining opcionce

606716528.name: This is a must see in Acapulco, we highly recommend!
606716528.author: a TripAdvisor user
606716528.reviewBody: This is a must see in Acapulco, we went with all my family and had a great time, we highly recommend,

567948693.name: Beautiful endless beaches
567948693.author: a TripAdvisor user
567948693.reviewBody: Picking a condo on Punta Diamante is a great way to vacation.  The ocean will send you into a dreamy sleep every night and during any siesta! The waves are fun and surfers, wind surfers, kite surfers, kite fliers all have lots of air and open space to let go.  Boogie and surf boards are available to rent. ATV\'s can be rented as well as.  Respectful vendors pass by to sell their shells, clothes, jewellery, hats and bags.  Several restaurants deliver right to your palapa.  There are 2 golf courses within a short walk or drive on the other side of the street.  Excellent location

566936862.name: Very good beach and service!
566936862.author: a TripAdvisor user
566936862.reviewBody: Punta Diamante in ACApulco is one of the best places to enjoy the beach in Mexico. Great service and food in its different restaurants!

564048926.name: Great place but too many motorcycles
564048926.author: a TripAdvisor user
564048926.reviewBody: This is an awesome beach, but there are just too many motorcycles. I hope they start to regulate this because it means contamination and has anti sustainability all over it.\n\n

559254517.name: R & R at its best!
559254517.author: a TripAdvisor user
559254517.reviewBody: Our friend took us to Punta Diamante at the level of the Quinta Real, the ocean has little waves and very fine sand, it was fun playing with the waves.  We relaxed and ordered from her club it was a great relaxed day.

557958060.name: New Acapulco.
557958060.author: a TripAdvisor user
557958060.reviewBody: Lacks the charm of old downtown but safe, fresh and clean. My best trip yet to Acapulco and I believe this was my 8th.

553410087.name: Head to Playa La Gloria
553410087.author: a TripAdvisor user
553410087.reviewBody: Great clean flat beach, ocean side restaurants, surfing and sunning.  The local people are laid back, friendly and helpfull.  You can\'t beat the sunset view at the end of the day.

551306579.name: GEM!
551306579.author: a TripAdvisor user
551306579.reviewBody: A wonderful beach to relax with family and friends! They offer several got eats and beach bars all walking distance. It can get overly crowded with locals though.  There is a very strong RIP TIDE in this area.....swimmers beware!!

550516563.name: Beautiful beach
550516563.author: a TripAdvisor user
550516563.reviewBody: The Punta Diamante is located in the New Acapulco (new part of the the town, which is still developing).  The beach is beautiful, peaceful, clean and uncrowded... My family and I stayed at Mayan Palace - and we had direct access to the beach - so we took advantage of it. Although the beach\u2019s \u201cmerchants\u201d and \u201cvendors\u201d are not authorized by the resort - take advantage of back horse ride on the beach or get the hand made beach attire or get the massage on the beach for the fraction of the price.  :)

474293625.name: Beautiful Beach
474293625.author: a TripAdvisor user
474293625.reviewBody: Punta Diamante is the newer section of Acapulco. Away from then loud Clubs and music. It has beautiful beaches. We stayed at the Grand Mayan walked on the beach and got a one hour massage for 20us. I recommend you stay Saturday & Sunday on the Costera than spend a week here.

472691375.name: Newer area of Acapulco
472691375.author: a TripAdvisor user
472691375.reviewBody: Yes, it\'s newer than traditional hotel areas, and nicely landscaped, etc.  But traffic is just as bad; hotel prices are higher, with many of them not even being on the beach; certainly missing the charm and variety of traditional Acapulco.\nOverrated.

457448964.reviewBody: Great place to be...Great places yo visit....\nAcapulco is truly a treasure to be discovered...any time of the year\n

403894497.name: Beautiful place
403894497.author: a TripAdvisor user
403894497.reviewBody: We stayed here on the beach and it was great. We walked outside the resort onto the beach and got massages every day! $20 for an hour massage, awesome!

403303211.name: Punto diamante
403303211.author: a TripAdvisor user
403303211.reviewBody: Open ocean. Good for wave jumping. Waves can get really big. As I have said before. Always keep one eye on the ocean. Here you can walk along the beach, horseback ride or rent an arc. Great sunsets. As always there are vendors selling their goods. As for the non beach diamante: There is a nice outdoor shopping mall next to the convention center. You will also find local restaurants as well. Go localthe good is very tasty. To think 20 years ago none of that existed except for the horseback riding. Have fun\u263a

372467273.name: Many things to do
372467273.author: a TripAdvisor user
372467273.reviewBody: This newer area in Acapulco has almost everything to enjoy holidays, one mall, several hotels, restaurants and BEACH.

366021395.name: Beautiful Beach
366021395.author: a TripAdvisor user
366021395.reviewBody: The ocean is relatively calm, and it\'s shallow - you can walk out quite a distance before it gets deep.  There are waves, but they aren\'t nearly as bad as the rest of the Pacific beaches I have visited.  \n\nWalking during sunset was beautiful.  We went almost to the northern end and stopped at a little store for drinks to enjoy as we watched the sun set.

358742686.name: Expensive, tourist trap
358742686.author: a TripAdvisor user
358742686.reviewBody: Not the real Acapulco feeling. Overpriced food and drinks. If you are a traveler, you will be dissappointed.

358021990.name: Yet to visit a better beach
358021990.author: a TripAdvisor user
358021990.reviewBody: Miles of perfect beach. No rocks or other debris. Usually visit between mid-Feb and early April, and the beach is often empty and never crowded. Ocean can be rough if you venture out, but breaks far enough out that the shoreline is safe for kids. 90 every day. 70 every night. Not humid, so comfortable, though the sun is VERY strong, so be careful or you\'ll burn to a crisp. Sun to hazy sun almost always - I\'ve experienced ONE rainy day in a total of 50 weeks of vacationing here over the years. Also a turtle preserve. A delightful place to visit. Oh, and hang around for the sunset...just gorgeous.

350394108.name: Excellent Beach
350394108.author: a TripAdvisor user
350394108.reviewBody: We stayed at a resort located on the beach. The beach is wonderful! The sand is very fine, but gets super hot in the afternoon. The ocean is the perfect temperature for swimming! The beaches were very empty and the ocean was sometimes unoccupied in front of our resort. This could be due to some larger waves or strong current present in the water, however, you could venture out very far before the water became deep. I highly recommend visiting Acapulco if you\'re looking for warm weather in Mexico. We had 90 degree days daily in February, unlike vacation spots north of Acapulco.

346437071.name: Our hotel was located on the diamond beach section of Acapulco.
346437071.author: a TripAdvisor user
346437071.reviewBody: Beautiful location and lots of beach to walk. Was hot in Feb 2016 85-95 degrees each day. Some days humid others not so much.

345190299.name: Not bad
345190299.author: a TripAdvisor user
345190299.reviewBody: Where the best resorts are (Mayan, Princess, etc, etc). Unless of course you own a nice loft over there with beach access. \u00a1The traffic in holidays is hideous!

340326270.name: One of the ten best
340326270.author: a TripAdvisor user
340326270.reviewBody: It\'s a peninsula that stretches for 25 km. Of dark blond fine sand without alguays and rocks. The surf breaks 100 m. from the beach so that children can safely play in the water. On one side there is a lagoon and on the other is the ocean. There is usually a fair wind and the beach is always more than 100 m wide. Don\'t tell anyone, it\'s the best kept secret of Mexico. Cancun can go hang itself.

340100024.name: Turtle Preserve
340100024.author: a TripAdvisor user
340100024.reviewBody: Since we stayed in Punta Diamante we went to turtle preserve neatby.  It\'s not a fancy preserve - just a snall house where volunteers find sea turtle nests and move the eggs to a preservation area where they can hatch out of danger. They then release the baby turtles to the sea where only .001% will survive.  There is a 35 peso/person charge to rekease 4 turtles (you adopt/name them and then send them out to sea). They also ask you to watch a short video on preservation of the turtles.\n\nI think it\'s a really nice activity to take young children to educate them on importance of preserving these sea turtles

338965968.name: Nice time at the beach
338965968.author: a TripAdvisor user
338965968.reviewBody: We go to this location every year. We eat at Chez Memo\'s. We are known there now, been going there for close to 10 years. Pescado a la tailla is great accompanied by a poutine. And yes, Guillermo speaks excellent French. Strongly recommend this place to all Acapulco visitors.

336981478.name: Loved it

333014805.reviewBody: Diamante bay is the best area to stay for a holiday. Food was outstanding, the CAMINO ROYALE HOTEL is under renovation,\nthey are slow but updating is needed.

332296607.name: Beautiful sandy beach!
332296607.author: a TripAdvisor user
332296607.reviewBody: our hotel is located in what they call, Diamante Beach area. You can walk for miles and feel secure. We took an early walk around 6:30am to avoid the heat, well at 32 degrees everyday, it is hot for sure. The weather is perfect first thing in the morning and good for strolling the beach.

332096226.name: Beautiful beach with lots of waves
332096226.author: a TripAdvisor user

Definitely a lot of waves but pretty shallow past the breaks. There was a relatively strong current throughout our vacation so children need to be very closely monitored.

330072240.name: Quiet place
330072240.author: a TripAdvisor user
330072240.reviewBody: Great gateway beach, nice new developments, La Isla shopping is near and you can find good places to eat.

322442324.name: Nice place in Acapulco
322442324.author: a TripAdvisor user
322442324.reviewBody: The best part of the new brand Acapulco, you can find a lot of amenities and restaurants, shopping in good places.

318973434.name: Great place for a good run
318973434.author: a TripAdvisor user
318973434.reviewBody: While in Acapulco last week we went running twice along the golf courses in the Punta Diamante area. A great place to run with a beautiful setting, I would highly recommend staying in any one of the areas hotels and getting in a good 10k. However, do run early since the humidity can be a killer

310138453.name: Acapulco Visit
310138453.author: a TripAdvisor user
310138453.reviewBody: Punta Diamante is the quieter side of Acapulco. The beach is long, flat and super clean. Perfect for long walks. It is the Pacific Ocean so there are strong waves so the best for swimming but a beautiful area of beach.

308342518.name: Best of ACA
308342518.author: a TripAdvisor user
308342518.reviewBody: The best part of Acapulco. This is the side where all the yuppie crowds from all ages gather. Best restaurants, shopping malls and hotels, even the beach in this side is my favorite but be careful on swimming since is open sea and not the bays anymore.

306589814.name: Calmness
306589814.author: a TripAdvisor user
306589814.reviewBody: Not the best beaches and nowhere near Acapulco Bay in fact you more or less next to Acapulco Airport.However it does offer a feel of calmness which in its self in the hussle and hussle of everyday life is worth its weight in gold.

282729026.name: Great spectacular area
282729026.author: a TripAdvisor user
282729026.reviewBody: Our hotel was on Punta Diamante. The upscale are for tourist. The view of the beach every morning is spectacular!!! our room had a beautiful long balcony and we could wake up in the mornings to the sounds of the waves hittting the big rocks nearby. Stunning!!! Great area!!! If you plan to travel to Acapulco this is the area where you

281644679.name: Nice area
281644679.author: a TripAdvisor user
281644679.reviewBody: The area is nice, with good places to eat. They have good hotels and the airport is quite near, around 10 mins by car.

258850401.name: a must see
258850401.author: a TripAdvisor user
258850401.reviewBody: you cannot go to acapulco and not visit the punta diamante,, it has great food/ great view and its always very busy

249754650.name: Grab one of the ATV guys for 30 min ride on the beach
249754650.author: a TripAdvisor user
249754650.reviewBody:
My fiancée is from Mexico and we have been to most of the top beaches in Mexico. Revolcadero beach is about 3 miles long and it is the best beach we've seen in Mexico, although we still like the Mayan Riviera and the Cancun area. There is good surf and little development, except at the north end where they are building endless condo high rises. I have to believe that within 10 years, the developers will come in and put hotels all along this stretch because the beach is so perfect. If they do, this could become the best beach resort in Mexico. The sand is good, the beach is endless, there is consistent surf, and the air and water are warmer in the winter than in Cancun. There are lots of little stretches where the locals have access, but for the most part, it is virtually undeveloped.
We walked 30 minutes from the La Isla shopping center past all of the condos until we found access to the beach. We sat on a couple of dilapidated chairs under a torn awning, and a local sold us a couple cans of coke. Every few minutes, some guy would race by on an old ATC wearing a red shirt. We flagged one down and asked him for a ride. He charged 200 pesos (about $15) for 30 minutes. We hopped on and the race began. We flew down the beach, stopping at different public beach areas, including one area where Canadian tourists have been coming for 20 years. They even have Canadian flags on the beach. This was a great way to see the beach, and it was fun. I am 62 years old, but in pretty good shape, so I thought it was worth the risk, and it was.

If you are looking for a great beach in the Acapulco area, this is the best one bar far. It is also close to Puerto Marques, which is a small, poor village, and worth a visit.

248025133.name: Revolcadero beach.... Nice and quite
248025133.author: a TripAdvisor user
248025133.reviewBody: Revolcadero beach is definitevely a great beach to take a bath... Quite, with soft tide, and fine sand that will help you to take a good bath... Very clean and despite the sand is not to white, the water is crystal clear...

240004883.name: Wedding beach club
240004883.author: a TripAdvisor user
240004883.reviewBody: Not to safe right now...the road isn\'t paved or lit so it is better to go in groups for security sake.

209171032.name: Only for those with the green cash to spend
209171032.author: a TripAdvisor user
209171032.reviewBody: This place is only for those who can afford to spend themoney and do not want to be bothered by other people that are not at the same socioeconomical level, great if you have the cash, absolute outstanding customer service and great services, anything you need can be found here.

200579731.name: A Cut Above
200579731.author: a TripAdvisor user
200579731.reviewBody: The Punta Diamante area affords an upper-class shopping and cultural experience. Nicely located near the airport, you can visit if you have a long layover in Acapulco. Great shops, food and outdoor sculptures. Definitely the opposite of old ACA!\n

195314942.name: Winter break in Acapulco
195314942.author: a TripAdvisor user
195314942.reviewBody:
The weather was glorious...especially after the winter we've been having in New York!
The Mayan Palace Resort/Grand Mayan was beautiful. The grounds rivaled any tropical botanical gardens we've visited! The facilities are well-maintained and sparkling clean, staff was terrific and there was no pressure to take sales tour. The pool at the Mayan Palace is truly amazing...so many nooks and crannies to sit, swim and play.  Easy shuttle service to the Grand Mayan to access the beach there, with easy towel service and at this time of the year, there was no problem getting a sheltered tent or hut on the beach. Although the vendors on the beach were numerous ( we counted over 20 different items or services offered), they were never pushy and were always polite. The Cafe de Lago at the Grand Mayan was always a good restaurant choice for breakfast or various themed dinners with live music and a wonderful wait staff. The only down side for us, was that the "studio" we had through our RCI exchange, was really a hotel room...lovely, but without the amenities of a mini-kitchen that we are used to from our other studio exchanges.  These rooms could benefit by having a refrigerator, coffee-maker, microwave and plates/utensils to make the stay easier for those of us that don't want to eat out for every meal.  We did stop at the "Selecto" market on the way to the resort, and because I had read another members review, I knew to purchase a small styrofoam cooler and various food items to get us through some breakfasts, lunches and snack times.
We took a tour of Acapulco..city highlights. It was informative and the view of the harbor from the Chapel of Peace was incredible. One evening we visited the local mall..La Isla and went to the movie theatre there...it was great!
Traveling to Acapulco is not easy..there are no direct flights and going through customs in Mexico City was an exercise in mass chaos...but once we hit the sunny beach, all was forgotten!

193862172.name: One of the most luxurious place in Acapulco.
193862172.author: a TripAdvisor user
193862172.reviewBody: This area in Acapulco was one of the most luxurious places I visited while my stay. It was the new Acapulco, with all the high end hotels and shopping plazas, new housing development. You could find a Sam\'s club, very well stoked I might add, a nice movie theater, and a couple of restaurants along the main boulevard. The beautiful thing about this area was that the beach, it was way cleaner, shallower and more private. You could also find lots of sea food restaurants along the beach past all the apartment complex and hotels. You would have to walk about 300 meters in the sand from the restaurants to swim in the sea. \n\nI do have to add that this section of Acapulco was the one that was hit the worst after the two hurricanes in September 2013. So If you plan to visit Acapulco have in mind that you may still see some wreckage from the hurricanes that struck in this area.

171756414.name: Great
171756414.author: a TripAdvisor user
171756414.reviewBody: We liked seeing the harbor and surrounding area, wish we would have had time to enjoy it more. Our tour guide Baldo Gomez did a great job showing us as much as possible for one day.

166457932.name: the grand mayan acapulco it is a wonderful place to take vacations with your family. they are very friendly .
166457932.author: a TripAdvisor user
166457932.reviewBody: i like everything. The beauty of the place through the attentive personal that made your vacation a success and a happy one.

156728402.name: Great place, beautiful sunset!
156728402.author: a TripAdvisor user
156728402.reviewBody: Acapulco is an interesting place. Nightlife is awesome and eventhough the  beach is not so clean  everywhere,  the view from/ to the bay is  beautiful. I guess  it depends on what you preffer, I love the  beaches in the Caribbean but you cant compare those waters to any other in the world! This is the Pacific Ocean so the water is not clear nor so warm but you get good waves and breathtaking sun sets..plus the weather in December is not painfully hot, and Punta Diamante is a nice and safe place to stay/ hang out  while in Acapulco.

146897009.name: To quote a famous movie line...THIS IS PARADISE
146897009.author: a TripAdvisor user
146897009.reviewBody: My recent trip to Acapulco in November 2012 was so fantastic, I\'m probably going to review each and every aspect of it that I can to folks on Trip Advisor because one of the things I did down to the dime is to prepare for this trip.  Although my initial desire was to spend my 50th birthday in Miami, I had a change of heart because the election of 2012 took so much out of the US that I wanted to get the heck outta here to enjoy my birthday with friends.  So we ventured down to the Grand Mayan Acapulco (5 adults, no children...we weren\'t sorry either!) and had a blast that could be called "Fall Break for 40+".  It was a great and surreal experience.  I planned the resort, the tour guide/driver and did my homework on the experience prior to going so that we would have enough funds without blowing our budget pre-holidays and making sure everyone who came had one hellava time, even though it was my and a friend who was with us celebrating birthdays.\n\nTHe view of Punta Diamante was just another piece of heaven on this trip.  I am so going back here!  That\'s all I can say...

140785862.name: A jewel.
140785862.author: a TripAdvisor user
140785862.reviewBody: When I first started coming to ACA this was just a hillside with a few houses.  Now it is the up and coming area of Acapulco to go for great dining and night life. Some wonderful accommodations as well.

128143893.name: not bad for solitary life
128143893.author: a TripAdvisor user
128143893.reviewBody: the view is awesome but the water isn\'t good at all, I don\'t have any idea is it polluted or what? it has some great waves too. quite good to have sun bath here, but not swim or bath on the water. but notice your belongings

126586659.name: to lie down in the sun
126586659.author: a TripAdvisor user
126586659.reviewBody: the water is often dirty. The beach is good surfing but not to be bathing on it, depends on the day. this is true for all beaches in acapulco

1766407.name: Mayan Palace
1766407.author: a TripAdvisor user
1766407.reviewBody: Excellent Hotel in Acapulco. It\'s on world in Acapulco.

673131630.name: Number one museum in the state here
673131630.author: a TripAdvisor user
673131630.reviewBody:
This was our last stop of the day, the fort is right beside the cruise ship terminal so easy to walk from there back onto the Norwegian Bliss cruise ship .
Built by the Spanish in the 17th. Century to keep the pirates at bay.
A very impressive structure worth having a look at .
There are some great items in the museum to view.
Read about the history of the fort and the likes of Sir Francis Drake the great English sea captain.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

652168452.name: HISTORY IS HERE!
652168452.author: a TripAdvisor user
652168452.reviewBody: This fort is fascinating, don\'t let your guide rush you through.  Another nice sight, however, is the museum across the parking lot.  The mural on the side, while ignored by the locals, is amazing

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

649538544.name: Nice museum in old fort
649538544.author: a TripAdvisor user
649538544.reviewBody: Intended to explore the fort on our own and then return to cruise ship. Local guide Antonio assisted us in crossing the street, and then proceeded to give us a private tour of the fort and museum. He then escorted us to Museo Casa de la Mascara (interesting mask museum), a local craft market, and the cliff divers. Very enjoyable day!

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

649226717.name: Mesmerizing landmark in Acapulco
649226717.author: a TripAdvisor user
649226717.reviewBody:
The second leg of our “Acapulco Historical Tour with Divers Show” revealed a captivating experience. Initially built in 1616, thanks to the Spanish Empire, the fort was widely affected by an earthquake in 1776. Then, it was demolished and fully rebuilt in 1783. 

But beyond the historical facts, we were fascinated by the exhibits along with the interesting stories told by our knowledgeable guide Humberto. 
From the height of the fortifications, you’ll have astonishing views, be prepared to take memorable pics. 

The visit is a gem, very enlightening, a golden opportunity to learn more about Acapulco’s history.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

617465764.name: History site
617465764.author: a TripAdvisor user
617465764.reviewBody: Nice display of history inside rooms under fort. Reminder that the world is changing fast now. The ship replicas really remind me of what it must have been like to travel then. Love Patrick O\'Brian\'s master and commander series so the fort is awesome.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

611078407.name: A must if you are interested in history.
611078407.author: a TripAdvisor user
611078407.reviewBody: I is a very well kept fort.  It is similar to other forts in different ports of Mexico and the Caribbean. I has a bit of technology and displays beautiful historical pieces.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

599566269.name: Amazing Fort San Diego at Acapulco
599566269.author: a TripAdvisor user
599566269.reviewBody: Fort San Diego is a beautiful fort placed at front of Acapulco\u2019s bay, we enjoy 2 hrs visiting the fort and the museum. Seems to be very strong to defend the port from pirates attacks in the past. My grandsons enjoy the visit too much.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

598044213.name: Historical monument Gem
598044213.author: a TripAdvisor user
598044213.reviewBody:
Easily accessible by taxi, foot or bridge (if you're coming in a cruise) the Fuerte de San Diego is one of the most important places in Acapulco. It serves as a history museum of the port and it contains important pieces connecting Asia and America.

All the rooms have AC so the almost unbearable summer heat can be avoided. In there, there's a good size replica of the Nao de China, the ship that brought porcelain, spices, silk and other goods from Manila into Acapulco so it could  be later be transported to Mexico City, Veracruz and Spain.

The views from the fort are spectacular.  There is an entrance fee but that's understandable.

Don't forget to visit the Museum of Masks next door.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

579141777.name: Very Interesting
579141777.author: a TripAdvisor user
579141777.reviewBody: A great little short trip... take about an hour or so to got though all the displays very well done and great view of the city and bay

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

577396421.name: Interesting historical site
577396421.author: a TripAdvisor user
577396421.reviewBody: As part of a tour we visited the fort for 45 minutes or so. Interesting and entertaining history and great views. Museum rooms at the fort were air conditioned.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

565664962.name: Go Early
565664962.author: a TripAdvisor user
565664962.reviewBody: They are closed on Mondays. Go early before it gets hot (open at 9am) and do the outdoor top part first. The views are great up there. Do the indoor air-conditioned parts last. Admission is 60 pesos/$3.22 US

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

565245651.name: Neat historic site
565245651.author: a TripAdvisor user
565245651.reviewBody: It is worth the trip to see it but that is about it.  It has extreme historical significance but the museum does not do too much to promote it.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

563380320.name: Gem of a find across the street from where our Cruise Ship docked
563380320.author: a TripAdvisor user
563380320.reviewBody:
Great perspective on the Maritime History of Acapulco.  Historical displays inside the Fort covered the history of the Fort and its importance on the Manila Trade Route.  This gives a perspective on the History of Acapulco beyond resorts and why it was an important trade location, something that was only briefly touched on in any of my History classes.  Admission at the time we went (Feb 2018) was $4.00 per person and given the proximity (literally across a street and up some steps) to where our Cruise Ship docked, it was the best value going).
    From models of ships, to artifacts to history, this Museum was well worth the entry fee.  
    Some of the display rooms were even Air Conditioned.  
Keep in mind that Spanish is the National Language of Mexico,  however, many of the displays did have English translations (I would like to Thank the Museum Staff for this).

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

562584834.name: If you\'re into History
562584834.author: a TripAdvisor user
562584834.reviewBody: Excellent place to visit in Acapulco. Displays are set up really nice. Not all information describing the displays are in English which is a shame. Many treasures can be seen inside. Religion is discussed a lot which was very interesting. Don\'t forget your camera as you need to show this to others. Cost to get in is minimal.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

558703885.name: The history of Acapulco is here
558703885.author: a TripAdvisor user
558703885.reviewBody: The fort is not very large and there is not much to see outside. However, by far the most interesting side is the museum hosted in quite a few room inside the fort. There are some other events that are hosted here but when we went there were not too many visitor. Apart from enjoying somewhat nice views of the surroundings, we spent most of the time in the museum.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

555175779.name: learn more about  Acapulco history of the by gone era
555175779.author: a TripAdvisor user
555175779.reviewBody: Individual air conditioned rooms within the walls of the fortress tell the story of regular galleon route to Manila and the Spanish trade with the far East.  The exhibits house samples of the goods traded. Very informative and worth a visit, but avoid the heat of middle of the day. Bus stops in front of the Fort, but you have to climb the steps to get to the  entrance.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

554310649.name: A lot of history
554310649.author: a TripAdvisor user
554310649.reviewBody: This place is really amazing it has a lot of history. On sundays its free. It has a lot of little rooms inside the fort and have a lot of history in it.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

554069395.name: Learning about Acapulco\u2019s history
554069395.author: a TripAdvisor user
554069395.reviewBody: The fort is an impressive example of Historic preservation and the architecture of military constructions of the 17th century.  Even thought it was rebuilt due to an earthquake, it does conserve its original character. I learned a lot of history of Acapulco and Mexico. The views atop are awesome and the staff was always friendly and helpful. I am not sure if they do speak in English but most of the information is in both Spanish and English. O would suggest to improve signage to find the access to the museum since we were only able to find it asking pedestrians.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

553820754.name: High quality, small museum
553820754.author: a TripAdvisor user
553820754.reviewBody: Acapulco is not a cultural destination. However, this museum has enough to make it worthwhile. It has a couple small artifacts that are 3000 years old and a good presentation of the history of Mexico.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

552301871.name: Midday Visit to 400 Year Old Spanish Fort Was Well Worth The Time
552301871.author: a TripAdvisor user
552301871.reviewBody: El Fuerte De San DIego is an excellent reconditioned and preserved Spanish fort with a storied history and an excellent museum on site.  Exhibits include art, furniture, weaponry, pottery, clothing, maps, and depict the history of the area from the time of the earliest native inhabitants through modern times.  The views from the top of the fort are stunning.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

549272472.name: Interesting
549272472.author: a TripAdvisor user
549272472.reviewBody: So decided to visit on our second visit to Acapulco and weren\'t disappointed.  Found the displays very interesting

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

548517775.name: I love it
548517775.author: a TripAdvisor user
548517775.reviewBody: Well it\'s the most amazing museum that we have in Acapulco you can see how was the life of the military in the Spanish conquest.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

545778971.name: a history lesson
545778971.author: a TripAdvisor user
545778971.reviewBody: this place is well worth a visit. very well presented. if you want to know about the erea\'s history this is the place to be

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

543299590.name: Well presented
543299590.author: a TripAdvisor user
543299590.reviewBody: The fort is very well preserved,You can walk around the ramparts on all sides,Lots of cannon.The best part is when you go inside the various rooms underneath.Very interesting exhibits.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

540163653.name: all day
540163653.author: a TripAdvisor user
540163653.reviewBody: could spend all day here and still have fun great water and weather great sights and fun place lots to do

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

532147426.name: Basic fort and museum
532147426.author: a TripAdvisor user
532147426.reviewBody:
We visited as part of a cruise ship tour (tied to the cliff divers) but could have easily visited on our own by walking from the cruise port. There is a bridge that crosses the main, busy street and takes you directly there, less than 5 minutes from the cruise dock. 

It's a very basic fort with museum. There were some fun items for kids to view - like replica ships and pirate chests - but overall you can cover the whole thing in 30 mins. 

I probably wouldn't pay for a tour again, they were charging 55 pesos entry to those that just walked over. If you're on a cruise and don't want to do a tour, you could use this as a way to get off the boat safely for an hour or so. Wouldn't visit otherwise.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

530363775.name: Educational and fun
530363775.author: a TripAdvisor user
530363775.reviewBody: A trip to Fort San Diego would be interesting for families and singles. The displays are well- documented in Spanish and English and not so detailed that children would get bored. Besides, the rooms are air conditioned--- a blessing in humid Acapulco. A climb up the ramp to see the canon mounts and the 360* view is a must.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

505647029.name: Wonderful museum
505647029.author: a TripAdvisor user
505647029.reviewBody: It cost 55 pesos to enter. We had an English guide that was also a teacher. Very large collections. The museum is airconditioned thank goodness. You can walk there from Acapulco Beach. We had a tour which cost $30 US plus entry but went later on the public bus for 10 pesos plus 55 pesos each entry. It was so good we went twice.\n\nI recommend it.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

484754919.name: A great historic must do in acapulco
484754919.author: a TripAdvisor user
484754919.reviewBody: Been there many times it\'s a museum inside an old fort ! The rooms are air conditioned but you can go outside on top of fort for great views of the city ! Right across from cruise ship terminal ! A must do

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

483068707.name: Went on an NCL Shore Excursion to Cliff Diving and then fort.
483068707.author: a TripAdvisor user
483068707.reviewBody: We were not happy with this tour.  We went by coach to see the Cliff Divers at 11:00 AM.  IT was an very hot humid day.  The guide took us into a store and everyone got sort of mixed up.  We ended up standing out in the heat.  If you are not good with heat and can\'t climb stairs this is not the tour for you!  The young men and girl that were the divers climbed up the rocks from the water and dove one at a time.  They did identify them so you were ready to see which one jumped.  Kind of Scary and depending on where you stand on the levels and stairs you could miss the water entry as they dive etc.  The heat and the time of day were not good for us...almost 38 degree C.  When we discovered that the fort we had next on the tour was back at the ship and involved a hike up and could have gone ourselves off the boat we just returned to the boat.  So I only rated this average because the cost was a lot!  We could have had access to the fort and had gone earlier on our own...so might want to do that but make sure you get a Taxi that is licensed and the guide takes you to the taxi and the driver meets you and understand how long and how much.\nSecurity everywhere with Tourist Police, Federal Military and regular police so doesn\'t make you feel very comfortable and worry if you should even leave the ship!

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

480730197.name: Interesting History of Acapulco
480730197.author: a TripAdvisor user
480730197.reviewBody: The museum has their displays translated into English, so you can go and read about the history of Acapulco especially relating to the relationship with the East. The displays are nice, the rooms are air conditioned, and the view is spectacular. Entrance price is $55 MXN, so not expensive at all to spend an hour or so learning.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

479339826.name: Wonderful Adventure through History
479339826.author: a TripAdvisor user
479339826.reviewBody:
The fort is incredibly clean and very well laid out.  All the exhibits are in air-conditioned rooms and the settings are wonderful.  The attention to detail right down to the wood work of the floors and the poles in the rooms is really good.  Even the restrooms are very clean and nice.

We spent more than two hours wandering through the history of the area and learned so much.  I am not a museum person but I highly recommend a visit to the Fort of San Diego - it is said that if you go to Acapulco you must see the cliff divers but for my money, you must see this museum.

In spite of the quality of everything here, the entrance fee was on 55 pesos each (a little over $3 US at the moment).

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

478014970.name: Great piece of history
478014970.author: a TripAdvisor user
478014970.reviewBody: A tour of the Fort holds a lot more than just meandering through an old fort.  Get a guide who knows the history and can take you along the history journey for this area of Mexico.  There are several rooms that contain bits of the history of Mexico, the wars and trade and so much more.  One could spend the good part of a day to take it all in.  I had no idea there was so much history here.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

472005424.name: Just okay
472005424.author: a TripAdvisor user
472005424.reviewBody: My wife and I visited the fort yesterday. It has a small museum inside that costs about $5 to view. It has some nice artifacts  and nice things and is air-conditioned. But the fort itself was a little disappointing. The views from the fort though are quite nice and there are some nice picture taking opportunities there.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

469895284.name: Very Interesting
469895284.author: a TripAdvisor user
469895284.reviewBody: We spent an afternoon strolling through the Museum with such lovely artwork and history it was a pleasure visiting.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

468356204.name: Loved it
468356204.author: a TripAdvisor user
468356204.reviewBody: History buff who enjoyed this very much. Did it in the city tour so it felt rushed.  Should have done it as a stand alone.  Cool structure and great reading about the artifacts in English.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

468163602.name: Great views!
468163602.author: a TripAdvisor user
468163602.reviewBody: This fort is gorgeous! There is a museum inside and the views from the different look outs are amazing. We only had one day in Acapulco so we just spent an hour or so here, but it was worth the visit!

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

466523020.name: Amazing collection
466523020.author: a TripAdvisor user
466523020.reviewBody: Great idea to have a museum in a beautiful historic fort. You walk from room to room tracing the history of the area. There is a nice collection of artifacts. This isn\'t a large museum but definitely worth checking out.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

463615480.name: 1st time visiting
463615480.author: a TripAdvisor user
463615480.reviewBody:
This was the 1st time we have gotten over to the Fort and it is a worthwhile visit. Wear your walking shoes here as just getting into the Fort is a workout on its own. 

Many interior room with many crafts from all over Mexico. The rooms are air-conditioned fortunately making viewing of all the different artifacts more interesting. 

Open Tues to Sunday after 9am. Admission is 55 peso. 

Pictures coming soon.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

462130228.name: Love the history
462130228.author: a TripAdvisor user
462130228.reviewBody: A great place to learn the history of Acapulco. Beautiful views! It takes about one and a half hours to go through the exhibits.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

461772879.name: History
461772879.author: a TripAdvisor user
461772879.reviewBody: This is where it all started when the Spanish settled here in the 1500\'s and established this fort to defend their settlement against the Portugese and to a lesser degree the British and the French..  Well worth the time to visit and the history behind it...

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

457660788.name: Something different in Acapulco
457660788.author: a TripAdvisor user
457660788.reviewBody: When you go to Acapulco you think about the sun, the water, the nightlife, the food, but to do something different I think you must go to Fort San Diego, a place where you can learn a little bit about Acapulco\u00b4s history and the importance of it as a port in the old times. It\u00b4s cheap and you learn a lot. The view from the higher part of the fort is really beautiful.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

457375370.name: Excellent museum in the old fort
457375370.author: a TripAdvisor user
457375370.reviewBody: The Spanish Empire built the Fort of San Diego to protect Acapulco from attacks by pirates.  It now houses an excellent historical museum with an extensive collection of authentic artefacts.  There is a comprehensive amount of information provided for the various exhibits.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

455459261.name: Solid history museum
455459261.author: a TripAdvisor user
455459261.reviewBody: The focus is on Acapulco\'s history as a port.  It is close to the cruise ship port and very easy to access.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

454828915.name: Historical Acapulco
454828915.author: a TripAdvisor user
454828915.reviewBody: El Fuerte de San Diego is a must see if you are into historical sites and can spare a few hours to get the story and see the sites including the WELL and many CANNON.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

454324242.name: Interesting fort
454324242.author: a TripAdvisor user
454324242.reviewBody: The fort is well kept, and it has a lot of artefacts from its history, including a good amount of information under each little part. They are supposed to have movies going too, but every single TV/VCR set was broken.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

451362120.name: Well maintained piece of history
451362120.author: a TripAdvisor user
451362120.reviewBody: San Diego Fort is well maintained & organized museum. There was a lot of history in every nook and cranny of this old fortress. There is a lot of amazing artifacts displayed in Air conditions wings. It cost $5USD per person and was worth every penny. It was built by the Spanish, and it was one of the most important Spanish fortress along the Pacific Coast. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable! Make sure you go up top and check out the canons, stunning views of the Bay & cruise ship port! Lots of great photo op\'s from above!

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

435221629.name: Turn back the hands of time
435221629.author: a TripAdvisor user
435221629.reviewBody: I was pretty surprised that this Fort was built so long ago 1600\'s and has been maintained pretty well.  The canons were amazing and the story the tour guide told us about the fort was fascinating. A definite "must see" in Acapulco.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

429038132.name: An amazing piece of history!
429038132.author: a TripAdvisor user
429038132.reviewBody: A visit to this fort is a must! It is an amazing exhibit with a really excellent museum! I love history and this even exceeded my expectations! The artifacts are amazing and it is so well organized and displayed! The exhibit areas are air conditioned and very comfortable. I have been to several museums in different countries and this is definitely one of the very best! The fort is a must see for any history buff!

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

419021210.name: Excellent!
419021210.author: a TripAdvisor user
419021210.reviewBody: If you are a history buff as I am you must visit this fort. Very well kept (kudos to the municipality!). The staff working on a Sunday afternoon where courteous and very welcoming. Inside the extremely well presented and clean exhibition rooms (there several), you\'ll find a plethora of original artifacts of all sorts. The views from the top of the fort are beautiful. Don\'t leave Acapulco without seen it!

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

410620998.name: Amazing History
410620998.author: a TripAdvisor user
410620998.reviewBody: Beautiful views and amazing historical art and artifacts. Well worth a visit for the views and for anyone interested in history.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

400541182.name: Museum
400541182.author: a TripAdvisor user
400541182.reviewBody: If you\'ve had enough Sun this is a good place to spend a couple of hours. You can learn some history about Acapulco.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

377148803.name: Best history in Acapulco! Be sure to ask if the place is haunted!
377148803.author: a TripAdvisor user
