377148803.reviewBody:
When most Americans think of Acapulco they think of the 50s era glamour spot, the 70s disco capital or, unfortunately, today's drug wars. Here is a place that will put the city and its long history into perspective. I highly recommend it to everyone -- especially foreign vistors.

I spend less than two hours at the fort but could have spent longer. Nearly 100 percent of the artifacts -- from petroglyphs to Cortez-era canons -- are authentic and you can get close up to them. 

The fort was built by Cortez, as he took control of Mexico from both native people as well as pirates who sought to rob traders from as far as China and the Philippines of goods ranging from gold to spices to china and cookware. The place is fascinating.

You can walk through without assistance but we chatted with guides who are trained historians throughout the museum. One particularly interesting guide entertaining teens in our group with stories about ghost sightings throughout the fort. There are English speaking guides so be sure to find one and ask about the ghosts if you do not speak Spanish.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

366064077.name: Cortez era Fort overlooking Bay
366064077.author: a TripAdvisor user
366064077.reviewBody: We took a taxi from our hotel which dropped us off at the front gate of the fort. It was built by Cortez soldiers to accept the gold being shipped to Spain from the Philippines. This treasure was then transported by donkey over the mountains to Veracruz where it was again loaded onto ships bound for Spain. Many original artifacts not only from the early Colonial Period of Acapulco, but also an insight into the indigenous population, which you can see by looking at the faces of real Acapulcuenos, still exists. Be prepared to climb the heights for views overlooking the Bay (with its new cruise ships) and try to imagine early galleons. It is cool inside, but can be hot outside.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

362130810.name: Part of the old city tour by Ricardo Alverez
362130810.author: a TripAdvisor user
362130810.reviewBody: Great tourist attraction. Many interesting items. Great views of the old city. Easy parking and reasonable admission.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

358748900.name: into forts and history then go
358748900.author: a TripAdvisor user
358748900.reviewBody: we have been to tons of forts and always find something new at each one.  this fort has alot more museum items in rooms thn most.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

356895617.name: Surprised by our visit
356895617.author: a TripAdvisor user
356895617.reviewBody: We visited the fort as part of an cruise excursion.  We were really impressed with the condition of the fort as well as the displays.  Good view from the top.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

355845831.name: Museo Hist\u00f3rico
355845831.author: a TripAdvisor user
355845831.reviewBody: Beautifully done museum in a perfectly maintained colonial fort.  Very interesting, well explained exhibits described in Spanish and in English.  The fort is situated on a hill (of course) and you can walk to the top of its lovely walls.  In March of 2016, there is an exhibit of Zapotec imaginary animals - brightly colored as usual, but huge instead of small:  thrilling.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

352402036.name: near cruise port
352402036.author: a TripAdvisor user
352402036.reviewBody: across the road from cruise dock and there is a bridge cross over to it. I think admission was only $4, nicely done exhibits, great views and well taken care of. A nice visit if you want an excursion from ship that is cheap and safe.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

351199872.name: Great if you are interested in pirates history
351199872.author: a TripAdvisor user
351199872.reviewBody: Small museum with great views of acapulco.\nEntrance 55 pesos adults.\nNice if you have a lot if days to spend in acapulco

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

350965769.name: Great view from a fort
350965769.author: a TripAdvisor user
350965769.reviewBody: The fort of San Diego is located within convenient distance from Zocalo and offers a rich set of view spots. I was here for one day in afternoon during my second day at Acapulco.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

348771038.name: Interesting Museum
348771038.author: a TripAdvisor user
348771038.reviewBody: The Fort is a good place to spend an hour or two.  The museum rooms are air conditioned and are full of interesting exhibits and useful descriptions.  I haven\'t seen anything like this one before.  \n\nGood views from the top of the fort.  Clean bathrooms.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

347497966.name: Historic Gem!
347497966.author: a TripAdvisor user
347497966.reviewBody: this is an extremely well preserved and historic Spanish built forts, has a magnificent museum with a comprehensive collection from a wide time period, extremely interesting and well signed in English and Spanish, strongly recommend if any interest in history and military....naval and maritime....

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

340090768.name: Historic Old Fort of San Diego
340090768.author: a TripAdvisor user
340090768.reviewBody: This old fort in Acaoulco was built to defenf against pirates. It has a very interesting history that us well documented in the 10 display rooms . There are lovely views from the fort walls. It is located in a gated area of very beautiful mansions

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

339962656.name: Not worth it.
339962656.author: a TripAdvisor user
339962656.reviewBody: This visit was part of our city tour. Too much of our time was wasted here.  We were disappointed that most of the information that we could read was more the history of world discovery and trade than it was about the Fort and its role in Acapulco history.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

338969393.name: Historical visit
338969393.author: a TripAdvisor user
338969393.reviewBody: We visited this museum on a great sunny day. Great things to see and description in English and Spanish. Provides history of the city.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

338285607.name: History
338285607.author: a TripAdvisor user
338285607.reviewBody: Have to be into history. It\'s the old fort that protected the bay of Acapulco. Not a history buff, but still enjoyed.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

333798076.name: Awesome even if you aren\'t a history buff
333798076.author: a TripAdvisor user
333798076.reviewBody: We only allotted about 30 minutes for this Fort / Museum and that was a mistake.  We could have spent 4 hours.  The Fort itself is very interesting but the presentation and variety of the artifacts took it over the top.  It is well worth the 52 pesos to get in.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

333371540.name: Very informative history of settlement and development of Acapulco
333371540.author: a TripAdvisor user
333371540.reviewBody: Really enjoyed our visit here in December 2015.  Very informative exhibits, all with English and in air conditioned refurbished fort on the port of Acapulco.  Nice outing away from the beach and boating.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

327691034.name: A cutural Must in Acapulco
327691034.author: a TripAdvisor user
327691034.reviewBody: This is one of the best museums I visited. Learnt a lot, enjoyed thoroughly. Great view of the city, fantastic architecture, VERY well arranged expositions. Thumbs up!

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

325575583.name: Interesting!
325575583.author: a TripAdvisor user
325575583.reviewBody: Didn\'t know about the Philippine/Mexico connection prior to my visit. Though we didn\'t have a tour guide, many of the placards were in English.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

324507453.name: Remembering Sir Francis Drake
324507453.author: a TripAdvisor user
324507453.reviewBody: Whoever is interested in the history of Acapulco and wants to feel like one of the defenders of the port against the invading pirates of the past  should visit the site.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

320540550.name: Historic Fort
320540550.author: a TripAdvisor user
320540550.reviewBody: The display rooms are very well done and arranged with various artifacts from times gone by. Much of the contents are from the trade that was set up with Asia or the Philippines. The literature is very good, written both in English and Spanish so it makes it easy to conduct a self guided tour.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

319252126.name: A must for Action Movie or history buffs. Great views of bay.
319252126.author: a TripAdvisor user
319252126.reviewBody:
Enjoyed the site. Cost is fair. No map or pamphlet-really messed up for the key government attraction. Is popular visit but not over crowded. 

Some restoration but not much. Most of fort is covered in paint and modern accommodations. Indoor displays are air conditioned. 

Busy place, lots of school children and nationals. Three tour groups on my visit, guides spoke in Spanish.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

318839147.name: Acapulco, History and Culture
318839147.author: a TripAdvisor user
318839147.reviewBody: Starting whit my review, I really would like to say that if you would like to see the Real, Historical and Cultural part of Acapulco,  start at El Fuerte de San Diego, you really going to not just to enjoy but admire the Indian Pottery Kitchen Art.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

314417791.name: Historic Acapulco with a colonial touch.
314417791.author: a TripAdvisor user
314417791.reviewBody: If you want to get to know the old Acapulco, this a good place to start. Fuerte San Diego (San Diego Fort), is a place where you can learn about the fist colonizers of the area and how they defended the bay from above. This a place full of history. Many nights a year they have fireworks for several celebrations, specially on independence day, where they hold the best celebration in port.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

312537545.name: History: A must in Acapulco if you like a little more than beach and fun.
312537545.author: a TripAdvisor user
312537545.reviewBody: This place tell us the history about Acapulco bay and the relevance for many centuries, if you have the opportunity; enjoy it.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

308715058.name: Yes the oldest building in Acapulco but it has been over renovated
308715058.author: a TripAdvisor user
308715058.reviewBody: The exhibition rooms are all air conditioned while there are no guides to show you around there are signs in Spanish and English translations to explain the exhibits. The exhibits mainly shows the trade relationships between the Philippines and Mexico and the trade routes from Asia to Mexico and America.\nIf not too hot and sunny you can go up the roof to get a good view of the bay.\nOutside the fort is also a view area to see the bay.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

305532632.name: Well worth a visit.
305532632.author: a TripAdvisor user
305532632.reviewBody: This is a lovely little museum, a good way to spend the morning learning about Acapulco\'s fascinating trade with the Orient and pirate history. It also has a great view over the old part of town and the docks.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

303672268.name: Mind blowing
303672268.author: a TripAdvisor user
303672268.reviewBody:
If you haven't already done your research on Acapulco this tour will explain to you more and more.

Private car park provided. Tickets are $35 pesos. All is written in English and Spanish. Not tour guides, just you and free to take your time.

The views are breathtaking.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

290049181.name: Absolute must when you visit Acapulco
290049181.author: a TripAdvisor user
290049181.reviewBody: Acapulco is  a very old town with lots of history but casual visitors don\'t get much idea of the town\'s past because history doesn\'t seem to be a priority for Acapulco\'s marketing folks. Thats a great pity. During the Colonial period Acapulco was a terminus for the annual Galleon trade with the Philippines and the annual fair at which goods were sold attracted thousands of merchants and visitors. The San Diego Fort looks back to Acapulco\'s past as an important trading centre and a target for pirates and rival foreign powers. The Fort provides a museum as well as an opportunity to get magnificent views over the city and ocean. There are also occasional cultural events (music for example).  Definitely not to be missed and you should allocate two hours for the visit.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

280388833.name: Cultural education experience
280388833.author: a TripAdvisor user
280388833.reviewBody: I had no idea of the rich history of Acapulco until visiting here! Very informative and interesting!!!

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

274906169.name: history of acapulco
274906169.author: a TripAdvisor user
274906169.reviewBody: Good history walk a lot and no water to drink they don\'t sell water..but it\'s so good to know about Acapulco..

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

274673486.name: The Fort
274673486.author: a TripAdvisor user
274673486.reviewBody: Was a nice place to visit and learn about Acapulco. Quite informational and it only takes about a hour or two of you time. It is walking distance from the Pier where the cruise ships come in.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

272837186.name: cinco de mayo
272837186.author: a TripAdvisor user
272837186.reviewBody: very good and the view was well worth it , historical value was great we all learn a few new things about the end of the Kings road and the boat and the harbors and how old this place is \nthe children enjoy the walk and after we went to the beach

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

269951491.name: hidden treasure
269951491.author: a TripAdvisor user
269951491.reviewBody: It is a replica of the actual fort- architecturally interesting and pleasing to the eye.\nInside, is a wonderful museum with archeological, site artifacts, and an art exhibit. Fantastic!

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

269723229.name: RECENTLY RENOVATED
269723229.author: a TripAdvisor user
269723229.reviewBody:
This is my 4th visit to this small museum. I was pleasantly surprised by the staff (very helpful and friendly. They lend us a wheel chair for my disabled father in law and helped us any way, to get over some steps and levels), as also to the new appearance of it.
Located in front of the cruise ship terminal, it is really worth a visit, if you want to learn something about the history of Acapulco.
Plan 2 - 3 hours for it and take your time to go on top on the roof for some beautiful vistas of the bay of Acapulco and even for a cruise ship, if one happens to be there.
The small shop has a good selection of books and souvenirs. 
So have a good time and enjoy reading and looking at the exhibitions about the Pirates, the Acapulco fair, its history and the different rebuildings of the fort.
Best to visit early in the day, to avoid larger groups, specially when cruise ships arrive.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

269082950.name: Cool historical site.
269082950.author: a TripAdvisor user
269082950.reviewBody: Fantastic job of caring for a treasure.  There were no guides and our cab driver was way more interested in napping than staying with us.  As history buffs we enjoyed the visit and the antiquities.  Amazing works of art are part of the experience that included Rodin, Renoir and Monet.  Amazing how advanced they truly were 500 years ago.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

268407149.name: Local Museum of Colonial Spanish Conquest Period
268407149.author: a TripAdvisor user
268407149.reviewBody: This little museum covers the colonial Spanish conquest period of Mexican history, long before Acapulco became an international tourist destination.  Not among the wonderful historical museums of the world, El Fuerte de San Diego collects the objects, but does not really explain much of the period and its importance in Mexican history.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

268070921.name: Fort San Diego
268070921.author: a TripAdvisor user
268070921.reviewBody: We went on a Sunday. The week we were in Acapulco was their downtime after Easter so Acapulco was u crowded and perfect! Our driver , Baldo Gomez, was incredible and knowledgable about Mexico history. Made the trip more interesting than I could imagine.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

263808356.name: Good review of historical Acapulco
263808356.author: a TripAdvisor user
263808356.reviewBody: Thanks to our charming, educated, and respectful cab driver, we dropped by this fort.  A taste o\nf history

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

258942674.name: A Must for History Buffs
258942674.author: a TripAdvisor user
258942674.reviewBody: See my full,review of this dated yesterday under full day tours.  Went late Feb. as part of a cruise excursion. EXCELLENTly restored pentagram shaped fort which presents the history fro earliest Indians through the Spanish rule until Mexico won its independence in 1821. WITHIN easy walking distance to cruise ship terminal (good shopping-last chance to get authentic alebrejas...gret Mexico memento or souvenir.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

258668628.name: Worth A Visit
258668628.author: a TripAdvisor user
258668628.reviewBody: Fort San Diego is a short walk from Costera Street and easy to reach on the local bus.  Admission was 52 pesos.  The Fort is very well restored and offers nice views of the harbor from the top wall.  The Fort Museum is located in several rooms on the lower level and much more than I was expecting.  There are some well-done informative exhibits on early inhabitants, Spanish sailors, trade routes, trade items, Pirates and Fort life/supplies.  There were 2 video programs that have English soundtracks if you ask one of the staff to change it for you.  The Fort is connected by a bridge/walkway to the cruise ship terminal but we did not see any ships the whole time we were in Acapulco, so there were very few tourists at the Fort.  It is well worth a visit.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

258250094.name: Gorgeous & important structure, 400 years old, now a museum full of lively stories!
258250094.author: a TripAdvisor user
258250094.reviewBody: One of my favorite places for absorbing Mexican history \'live and in person\'. Among many other historic currents, it beautifully presents the history of the Nao de China or Manila Galleon, the ship that made a yearly trip between Acapulco and Manila, starting very early during the viceregal period. This site is SO worth a visit; I have honestly never seen anyone get bored here. Managed by the national anthropology and history institute (INAH) which has a strong online presence; for those reading Spanish, the state of Guerrero also has a nice site describing this wonderful historic site.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

257373445.name: Such a very historic place
257373445.author: a TripAdvisor user
257373445.reviewBody: our guide happiness took us here on our first day a Sunday (free admission on Sunday\'s) you could see the whole bay and city from this beautiful fort a must see for everyone in Acapulco

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

255114291.name: Very impressive historical monument
255114291.author: a TripAdvisor user
255114291.reviewBody: If you\'re in the area, while visiting Acapulco, consider stopping by this historical monument. It has been well preserved and offers a nice glimpse into the historic-architecture and history of the area. \n\nThere\'s a small fee for entrance and tour, but you are able to walk the exterior grounds, as well as climb some of the fort\'s embankments.  It also offers a great view of the ocean.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

254365106.name: A bit of history
254365106.author: a TripAdvisor user
254365106.reviewBody: This was a very interesting museum and well presented. You can explore the various rooms and even walk up top for a great view of the area.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

252514598.name: A Must Visit in Acapulco
252514598.author: a TripAdvisor user
252514598.reviewBody: A must visit, historic, well maintained, really interesting.  It is shaped in a unique fashion, all information in English and Spanish.  Clean, on the beach, and you will understand so much about east-west culture and Acapulco\'s role in it all.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

251004608.name: Learn about pirates with a Spanish twist
251004608.author: a TripAdvisor user
251004608.reviewBody: An interesting fort due to the historic displays about Spanish Galleons and the Spanish trade with the Far East. Worth spending a couple of hours visiting and wonderful views.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

247474569.name: Fort
247474569.author: a TripAdvisor user
247474569.reviewBody: Very interesting place to visit, you can learn about the international trading that went on in days past.Great museum displays

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

245286616.name: Excelent museum best place in Acapulco
245286616.author: a TripAdvisor user
245286616.reviewBody: Very well put together, nice exhibitions, unexpensive, full of culture, bilingual, if you like old history including indigenous tribes, pirates, etc you\'ll definitely love this place

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

244409074.name: Great Place
244409074.author: a TripAdvisor user
244409074.reviewBody: Worth a visit\n\nIf your traveling this way then this is a great place to stop off and see the sights. defo go

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

233269594.name: Very interesting
233269594.author: a TripAdvisor user
233269594.reviewBody: Actually learned that the Mexicans are decendants of the Phillipines. The fort is shaped like a tortuga.  History buffs will enjoy.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

232594173.name: Interesting Museum
232594173.author: a TripAdvisor user
232594173.reviewBody: Also known as the Museo Historico de Acapulco.  What surprised me most is that this is older than the US, but our pentagon is patterned after this fort building.  This is no place for someone who is limited ambulatory ability.  Lots of walking.  Lots of interesting things to see... laid out so that really have to stop and look to catch the details.  And one of few places we went that we weren\'t bombarded by vendors.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

229821372.name: Great historical place
229821372.author: a TripAdvisor user
229821372.reviewBody: It was very interesting seeing the history of Acapulco. Many items  from the past. Seeing I have been visiting Acapulco for more than 40 years I really enjoyed seeing the history by visiting the Fort which I had gone by so many times in the past.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

223741672.name: Nice exhibition of local history
223741672.author: a TripAdvisor user
223741672.reviewBody: Some nice exhibits from prehispanic days to cononial rule, with special attention to the "Gale\u00f3n de Manila" the ship coming from the Philipinnes to Acapulco which started the trading between the Spanish territories at the time.\nA clean and well displayed collection of sculptures, paintings, maps and other artefacts, as well as panoramic views of the town and beaches, makes this place a very nice visit during your stay in Acapulco.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

219839432.name: Great glimpse of historic Acapulco
219839432.author: a TripAdvisor user
219839432.reviewBody: I went with my nephews to Fuerte San Diego and really enjoyed the glimpse of the history of Acapulco. The exhibits kept the kids\' attention as well (ages 5-15). The views from the rooftop are also nice.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

192684007.name: Amazing!
192684007.author: a TripAdvisor user
192684007.reviewBody: Fascinating history and artifacts. Most of the exhibits have explanations in both Spanish and English. Met a worker who spoke English so we learned a lot more about the history of this amazing fort. Also, great view of the marina from the top of the fort.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

181043034.name: Learn about the History of Acapulco
181043034.author: a TripAdvisor user
181043034.reviewBody: This fort/museum provides a very good history of Acapulco and its trading tradition. There are guides and videos in several of the rooms to provide background information on the exhibits. The displays have both Spanish and English captions.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

176192999.name: Good place
176192999.author: a TripAdvisor user
176192999.reviewBody: When you are in Acapulco, dont miss a trip to the fort. You may not feel it too great compared to other forts and palaces in other places in Mexico, but a visit here is worth it. The view of the Acapulco Bay from the fort is breathtaking, which you cant afford to miss.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

172894174.name: Don\'t Miss This
172894174.author: a TripAdvisor user
172894174.reviewBody: Easy to find.  If you are on a cruise ship it\'s right across the street from the dock on Acapulco harbour.  Very well maintained.  Easy to navigate.  It reveals a history of the new world dating to the 15th century.  Museum displays in Spanish and English.  Gift shop.  History buffs will love this, but I really think that children will enjoy exploring it also.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

155377055.name: Interesting history, well maintained
155377055.author: a TripAdvisor user
155377055.reviewBody: The fort is easy to find and you can tour it w/o a guide.   The displays are in Spanish and English (mostly) and very informative.   Never knew that Acapulco was a trade route to the orient, which is what they focused on.    Most people see the fort in 1 hour, but we took 2.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

151664977.name: Historical
151664977.author: a TripAdvisor user
151664977.reviewBody: Very interesting and lots of Historical informatiom about Acapulco and its past. Situated towards the Zocalo another place well worth a visit and very informal

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

151620446.name: Part of the China trade before Panama Canal
151620446.author: a TripAdvisor user
151620446.reviewBody:
Lots of interesting facts in this quaint, small museum at the fort.

Closed on Mondays.

Not far from the Zocalo, so you can do the fort in the morning, visit the Catedral at the Zocalo next and then have the pizza!

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

149993265.name: my favorite place in Acapulco
149993265.author: a TripAdvisor user
149993265.reviewBody: loved the place.  It has a museum in the first floor.  Great place to get history.  It has A/C....!!!\non the top floor, you can find beautiful views of the city.  Loved it!

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

147282559.name: Great History
147282559.author: a TripAdvisor user
147282559.reviewBody: Our tour guide and driver, Juan Corona took us here and we loved it.  I am a history buff and soaked in the displays and stories of the forts creation, service, and fall during the Mexican War of Independence in 1812.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

142750018.name: Educational!
142750018.author: a TripAdvisor user
142750018.reviewBody: Loved that this fortress was turned into a museum...it was so cool to see the way people protected themselves in the 1600s. Very fun and educational part of our trip.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

140785675.name: History
140785675.author: a TripAdvisor user
140785675.reviewBody: a lot of visitors to Acapulco don\'t even know that the fort is there even though they pass by on the Costera.  Take the time to go.  It is well worth it.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

137286176.name: Great piece of history
137286176.author: a TripAdvisor user
137286176.reviewBody: When we pulled up to the front, I thought we were just looking at the building, which was interesting.  But when you get inside, the artifacts are amazing.  The whole place is air conditioned, which really helped when it was 100 outside.  They have displays of pottery, clothing, weapons, and the original chapel.  Beautiful.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

128294608.name: historical site
128294608.author: a TripAdvisor user
128294608.reviewBody: Local history in the heart of the city and all walkable for everyone including children.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

128144958.name: History comes alive before you!
128144958.author: a TripAdvisor user
128144958.reviewBody: A visit to this museum will provide an insight to the history and development of Acapulco like nothing else. The items on exhibit are phenomenal and well organized. Several rooms are set aside to tell a specific aspect of a portion of the area\'s history, and this description is complete with magnificent exhibits and narrative.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

127314432.name: THIS FORT IS VERY WELL PRESERVED
127314432.author: a TripAdvisor user
127314432.reviewBody: A "MUST SEE" in Acapulco. Nice air conditioned museum inside. Very informative, unexpensive and great place to take pictures of the bay.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

126799693.name: Wonderful Fort
126799693.author: a TripAdvisor user
126799693.reviewBody: It is a small museum, but a fairly large fort.  There is something here for all ages.  i have been here 3 times and always discover something I hadn\'t noticed.  There is a spectacular view of the city from here and a nice but small gift shop.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

126709435.name: Excellent Museum
126709435.author: a TripAdvisor user
126709435.reviewBody: Take some time to absorb the rich history of the various European nations attempting to colonize Mexico.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

126157854.name: Nice view and informative - and had A/C! :-)
126157854.author: a TripAdvisor user
126157854.reviewBody: The fort is a nice little musuem, that offers good views over the bay.\nThe museum is well set out and well labelled, with most wording in spanish and english.\nAll the rooms are air conditioned as well, which makes it a nice retreat from the heat outside, and lets u take your time reading and absorbing the information.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

125937999.name: Worth the trip
125937999.author: a TripAdvisor user
125937999.reviewBody: Near the Zocala and worth seeings; several places across the street on the beach for lunch aftewards; great views

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

123811343.name: Historic Acapulco site
123811343.author: a TripAdvisor user
123811343.reviewBody: Most people are not aware of the important history of Acapulco, a Spanish gate to the Orient from the Americas since the 1600.\nYou learn about "La Nao de China" the Spanish Galleons that went to Phillipines and the pirates that attacked them. Very interesting.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

123228166.name: Great History
123228166.author: a TripAdvisor user
123228166.reviewBody: This fort has been refurbished in the last 12-18 months and is a nice view into the history of Acapulco

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

123126616.name: Learn about the history of Acapulco
123126616.author: a TripAdvisor user
123126616.reviewBody: You can not miss this historical site, we learned many things about Acapulco we did not know and the tour answer a lot of questions!\n\nOnly wish there book on the fort had pictures to show friends

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

122800207.name: Defintiely worth a visit
122800207.author: a TripAdvisor user
122800207.reviewBody: I love history and this place satisfied my craving.  Very detailed history written in English of the area and amazing views of the bay

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

122637180.name: Mexico has a lot of Culture!
122637180.author: a TripAdvisor user
122637180.reviewBody: To know about Mexican History, you have to go to Fuerte de San Diego, great place to go to learn about Acapulco and Mexico in general

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

120617140.name: History
120617140.author: a TripAdvisor user
120617140.reviewBody: Great place to get a little history of the area. Not really very much to see, so the visit is fairly short. Lots of little indoor rooms with items, and stories in spanish and english.\nVery informal. As usual here, beautiful views.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

119895408.name: History
119895408.author: a TripAdvisor user
119895408.reviewBody: Enjoyed it.  Short walk to LaDiana from there too along the beach

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

119290866.name: An important piece on the History of Mexico
119290866.author: a TripAdvisor user
119290866.reviewBody: The fort was intended to protect the main port of the western coast of Mexico, where the ship from China arrived delivering a lot of asean goods that would cross by land to Veracruz in the Gulf of Mexico and from there to Spain.\nIt is a nice museum if one likes these kind of stuff. Nicely maintained and in the heart of Acapulco with a good view of the bay.\nSundays entrance is free.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

118534297.name: Next to cruise terminal
118534297.author: a TripAdvisor user
118534297.reviewBody: This fort has a nice museum which has a low price entry fee. You can walk around the fort at no cost and take nice pictures from here.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

95352397.name: Interesting
95352397.author: a TripAdvisor user
95352397.reviewBody: You get a feel for the history of the area . In the various air conditiuoned rooms you visit you start with artefacts from /history of the original inhabitants through to the Spanish peiod of control. The importance of the Phillipines , China and Japan in terms of trade and the relevance of the fort during the Spanish time.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

67783295.name: Interesting museum with well done historical perspective
67783295.author: a TripAdvisor user
67783295.reviewBody: We were just walking by and decided to go in for a visit.  Pleasant surprise and well worth the 35 pesos to get in.  You make your way through a series of air-conditioned rooms and learn about the history of the area from pre-columbian times to the recent past.  \nWe were impressed with the quality of the exhibits and the information was posted in both Spanish and English.  Nice way to spend an hour.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

58082059.name: Nice small fort - free admission now
58082059.author: a TripAdvisor user
58082059.reviewBody: It was nice fort, right next to cruise ship pier. Worth a taxi drive from hotel. Little fort offers A/C\'ed spaces inside walls with exibition of trade articles, weapons and chinese goods from pacific trade routes from the past. Also good photo shoots of the bay and panoramic views of city. It\'s walking distance from flea market and marina, thou neighborhood is a bit ghetto and scary to walk after sunset.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

6616473.name: Interesting exhibits
6616473.author: a TripAdvisor user
6616473.reviewBody:
In January 2007, I spent a couple of hours touring the self-guided exhibits at the fort. There are some interesting glimpses of how the soldiers lived, several excellent videos in English or Spanish on the history of the area, and quite a few examples of the treasures carried by the Manila galleon. 

The exhibits are well explained, especially regarding trade routes to the Far East, and the history of Spanish imperialism in Mexico. The temporary exhibit on jaguar cults was also enlightening; I had no idea they were still active in Mexican festivals and folklore. There are lovely views from the top of the fort around the bay.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

5146932.name: only a photo op
5146932.author: a TripAdvisor user
5146932.reviewBody: I wasn\'t too impressed with the fort. I definitely don\'t think it was worth the admission price. If you\'re into photography, then it\'s a good opportunity for some pictures, and a good view of the bay.\n

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos s/n Colonia Centro

669412653.name: La Roqueta could be seen from far away
669412653.author: a TripAdvisor user
669412653.reviewBody: Will only visit it again during Low Season because I went during High Season and it was soooo crowded that I couldn\u2019t even get off from the boat.\nThe Island is only visited by locals and national tourists mainly because it\u2019s certainly not the best place to stay during your visit to Acapulco. However, you can go there on a boat trip and enjoy the view, the weather, the trip itself and the greatness of Costera Miguel Alem\u00e1n.\nThe restaurants in La Roqueta are very expensive and the quality of food doesn\u2019t pay off.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

667932610.name: Disappointed with the snorkeling
667932610.author: a TripAdvisor user
667932610.reviewBody: We elected to do this on our own, instead of paying $90 per person to a tour company, since we had a rental car. We parked in La Caleta (had no problem finding parking, and the car was well taken care of by a street attendant), got on a glass-bottom boat that was about to leave, and made to La Roqueta. The captain was funny, but he only spoke Spanish. We went because we wanted to snorkel, but were disappointed. You need to go beyond the rocks to see a bit of marine life. There is a guide with you, but the actual snorkel time is very short. We also paid for the banana boats, which was not expensive, but the ride was too short, as well. If you want a table, you need to buy food/drinks, and you will pay extra for the umbrella. The pina coladas were terrible. This is one of the recommended attractions in Acapulco since you get to see mansions owned by the rich and famous, but I would not do it again. Had a good meal when we came back to La Caleta at one of the many restaurants right by the docking area.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

665584223.name: So funny!
665584223.author: a TripAdvisor user
665584223.reviewBody: In this place you can relax because is very quiet, before arriving you get a boat and you can see the fish and a estatue of the virgen at the bottom of the sea, t\u00fa this clean with delicious food and there are many activities what can you do there with your family our friends.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

664605288.name: Snorkeling
664605288.author: a TripAdvisor user
664605288.reviewBody: It was a very pleasant activity, the crew were extremely helpful and went into details of everything around, I am pleased to see that they are culturally aware of protecting the reef, yet you can tell that it was not in the past.\n

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

654170733.name: Go on a snorkel tour
654170733.author: a TripAdvisor user
654170733.reviewBody: We visited on a snorkel tour; the boat anchored just offshore and away from the main beach. That was good, because the main beach looked like a madhouse -- wall to wall people. We had the little snorkeling cove all to ourselves, though. The variety of fish was excellent, and our guide dove to bring up interesting specimens from the bottom.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

642508369.name: Not much here!
642508369.author: a TripAdvisor user
642508369.reviewBody:
Walked from the quayside up to the lighthouse viewpoint and back to the bar area. The walk up is tough and takes much energy, in our December visit the humidity was high making the walk difficult for many.

The bar area is low calibre and plastic but prices are very low by European standards.
The beach is popular and packed but could do with a good clean.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

635061259.name: Excellent Beach
635061259.author: a TripAdvisor user
635061259.reviewBody: The beach was beautiful. There were less vendors than other beaches in Acapulco. There were less people, but it was also a weekday. Be careful of the boat ride over. We took a glass bottom boat ride and it took 2 hours to get there.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

633960027.name: Forget about your troubles
633960027.author: a TripAdvisor user
633960027.reviewBody: Roqueta Island is a gem.  Our guide, Juan, was about as friendly and accommodating as tour guides come.  The guided tour of the island was informative and the views of. Acapulco and Pacific Ocean were breathtaking.  The restaurant was very good as well.  We\'ll have to come back soon for more Mescal.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

610702994.name: It\u2019s an island, !,,,,,!!!!!!!,  warm water..... soft sand
610702994.author: a TripAdvisor user
610702994.reviewBody: Wonderful beach, no one lives in that island,so is wild,..... soft sand ease waves , nice snorkeling in the rocks ....

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

606909100.name: Beautiful crystal boat tour
606909100.author: a TripAdvisor user
606909100.reviewBody: A view of Acapulco by sea. The tour was exceptional. the tour guide was very entertaining, he showed us many famous houses of aristocratic individuals, we also saw a guy feeding fishes under the water. we saw the Virgin Mary under the sea and went to La Isla Roqueta

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

589839603.name: Best Day of Fishing and swimming at Isla Roqueta!!!
589839603.author: a TripAdvisor user
589839603.reviewBody: I highly recommend a fishing or boat trip out to this little slice of heaven! My husband and I\u2019s tour guide, Benjamin Alarcon knew a guy with a fishing boat that took us fishing all day for $300! Boat was partially covered, had bathroom, poles and bait were included in price and they brought sandwiches and water for us. Benjamin arranged for us to shop for our favorite liquors of choice and made sure our drinks are always cold and full while on the boat!! We stopped at the island afterward where We jumped into the ocean and swam! Perfect day! You can snorkel at the island when the water is clear before the first rains of the season. Hire Benjamin to experience this island and ocean fishing adventure! The price was incredible for what we got and the captain and deckhand on boat knew Benjamin personally and treated us like kings and queens! Contact Juli at 503-960-1352 for info on how to contact Benjamin

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

582065078.name: Beautiful view
582065078.author: a TripAdvisor user
582065078.reviewBody: A boat will take you around And highlight some important landmarks.  I was unfortunately not fluent enough in Spanish to understand it all.  There was no English translator, but I really enjoyed the scenery, landmarks and views.  When everyone else laughed, I laughed with them.    There is a restaurant at Isla  la roqueta, and washrooms you can use for small amount of pesos.   Does get crowded, and reminder to always watch for your  boat to get back.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

567508171.name: Nice
567508171.author: a TripAdvisor user
567508171.reviewBody: Have been many times, always a nice experience. The glass bottom boat ride is very enjoyable!  It\'s a well spent day!!

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

564888812.name: La Roqueta
564888812.author: a TripAdvisor user
564888812.reviewBody:
Place to visit....really interesting.
Please take a tour and stop at the beach.
Will not tell you everything concerning the tour or visit by boat because they are a few surprises.
Also go snorkling if you have the time.
Really worth it.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

560712085.name: palao tour
560712085.author: a TripAdvisor user
560712085.reviewBody: we took the palao boat to get there .great ride .frendly staff .on the island open bar and great staff.even a show of traditionnal native dance !  please tip them like a civiliz ated  person would do !

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

559479056.name: good day trip
559479056.author: a TripAdvisor user
559479056.reviewBody: The island is accessed by boat and you can leave at different times . The boat takes you on a tour and ahowes you many things even a cliff diver who works on the boat. Good place to visit there are many attractions there ,restaurants,a show at the Paloi or you can walk the island or swim in the ocean or a long walk up to the lighthouse. There are donkeys that sometimes roam around and are fun to watch.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

559253206.name: A stop while boating
559253206.author: a TripAdvisor user
559253206.reviewBody: We jumped from the boat to swim at the Roqueta, it was a bit busy but beautiful and the water was clear.  We had lunch there and left afterwards, its beautiful and clean.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

559087895.name: Only went to the La Roqueta beach
559087895.author: a TripAdvisor user
559087895.reviewBody: We just wanted to go strait to the beach but were treated to a short cruise in Spanish. The beach is very nice and relatively clean, better said least dirty of pretty well all Acapulco beaches. Once you have swum on Mayan Riviera and also Puerto Escondido beaches you may find it a bit difficult to swim here.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

551966811.name: save your time and money
551966811.author: a TripAdvisor user
551966811.reviewBody: this trip is a tourist trap, especially the glass bottom boats.  they stop halfway to sell items and food  it is a racket

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

551619928.name: Very nice!
551619928.author: a TripAdvisor user
551619928.reviewBody: Great day trip.  Snorkeling not the best, but the hike was nice.  Not super strenuous.  Great lunch.  Very busy beach--maybe too busy but it was Christmas time..

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

542530552.name: Crowed
542530552.author: a TripAdvisor user
542530552.reviewBody: Nice place to see but the crowds and the boat taxis are just too much for me bay water is clear and you can dive on the reef. Enjoy yourself and have fun.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

542099356.name: Snorkeling was fun!
542099356.author: a TripAdvisor user
542099356.reviewBody: The boat ride was great, the beach was very nice, food was delicious, and snorkeling was so much fun!

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

508060034.name: Lunch on the beach
508060034.author: a TripAdvisor user
508060034.reviewBody: Pay a man and he will set up an umbrella table & chairs on the beach. You\'re wedged in with lots of beach goers. I ordered the shrimp cocktail and the rest of our family of 5 shared a huge tray at least 2X2 feet of seafood. You can ride the big banana and swim too.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

498325986.name: Acapulco nature hike adventure
498325986.author: a TripAdvisor user
498325986.reviewBody: Get ready to sweat as you climb, climb, climb to the top, and watch your footing in case you get caught in the rain before, during, and/ or after. Best to bring along water, a walking stick, and lots of energy. Interesting place to visit. Get there by glass bottom very basic small boat, and enjoy the lushness of the island. Best if you have a guide to explain the history, the flora and the fauna.\nAcapulco has seen better days, but la Roqueta Island has maintained its natural allure. It does have souvenir shops, basic restaurant, as you get off at the pier.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

494963534.name: Keep it Cheap, Just take the ferry over, leave when you want.
494963534.author: a TripAdvisor user
494963534.reviewBody: we paid for the VIP ticket that included all the watered down drinks you can have and a simple mass produced lunch that was nourishment the taste was plain. we went to the Palao part and it was not worth it. if i had it to do over i would get the Cheap ticket buy my own lunch and drinks on the non VIP side. sure there was a small show with a Mayan / Aztec dancer and some snorkeling. but all four of us said the Palau part was a waste of a day.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

489992519.name: Crowded and felt like kidnapped
489992519.author: a TripAdvisor user
489992519.reviewBody: Probably back in the day, the Isla Roqueta was a nice place to go, but not anymore. The boats that transport you from the shore to the island and take you to the tour keep you for over 20 minutes by the rocks where a virgin is. They asked for collecting money for the the guy who went down to feed the fish. The other little boat with vendors approached the boat where we were and they started selling things. Finally we got to the Roqueta to do some snorkeling that was not the best as the water was cloudy and there was not many variety of fish to see. The beach was packed with a lot of people and it was very noisy. Not a place to relax or enjoy the beach.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

482789672.name: LA ROQUETA\u2026
482789672.author: a TripAdvisor user
482789672.reviewBody: WIth a privilege location, right in front of LA CALETA (local beach) this beautiful island is the destination of many who are trying to avoid the crow of the beach. It is a short trip. The cost is 50 pesos. You will go with many locals\u2026 many\u2026.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

477083991.name: Be prepared for Jellyfish
477083991.author: a TripAdvisor user
477083991.reviewBody: We visited in April, with our children, because we wanted to snorkel with the kids. Soon after getting in the water my 6 year old daughter was stung several times by jellyfish and we were unable to stay in the water. We later noticed many others complaining from being stung, especially young children. The beach filled up quickly with many people. The place is beautiful, but we were not able to snorkel which was the main purpose of our visit and we quickly left due to there being just too many people. We did get to see some beautiful fish through the glass floor on the boat we used to get to the island. And the people,the workers, as is common in Mexico, were very nice. Tourists on the snorkeling trips were allowed to touch the fish and other wildlife which in my opinion should not be allowed. And I was told by someone who did go on the snorkeling tour that there was little wildlife to see, most likely from too many tourists and the little protection the industry grants the animals. I imagine most of the wildlife have moved away from the island shores. If we would have known about the jellyfish, we might have visited prepared to take a hike around the island instead, visiting the more deserted parts and maybe having a picnic there, otherwise I would not return again.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

473285179.name: LAs AventurasdeCary
473285179.author: a TripAdvisor user
473285179.reviewBody: Great experience we took a boat from caleta to Isla la Roqueta the guy give a a nice trip showing all around there and the Virgin Mary that is under water plus they offer u tickets if u like to do snorkel but I recommend to buy it on the place when u arrived because can save a few bucks,the food they sell there so good fresh and also recommended a good massage it relaxed u so good and u can take water shoes and extra shorts everything was so beautiful and the water so clean I loved it...

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

471686387.name: Kayaking at La Roqueta Acapulco
471686387.author: a TripAdvisor user
471686387.reviewBody: The staff was very friendly and accommodating. However the equipment was in very poor condition. We booked the trip as a excursion on a cruise. It was listed as a  difficulty  level 2 however I think it was a bit more strenuous and would rate it a level 3. The trip involved about 45 min of continues paddling in a channel with a pretty strong current and wind. We then put into a small beach for about 15 min. Then paddle back to where we put in to start the trip. The total Kayak trip was about 90 min. The trip included lunch that was very good and consisted of homemade local food. I think the trip operators should consider stopping and talking about some local points of interest along the way. It is a very beautiful coast line.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

469166714.name: Away from the crowd
469166714.author: a TripAdvisor user
469166714.reviewBody: There are some nice paved walking trails around the island leading to some secluded beaches (east of the main beach) and also up to the light house (one can walk up to the top inside the lighthouse, but be very careful as a few of the steps are unstable).  Walks are hilly but not difficult with very scenic overlooks.  We had most of the trails to ourselves.  Bring water (available on the main beach or before taking the 8 minute ferry to la Roqueta from Playa Caleta).  We judged it much nicer than Laguna de Coyuca and Pie de la Cuesta.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

464567077.name: very beautiful
464567077.author: a TripAdvisor user
464567077.reviewBody:
took the dinka  tour boat over to the main beach way too crowded
took a sharp right and ended up at palau
very quiet friendly laid back atmoshere
had a great time
would reccemend calling palau for shuttle service too the islan d
its free!!

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

460242570.name: Best for kids
460242570.author: a TripAdvisor user
460242570.reviewBody: You pay to get to the island about $50 pesos  per person, once you get there, it has a nice beach area. There aren\'t big waves and the shore isn\'t that deep so it\'s a great place for kids. They rent the chairs and tables and sell food. You can take snacks and drinks and just rent the chairs for like $75 pesos.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

457626034.name: Worth the visit for great fun in the ocean
457626034.author: a TripAdvisor user
457626034.reviewBody: Be sure to take your own food and water. Enjoy snorkeling, wading, swimming, paddle boarding and other activities on a beach a little more protected from the ocean waves.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

454999978.name: Snorkeling at la Roqueta
454999978.author: a TripAdvisor user
454999978.reviewBody: Had a great time snorkeling at la Roqueta with Family and friends. We rented a boat to go snorkeling and then went to see the dives at la quebrada

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

452457269.name: Nice Flora and Fauna
452457269.author: a TripAdvisor user
452457269.reviewBody: We took a glass bottom boat from the Boca Chica Hotel over to Isla La Roqueta.   We climbed up to the lighthouse, and there we were able to enjoy the most amazing view of the city!  It was worth the uphill walk!

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

450313579.name: Save your money and don\'t use Palao tour!
450313579.author: a TripAdvisor user
450313579.reviewBody: It was on the Palao boat and the restaurant was also called Palao. No hotel pickup but that\'s fine.  When we arrived at the pier, we were the only 2 people that were on time!  The owner sat with us for a while and complained about the peso being so weak against the US $, but we were the only 2 Americans, so how much could that harm him.  When we finally left, we had waited a little over an hour and the boat was full, probably 45 people on board.  Also, we were the only English-speaking tourists and the entire tour was in Spanish!  Not very informative for us.  This tour was not what we were expecting.  We kept stopping for these fake cliff divers to dive off of cliffs along the way.  It was ok, but tips were expected.  Then tips were expected for the lads under the glass bottomed boat.  The only word we recognized the entire tour was "propina" and it was said a lot.  The Palao restaurant was very rustic, if you know what I mean.  And the bathrooms we so dirty!  There wasn\'t any toilet paper or paper towels and the toilets had no rims.  If you go, be prepared.  Our person that helped us snorkel was very patient and helpful, though there was a language barrier.  We tipped him a 100 pesos and thought he was going to pass out!  As it turns out, we were the only ones in the snorkeling group of 10 that tipped him!  The food was awful and cold as it had sat out too long.  We would not do this tour again or recommend it.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

437232232.name: Beautiful warm water
437232232.author: a TripAdvisor user
437232232.reviewBody: We went out snorkeling. The water was perfect, lots of cool fish and pretty coral and the locals stay far enough back that you won\'t get run over. We\'ll go back to actually hike on, what appears, to be a very beautiful island.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

436466778.name: Vacation
436466778.author: a TripAdvisor user
436466778.reviewBody: This is a perfect spot for a day trip restaurants beautiful beach beautiful sunsets very laid-back awesome

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

422637510.name: Nice Swim
422637510.author: a TripAdvisor user
422637510.reviewBody: Nice place to take the family and swim, snorkeling and even diving is available. Simple food and drinks available at Palao. Lots of people though

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

420571552.name: Family Vacations
420571552.author: a TripAdvisor user
420571552.reviewBody: We spent an afternoon very comfortable, I was surprised such a magnificent degree of cleanliness, both on the beach and in the sea, all staff there works very friendly and attentive. A family atmosphere. Widely recommended.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

415510615.name: Not worth going.
415510615.author: a TripAdvisor user
415510615.reviewBody: It took a long time to get there, we had to stop to watch this guy jump off a cliff which that was not what we pay for, and than we had to give him tip. And than after watch couple of things on the way we finally got there. When we got there we got all this Anoying people asking us to seat down and eat or drink, after we agree to eat they gave us the worse and smallest portion of food. Than we drunk a not so cold beer to complete the bad meal. Save your self some time and money and stay away.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

401507073.name: A morning at roqueta
401507073.author: a TripAdvisor user
401507073.reviewBody: Me and my family went there. First we took a bus from the other side of the bus, it took us around 45 min, but the bus was air conditioner. We get to caleta and took a direct boat, 15 min long. We get to the island at 1300 and there was a bunch of people but we could find a place. It is a nice place for stay a couple of hours.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

400425472.name: Crystal clear water
400425472.author: a TripAdvisor user
400425472.reviewBody: This is a good place to snorkel. The water is clear and calm. A boat ride gets you there and back. You have the option of enjoying the beach or expliring the island. A nice place to spend the day.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

389894171.name: Looked nice but never got there!
389894171.author: a TripAdvisor user
389894171.reviewBody: Bought a ticket to be taken to the island by boat from Zoccalo. It took an hour to get to the island because the boat was constantly stopping while one of the boat staff would jump in the water and swim with the fish and then ask for tips. We were bobbing around about 20 metres from the island shore when the captain decided the island was \'too full\' and headed back to Zoccalo! When the boat arrived back we complained and were told that it was the \'Government\' had \'closed\' the island. Why sell us of a ticket then?.. After a long heated exchange we were given a refund. \n\n

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

388671864.name: Wonderful
388671864.author: a TripAdvisor user
388671864.reviewBody: My husband and my two children and I went to this island it\'s a wonderful beach. We enjoyed a big part of the day here. The down side is that it was very crowded and had to pay for chairs to sit on by the beach. I recommend bringing beverages and snacks/food because it is very expensive to buy it at the island.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

388258397.name: Warning!!! Boat tour wasted half my day
388258397.author: a TripAdvisor user
388258397.reviewBody: After paying the $400 to get the boat trip to the island, we spent over an hour going around the bay at 3mph while constantly being harassed to buy food, pictures, souvenirs and give tips to divers and swimmers. When we finally got to the island after what felt like an eternity, the captain declared that \'the island was full, and the government has closed the island\'. We then had to spend another 45 mins or so going back without even stepping foot off the boat. Total scam and a horrendous waste of time. After complaining enough at the shore we finally got our money back only because we were causing a scene that was obviously bad for business. They kept saying we should come back tomorrow and trying again... I don\'t think so! BE WARNED!!!

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

387898655.name: MUST see spot
387898655.author: a TripAdvisor user
387898655.reviewBody: Excellent spot with crystal clear waters. If you have never been, take the small tour. It is short enough that you will enjoy without having to sacrifice time spent during it. Take some goggles.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

381248629.name: Beautiful and great for snorkeling.
381248629.author: a TripAdvisor user
381248629.reviewBody: My wife and I came for a few hours yesterday and definitely recommend it. We took a 45 min tour boat that shows the bronze statue of St Mary but if you don\'t speak Spanish I don\'t think it\'s worth paying extra $35 pesos. Although if you want to see a young lad feeding fish off his mouth through the boat\'s glass floor then do pay $85 instead of $50 for a 10 minutes boat taxi ride (both are round trip so do keep the ticket for the trip back).\nWe went snorkeling which was great and we recommend it. It was $100 pesos for one hour although it probably was less and we could have pick the 30 minute one for $50 pesos. Not many people there speak English - just a heads up.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

379609245.name: Snorkeling/Boating Trip was Amazing!
379609245.author: a TripAdvisor user
379609245.reviewBody: Great way to see the bay of Saint Lucia .. By boat! So many lil beaches to choose from & snorkeling was amazing. Waters were calm & cool. Breath taking views from the sea.. Definitely worth spending the day out on the water!

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

376874650.name: Isla of pleasure (La Roqueta Island)
376874650.author: a TripAdvisor user
376874650.reviewBody: First, Acapulco is awesome.  Not very many Americans.  Mostly well to do Mexicans from Mexico City.  But English speakers are easy to find.  The city once was frequented by many Americans.  Hollywood moved in over the 60\'s though the 90\'s.  But for some reason (probably Cabo) they stopped coming.  Acapulco is beautiful.  The water is 85 degrees and crystal clear.  \nThe trip to Island was on a glass bottom boat.  There are a few boats that go there but this glass bottom boat tour was no frills but fun.  We went to a small restaurant about a 10 minute walk from the larger tourist spot most boats take you to.  The beach was private and the service was wonderful.  It was on the Palao boat and the restaurant was also called Palao.  Well worth the extra couple of dollars to go there instead of the main place.  The snorkeling is really spectacular.  In the city we went jet sking twice, city tour by van, the cliff diving dinner show, and ate, drank and were merry for 5 nights.  I don\'t know why the Americans stopped going but I am very glad we went.  The people are wonderful, patient, fun loving and friendly.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

363356261.name: Great little get away
363356261.author: a TripAdvisor user
363356261.reviewBody: My friends and I organized a little tour to this island. We stopped off to see the virgin beneath the water then went across to the Island. The beach was really nice (just a bit dirty and polluted). \n\nOnly down part of the trip was that we didnt spend longer.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

355942230.name: Amazing
355942230.author: a TripAdvisor user
355942230.reviewBody: The island is very beautiful with transparent and warm water, even in the winter.\nYou can see turtles and beautiful fishes.\nThere are place to have lunch, drink margheritas and so on.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

353942153.name: Snorkel Here!
353942153.author: a TripAdvisor user
353942153.reviewBody: This is the #1 location for snorkeling according to locals.  When we went, it was rather a cloudy day, but I still got sunburned on my back a little.  Saw some beautiful fish and our snorkel/diving guide was fantastic.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

353417041.name: A beautiful slice of paradise, a bit off the beaten track.
353417041.author: a TripAdvisor user
353417041.reviewBody: I had a great time walking up La Roqueta and looking at the beautiful views from the lighthouse at the top. Our guide was knowledgeable and affable and I learned a lot about the beautiful surroundings and some of the history of the city and the island. I would come back another time to wander, swim and enjoy the restaurants.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

348988694.name: Paradise swimming!!
348988694.author: a TripAdvisor user
348988694.reviewBody:
Glass bottom boat ride from caleta or caletilla for 50 pesos will take you to an island paradise, ride is about 10 minutes.
Try to get one of the first boats of the day - leaving at 10:00 or 10:30 as the water is calmer and there are fewer people.  The bigger tour boats from the zocalo come in around noon with many more people some bringing there own musical entertainment.
The water is clear - sometimes blue, sometimes green, sometimes turquoise - this week we were in the company of small manta rays swimming below us.
Food and drinks can be purchased on the island - Fran, one of the waiters is especially helpful -
Snorkelling, they have it, and lots of fish to see especially by the rocks.
Good sun exposure the entire day.
Water is always clean as it washes through the channel from open ocean but still protected from a big surf.  
ENJOY

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

348473056.name: Best beach in Acapulco, clean with crystal clear water
348473056.author: a TripAdvisor user
348473056.reviewBody: Only a few minutes away from Caleta beach, you\'ll need to board one of the local small boats to get there, $60 pesos round trip, last boat departing the island by 6 PM. The beach is really clean, only a couple of restaurants there, food a little bit pricey. If you can, take a walk to the lighthouse.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

340743333.name: Fun
340743333.author: a TripAdvisor user
340743333.reviewBody: Can only get there by boat. Tour takes you to see the Virgin of Gaudelope  which is under water. Nice beach with small waves. Has restaurants with local food.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

337662036.name: pass on it
337662036.author: a TripAdvisor user
337662036.reviewBody: the boat ride over takes way too long and they stop to try and sell you trinkets, food and other things.  once you are there it is okay and interesting, but like another reviewer stated, there are much better things to do

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

336822349.name: Great snorkeling!
336822349.author: a TripAdvisor user
336822349.reviewBody: We took Swiss Divers tour out to the island for snorkeling!  The water was very calm and we were lucky that both days we were out there the water was clear.  Bit of trash floating around in some areas which wasn\'t too good.  But overall beautiful!

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

336276212.name: Nice time
336276212.author: a TripAdvisor user
336276212.reviewBody: The beach was pretty crowded, but the food was delicious and the waves were very calm. The snorkeling wasn\'t mind-blowing, but it was a nice activity.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

336025884.name: Nice experience
336025884.author: a TripAdvisor user
336025884.reviewBody: This is an island even if is very close to the Caleta beach, that means doesn\'t have potable water or other basic amenities. But even with that you will find nice people trying to give you nice time; the boat that translates you is fun and stop by the rocks that have a Virgen statue under the water; the food is good, the banana boat is so much fun. Prices are very reasonable and you can always get a bargain with the right people!!!

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

314416583.name: Enjoy a different side of Acapulco.
314416583.author: a TripAdvisor user
314416583.reviewBody: This is one side of Acapulco known by a few. It is a good place to do scuba diving, but also a grate place where to find a fresh catch served on the beach. Try one of the local sites and ask for a Huachinango (red snapper) a la Talla, they are to die for.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

310566213.name: Just skip it
310566213.author: a TripAdvisor user
310566213.reviewBody: This "island" was a nice destination 30 years ago (my mother was from Acapulco so I can assess this statemant). There are twenty other place I could think of before even attempting to visit Roqueta Island, such as Acapulco Diamante, La Quebrada area or even Pie de la Cuesta if you are tempted to have a close encounter with nature.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

292759671.name: Paradise in Mexico
292759671.author: a TripAdvisor user
292759671.reviewBody: Beautiful island, full of little crabs everywhere,a lot of flowers and fish.\nPeaceful beach, if you prefer to be alone or with less people this Island is going to fit you.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

291214622.name: It\'s not  the Caribbean
291214622.author: a TripAdvisor user
291214622.reviewBody: Our trip to the Isla La Roqueta was for my first scuba experience ever.  Water wasn\'t too clear and we didn\'t see many      fish.  The day was sunny so am not sure why the water wasn\'t the beautiful aqua clear tropical feel I had wanted.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

287466724.name: Ok but not much more
287466724.author: a TripAdvisor user
287466724.reviewBody:
The glass bottom boat by itself is not Worth it. If you use it to goto the isla La Roqueta and spend the day there, it is probably justified. 
The price is not what is advertised because there are offerings on the boat that require you to pay tips: for exemple, one yongster will dive off a low cliff and then ask for tips.
Another one will dive for sea urchins and then ask for tips. etc. etc.

As far as the glass bottom is concerned, very little fish are viewed. Only one kind as a matter of fact.

You are much better off with the Acarey tour.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

263342049.name: Not worth going to.....
263342049.author: a TripAdvisor user
263342049.reviewBody: There is no sense in paying for the boat ride over to Roqueta Island and being stuck there until your boat leaves when it is exactly like the Old City beach where you depart. There is absolutely nothing unique about it.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

258940432.name: Nice outing
258940432.author: a TripAdvisor user
258940432.reviewBody: Very nice day trip. Good boat, staff, and equipment.  The snorkeling was ok, but not as good as you\'do find in other places.  Very little coral, and limited fish species to see.   Still, a nice outing whiched we booked through our driver Roberto Alacon during and earlier city tour.  Roberto saved us about $10 each by booking this thru him instead of through our hotel.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

258445448.name: Nice Day Out
258445448.author: a TripAdvisor user
258445448.reviewBody: We went over to the island twice during our stay in Acapulco.  The fee is 50 pesos round trip straight to the island and 85 pesos if you get the tour to see the Statue of the Virgin of Guadalupe through the glass bottom boat.  There are so few foreign tourists here that nothing is in English.  There are several trails to hike on the island and plenty of restaurants and a nice beach. The hike up to the lighthouse was excellent and offered wonderful views of the area.  We had our own snorkel gear but rented a locker for 50 pesos for valuables.  Bathrooms are 5 pesos.  We snorkeled along the rocks in the designated area but there is really nothing to see, just a few fish. It seemed a bit dangerous to try and go out to the underwater statue due to all the boat traffic in the bay.  Overall the trip to the island is very relaxing and enjoyable but not as good as I was expecting from reading about it beforehand.  Unfortunately, the Aquarium at the boat dock by Caleta Beach is completely closed and looked in bad condition.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

256740968.name: Very clear and beautiful  water!
256740968.author: a TripAdvisor user
256740968.reviewBody: We took a glass bottom boat to the Private  island. We got to see fish and a statue in the bottom of the ocean. The island offer little shops and a restaurant. The shopping  was more expensive.. The island also had  snooba and snorkeling  and a banana  boat. Do not by the tickets for these on the boat. The ticket say they sell for 150 pesos for the snorkeling  and 80 for the banana boat. On the boat the guys say to by from them and they will be cheaper then to buy it on the island. WRONG! On the boat we paid 100 for snorkeling  and 50 for banana. Thought  we got a deal... On the island  they offered 50 for snorkeling  and 30 for banana! Other then that we had fun.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

254868224.name: Vacation in a Vacation
254868224.author: a TripAdvisor user
254868224.reviewBody: If you are adventurous then you will love Isla La Roqueta.  In the old part of Acapulco at Caleta you can take a boat over to the island.  There are venders there that will sell you a ticket to go and come back.  Its about a twenty minute boat ride over.  There are plenty of options once your there.  If you want water sports, food, drink or just relax and enjoy the view.  The water is crystal clear and beautiful and lots of snorkelers around.  Sometimes we pack a snack or you can sample what the locals eat.  Ceviche, Fresh fish, oysters, etc.  Its an afternoon you will enjoy and will likely return on your next visit.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

254805474.name: Great little brach to enjoy your day
254805474.author: a TripAdvisor user
254805474.reviewBody: The beach is very rocky.\nbring snorkel gear to have the most fun. Water is refreshingly fantastic. People are genuinely kind and food is delightful.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

254453381.name: Wish I had gone back again!
254453381.author: a TripAdvisor user
254453381.reviewBody: I only squeaked in about 30 minutes of snorkeling while I was there, and after talking to the restaurant staff, I found out just how much I had missed. The glass bottom boat ride was fun, but next time I\'ll find another option to get to the island (kayak, preferably) and hike some of the trails and explore the island more. On my next ACA trip it\'s my first "must do".

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

249919638.name: Don\'t need a boat reservation...just show up, about $10
249919638.author: a TripAdvisor user
249919638.reviewBody: Just go to the Malecon and you will see the boats that take you to the island. It was 100 pesos per person. I was the only gringo and everything was in Spanish, which was fine, especially since my fiancee is Mexican. The guide was funny and his sidekick dove for sea urchins and let us all hold one. he also did a cliff dive. We went over the Submarine Virgin, which is just a statue just below the surface near a rock island just off Roqueta. Not a big deal, but there are not a lot of great things in Aca, so it is worth seeing whatever you can. We were met by a snack and drink boat, and a souvenir boat, which is amusing because you know they are trying to get you a la carte after a cheap ticket. Still cheap fun and definitely worth the 2 hours and $10.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

247475350.name: Relaxing
247475350.author: a TripAdvisor user
247475350.reviewBody: A great place to spend an afternoon, the ride out on a glass bottom boat was great. You can walk out in the water for quite a ways and if inclined to you can snorkle. Plenty of food and drinks available

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

240107976.name: very nice place
240107976.author: a TripAdvisor user
240107976.reviewBody: well,this is the third time we visit the island of roqueta,we liked because the beach its very clean and quiet,and the kids have a lot of fun on the sand or in the rocks jumping on the water,we also visit the virgin of guadalupe under the water its soo pretty,

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

236935501.name: good for swimming
236935501.author: a TripAdvisor user
236935501.reviewBody: Nice place for half a day trip. Wasn\'t that amusing as i expected, water was quite dirty so didn\'t see much whilst snorkling. however, it is nice to see families just cross over with their kids for a picnic!

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

226666117.name: Great Fun
