226666117.author: a TripAdvisor user
226666117.reviewBody: My wife and I had a great time at this place. great place for families to go. Not to crowded. Lots to do.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

223537129.name: Boat tour
223537129.author: a TripAdvisor user
223537129.reviewBody: We ate at the Palao restaurant on the island, the food was great. The views were beautiful from the boat and from the Island. My daughter and my niece had fun snorkeling. They had a Polynesian dancer show at the restaurant which was interesting to see. So those 3 stars are for that. The boat is dirty for American standard, the glass bottom to view the fish was polluted on the side with green algae. The most disappointing was that even though the crew and the guide were friendly, they  only spoke Spanish. So, we didn\'t understand all of the explanations about what we saw through out the tour. Maybe we should request an English speaking tour. We found this tour through an English language flyer at the hotel, so we assume that we had an English speaking guide.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

223512683.name: Isla la Roqueta
223512683.author: a TripAdvisor user
223512683.reviewBody:
Fun little excursion, you travel in a glass bottom boat.
relaxing just to sit by the beach or people watch
food at the restaurant was good
staff friendly

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

221176979.name: Nice place
221176979.author: a TripAdvisor user
221176979.reviewBody: A good place to visit ,nice weather and interesting visits are offered to different places. we enjoy this visit.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

205471535.name: Always love it...
205471535.author: a TripAdvisor user
205471535.reviewBody: When we were there the water was so clear we could hunt many fish of various colour. I used a little blow up float and went everywhere close to shore and explored and saw so much!!!!

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

195215294.name: Perfect day trip - outstanding hike + beaches - My favorite!
195215294.author: a TripAdvisor user
195215294.reviewBody:
I discovered Isla la Roqueta by buying a ticket on a PALAO excursion. A great intro for Isla la Roqueta and worth the price - 150 pesos + 35 pesos the hotel that sold me the tickets charged on top. I will write a separate review for Palao.
 
After I discovered la Roqueta, I went back 9 times. Instead of getting there via Palao boat, I started going directly to Caleta beach, buying Roqueta Directo for 40 pesos and going straight to the island, skipping the cliff-diving and other attraction spots offered by other boats. 

Most local tourists go there to hang out on the beach which is wonderful. There are also two smaller beaches that are rather secluded and on business days could be totally empty and feel like your "private" beaches. 

I loved the hiking trails on la Roqueta. Took me about 3 hours including stops at scenic overlooks to complete a trail variation around the island. If I hang out on one of those private beaches, it would be longer. 

I never felt threatened by anything - snakes or shady people while on my hikes. I am a 50 year-old woman and most of the times I was on the trails alone. Just gorgeous and perfect for me because it is a well established network of trails, signs are mostly missing but it didn't matter, I just picked the ones that were hugging the shore. Then on other hikes I'd go to the Lighthouse and change my trails... 

So, if you like to hike, stay on the trails - you'll be in the shade and you might find the beaches on your fist hike - or at least one, and at least one overlook with a breath-taking views... 

I can't wait to go back. I did lose 10 lbs in 2 weeks and la Roqueta hikes definitely helped me to shape up!

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

192107859.name: Relaxing and fun!
192107859.author: a TripAdvisor user
192107859.reviewBody: Isla la Roqueta, is a very relaxing place to spend the day.  Watch the seashell salesmen float by on their small rafts, and take in snorkeling.  Or just people watch and a little swimming while relaxing in a lounge chair on the beach.  All boats are glass bottom, so when buying your ticket to cross to the island, purchase the NON-glass bottom boat ticket, it\'s cheaper!

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

187154866.name: Perfect ending after Cliff Divers
187154866.author: a TripAdvisor user
187154866.reviewBody: We\'ve been going to Acapulco for 28 years in a row, thios Feb 2 will be 29. Every year I rent a cruiser and take friends from Acapulco, most have never been out on the ocean, and go to the cliff divers. After we stop at Isla La Roqueta and have dinner. GREAT food,service and view....a MUST go!

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

165043973.name: What an island!
165043973.author: a TripAdvisor user
165043973.reviewBody: My family from Canada just love this island.Assured fun guaranteed.A must for anyone visiting Acapulco.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

154442367.name: OH FUN
154442367.author: a TripAdvisor user
154442367.reviewBody: I just love going here!  I\'ve been here three times, maybe more!  Great relaxing and interesting place to spend the day!  Easy swimming and snorkeling is the best here.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

154340836.name: A fun half day.
154340836.author: a TripAdvisor user
154340836.reviewBody: the boat to get there is an old tub but the commentary is fun and the time on Roqueta Island is fun with live Aztec dancers and a light buffet and complimentary bar.  (no beer)

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

151663938.name: Great for Families
151663938.author: a TripAdvisor user
151663938.reviewBody: Great place to take the kids there\'s plenty to do inside take your swimming gear and enjoy. look for discount tickets just outside The Isla Roqueta

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

149132325.name: fun little hike
149132325.author: a TripAdvisor user
149132325.reviewBody: you can hike up this hill and if you ask nicely the military guys at the top will let you and you can climb to the top of the lighthouse. lots of kids will try to guide you but it is not necessary unless you just feel more comfortable. our guide was nice and didn\'t charge too much.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

148206572.name: Secluded and a bit run down
148206572.author: a TripAdvisor user
148206572.reviewBody: To get to the in inhabited island you take a short glass bottom boat ride which is the most interesting part of the trip.  A no frills tour for sure without a restroom.  I do not recommend this tour unless your into roughing it.   Pretty view though

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

146592981.name: Great time.
146592981.author: a TripAdvisor user
146592981.reviewBody: We booked from Fiesta Americana Lobby for 600 pesos, no travel included. We ended up paying about 100 pesos each way from our hotel for travel plus a few 20\'s for tips. We could have bought the regular meal for 150 pesos each but the better service, food, and drinks was WELL worth the few bucks. We had a fun time on the boat and got to learn about the island. Bring a spanish friend though because its all in spanish. The restaurant had a great bilingual staff though and the show with the meal was great fun. The beach time was also great. Snorkling could have been better but I did some off exploring and pickedup a bunch of sea urchins.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

144004582.name: An ok island
144004582.author: a TripAdvisor user
144004582.reviewBody: Some people rave about it but I found it pretty much just and island. A decent place to go and pass some time and enjoyable with some mates but I wouldn\'t consider it a "must see". Take your own food.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

142750048.name: Awesome Snorkeling
142750048.author: a TripAdvisor user
142750048.reviewBody: Loved snorkeling here! The water is crystal clear. We saw sea turtles, sting rays, jelly fish and other amazing fish as well.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

136036444.name: Just an Island
136036444.author: a TripAdvisor user
136036444.reviewBody: Since the moment we landed in Acapulco, everybody recommended us to visit "La Roqueta". Finally, our friendly taxi driver sold us a package (we were about 6 -including me-) so that we could get a "better deal" that included the round-way trip to the island on a bottom glass boat departing from Caletilla beach. The tour included a tourist guide showing us a famous underwater virgin statue, a display of colorful fish and a tour around houses owned by some famous people. If you don\'t speak Spanish, I recommend that you find another option to the island because most tourist guides do not speak English. When we finally made it to the island around 10 am Acapulco time, the beach was packed with people (maybe because it was a Saturday) and frankly, the beach is not that big. You\'ll find a restaurant (and be sure to place your order within 20 minutes because otherwise they\'ll ask you to leave) with average, expensive food so better bring some homemade sandwiches, filthy public bathrooms, and you can do some scuba diving or hiking if you like -but be sure to go really early and during weekdays because believe me...it gets very crowded. In my opinion, the locals make a bigger deal than what it is to get you to visit the place, so if you got a spare day and money, make a visit, otherwise, there are better places to go in Acapulco such as the "Fort of San Diego" or the "Nuestra Se\u00f1ora de la Soledad" cathedral, which are considered historical landmarks.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

127312911.name: Graet beach for snorkeling
127312911.author: a TripAdvisor user
127312911.reviewBody: The water is very clear and on both sides of the beach there is a lot of fish in the rocks. Is you bring your own boat is awesone to spend a day there.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

126573715.name: 3 hours spot to explore.
126573715.author: a TripAdvisor user
126573715.reviewBody: If you are looking for any palce to spent 2-3 hours to relax with nice view and average beach this place is for you. Easy to get - take a short boat ride for 40peso return and less than 20 min you will be there. Restaurante food is average, nothing special.  Do not visit this island on fridays and weekdays, a lot of lundly and bustly locals.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

123884598.name: An Island with a cool name
123884598.author: a TripAdvisor user
123884598.reviewBody: So I read a lot of reviews for this island and heard it was a place to go.  I did take the family snorkeling, while I scuba dove, the area.  There were some nice private beaches but the privacy is useless unless you go with your own boat.  The island is nice, but nothing to marvel at.  If you had extra time and wanted to tour the area I would see it but would not say it is a "must  see."  The view is pretty and the countours of the island are interesting but again I would not spend money to go.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

123408176.name: Snorkeling Beach
123408176.author: a TripAdvisor user
123408176.reviewBody: Very interesting and pleasant Beach. Access is by water taxi. Seems to be frequented more by local inhabitants than by tourists.\nCould be very crowded. Snorkeling good, but not great.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

122800253.name: Great food and Pina Coladas
122800253.author: a TripAdvisor user
122800253.reviewBody: We did the lunch at the Palao and loved their Lobsters.  Excellent bar too and they hooked us up with some snorkeling equipment.  Great trails too all around the island

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

120618324.name: Isolated
120618324.author: a TripAdvisor user
120618324.reviewBody: Take a water taxi to this island. Go late morning or early afternoon. Return by water taxi around 5 pm. \nWater is very calm and shallow for all ages. Lots of boats parked close by also. Not an ocean view, but more of a harbour view.\nTake a costera bus.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

118534763.name: Relaxing island
118534763.author: a TripAdvisor user
118534763.reviewBody: You can take a bay tour boat ride to the island and stay for an hour.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

100644187.name: Don\'t miss the Tiki Restaurant
100644187.author: a TripAdvisor user
100644187.reviewBody: Took a glass-bottom boat from Caleta Beach.  Don\'t take the 1 hour tour unless you\'re fluent in Spanish as the narrator didn\'t speak English.  The beach on the island was nice but got deep fast.  There\'s a walking path near the dock area that will take you to a very cool tiki-style restaurant about 100 yards from the beach area.  Around mid-day, there was an Aztec dance performance and the whole place shut down for about 20 minutes as everyone - diners and service people - got up on stage and participated.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

6628489.name: Great hiking
6628489.author: a TripAdvisor user
6628489.reviewBody:
We had intended to take the $3.50 water taxi to Roqueta from Playa Caleta, but our taxi driver talked us into the $7 harbor tour. We were glad we did it, because it was fun. We were the only Americans on board, so we got a good opportunity to practice our Spanish. The glass-bottom boat circled the harbor, where we viewed the yachts and homes of the rich and famous. 

We were wondering how they were going to show us cliff-divers as advertised in their flyer, since it wasn’t time for the show at La Quebrada. Well, here’s how: they had a diver who jumped off the boat, swam to shore, climbed up a rock, and dove. We also saw the submarine Virgin, and a diver swam under the boat with food to attract fish. The only part of the tour I didn’t like was a loooooooooong stop at a lunch boat, just a few hundred feet from La Roqueta, where we had to wait until everyone who wanted lunch was served. I almost went over the side and swam for the island, because I was anxious to get started sightseeing! There is plenty of food on the island, so I don’t know why everyone had to patronize the lunch boat. You can take as much time as you want on La Roqueta, and come back on any of the company’s boats throughout the day. 

La Roqueta has a beautiful beach, and there were lots of families enjoying the shallow water. We were looking for hiking and snorkel spots, so we started walking. There are numerous trails, all very well maintained. The first sight we encountered was a trio of burros, two of which were shaking down the hikers for snacks. We had read there was a burro who liked to drink Coronas, but we didn’t have any beer, and anyway we later heard from our local friend Pablo that the “burro borracho” was muerte. The burros we met liked trail mix just fine. We gave the rest of our bag to an onlooking boy of 9 or 10, who was thrilled to get to feed the burros. We enjoyed seeing how much fun he found it. 

We hiked upwards, aiming for the lighthouse. But near the crest of the island, we had a bit of an adventure. Three large black dogs trotted onto the path and started barking at us. They were wild-looking! Not your generic small tan Hispano-Caribbean street dogs, but big strong dogs with heads that looked like there was some Great Dane in the bloodline, and long whip tails with tufts at the end. It was like a game of Tomb Raider! One was a nursing mother. When we realized they had pups to protect, we lost no time in backing away down the trail, making soothing sounds. We detoured around widely, and never did make it to the lighthouse before we tired of hiking. 

We also didn’t succeed in finding a snorkel spot. We came upon a place where dive boats were anchored, which looked ideal for snorkeling, but the surf was a little too rough and the beach too rocky to make entry safe. Our amigo Pablo later told us that the snorkeling was better at the Camino Real anyway, which I do believe. We did enjoy hiking around the island, taking in the scenic vistas. Next time we visit Acapulco, we will definitely return to Roqueta.

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

5419558.name: Take the glass-bottom boat tour, no zoo but excellent food, family atmosphere
5419558.author: a TripAdvisor user
5419558.reviewBody: We took the glass-bottom boat tour to la Isla de la Roqueta from downtown, near the zocalo- don\'t remember the name.  But take the blue/white no-frills boat.  My friends took the boat that was supposed to have entertainment and a buffet and paid more and got less.  Ours had a nice tourguide (tour was in spanish of course), cold mexican beer, and a couple young teenagers that jumped off the boat, swam over to a cliff and climbed up and dove in,  a mini-version of the cliff divers.   Then they swam under the boat corraling fish under the boat so you could see them through the glass bottom.  They even had a little boat that pulled alongside selling fresh ceviche or shrimp in salsa w/avocado - YUM!!! Very fresh and delicious.  Once we arrived on the island we were disappointed that the zoo was closed - I think it is closed for good.  There\'s not much to do on the island except sit on the beach or rent a ride on those inflatable bananas that they pull behind a boat.  But we enjoyed it because it was very relaxing to just sit back and watch the people.  Be advised - this is a family beach (lots of kids) and most families appeared to be locals.  But the food was EXCELLENT!!.  I\'m of mexican descent so I know what is authentic and the food was fresh and good.  This is definitely no frills - plastic chairs and tables but there are waiters that are attentive and quick and I don\'t think there\'s much of a selection but the freshly caught sauteed shrimp in the shell (still had legs & head!) in garlic w/rice with the fruit and cucumbers on a stick we bought from vendors made for an authentic and relaxing experience.  This is as real as it gets and we loved it.\n

address.streetAddress: Playa Caleta Muelle, Caleta

674172254.name: Relaxing day!
674172254.author: a TripAdvisor user
674172254.reviewBody: A friend and I spent the day at Tres Marias Restaurant on the ocean side and had a very relaxing time. We sat under a palapa and had a wonderful chat about nothing in particular. The Pina Coladas were fresh and cold. We had fish grilled al la talla and it was very tasty. This was the first time I\'d tried it. We had hoped to see some whales out in the ocean, but just birds. We do this at least once every trip. My friend winters in Acapulco, but I manage to come every other year for a coupla weeks.

660589843.name: Seems the same as it was in 1987
660589843.author: a TripAdvisor user
660589843.reviewBody: Visited in 1987, and stayed there 2 nights in 1988. We had rented a vehicle in 1988 so we could travel the area. It is good to know it is still off-the-beaten average tourist trail, unlike below Plya Del Camen, which has "exploded" with hotels the entire 50 miles south of Cancun. It is on my "bucket list" to visit again. If you like to swim in the ocean, this is NOT the beach, as the rip tides are extreamly dangerous.  If you enjoy laid-back, quaint, Mexico natural beach, that is quite, this is it!

657078244.name: Dont miss the sunset
657078244.author: a TripAdvisor user
657078244.reviewBody: We spend a long week end four girl friends. The beach was only for us, at sunset we shared it may be with some five locals, it was sooo relaxing.

645597130.name: Extremely dangerous waves
645597130.author: a TripAdvisor user
645597130.reviewBody: The place is beautiful but be warned, the waves are huge and extremely dangerous. I am a strong swimmer and used to work as a lifeguard. I cold not handle these waves.They are deadly. I witnessed a near drowning there, the guy was extremely lucky he got out alive. He got knocked unconscious by a wave and was saved by a young Mexican who swam out to get him. He could not get him back and we had to form a human chain to bring them back. We had to perform CPR as he was not breathing. Another time, a girl got her arm broken when she was slammed and dragged to the bottom by a wave. Do not go into the water and do not swim out toward the waves under any circumstance.

645558762.name: Glad we saw it
645558762.author: a TripAdvisor user
645558762.reviewBody: We had been meaning to come out here for years and finally did this time. It was fun to explore the area, but there is really nothing here of interest. We live on the west coast of California, travel to Mazatlan, PV, and other places all the time, so the sunset here is the same one we see all the time. If you are from the east coast or midland somewhere, it is worth seeing, I\'m sure.

621620535.name: Visit both a Lagoon and the Ocean Beach in the same place
621620535.author: a TripAdvisor user
621620535.reviewBody: Beach Resort Tres Marias un Pie de la Cuesta has very good service for visitors; we had late brunch at the Lagoon shore and then proceed to the Beach on the other side of the road, where we enjoyed the spectacular waves and a sun bath walk along the coast (don\'t go into the sea is dangerous here)

567939824.name: Fresh water waters
567939824.author: a TripAdvisor user
567939824.reviewBody: we always head to Tres Maries first.  They prepare a picnic and we take a private boat rental to run through the lagoon, stop to swim, water ski or tube, nibble our picnic then cruise all the way to the end to the Pie de la Cuesta for a cold beer and watching for dolphins, sharks etc.

565668666.name: Beautiful Beach
565668666.author: a TripAdvisor user
565668666.reviewBody: We hung out at the bar and pool at Hotel Vayma. The waves can be a bit strong but the beach is beautiful. I saw some folks riding horseback on the beach

559252792.name: A show to remember at Pie de la Cuesta
559252792.author: a TripAdvisor user
559252792.reviewBody: We went to hotel Vayma at Pie de la cuesta for lunch, there were only 2 other people around us. The waves were big but so beautiful.  Suddenly a whole school of - we are not sure blue whales or humpback whales- were passing and jumping and showing their tail! We were so excited.  Then later during the day we see a flock of dolphins jumping and feeding and playing with the waves.  It was magical.  The beach is beautiful the ocean a bit rough so be careful but deliciously reinvigorating!

557235420.name: Primitive, but beautiful. A fun group outing area or a couple
557235420.author: a TripAdvisor user
557235420.reviewBody: I like to go with friends once in a while . It\'s beautiful with  the Ocean  on one side and a lagoon on the other side . It\'s nice to \nLie in a palapa in a hammock while fish is cooking . I\'ve riidden horses On the ocean side . The horses weren\'t real speedy .

530365624.name: The singing of the sea becomes opera!
530365624.author: a TripAdvisor user
530365624.reviewBody: Was amazing to be there! At the beggining of my trip started in the local market UP the beach, at the mountain, lets say is the local little village absolutely non tourisic area. Up there in the mountain there is a neigborghood called "Miramar" wich means "look the sea" and of course is about the amazing view. If you have imagination and memory you can picture how strange is to be so up the mountain and at the same time see the sea at the same level, fading in the orizon. If you think that was amazing, no way! the sound ! the voice of the waves, singing rage!! furious opera choir!! you could hear from up the mountain and all the way down to the beach were finally you met the face of the furious imponent singer waves. Open sea, people surfing huge waves. Lonely and forgotten, not much people, so everything is really cheap, quiet, nice and delicious. The BEST sunsets in the area. LOVELY!

479834263.name: A wonderful day out.
479834263.author: a TripAdvisor user
479834263.reviewBody: Pie de la Cuesta is a little village outside Acapulco with a beautiful (but mostly unswimmable)  beach, where you can walk, horseback ride or just sit with a \'coco loco\' cocktail while enjoying the sun or a spectacular sunset. Across the road is the mangrove-lined lagoon where Johnny Weissmuller filmed the Tarzan movies, Sly Stallone filmed Rambo and Elizabeth TAYLOR filmed a White Diamonds commercial. You can rent a boat and go all the way down to the \'barra\' where the lagoon meets the ocean or over to the island for a Mezcal with Aldegundo. There are plentiful restaurants both on the beach as well as the lagoon side and you can rent a speedboat for world-class water skiing at one of the clubs on the lagoon side.

474200720.name: Unspoiled, peaceful very long stretch of beach!
474200720.author: a TripAdvisor user
474200720.reviewBody: Pie de la Cuesta is a perfect place to relax and do a lot of nothing. Long walks, spectacular sunsets, great food and people. Highly recommend the Tio Marcos restaurant.  Great service and food on the beach!

469895786.name: FUN FUN FUN
469895786.author: a TripAdvisor user
469895786.reviewBody: Playa Pie de la Cuesta is a quaint little town you must see when visiting Acapulco.  Make sure to rent a boat and go have some Mezcal on Mezcal Island.

466166084.name: Remote, quiet and still unspoiled
466166084.author: a TripAdvisor user
466166084.reviewBody: I have not been to Pie De La Cuesta for 20 years. We books a van and took a ride out to Tres Marias Restaurants. The location is still amazing and had a great lunch on the beach. The Red Snapper was amazing.

458401204.name: AMAZING SUNSET VIEW
458401204.author: a TripAdvisor user
458401204.reviewBody:
Wanted to experience Pie de la Cuesta since I saw gorgeous  photos from reviewers on Trip Advisor. Got great info and advise from the Acapulco Trip Advisor Forum. Since I was going solo I had some concerns. For anyone that wants to experience a spectacular sunset, take a drive out there. I wanted just to walk the beach and see the sunset, so I left the Costera around 2 pm. You have a choice of taking a private driver, a taxi from your hotel, taking a bus to the Zocalo and then a taxi to Pie de la Cuesta but if you do it my way experiencing the bus ride from the Costera to Pie de la Cuesta it is sooo cheap. 

The bus is green and white and says Pie de la Cuesta but you have to make sure that what is written on the windshield says Playa or Playa Luces. It is an old bus and a bumpy ride but only costs 7 pesos. The bus ride is approx. 40 minutes. 

Imagine experiencing a bus ride where the bus driver stops for gas along the way and also near the central market vendors come on the bus selling water, bananas and colorful ices in a round bag with a straw sticking out.

I would advise to get off the bus in Pie de la Cuesta at Tres Marias Restaurant so you have a landmark. If you don’t speak Spanish write on a paper “Tres Marias, por favor” and show the driver when you get on the bus.

There are two places I am familiar with to pick up the bus. Originally I was told to pick it up on the Costera beach side across the street from Sanborns and Scotia bank (near Zocalo). It no longer stops there as there is the new red Acabus stop at that location. It is now located about 3 blocks behind Sanborns near Woolworths I think on Av Mayo. The location where I took the bus is on the Costera beach side half circle (where different bus pick up) just a few blocks from Parque Papagayo. You will also notice at this location there is a road sign indicating Pie de la Cuesta with an arrow to turn off from the Costero. The street might be called Av Diego Hurtado de Mendoza- Hwy 200 on map. 

Make sure when leaving Pie de la Cuesta by bus after the sunset you catch the last one by 7pm. The sunset is from 6:15pm to 6:45pm. Surprisingly a disco bus was coming and I said Zocalo and the driver nodded. I took it for 8 pesos. 

Went on the Sunday which was a holiday week end so the restaurant Tres Marias on Lagoon side and beach side (across street from each other) was packed with people. On the beach there is horse back riding and ATV (4 wheelers or dunebuggys) adult size and smaller ones for kids which are driven on the sand along the beach. It is beautiful to watch the ferocious waves and makes for a beautiful photo. It is very dangerous to go in the ocean here but saw a few taking a chance. Everyone comes on the beach for the sunset otherwise the beach is very quiet and you can walk far with no one around.

441482832.name: What a place to relax fully
441482832.author: a TripAdvisor user
441482832.reviewBody: One of my preferred place to go and return. I have been in Pie de la Cuesta numerous time and always found serenity, pleasure, friends, and good food. A corner of Paradise away from the noise and dust of Accapulco

433581587.name: Nice place
433581587.author: a TripAdvisor user
433581587.reviewBody: The place is nice!\nYou can see the sunset and riding a horse but you can\'t swim there, the waves are really brave.

429788783.name: Best place in Acapulco to watch a sunset
429788783.author: a TripAdvisor user
429788783.reviewBody:
This beach is not located in a cove or bay and as such has has strong currents and high waves hitting the beach.  It's not a place to go to play or swim in the water.  There were a few people with body boards that were riding the waves, but they seemed to be experienced with the ocean. 

This beach is long and perfect for horseback riding and riding ATV's. There are several restaurants that provide shade and hammocks. We had some great seafood.  This was a place to come and relax, not swim or play in the ocean.

The best thing about this beach is the amazing sunset. A bus of people came to the beach just at sunset.  The colors were so vibrant, more so than the other beaches where I saw sunsets.

423240483.name: Beautiful sun
423240483.author: a TripAdvisor user
423240483.reviewBody: Nice place to relax, have a good home made soup, and ride a horse on the beach.  Some nice hamac also on the beach..Nice

363975489.name: Beautiful Day with a Beautiful Sunset
363975489.author: a TripAdvisor user
363975489.reviewBody: We spent the day out here under the thatched roof eating authentic Mexican food and took a boat ride on the lagoon side to swim.  The day was toped off by a beautiful sunset.   We were with family that lived out here so if you were doing it as a tourist you would want a guide at least the first time.

352420972.name: Another great day
352420972.author: a TripAdvisor user
352420972.reviewBody: Went on my last day of vacation this year. This is at least my 20th visit to Pie de la Cuesta. Always begin my visit by stopping at Tres Maria for a snack and then go next door to Vayma Resort to finish my day relaxing in their pool and having their signature shrimp pizza before the amazing sunset.

352288765.name: Splendid sunset at Pie de la Cuesta
352288765.author: a TripAdvisor user
352288765.reviewBody: I started from Acapulco, took a bus labeled "Playa" out to the end destination at Pie de la Cuesta. I Provided myself with water and kept walked toward Pacific Ocean.\n\nWhen I reached the beach my eyes was caught in the view of a fantastic horizon. Later on, when the sun went down, I was surprised to watch the sunset - the most impressive moment I ever seen so far in North America!

340735391.name: Huge waves
340735391.author: a TripAdvisor user
340735391.reviewBody: We usually go to Tres Marie\'s. The beach is huge and the waves huge. Very relaxing . We have always gone to the ocean side. Want to try the lagoon side some time.

338965343.name: Great sunset
338965343.author: a TripAdvisor user
338965343.reviewBody: We go there every year or almost. Great food at Tres Maria, great sunset but do not blink cause the sun goes down fast. Even saw whales a couple of years ago.

338907544.name: The best sunsets
338907544.author: a TripAdvisor user
338907544.reviewBody: 20 km.north of Acapulco lies the village of pie d la Cuesta. It stands between a very important lagoon ans the ocean. The beaches are very nice but also very difficult to swim by because the wave are very strong and they break right on the beach, not for children. On the other hand the lagoon is worth seeing by boat that you can rent with a pilot. It\'s a bird refuge, you can water ski and a few jungle films were shot there. Nice way to spend an afternoon.

319651168.name: terrible place to visit
319651168.author: a TripAdvisor user
319651168.reviewBody: we took a boat trip on the lagoon, dirty and smelly water, we stopped in a smelly place and they planed to leave us there for 3 hours to eat, I ask to be returned and they charge me all trip again, I prefered to pay but get back to the beach, they dropped me 4 miles away from town in a lonely road, I had to walk all the way back, they took my money, I did not get the promised trip, and I had to walk 4 miles at noon with hot sun.

310360649.name: A classic beach
310360649.author: a TripAdvisor user
310360649.reviewBody: This is a beach that shpuld be visited in Acapulco, It is not the best one but you will find out a lot of fun

306078798.name: Precious place
306078798.author: a TripAdvisor user
306078798.reviewBody: Never get tierd of visiting Pie De La Cuesta. My wife and I got married here nearly 20 years ago and its still just as beautiful as it was then.With the huge waves on one side and the lagoon on the other a truly beautiful place

305533509.name: A  great day out.
305533509.author: a TripAdvisor user
305533509.reviewBody: A day out at Pie de la Cuesta and on the Coyuca lagoon are an absolute must while in Acapulco. The beach isn\'t great for swimming but is the best place to catch a spectacular sunset. The lagoon is mirror flat for waterskiers and just breathrakingly lovely for nature lovers.  The old Tarzan movies were filmed here, as was Rambo and an ad for Elizabeth Taylor\'s White Diamond perfume for which she was flown in by helicopter.

298572726.name: Definitely worth the trip.
298572726.author: a TripAdvisor user
298572726.reviewBody: A small little beach town located about 20-30 min outside Acapulco bay.  Truly feels rustic and authentic.  This is not a resort place and  the accommodations are clean but quaint.  We ate lunch at Tres Marias beach club and it was amazing.  Fresh seafood and drinks served to you right on the beach!  They have a bunch of tables and chairs under palm frawn canopies equpped with hammocks...steps from the water.  The waves break really close to the shore so it was difficult to "hang out in the water" but it might have been the tide that day.  They have the typical horse back riding on the beach and locals who sell you all sorts of trinkets and snacks.  If you like to get away from the crowds and feel more like a local...take the trip out and spend the day here.  It is definitely more of a relaxing day and if you are up to it...you can take a tour of the lagoon.  Pie De La Cuesta is beach on one side of the strip of land and then a huge lagoon on the other side.  Both are beautiful and worth seeing.

284592829.name: Relaxing By the Sea..
284592829.author: a TripAdvisor user
284592829.reviewBody: I was At Pie De La Cuesta two years ago when huracan Mannuel hit the town but even everything was I little aou of place it was fantastic to stayed here we ate fresh Fish and fresh shrimp and enjoy to lay down on the hammocks then we walk to the end where the sea and the lagoon meet together stunning yay so beautiful place...I love it..

275802493.name: A special place
275802493.author: a TripAdvisor user
275802493.reviewBody: I think this is my favorite place in Acapulco. We usually stay in Mexico for 6 or 7 weeks and make the trip to pie de la Cuesta once a week during our stay. Just being by the open sea, the sound of the huge waves breaking and when we\'re lucky, seeing some whales frolicking makes for a wonderful, relaxing day! We\'re usually at Tres Maria\'s & are well taken care of there.

272838043.name: magic
272838043.author: a TripAdvisor user
272838043.reviewBody: Best place ever , home where my soul found rest and relax and was once again the young child running bare foot on a sandy beach the sunsets ... they took my breath away..

263300375.name: Always great to get away from crowds
263300375.author: a TripAdvisor user
263300375.reviewBody:
I love this beach.  It is a bit far to drive, but so totally worth it.  I love it because the beach area is much wider than in the bay or Diamante, and because it is never crowded.

You have your choice of the bungalows where the small restaurant owners offer you shade, hammocks and tables and chairs as long as you consume from their restaurant.  You can spend all day there and get an inexpensive massage, or buy interesting trinkets or local food.

Definitely worth it!

262981698.name: BEACH IN THE OPEN OCEAN
262981698.author: a TripAdvisor user
262981698.reviewBody: This beach is around 30 minutes drive from la Costera.Av You have there nice sand with no to much people and big waves. The sunset is great. And if you cross the road there is a fantastic lagoon for water skiing and good local restaurants.

261699830.name: Great sunset, far away from the costera
261699830.author: a TripAdvisor user
261699830.reviewBody: The best thing about pie de la cuesta is the Sunset, other than that, theres not much to do right on the beach. If you go back to the lagoon you can do various boat activities, however you should be ready to spend the day here as it is very far away from the costera.

257632507.name: Great Place
257632507.author: a TripAdvisor user
257632507.reviewBody: Just one great place to send a day eating ,strolling, swimming in some pools and enjoying yourself. Try Tre Marias on Lagoon side, or go for a boat ride on the lagoon , Vayma on ocean side has goos eats ans good pool

256507065.name: Tres Marias
256507065.author: a TripAdvisor user
256507065.reviewBody: Have been out there once a week and it\'s been great.  Big waves, whales, good food,  service can be slow but usually pretty good,

214321766.name: Pie De La Cuesta---Tranquil Hidden Gem
214321766.author: a TripAdvisor user
214321766.reviewBody:
Before leaving to Acapulco with my exes family, a colleague had advised me of Pie de La Cuesta. 
After a couple of days with a crazy family....We needed time alone and I suggested we go check it out.  I was completely amazed.   

Pie de la cuesta translates to foot of the hill and is located away from acapulco city. It is a nice quiet, tranquil beach where the Ocean water meets a small lake (river?)  There is a small boat tour approximately 3 hours long which takes you to small island which is owned by a family who runs a restaurant on Island.   

Once we got off the small boat, we spent a few hours on the small island.  We ate and had coco loco (crazy coconut), which had alcohol in it.   And we had time to splash around in the water before heading back.   There was an alligator kept locked in a cage, which was awesome to see.

It was definitely a much needed get away to relax.

675858354.name: AMAZING
675858354.author: a TripAdvisor user
675858354.reviewBody: Was the most beautiful, peaceful, humbling place I have ever been. Its a must see for anyone while in Acapulco

itemReviewed.name: Capilla de la Paz (Chapel of Peace)

address.streetAddress: Calle de la Paz, s/n Fraccionamiento Las Brisas

673824937.name: Very Beautiful
673824937.author: a TripAdvisor user
673824937.reviewBody: Beautiful chapel with lovely view.  Simple and pretty with cross which can be viewed from a great distance.

itemReviewed.name: Capilla de la Paz (Chapel of Peace)

address.streetAddress: Calle de la Paz, s/n Fraccionamiento Las Brisas

673824245.name: Beautiful place.
673824245.author: a TripAdvisor user
673824245.reviewBody: A must to see in Acapulco. Will see whole bay and all of Acapulco. Chapel has great lighting and very quite place. Is a non denominational chapel.

itemReviewed.name: Capilla de la Paz (Chapel of Peace)

address.streetAddress: Calle de la Paz, s/n Fraccionamiento Las Brisas

669959673.name: Breathtaking!
669959673.author: a TripAdvisor user
669959673.reviewBody: The history behind this Chapel is extremely interesting. We had the pleasure of visiting this Chapel and learning all about its history, meaning and importance. The Chapel was constructed with the idea of "being simple," which can be seen through the careful placement of surrounding decor. The Chapel looks very modern and allows visitors to walk through and around. The view from outside is breathtaking, as the Chapel is located on a high point and looks down on the Bay of Santa Maria. Our tour (by TourByVan) allowed us to spend 30-45 mins at the Chapel, which was more than enough time. Overall, it is a beautiful landmark of Acapulco, and definitely a must-see!

itemReviewed.name: Capilla de la Paz (Chapel of Peace)

667929132.name: Go to see it to get a beautiful view of the city
667929132.author: a TripAdvisor user
667929132.reviewBody: As we arrived, Ave Maria was playing, and it felt heavenly (there was a wedding taking place). This chapel is located inside a gated community, and it closes to visitors at 6:00 pm. They will ask you for identification at the entrance, and hold it until you leave. The chapel is small and plain, but the view is spectacular.

itemReviewed.name: Capilla de la Paz (Chapel of Peace)

address.streetAddress: Calle de la Paz, s/n Fraccionamiento Las Brisas

666461018.name: serene place - no matter your religion
666461018.author: a TripAdvisor user
666461018.reviewBody: we had a privately organized tour of this place through our hotel. We could see the cross from our hotel on Acapulco Bay, and I expected it to be a cross for a church. The guide told us the sad story of the cross, and why it is there, why it is so large. The church and grounds are lovingly tended, immaculate, and respectfully quiet. The architecture of the church is very unique, and I liked that there were no sign of religious symbols. Seeing the tombs and vaults of local families was interesting. The views from the grounds are incredible, as well. We are glad we went to the location, as I usually do not tour churches or other religious facilities. Well worth the time we made for it. There is a donation table, and we did not feel pressured to donate, but of course we did. There was a gift shop, we did not go in. What a beautiful final resting place for the locals!

address.streetAddress: Calle de la Paz, s/n Fraccionamiento Las Brisas

647144643.name: Acapulco History
647144643.author: a TripAdvisor user
647144643.reviewBody: There is a few different ways to see and visit historical sites in Acapulco. You can go on the tours provided by your travel group or you can find a private driver that will take you to all the histortial places and into local areas like we did. We used an English speaking guide by the name of Jose. Jose stayed by our side at all times and spoke for us to the local people when needed. He took us to the Chaoel of Peace and explained the history and stories of the Chapel of Peace. The view from the Chapel is breath taking. It over looks the Acapulco Bay and if you lucky, you may see a Whale in the Bay. This is a must visit location in Acapulco. Also, when you hire a private driver that you pay by the hour, the cost of visiting tourist attractions are half the cost of what is being charged by the travel tours like Sunwing. This visit to the Chapel was free of cost but you can make a donation on the way out. The cost of going to see the divers which is a must as well, was thirty seven USD each from Sunwing and we paid only ten each which also included a free driink of your choice. Pop, Beer or a poured drink. There is no cost for your private guide to enter the show with you.

628598623.author: a TripAdvisor user
628598623.reviewBody: If you\u2019re in Acapulco I recommend taking the time to go up here.  We had walked to the Walmart from our place at The Emporium hotel (about 25 mins).  Could see that the big cross on the hill wasn\u2019t thaaaat far away, so thought we\u2019d go.  Across the road from the Walmart was a public seat and parked on that corner were a few taxis ( the AC kind!). \nWe asked one of the drivers and if he could take us, said he could.  Arranged a deal and for 300 pesos he took us up there, got us in (cause there is a security gate and stuff) walked us around telling us about it, got some cool photos, and he dropped us back to our hotel at The Emporium.  The taxi was Air Con so always cost a little more... Luxury!\nWe actually payed him an additional 300 to take us to the airport the following morning.

address.streetAddress: Calle de la Paz, s/n Fraccionamiento Las Brisas

602265815.name: What a wonderful and peaceful place
602265815.author: a TripAdvisor user
602265815.reviewBody: The history of this church was originally builded by the Trouyet Family. They build \u201cLas Brisas\u201d a housing project in the early 50\u2019s. In 1967 the brothers Carlos and Jorge Trouyet died in a airplane crash from Mexico City and his father built this mausoleum to honor their memories. This chapel is known as the \u201cCapilla Ecum\u00e9nica La Paz\u201d at the top of the \u201cCerro El Guitarr\u00f3n\u201d. Beautiful and peaceful place.

596240168.name: Be sure to see this beautiful, Peaceful Chapel
596240168.author: a TripAdvisor user
596240168.reviewBody: My English speaking Tour Guide JonathanBasilio was the best! He took me on a CIty tour and insisted I see this church - he knew all the details about why the chapel was built on the highest point in Acapulco. You will get some beautiful photos, and its a great place to come to pray or meditate. Wear walking shoes! You can see this and the rest of the city, cliff divers, Old Holywood area, the old Fort - All in ONE day! Jonathan will help you - +52 984-158-1105 tell him Riana sent you from Romance International Travel!

address.streetAddress: Calle de la Paz, s/n Fraccionamiento Las Brisas

594457582.name: Serene & Quiet View Over the Bay
594457582.author: a TripAdvisor user
594457582.reviewBody: The last section of the road up to the Chapel is quite steep, so our tour group had to exit our full size bus and clamber into mini-buses for the short ride; but it was worth it. Our local guide gave us the history of this lovely chapel and escorted us around the grounds and into the serene chapel. He raved about the stunning view even though there was such a thick haze (in late April), that you could barely see across the Bay. Nevertheless, the vantage point allowed us to see the full expanse of the Bay. Indeed, on a clearer day, and in the evenings, it must be quite stunning. The garden is nice and shady, and there are several interesting sculptures. There is a small gift shop and clean restrooms, so this is definitely a stop worth considering the next time you\'re in Acapulco.

571662777.author: a TripAdvisor user
571662777.reviewBody:
Our local driver took us to visit this Chapel of Peace, high up in the hills above Acapulco.  
What a beautiful, peaceful place. And the views of the city below are spectacular.

Our guide explained the history of the family that built the Chapel to commemorate their two sons who died in a plane crash. 
The sculpture of the two hands seemed to be hands in prayer, but they represent the two right hands of the brothers, holding each other in their last moments. 

This is a place that I would like to visit again.

address.streetAddress: Calle de la Paz, s/n Fraccionamiento Las Brisas

564948287.name: A simple prayer for our friends and family
564948287.author: a TripAdvisor user
564948287.reviewBody: The Chapel of Peace is a must see when visiting Acapulco. You can see this magnificent Cross from just about everywhere in Acapulco. The chapel is a place of worship for all faiths. You can also  purchase a vault for six people\'s ashes they have larger and smaller. While visiting you will enjoy the wonderful architectural work. A single family Carlos Trouyet and his wife Millly build this beautiful memorial in memory of two of  their sons Carlos and Jogre who died in a plane crash in 1967. The cross is approximately 138 feet in height, 66 feet foundation; the tallest monument in Latin America. Located in Las Brisas. You will walk up a hill from your car... then steps to the chapel not for the faint of heart. The Chapel is simple in design and holds about 200 people. The hands of Brotherhood are something to see. The water features and flowers contributes to the peace and serenity of this memorial. The view of Acapulco is spectacular.

I would have given 5 stars but the old lady in the gift store was rude and grumpy. If you think you might want to buy something, bring pesos. She gave us a hard time while trying to buy a photograph for $1 even though that\u2019s exactly what it was advertised as.

543367431.author: a TripAdvisor user
543367431.reviewBody: The Chapel of Peace is a must see if you are visiting Acapulco.  Built high on a hill it overlooks the Old Acapulco and the Golden Acapulco sections of town.  Wonderful place to take a picture or just enjoy the views.   If you would like to see know about the history of the chapel, have the movie stars homes pointed out on the drive up the chapel, as well  as the honeymoon spot for Elizabeth Taylor and Mike Todd, and Jack and Jackie Kennedy plus hear the wonderful history of his Beautiful Acapulco, I would recommend Miguel #4.  Contact him before you book your trip, he will personalize your tours for you.  Email him at acapulcomikehome@live.com.mx.

Getting there may be tricky. Luckily, we were on a tour with "Tour by Van" with Rudy, our amazing guide, who literally pulled up at the top of the (steep) hill allowing us to easily access this perched jewel.\nThe story of love and loss behind the Chapel of Peace is responsible for people of all paths and faiths to be able to visit and enjoy it nowadays. The grounds and views are plain gorgeous. A peaceful, meditative place, hard to leave without turning back.

The couple who built this Chapel originally built a romantic resort just below this.  Sebastian worked at the resort and new the history of the family and the building of the Chapel.  I highly recommend you go with him on the tour.  Great views and history at the Chapel.  The only negative was the gift shop could have been so much better with such a rich history.  A small investment in the gift shop could really make this place more complete as the documentation and religious gifts where so cheap we did not want to buy anything even though we wanted to take something back with us.  We settled for all our photos.

address.streetAddress: Calle de la Paz, s/n Fraccionamiento Las Brisas

472674369.name: Finally The Lights To The Cross Are Back On & The History Continues!!
472674369.author: a TripAdvisor user
472674369.reviewBody:
It is so true what TripAdvisor reviewers say about La Capilla de la Paz! It is a very beautiful and peaceful place to visit! The gardens, the Chapel, the monument of The Hands of Brotherhood and especially the Cross are all very beautiful. Also the view of the bay from the lookout point up there is probably the best view that you will find! 
That, plus the history of the Chapel are some of the many reasons why we have always visited the Chapel when we are in Acapulco! 
The last time that we visited the Chapel was in 2014. The reason didn't visit the Chapel in 2015 and 2016 is because they stopped turning on the lights of the Cross and that is a matter of principle for me and so many other visitors that come here to visit this site.
A big part of the history of this Chapel is that the lights of the Cross have always been on from the day that the construction was completed back in December 1971 and that the Cross would always be illuminated at night in memory the two sons that died in an Airplane crash and the lights have always been on for about the last 44 years or so! 
Since the Chapel was not living up to it's expectations to the history of what the Chapel is all about, so many of us stopped visiting and giving donations to the Chapel which by the way, it is not mandatory to donate. 
Myself and so many others have tried emailing, calling, visiting and even asking the locals to try and help to get the Chapel to turn the Cross lights back on again but the efforts were futile.
Finally, on March 18, 2017 at 7:30 pm the Cross was visible again, the lights were finally turned back on!! 
We were so excited to see that the tradition of the Cross being lit up at night continued again. 
Another amazing fact about the Cross is that it is visible from everywhere along the bay of Acapulco and that's also why it was placed on top of the hill in the “Las Brisas area. As of yet, we don't know why the lights were turned back on but we are very happy that they are on again and that they will continue to stay on! I would like to give a Big Thank You to whoever is responsible for turning the lights back on and that is why we have returned to visit the Chapel again!

439172723.author: a TripAdvisor user

itemReviewed.name: Capilla de la Paz (Chapel of Peace)

address.streetAddress: Calle de la Paz, s/n Fraccionamiento Las Brisas

437523799.name: Nice story, great structure
437523799.author: a TripAdvisor user
437523799.reviewBody: Each time I came to Acapulco, I went here. The story behind this "chapel" about the family who built it is very interesting. The view of the bay is great from here and a nice drive up the hill with amazing houses to see on the way.\n\nIt\'s not your average religious site to visit and feels more like a peaceful recluse from the bustling city below. It\'s amazing piece of architecture with an open air seating and well designed landscape around it. This would be a nice place for a tranquil picnic.

itemReviewed.name: Capilla de la Paz (Chapel of Peace)

address.streetAddress: Calle de la Paz, s/n Fraccionamiento Las Brisas

437234289.name: Interesting
437234289.author: a TripAdvisor user
437234289.reviewBody: If you\'re interested in churches, then this is a nice chapel for you to visit. I personally felt that it was a personal kind of church and not much to talk about. The history is very interesting, and the view is awesome. If you have the time and you\'re in the area, you really should stop - since the whole time you\'re in Acapulco you\'re going to see that huge cross up in the hills :)

itemReviewed.name: Capilla de la Paz (Chapel of Peace)

address.streetAddress: Calle de la Paz, s/n Fraccionamiento Las Brisas

436363419.name: the view of Acapulco is stunning
436363419.author: a TripAdvisor user
436363419.reviewBody: The tour I went on was solo and the history of the Church is very worth while. Two brothers who planned most of Acapulco died in Plane crash in 1967 and the family erected the church in their memory

itemReviewed.name: Capilla de la Paz (Chapel of Peace)

address.streetAddress: Calle de la Paz, s/n Fraccionamiento Las Brisas

434951454.name: Solemn and Beautiful
434951454.author: a TripAdvisor user
434951454.reviewBody: My husband and I went to this chapel as part of a city tour of Acapulco.  The story of how this chapel and large cross was built was amazing and a little sad.  I don\'t want to retell the whole story, but it is amazing how Carlos Trouyet built these structures as a memorial to his family.  The view is wonderful and well worth the time to go see the view and hear the whole story of this monument.

428625049.author: a TripAdvisor user

itemReviewed.name: Capilla de la Paz (Chapel of Peace)

address.streetAddress: Calle de la Paz, s/n Fraccionamiento Las Brisas

427072467.name: sunday mass on the hill
427072467.author: a TripAdvisor user
427072467.reviewBody:
We took a trip up the hill and enjoyed Sunday mass last week.
Event though we don't speak Spanish and are not regular church goers it was a lovely experience.
The guitar and hymns were upbeat and musical not sombre as I'm used to. Everyone was singing and there a point during the service that everyone turned around and said hello to each other and gave their blessings which was quite touching.
The Capilla de la Paz is a striking building on top of the hill as well as the impressive white cross which stands next to it. We could view it from our hotel. The drive up was spectacular with the view of the ocean, mountains and beautiful homes. Well worth a visit if you're in Acapulco

itemReviewed.name: Capilla de la Paz (Chapel of Peace)

address.streetAddress: Calle de la Paz, s/n Fraccionamiento Las Brisas

425638230.name: The view of Acapulco is breathtaking!
425638230.author: a TripAdvisor user
425638230.reviewBody: This is a magnificent attraction and a must see! The view of Acapulco bay is amazing! The chapel is a simple but wonderful construction. The opaque triangular onyx tiles are spectacular. The wood work inside is wonderful. The huge cross and the bronze sculpture of the hands are also beyond words. It is a peaceful place built to honor loved ones. The family history is tragic but this chapel is an amazing gift to Acapulco! You have to see this beautiful place!

423340542.reviewBody: We loved the view from the Chapel.  Loved the story the a father built the chapel in honor of his two sons who were killed in a car accident and the statue of two hands is in honor of them.

itemReviewed.name: Capilla de la Paz (Chapel of Peace)

address.streetAddress: Calle de la Paz, s/n Fraccionamiento Las Brisas

395196458.name: Home Away from Home
395196458.author: a TripAdvisor user
395196458.reviewBody: Las Brisas sits on the side of a mountain over looking the Acapulco Bay at first you are ah! struck at the beauty of the surrounding. The beautiful blue bay, The majestic mountains, and the world famous Acapulco strip. The hotel may be one of the oldest  but it is very well keep. Service is very good and very accommodating to your needs. Each Cassata has a separate pool private are a share pool but I choose the private pool. Every morning they would bring you a little breakfast teaser of your choosing to help start your day. While you are there don/t forget the Pink and White jeeps get you one to go about the town in it open pathways for you like have special privileges. But on the top of the mountain is this beautiful Chapel of Peace Capilla De La Paz quiet serene and peaceful a great place to meditate, pray are just simply take in the beauty of it all a must see. When you reach the White Cross your are there.

387275887.name: Amazing Views of Acapulco Bay from a Beautiful Chapel
387275887.author: a TripAdvisor user
387275887.reviewBody: Our guide stopped by here on our tour of Acapulco.  Learning about the family that built it and the story behind it was interesting.  The cross is approx. 147 feet tall, and can be seen for miles. We flew directly over the top of it on the way back to Mexico City as well. There is also a beautiful sculpture dedicated to the two brothers in the family that were killed in a plane crash. If you want to get pictures of Acapulco Bay and all of the city, this is the place to take them from.

itemReviewed.name: Capilla de la Paz (Chapel of Peace)

386809636.author: a TripAdvisor user
386809636.reviewBody: The Capilla de la Paz is a must see.  The giant cross on the top of the Las Brisas mountainside can be viewed from almost anywhere in Acapulco, but it\'s even better at the Chapel of Peace looking down over all of Acapulco Bay.

The chapel has an open feel to it and the grounds are peaceful. The large cross can be seen from most areas of the bay.\nThe views and photographic oportunities from the back of the chapel are breathtaking as you can view the whole of the bay of Acapulco- a must visit when in town.

352250961.author: a TripAdvisor user
352250961.reviewBody: We visited this chapel as part of a shore excursion from Acapulco.  The chapel is on the highest point in the area and has amazing views of the town and ocean, and is very peaceful and quiet.  The windows are made of onyx and the light shines through it.  When we were there, there were two large flower arrangements in the chapel that were just striking.  \n\nThe chapel is free but there is a small fee for using the public washrooms.

327932367.name: A must-see for first-time Acapulco visitors
327932367.author: a TripAdvisor user
327932367.reviewBody: The Chapel of Peace is a remarkable, tranquil place located on a peak with a commanding view of Acapulco Bay. It was built by (and is still owned by) a family who maintains it open to the public for free (donations accepted). Go with a good guide (ours was Sebastian Hernandez with "Acapulco for All") who can give you the complete story of the family, the non-denominational chapel (history and architecture), and the huge cross and the sculpture of the hands.

address.streetAddress: Calle de la Paz, s/n Fraccionamiento Las Brisas

324702067.name: Capilla de la Paz, Acapulco, October 17, 2015
324702067.author: a TripAdvisor user
324702067.reviewBody: This chapel is located in the Las Brisas area of Acapulco.  It has a commanding view of Acapulco Bay and was built by the parents of two young men who were killed to honor their memory.  The sculpture of the Hands of the Brotherhood is actually two right hands, one for each of their sons.  There is a crypt area below the chapel.  The pews and the alter and the gates are made of ironwood.  The windows are made of translucent onyx.  The admission is by donation.  There is a gift/book shop adjacent.  They charge $5 to use the bathrooms.

307856073.reviewBody: Capilla de la Paz is the most amazing non denominational chapel I have ever been to.  The chapel is located at the highest point of el cerro El Guitarron where you are able to see the cross from various parts of Acapulco. You can also see the famous sculpture Las Manos de La Hermandad, The Hands of Brotherhood a tribute to Jorge & Carlos Trouyet who died in a horrible accident.  This chapel is very well worth visiting hire Roberto Alarcon Transportation & Tours for a great tour of Capilla de la Paz.

271985258.name: My tour of Acapulco hosted by Roberto Alarcon
271985258.author: a TripAdvisor user
271985258.reviewBody:
I'm always interested in architecture and history, as well as culture.

     The visit to the Chapel was definitely and intriguing experience, it also helps to understand the background story of how it came to be.

     My Tour guide was amazing and fully aware of its past and how it came to be of fruition.

     As I sat inside, I was amazed by the simplistic architecture yet how modern it looked at the same time. 

     The landscaping and use of large boulders is to be recognized, and the cemetery below the church which add to its uniqueness.

     Definitely take a look see and learn what it is that makes church a gem of Acapulco history!

:)

258309331.author: a TripAdvisor user
258309331.reviewBody: We were lucky and got a free ride with a local up to the chapel. It is in a private gated housing complex and there are definitely no buses.  It is feasible to walk back down to the road and get a collectivo taxi back to town, but I would not recommend walking up.  It is a super steep and long walk in the boiling sun even for ardent walkers. The chapel is worth a visit as the views of Acapulco were astounding.  The cross appears large from the town but is unbelievable when you see it up close. The chapel is peaceful and very simple and well landscaped.  Very relaxing and enjoyable.  We were glad we did not have a taxi waiting so we could enjoy a longer stay.

The landscaping is excellent as well. Since we were staying at the hotel, it was a 5 min trip. 244700350.author: a TripAdvisor user
244700350.reviewBody: My Fiance and I recently took a trip to Acapulco with friends of ours.  I am not the best at planning ahead so we relied on the Concierge for a driver.   We were lucky enough to have met Carlos Alegria Corona, Mr Happiness. his email is: calegriacorona@gmail.com. Having Carlos was like having our own personal tour guide.  He gave us fabulous recommendations and took us to this magnificent place.  The view and the overall feeling while being at this Chapel cannot be expressed with words.  I would definitely recommend adding this place to your list of "must sees" in Acapulco.  I would also highly recommend Carlos, as he did everything he could to make our trip that week the best ever. We actually booked our tours with him, more private and definitely was the best ever. He cared and it showed. we felt very comfortable with him and his son we had one day. His wife made us dinner after the men went deep sea fishing. They are great people and we were very happy to have met them. We felt he was genuine and cared about us too. Thanks Carlos for showing us a good time!

address.streetAddress: Calle de la Paz, s/n Fraccionamiento Las Brisas

199363941.name: Best view in Acapulco
199363941.author: a TripAdvisor user
199363941.reviewBody:
The chapel itself was pleasant but unremarkable; the architect was important, and it looks kind of like a pineapple, but inside it is basically a lot of concrete.  The grounds are pretty and well maintained.

The cross is iconic, and it is kind of interesting to see up close.  Our tour guide told us it is about the same height that the cliff divers jump from, which puts that into perspective.

The real reason to visit the Capilla de la Paz is for the view, which is absolutely breathtaking.  

A couple practical matters:
- ACCESSIBILITY: This is up a hill.  To get to the chapel property you have to walk up a little hill from where you park; once you enter the chapel property there are a bunch of steps (some short and some tall) to get up to the chapel itself.  For people with limited mobility, I think this would be difficult to visit.  It is not a very difficult, long, or challenging hike, but it is moderate (vs. something that is flat and totally accessible.)  
- KIDS: Our daughter (20 months) did fine, but we had to carry her a bunch because she is not good enough with stairs yet. We also had to be careful about the fences, because they were not child-proof fences, but it wasn't a problem for us.  
- COST: I didn't see anyone charge us anything to visit, although there was a donation box at the entrance.
- SITE INFORMATION: I did not see any placards or signs with information about the history, and it was far more interesting with the background story, so we were happy to be there with our guide. (We went with Sebastian, and he knew all about it.)

195908890.name: Memorable stop on tour with Roberto Alarcon
195908890.author: a TripAdvisor user
195908890.reviewBody: A memorable site given the history, beautiful chapel and outstanding, peaceful views of Acapulco.  However, we would not have fully appreciated this site if not accompanied by the knowledgeable Roberto Alarcon (www.robertoalarcontours.com).  Roberto brought us here as part of a half day comprehensive tour of Acapulco.  Roberto showed us the top tourist sites and sites of importance such as the Chapel of Peace, but also brought us to where the locals live and shop, demonstrating the broad range of conditions and affluence in Acapulco. When you plan your customized tour with Roberto, include the Chapel of Peace.

address.streetAddress: Calle de la Paz, s/n Fraccionamiento Las Brisas

162970737.name: Stunning and breathtaking, thanks to our guide Sebastian
162970737.author: a TripAdvisor user
162970737.reviewBody: The Chapel of Peace was definitely one of our vacation highlights. It was absolutely gorgeous inside and out. We went with our tour guide Sebastian Hernandez (acapulcofor_all@yahoo.com) and had the entire place to ourselves! He showed us all the local fruits, nuts, and plants growing around the church (almonds, mangos, avocados, guava, etc!) and was highly knowledgeable about the interesting history of this beautiful chapel. I loved the parrot brothers that the chapel takes care of. They said hello to us in Spanish and English when we went over to them and were super friendly and fun. \n\nThe view from the back of Acapulco Bay is truly one of the best in the world and Sebastian built the suspense up to it perfectly. When we turned the corner, we literally gasped and "ooh\'d" and "ahh\'d" at the sight. Sebastian is an excellent photographer and took stunning panoramas of the bay with his own camera for us. He e-mailed them to us right when we got home. It was truly an unforgettable experience.

162435291.author: a TripAdvisor user
162435291.reviewBody: This beautiful peaceful ecumenical chapel is perched on top of a hill in the exclusive Las Brisas overlooking Acapulco bay and all the way out to Pie de la Cuesta to the north and Puerto Marques and out to the airport to the south. It is a perfect place to either catch a church service on a Sunday or just wander around the peaceful gardens admiring the spectacular view or to sit in the cool shade of the minimalistic rock, granite and onyx chapel to enjoy some peaceful meditation. There is a little shop with a bathroom should you need either!

address.streetAddress: Calle de la Paz, s/n Fraccionamiento Las Brisas

155642792.name: Capilla De La Paz
155642792.author: a TripAdvisor user
155642792.reviewBody: After reading a few reviews along the lines of "great view, nothing else.. great site, nothing to do.. etc" I HAD TO WRITE THIS REVIEW. First and foremost, this is one of the MUST SEEs of Acapulco. My family and I were fortunate to see the Capilla De La Paz as a part of the Acapulco Highlights Tour offered by Acapulco for All (Sebastian Hernandez, proprietor). Trust and believe, while the church and the surrounding areas are beautiful to see, nothing helps you understand its significance--history, location, construction--like having the right person explain it to you. Sebastain did a fantastic job detailing how the church came to be located, the family behind its construction, and the materials used to construct the church. Sebastian came HIGHLY recommended and I would recommend that ANYONE who wants to visit the church and understand more about it, use Acapulco For All! Don\'t just go and see a beautiful site, UNDERSTAND why the site exists and what it means to the community it serves. It will immensely improve your appreciation of the church and the surrounding grounds.

152740233.reviewBody: If you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of Acapulco for awhile please check out the Chapel of Peace.  Built by rich Americans who settled in the area, it is a fantastic area to take beautiful pictures of Acapulco, and to enjoy the refreshing breezes and especially spend some quality time in a very peaceful atmosphere. While we were there, a young Mexican lady was having her picture taken for the celebration of her fifteenth birthday. Also in the area are incredible condos owned by famous Americans and Mexicans alike ! Well worth the trip ! Go, enjoy! SKIPPYFRIZZ !

144271266.author: a TripAdvisor user
144271266.reviewBody: Roberto sounds familiar :)  \n\nIn the mid eighties I visited Acapulco the first time . From the hotel room at the Hayatt Regency I could see a navy base with some pt boats and a destroyer / battleship. But at night all lit up on top of the hill was this beautiful cross. Well on the second visit it was time to go see this cross. What a great view of the bay from up there. VERY Sad story about why it was built too. But the view from the Hyatt was spoiled this time by another hotel/condo?

144074718.name: Nice views
144074718.author: a TripAdvisor user
144074718.reviewBody: A well-kept, tranquil place to visit with fantastic views out across the Bay and to the Pacific.\n\nTo get there from the bay, get to Wal-mart on the Costera then look out for a 7 pesos bus heading to Colosio, which will take you up the hill. There is a bus stop right at the road which leads up to la Capilla but will have to take a taxi from there as it is a Residential Estate. You should be able to get one up for about 25 pesos and then enjoy the walk back down. The sign out front says the Chapel is open free to the public 10am - 1pm and 4pm - 6pm every day.

After their sons died in an aeroplane accident in the bay they donated the land and chapel to the public.

However anyone can chose to be cremated and the urn put into one of the vaults.( I assume it will cost you.) The chapel can also be used for weddings. It is a simple but lovely place. It is free but a contribution is requested\nHowever it is the view I suggest most people go for as you get a panoramic view of the whole seafront of Acapulco with its hotels, beaches ( lovely ) marinas etc.

itemReviewed.name: Capilla de la Paz (Chapel of Peace)

address.streetAddress: Calle de la Paz, s/n Fraccionamiento Las Brisas

10302625.name: Charming Chapel...Picturesque Location.
10302625.author: a TripAdvisor user
10302625.reviewBody: Perched atop a cliff overlooking the bay of Acapulco, the Capilla de la Paz or (Chapel of the Peace) is a very picturesque site and well worth a visit. The non-denominational chapel is located in the very pricey Las Brisas area of Acapulco. The chapel itself is small but very quaint and charming. It has beautiful marble facades which allow lovely opaque light to shine upon the chapel interior during the day. The cross is massive (at over 130 feet in height) and overlooks Acapulco bay. At night it is lit up atop the mountain.  Next to the cross there is also a smaller statue called Las Manos de la Hermandad, of two right hands joining together signifying brotherhood. \n\nMy suggestion is to try and visit this site on an early/small tour group. We visited on Tuesday morning around 10:30am with a group of only 7 people. We had the site to ourselves for most of the short tour, which was nice considering the small size of the grounds. As we were leaving we saw a few large tour groups arrive and I had a hard time imaging how they were all able to comfortably tour the small site.  I would highly recommend this site to anyone visiting Acapulco who is interested in seeing more of the unique charm of the city itself. The view from the top of the chapel atrium is worth the trip alone. Acapulco bay is breathtaking from this vantage point! Bring your cameras this place is gorgeous and a perfect way to spend a bit of the day.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

647146449.name: This Show is Must See
647146449.author: a TripAdvisor user
647146449.reviewBody: We went to the afternoon show with our private driver & guide. Our private driver & guide Jose got us in to this show for ten dollars each and free drink was included. If you go to see this show with a travel guide like Sunwing your cost will be thirty seven each and a free drink is not included. \n\nThe divers are absolutely amazing. To do what they do takes a lot of practice and training and this is very dangerous due to high winds and the very shallow water that they dive into. The diver also have to be rock climbers to get to the highest point to dive in. This show is worth every dime.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

646418566.author: a TripAdvisor user
646418566.reviewBody: Did only watch the diving at daytime. Impressive quality on the divings. WiFi a bit slow. Wanted to brodcast live.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

644576094.name: Dare devils
644576094.author: a TripAdvisor user
644576094.reviewBody: The divers are pretty brave I would not climb or jump off the cliff, but they do it multiple times a day. After the show get a picture with them and give them a tip. As far as the restaurant: you get into the show for a drink and a meal for the about the same price as a drink except you can sit in a comfortable place. The drink was good, fish was very good as was the rice. Salad had no dressing and portions are small so more of a "light lunch". Do not order an extra drink as a Pacifico beer is $4 USD and no you can not take it with you. The show is short with about 10 dives, but iconic and worth it. The neighborhood is in the traditional part of town with multiple other iconic places: Casablanca bar/restaurant great view; Flamingo hotel of the stars and a mosaics close by by Diego Rivera on the wall of the building where he kept his studio- A must check out!

I wanted a solo trip and that’s what I got! Fantastic service. Collected me on time at Banyan Tree Acapulco in Air conditioned luxury vehicle. We shared the sunset at La Vista restaurant including dinner and a pretty fireworks display in the bay and on to the cliff dives for the evening diving performance which, you have to see to believe! Especially the fire at the end. 

Forget the rest and book the best!

Very far away, it was free from the street.  There was a boat also watching.  I went to the nearest point about a hour before starting time.  They do them on the half hour starting at 630, 4 more times.  There is a afternoon one but not sure of time.  There were 6 divers and only 1 went from the top.  I was told that most of them are descendants of divers many years ago.  My first impression was from what Ive seen in print that it was higher. But it still is high from where they dive into the small area in the water.

389186876.name: Family Vacation
389186876.author: a TripAdvisor user
389186876.reviewBody:
My family of 6 went on a 7 day vacation to Acapulco and we had a wonderful time.  My children are 22, 21, 19 and 13 so it was a challenge to find activities that all enjoyed.  

We found a wonderful tour guide that helped us navigate the right choices and we had one of the best vacations we have had as a family.  Highlights include:

1. Jungle Tour, nothing compares to getting in the mud with your children and not worrying about the laundry consequences:-)  

2. The Tehuacalco Archaeological Ruins, our guide Roberto of robertoalarcontours.com had a special gift of bringing the history alive with stories and descriptions of how his own ancestors lived thousands of years ago.  My kids appreciated the "sacrifices" of our ancestors...

3. Real Mexico and Markets was a wonderful tour where we were able to see how people currently live and tasted many of the wonderful foods that are a part of the culture and history of the country.  Try the fresh mangos, herbs, drinks, etc.  The people working the market were wonderful!

4. Cliff divers was awe inspiring and the kids got to take a picture with the cliff divers after the show.  

So many more experiences but the best way to tell the story is through pictures (see pics).  It all started with an email to Roberto at robertoalrey@yahoo.com.mx 

My lesson on this trip was find someone you can trust and surrender to the many wonders that a wonderful local place like Acapoco has to offer, happy travels.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner
