itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

371858270.name: Sunset Show from the Lower Balcony
371858270.author: a TripAdvisor user
371858270.reviewBody:
You don't have to stay at this hotel or even dine there to watch this spectacular show! We came from across town to see the show and were not disappointed!

Admission for the balcony (non-hotel) that the divers actually enter from is only 40 pesos, not expensive at all. You buy a ticket and enter, immediately surrendering your ticket. Then there is a slight trek down a good number of stone stair cases to the platform. Some of the sections of stairs are steep or uneven, watch where you are stepping! This is a beautiful place to take pictures, especially at sunset!

When the show begins, there is epic music and the divers come down the same staircase you entered from with torches in their hands. They climb down the wall you're standing at, jump in the water, and climb up the huge cliff on the other side. Once all of the divers are there, they take turns diving. Some dive backwards, some in tandem from different heights, some do somersaults. They are all amazing! If you go after dark, I think it's the 10:30pm show, they dive with the torches in their hands!

Regardless of what time you go, be sure to find a spot to stand early and stand your ground there carefully. People will try to push their way around you, I was stepped on by a local who thought I would move because I'm a little white girl. I'll say again, be careful.

After the show the divers have a bag for tips and they stand on the stairs as you exit by them. Some of them are available for photos there if you want one.

There are food vendors and souvenir shops near the entrance and throughout the parking lot if you get hungry or thirsty. There is even a table where you can pick a shell or plate and have it painted with a scene of the divers right there in front of you. We waited 10 minutes for one of these and only paid about 3 USD for it. They wrap your item in plastic wrap so it can continue drying and then again in another plastic bag so you can carry it.

There is also a public bathroom right by the ticket counter, but just like any other public bathroom in that area, there is no toilet paper, and there is a lady sitting outside the bathroom who will ask you for 5 pesos in exchange for a good handful of it. I personally always carry wipes in my bag and do not pay to use the restroom, but they will totally give you dirty looks and talk about you if you tell them no. Your choice.

I would totally go again, especially to see them dive with the torches.

349529742.name: WOW!!
349529742.author: a TripAdvisor user
349529742.reviewBody: I enjoyed watching the show here but the food was not great. The staff was very friendly and the cliff jumpers were great. They would come and take pictures with the ground between jumps. It was a fun night but don\'t expect much from the food....Its just ok.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

347689158.name: No reservations required, dinner was very good
347689158.author: a TripAdvisor user
347689158.reviewBody: For about $25.00 a person you get two drinks a three course pre fix menu (order the cheese cake for dessert) and the diving show. The first evening show is 7:30 and every hour after that . The first show has the most divers, after they\'re done the first show several of the divers walk around and collect much deserved tips. It took about 2.5 hours for our party to finish everything so we saw two shows. We drove ourselves, for 50 pesos Carlos watched our car. There are lots of venders selling Mexican trinkets at excellent prices along the streets once you finish dinner. There isn\'t a bad seat in the restaurant (La Perla)

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

343648979.name: Once in a lifetime view
343648979.author: a TripAdvisor user
343648979.reviewBody: We took an excursion from our resort, and were quite please with the results! Dinner was good, and the show was a once in a lifetime event!

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

343438026.name: Great show and good food
343438026.author: a TripAdvisor user
343438026.reviewBody: We had a great table to see the show and we really enjoyed it.  The diving was exciting and fun to see.  The food was good but not great.  I had the fajitas and they were very good even though the rest of the group was not as impressed.  I would recommend seeing this show.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

341908968.name: NIght on the town
341908968.author: a TripAdvisor user
341908968.reviewBody: My husband and I were staying locally at an all inclusive - but wanted a night out.  Saw the info for the cliff divers / dinner and were glad we decided to go!   Good food - great atmosphere - what a show !

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

337827506.name: Awesome Sight
337827506.author: a TripAdvisor user
337827506.reviewBody: No matter how many times I see these divers risk their lives, I am in awe of their skill and bravery- an amazing site! Dinner is also excellent at their restaurant and all tables have an excellent view.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

334842913.name: Nice meal as the divers performed perfectly
334842913.author: a TripAdvisor user
334842913.reviewBody: Our taxi driver friend got us fine seats at the restaurant for the show and a very reasonably priced meal.  The dives went just perfectly to the robust cheers of the standing audience.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

334113955.name: A must see in Acapulco!
334113955.author: a TripAdvisor user
334113955.reviewBody: We booked this true the hotel lobby. I believe we paid 25US each  for transportation and 2 included drinks. Well worth the money, try to seat yourself closest to the cliff as possible and be amazed! If you ever watched the Red Bull Cliff divers show, you will be impressed seeing this live! Impressive!!

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

331832620.name: If you are in Acapulco, you HAVE to see this part of its culture
331832620.author: a TripAdvisor user
331832620.reviewBody: We ate at the restaurant.  Food was okay (though not nearly as good as what we had throughout the rest of our visit) but the show is fun!

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

328858989.name: Impressing!!!
328858989.author: a TripAdvisor user
328858989.reviewBody: Called La Quebrada. That\'s amazing, breath-taking show. Few teenagers at first go downstairs among the audience (sitting or standing on another cliff). Then they jump to the water and climb to the top of another cliff. They pray at the statue of the Lady of Guadalupe. Then they jump to the water - from two places of the cliff, one 20 feet (12 m), second 40 feet (24 m). The jump both single or in couples.\nLooks great, specially after sunset. The jumpers need to calculate when to jump - if they are wrong, the wave could throw them to the rocks, could be dangerous. \nWalking distance from Zocalo in Acapulco, as well you can take a taxi.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

317391257.name: Cliff divers
317391257.author: a TripAdvisor user
317391257.reviewBody: Pay for a seat in the restaurant, it is worth the meager charge and included 2 drinks each.  Get a seat as close to the cliff as possible and be prepared to be amazed at the skill of the divers.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

307444544.name: Cliff Diver Show
307444544.author: a TripAdvisor user
307444544.reviewBody: We didn\'t do dinner, but the Cliff Divers show was excellent! It is a must do in Acapulco. The restaurant was not recommended by anyone that we encountered, so we stayed away.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

306115486.name: Incredible show, Incredible views
306115486.author: a TripAdvisor user
306115486.reviewBody: Divers climb the tall cliffs and set up on top to stretch and pray before their dives. The divers wave and crowds of people are gathered to watch them jump. They start with dives lower on the cliff and work their way up, jumping into the narrow waters between the cliffs. The view from La Perla (restaurant) is excellent and allows for a nice sit-down show of cliff-diving. Seating is nice and spacious, and the food at La Perla is decent although you really pay for the experience.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

304252555.name: WOOOOWW
304252555.author: a TripAdvisor user
304252555.reviewBody: I loved it , great location , sounds of waves and dining , totally nice experience. lights of the city makes it very romantic :)

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

298368490.name: Great to see divers, Food just OK
298368490.author: a TripAdvisor user
298368490.reviewBody:
Watching the cliff divers is a must-do activity. Because we didn't have much time, we decided to have dinner at La Perla to watch them. The restaurant has a nice ambiance and good service, the food was mediocre though. I ordered the Lobster tail in butter and it didn't turn out too spectacular. We got a table along the boundary wall of the restaurant to get a good view of the cliff divers. The only benefit of this dinner was that we could sit comfortably and watch the act, as opposed to buying tickets and standing amongst a crowd. 

The best part are the divers who magically dive from heights like 80 feet down in water surrounded by cliff edges, the most dangerous dive, which they seemed to do with such ease. Kudos to the divers!

Read more about my Acapulco trip here: http://tiptoesworld.weebly.com/blog/true-blue-acapulco

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

293087084.name: What a sight: Brave, Daring men doing the dangerous jumps
293087084.author: a TripAdvisor user
293087084.reviewBody: I had heard so much about the cliff divers in Acapulco that I had to go and see it for myself. Thats exactly what I did when I went to Acapulco. The sight was amazing. It gives you goosebumps. Read more about the Cliff Divers and Acapulco in my blog:\n\nhttp://www.madaboutdeetravel.com/2015/06/acapulco-mexico-best-beach-destination.html

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

292019661.name: Acapulco History
292019661.author: a TripAdvisor user
292019661.reviewBody: Whenver you visit Acapulco, the cliff divers is a "must see" experience. The divers are daring and exciting. The best place to watch the show is at La Perla. The crowds from the public platform are just too many and a bit "pushy" (shoving and pushing to get a better look). At La Perla you have a table and a wonderful view. Unfortunately, it is not well known for stellar service. I believe it\'s understaffed. You can wait quite a while to get someone to your table, then it will be "rushed" service and many times they don\'t get the order right because they simply don\'t pay attention. To add insult to injury, the food and drinks are ovderpriced. They did recently remodel which made it a little more enjoyable. The ONLY reason to put up with this poor service restaurant is to watch the amazing divers who are part of Acapulcos long history of wowing its tourists.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

291833181.name: Dinner and high cliff diving
291833181.author: a TripAdvisor user
291833181.reviewBody: The divers were very impressive, diving after dark into the strong current but the restaurant we watched from (La Perla) was not.  Mediocre food and sub par service.  If there is another way to see the divers do it.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

290051260.name: You\'ve Got to See This But Avoid the Restaurant
290051260.author: a TripAdvisor user
290051260.reviewBody: The divers (clavadistas)  of La Quebrada have been doing their extraordinary shows since the mid 1930s and its still a thrilling thing to watch. You can join hundreds of people who watch the diving from the roadside, or you can pay four dollars to view the clavadistas from a lower platform, or you can pay a lot of money at La Perla restaurant to get a better view and some rather ordinary food.  There is a dive session during the day plus one at night. Try walking to (or back) to the Z\u00f3calo. Its a 30 minute walk at most and the sights are interesting.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

286217142.name: Cliff Divers
286217142.author: a TripAdvisor user
286217142.reviewBody: Watching the Cliff Divers was great.  Seeing them with their torch flaming at night was cool.  A definite must when you are here in Acapulco.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

282117720.name: Good scenery good service bland food
282117720.author: a TripAdvisor user
282117720.reviewBody:
Good: The restaurant is positioned so most of the seating has a good view of the cliff divers, which jumped at 830,930,and 1030pm. If you get a seat to the left area, you can see where they jump in from the pier, swim through the cove, climb the mountain, and jump off of the cliff. The jumpers will come talk to you on the left side by are not allowed to enter the restaurant.
The service is good and they do not rush you so you can see a couple of the jump times. The soups and desserts are very good. 

Bad: There are not many menu options. The main course options, particularly the Alfredo pasta, are very bland and dry. The fajitas have very little seasoning and the refried beans are for decoration so don't eat it. 

Lasting memory: It is definitely worth seeing with a glass of wine and a nice dessert. I would recommend eating dinner first though. Bring a camera for some lasting memories.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

281976920.name: Dinner at La Perla.
281976920.author: a TripAdvisor user
281976920.reviewBody: We loved the divers. Our dinner at La Perla was very good. We had a front row seat to see the divers

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

281255032.name: Cliff divers
281255032.author: a TripAdvisor user
281255032.reviewBody: This is exciting to watch, the kids enjoyed it. They do two shows at 730 and 830pm and it\'s about 40 pesos or 3 dollars per person. The Mirador hotel has a balcony you can watch from if you choose to have dinner there. We didn\'t have dinner there but might next time

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

275043213.name: Restaurant overlooking cliff divers
275043213.author: a TripAdvisor user
275043213.reviewBody: Tickets include watching cliff divers, three course dinner and 2 drinks. Good wait service. Drinks good. The food could have been much better, and I spoke to others who had visited and they all thought the food was so-so. However, I have always found, no matter where I have eaten, that if the view is fantastic the food is often below par. It is as if they think the good view will make up for sub-standard food.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

274837443.name: Lunch & Divers
274837443.author: a TripAdvisor user
274837443.reviewBody: The dives were not organized, nor were we told anything about them or the divers themselves. They just jumped seeminly at random times and without introduction or fanfare.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

272837692.name: mayo cinco
272837692.author: a TripAdvisor user
272837692.reviewBody: they try very hard but the tides were so high they could not do however we had a night we very much enjoy the walk along the avenue of Sinfonia " was one of my highlights

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

272403672.name: Spectacular Show
272403672.author: a TripAdvisor user
272403672.reviewBody:
This is really something different to see. Dining here is relatively inexpensive, and the food is OK. It’s worth booking to ensure you’re seated near the front, you get a far better view then, and it’s easier to take photos and video.

The place is a real who’s who of celebrities who have visited over the years, and must have been a great place to meet famous folks in the 50’s and 60’s.

Some of the divers are very young, but all extremely brave, particularly as the waves were crashing into the rocks. We met some of the divers outside after the show and all were very polite and friendly, and unlike other reviewers none of them asked us for anything.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

269927045.name: very exciting
269927045.author: a TripAdvisor user
269927045.reviewBody: the food was average but the view for the show was amazing best table in the house I highly recommend the dinning show just for the fact of the view.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

269788187.name: Average Show & Average Food
269788187.author: a TripAdvisor user
269788187.reviewBody: Everyone raves about the cliff divers and yes it is quite high and yes it is wavy but they did about 4 dives then asked for money. We paid to get in and for the show, we paid for dinner which was simple at best and the service was pretty poor not over busy but took ages for service then we got hounded by the divers.\nNot a particularly exciting day/night.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

268406739.name: Not Exciting
268406739.author: a TripAdvisor user
268406739.reviewBody: I remember my thrill as a teenager seeing the daredevil divers diving off the cliffs.  It is simply not so exciting any more.  It seems quite dated, although it certainly isn\'t any easier for the divers.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

265437875.name: Diving show great, food not so much
265437875.author: a TripAdvisor user
265437875.reviewBody: Ok, let me start off with the good - the show. It was amazing, scary, nerve-racking, exciting and spectacular. The divers were great, some of them were teenagers, training to be as good as the adults. \n\nThe restaurant is obviously very touristy, which you would expect, but the food was not good at all. I would avoid eating here. Eat somewhere else, then stop in for drinks and to watch the show.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

262656532.name: Thrill Seeker
262656532.author: a TripAdvisor user
262656532.reviewBody: Didn\'t do the dinner just the daytime dives.  It was very entertaining and scary!!!!  These divers certainly have little fear!!!  Must see while in Acapulco!!!!

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

261165069.name: Spectacular!
261165069.author: a TripAdvisor user
261165069.reviewBody: I have been to see the cliff divers seven times over the past ten years.  It still thrills me!  However, I would not recommend the restaurant, La Perla.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

261063903.name: Amazing Divers
261063903.author: a TripAdvisor user
261063903.reviewBody: We have been going to see the Cliff Divers for over 25 years and they never cease to amaze us. This last trip showed us something new. The winds were high and I was not sure that they would dive, but they gave us a show to remember. Acapulco is a beautiful destination and we are always happy to return.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

259341719.name: You gotta see this, at least once!
259341719.author: a TripAdvisor user
259341719.reviewBody: The divers are amazing, especially at night. Dinner is incidental to the experience. This has been going on for many decades (was on the first episode of ABC\'s "Wide World of Sports" back in 1960) and it continues because it continues to amaze.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

259120173.name: Just did the divers, no dinner
259120173.author: a TripAdvisor user
259120173.reviewBody: Divers were great...you don\'t gave to go to a restaurant to see them...there is a minimal fee to watch them from a bar like balcony...the divers were excellent...a must see and it doesn\'t take too much time...about a 20 minute show...very cool! Your videos and pictures are much better If you view it from an upper plaza rather than the big low patio... Also amust do when in Acapulco !

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

257315017.name: Cliff Divers by day
257315017.author: a TripAdvisor user
257315017.reviewBody: What a hoot. You pay a few Pecos to get in but you get a drink for free. The divers make a big production out of the diving. It was great

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

256506240.name: Great dinner
256506240.author: a TripAdvisor user
256506240.reviewBody: Have eaten there many times of the years and have had good and bad meals.  this year the meal was great and it\'s the best place to see the divers from..

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

256395813.name: See above comment for La Quebrada
256395813.author: a TripAdvisor user
256395813.reviewBody: See above comment for La Quebrada.  Great place, a MUST visit while in Acapulco.. There are also some shops in the square - the silver store is expensive but high quality.  The square vendors are well priced

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

255895249.name: the divers were awesome, the food substandard
255895249.author: a TripAdvisor user
255895249.reviewBody: It was a great place to see the show and the divers were great but when I ordered guacamole with shrimp I did not expect to get a basket of burnt tortilla chips with saltine crackers. Saltine crackers? really? and they charged money for them? unbelievable. and the shrimp were tiny little frozen shrimp placed on top of the guacamole with salsa from a jar. Worst appetizer ever.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

255895234.name: Good not as good
255895234.author: a TripAdvisor user
255895234.reviewBody: This is a definate go see. They just have less divers now and it is junkier than it used to be. They had to cut costs probably due to less tourism.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

255602371.name: Young and foolish
255602371.author: a TripAdvisor user
255602371.reviewBody: The title was our first thought. But these divers are brave. The dinner was really good.  Not busy at all in the restaurant. Tourist should not be afraid to go to Acapulco. We felt very safe in the Tourist Zone.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

252515322.name: See them during the day and at night!!
252515322.author: a TripAdvisor user
252515322.reviewBody: This is not something you will see anywhere else.  During the day you can see them come in and climb up the cliffs, before they dive.  At night, they dive with torches.  The food is good, not special, but the divers are fun to watch before they dive.  They put on a great show!!

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

226408650.name: An amazing show that one must see.
226408650.author: a TripAdvisor user
226408650.reviewBody:
I grew up watching the Acapulco Cliff divers on a certain cigarette advertisement in the movies. I admired those Cliff divers as amazingly brave and talented and never thought I would have the privilege of being there one day.
When we booked a cruise to Mexico I particularly chose one with a stop at Acapulco to view this show. One of the cruise ship excursions takes you to La Quebrada where we enjoyed a dinner while admiring the cliff divers.
We were seated at a table right up front at La Perla that provided my wife and I with a very romantic setting and a great view of the divers.  They first climbed up the steep hill before diving off into very small channel of water with an average depth of about 4 metres. During the night show some divers held torches while diving from a height of about 35m (equivalent to a 10 storey building).  As the depth of the water in this small channel varies between about 2 - 4 meters they need to wait for a suitable wave before performing their dives.
The food was also good and contributed to making the entire outing memorable and well worth the price.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

225814750.name: Good Local Show
225814750.author: a TripAdvisor user
225814750.reviewBody: This show is historic for Acapulco so you have to go and experience it just one time.  We paid $19 and had lunch that included an entree and a one drink (alcoholic or non alcoholic) and we had a perfect view of the show.  If you don\'t do this option, to get into the show you will still be charged.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

214010547.name: Fantastic
214010547.author: a TripAdvisor user
214010547.reviewBody: Amazing how they have the guts to do it!! Definitely go and tip the divers as they can die from doing this!! Don\'t do the whole restaurant package if anyone recommends it.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

210854653.name: Super!!
210854653.author: a TripAdvisor user
210854653.reviewBody: We really enjoyed watching the High Cliff Divers.  I was amazed at how high they climb up and then jump off into very small channel of water.  Awsome value...only 40 pasos each

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

210313405.name: High Cliff Divers in the Morning
210313405.author: a TripAdvisor user
210313405.reviewBody: We arrived on a cruise ship in the morning and were leaving later that afternoon so we got to see the show in the bright daylight and it was spectacular.  The divers go off the smaller cliff and swim across to the higher one.  The younger  ones go in first to  clear the water of any bottles or debris that may have floated in the the divers might hit upon landing.  The off the go after timing the swell just right so they have the most water under them when they hit  The is a fine location for viewing on the balcony of the hotel, they served us Margaritas when we arrived. They did straight dives, somersaults and even dove in pairs.  It is a must see if your are in Acapulco.\n\nThe divers station themselves at the hotel entrance with baskets for tip as you leave.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

206475686.name: Not Board..!
206475686.author: a TripAdvisor user
206475686.reviewBody: Yep, this was one of those very special nights....................saew Elvis do it from our local pics. when I was a wee skitter....never thought we would be there.\nLovely meal and excellent service which I have to confess was superfluous with the surroundings..................stale cheese and bread would have been as good.......\nDo it or......rue it.!!

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

205723696.name: Better in person
205723696.author: a TripAdvisor user
205723696.reviewBody: I had seen the Acapulco cliff divers on tv but it was quite different to see them in person. We got a nice table at La Perla in the late afternoon and the show commenced within ten minutes of our arrival. We ordered some margaritas and a nacho appetizer.  The drinks were not great and the nachos were also nothing to write home about, but the divers made up for whatever this restaurant is lacking.  I was amazed at the fact that some of the divers seem to be in their early teens.  The divers wait for the right moment when the tide recedes and then they plunge into the ocean. The width of the cove into which they dive seems very narrow which adds to the  drama of each dive.  I am not sure we will ever go back to Acapulco. It is an aged city now with a lot of crime but I am glad we got to see this attraction.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

199517842.name: A must see!
199517842.author: a TripAdvisor user
199517842.reviewBody: We went to the night show over spring break with our family and kids. We watched from the restaurant. We had a great table, right up front. We didn\'t eat there, so I can\'t speak about the food. The service was good.\nThe divers started off diving off a smaller cliff, into this small cove. They then climbed up the mountain on the other side to do the \'BIG\' jump. It was exciting and beautiful at night with all the lights. At the end of the show, as we walked out to the parking lot, the divers where outside to take pictures with the guests (for a small tip). The kids thought that was so cool! We all loved the first show so much, we stayed to watch the next show!

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

197418763.name: Great Location, cliff divers amazing, restaurant service horrible! !
197418763.author: a TripAdvisor user
197418763.reviewBody: Loved the views and the cliff divers.  Restaurant service, food and staff was horrible.  Was told they had three staff quit that night.  Waited for drinks, which never came..had to go to bar if you wanted even water...they ran out of pop...7 of us never recieved our food..dinneronly came after complaints were given 1-1/2 hours later...and food was cold.Cliff divers are amazingly brave and talented, next time I would opt out of dinner at La Perla.  Great history at this location, wish the owner of restaurant realized what a gem of a place and they would a step up the customer service. Don\'t waste your time or money eating at restaurant, but definitely go see the divers from the lookout only.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

194749593.name: Epic
194749593.author: a TripAdvisor user
194749593.reviewBody: We grew up watching them on TV - the cliff divers of Acapulco.  So it was the one "must do" when we arrived.  Skip dinner at the restaurant La Perla.  The food is rumored to be awful - and the place is pretty run down.  You then have two choices - pay $40 pesos ($3 USD) to stand on the pier, or for $150 pesos ($11 USD) you can have two drinks and sit on the terrace at La Perla and watch.  We opted for drinks and nice seating as the price was right.  We didn\'t regret it.  We loved the show!

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

194216512.name: Evening entertainment
194216512.author: a TripAdvisor user
194216512.reviewBody: We did not have dinner when we watched the cliff divers but still got to enjoy a great show. Roberto Alarcon suggested the evening show and it really was quite amazing. Watching the guys climb the rocks and then perform a variety of dives into a narrow channel is a little breath taking. This show was worth the couple of $ admission and we would go again.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

190645054.name: The Great Baldo Gomez
190645054.author: a TripAdvisor user
190645054.reviewBody: The only shining light was getting Baldo as our driver and guide.  If you do not hire Baldo to take you around ACA, you are missing out.  He knows everything and IS THE BEST.  We have never done anything like this but he was there at the airport to meet us and drove us to dinner every night with superb seating and excellant choices.  I cannot state how much we enjoyed Baldo, Jesus, and his staff.  They are reliable and very good at what they do.  Please do not miss out and give them a try when in ACA.  You will not be disappointed!  The Great Baldo saved the trip and made it a wonderful experience for our vacation!

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

188629948.name: Very entertaining!
188629948.author: a TripAdvisor user
188629948.reviewBody: We went to the 830 show and plenty people and music was to be had. Paid 40 pesos per adult to watch from the pier instead of eating gross la perle food, and it was totally worth the experience! Something I haven\'t seen in any of my travels.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

172743810.name: Very Entertaining
172743810.author: a TripAdvisor user
172743810.reviewBody: This was very entertaining. Not long or borning. Watching men jump off cliffs into the water. The water looked inviting.....I felt like jumping myself hahaha! I hear the night shows are best. We went to a night show and it was fun. I would recommend making this a must see while here.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

172717491.name: a must see while you are there
172717491.author: a TripAdvisor user
172717491.reviewBody: cliff divers are great , this trip comes as a package , evening meal at a cliff top location and watch the divers , meal is standard and nothing spectacular drinks are not included , you will be picked up from your hotel and taken to the location , I went at the evening showing , nice evening out ,

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

152909845.name: Dinners & Dives
152909845.author: a TripAdvisor user
152909845.reviewBody: This was the best way to see the cliff divers perform.  The night show was most impressive. The food was varied and delicious.  Very romantic setting and a good way to impress your sweetheart.  The entire outing was well worth the price.  Probably the highlight (or top three) of our trip.  A truly worldly and unique experience not to be missed.  Where else but in Acapulo! I would suggest trying the seafood appetizer if you want to give your palate a truly memorable experience as well.  DIVER DOWN!

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

My daughter ordered "Stuffed Shrimp". ....was stuffed with Cream Cheese, wrapped in Bacon.  Really?!  I thought it was disgusting.  Diner was not worth it, but the show was great & my wife liked the shopping here, so I sat at the bar and watched the divers for a 2nd show.

146592882.reviewBody: While it was fun and the dinner was good, we certainly could have seen more action. There were like 10 guys at most and each jumped 2 times over a 2 hour period. So pretty slow. I\'ve seen better jumping from higher cliffs. They did have a pretty small place to jump into though. The view was nice and the service was good. The food was good too. I had the Chicken Fajita and it was GREAT!

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

Then we were transported to watch the cliff divers from the balcony of another restaurant, where we had another drink.  When the divers are finished, they will have their picture taken with you ( give them a tip... they appreciate it!).  It was a very enjoyable trip.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

126574026.name: Unbelievable!
126574026.author: a TripAdvisor user
126574026.reviewBody: There are many positive sides to see this show at night. You can enjoy the show not paying for the dinner, just pay the entrance fee - 3USD. Come 30-40 min prior the show starts and take the best place. At 1 p.m its extrimly hot to stand there. Before the show you can see short histrorical introduction to this performance at the rock. They use film projector and sound effects. I liked it. These guys are brave and do amazing jumps. Buy some beer and chips at local supermarket to enjoy the show more. Have fun!

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

126070734.author: a TripAdvisor user
126070734.reviewBody: The divers are young & honestly, nuts! It was fun to watch and cheer. They are brave to jump. You have to be patient though. They do signal when they are ready to jump, so get your high-speed camera ready. We sat at La Perla restaurant with food & drink during the show. The other option is to pay to watch closer up (but in the hot sun and no where to sit) or go by boat

To see these cliff divers in person is truly remarkable and a amazing photo opportunity.  The skill and dare devilish jumps and dives are unlike anything I have ever seen.

The views from here are amazing too.

itemReviewed.name: High Cliff Divers by Night with Dinner

122603897.name: Young and old do not try this at home!
122603897.author: a TripAdvisor user
122603897.reviewBody:
Although we were not there for the dinner show we saw the divers from both the hotel and from the water. A very impressive display from both angles. I have wanted to see them since the Elvis movie came out.

I enjoyed the boat trip as you saw the multitude of large homes gracing the waterfront and hillside.

You spend quite a bit of time watching them scale the cliffs, stretching, praying and waiting for the right wave set which builds the anticipation, but it is amazing to watch the divers both young and old. The divers came on the boats and also through the viewing lobby after the dive for tips.  You could have your picture taken with them for a fee as well.

673824759.name: Great Lagoon
673824759.author: a TripAdvisor user
673824759.reviewBody: Had a nice tour of the lagoon. Saw numerous types of birds and fish. Very peaceful trip down the river and a small lagoon. Had a very large Mexican fish and chichen lunch. very good. Excellent tour.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto Entrada por restaurante Los Pavorreales

669168163.name: Authentic visit across a real Lagoon
669168163.author: a TripAdvisor user
669168163.reviewBody:
Nothing drives me crazier than visiting built o prefabricated places, therefore paddling or going on a boat through Tres Palos lagoon has been one of the most authentic, amazing, nurturing experiences in my life.
You can start the trip either in the famous Beto Godoy restaurant with local fishermen, who offer boat rides at low costs or getting a real experience from local boat riders in the lagoon.
They take you all the way East or West the lagoon to observe local fauna: blue crabs, snails, small alligators, shrimp, pelicans and other.
The lagoon is surrounded by forest habitat, which makes your trip worth visiting and highly enjoyable. The water has a light green color that turns aqua blue when you see it from the distance.
The flora you can see is simply spectacular: wild flowers, lotus flowers, and much more.
Highly recommendable, enjoyable and worth visiting experience!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto Entrada por restaurante Los Pavorreales

637504307.name: Nature Experience in a Major Resort
637504307.author: a TripAdvisor user
637504307.reviewBody: The most interesting thing to me is that you can have this huge unspoiled lagoon so close to this very developed resort. Makes for an interesting escape especially if you like birds which are plentiful.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto Entrada por restaurante Los Pavorreales

567111997.name: Amazing Lagoon Adventure
567111997.author: a TripAdvisor user
567111997.reviewBody: Our family rode upstream in a low riding canopy boat in what could easily pass for South American jungle. We eventually came upon a large beautiful lagoon filled with herons and flamingos. It was amazing watching the birds, some flying in formation barely above the water. We soon left the large lagoon and entered another series of waterways if we didn\'t have a guide we\'d never have found. Our last surprise was entering a smaller lagoon filled with lily pads and beautiful white flowers!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto Entrada por restaurante Los Pavorreales

548693589.name: Back to nature
548693589.author: a TripAdvisor user
548693589.reviewBody: A lovely boat trip through the mangrove swamp. With the tree canopy overhead it feels primeval. Hundreds of heron & other birds to watch. fun to see the local fishermen at work.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto Entrada por restaurante Los Pavorreales

547002288.name: Blue Lagoon
547002288.author: a TripAdvisor user
547002288.reviewBody: Excellent ride on the platoon boat, David/Irving (tour guides) will also have lunch prepared by the local family...which was mouth watering good!!  Everything is fresh, homemade!!  Must try the natural clay mask...

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto Entrada por restaurante Los Pavorreales

540284196.name: Unique and unforgettable
540284196.author: a TripAdvisor user
540284196.reviewBody: 1 hr ride to get there with great historical narrative by guide during trip.  Boat ride was incredible with loads of wildlife.  My lady got a mud facial from little home on the shore.  Pictures of all the famous people that use her facial product was interesting.  Went walking on a sandbar for ten mins to get refreshed and then back to turtle preserve for lunch and release of baby turtles \ud83d\udc22.  Felt good to get out of city for a day

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto Entrada por restaurante Los Pavorreales

478017697.name: A must do
478017697.author: a TripAdvisor user
478017697.reviewBody: Take a day out of your trip to leave the city/resort.  This tour will expose you to so much nature.  You get a great lunch, will go out for a nice long  ride on a pontoon boat to look for birds and other wildlife.  You will see mangroves, learn about lily pads, probably get a mineral rich mud mask.  \nThe tour will include a lot of other stops that I hope to write about on those attractions, such as releasing baby turtles and more.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto Entrada por restaurante Los Pavorreales

448121434.name: Laguna de Tres Palos
448121434.author: a TripAdvisor user
448121434.reviewBody: Spent a wonderful afternoon with Captain Felix and crew travelling through the mangroves, listening to so many varieties of birds.  Stopped for water lily necklaces and a mud facial.  Time to try our hand at net fishing. Enjoyed seeing this beautiful side of Mexico and Acapulco.  \n\nThis tour was set up for us by our guide Roberto (RobertoAlarconTours) and he accompanied us to help with translation.  He also set up the dinner on the beach following the tour.  An amazing day!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto Entrada por restaurante Los Pavorreales

389666734.name: Tres Palos Lagoon - Nature at its finest...
389666734.author: a TripAdvisor user
389666734.reviewBody: Just came back from a great visit to Tres Palos Lagoon.  I was challenged to find an activity that interested my 4 older kids who all like different activities (22, 21, 19 and 13).  We went out on a boat with our tour guide Roberto (robertoalarcontours) and 2 great local fisherman who provide tours and live on the lagoon.  I have never witnesed nature up close and at its finest like this.  We saw over a dozen variety of birds, the kids and I loved getting into the clay and enjoyed a full body mask and we ate at a wonderful restaurants sitting 50 feet from the ocean waves.  The restaurant was "Esmirna del Mar"  in Barra Vieja town (fisher mans villages) great red snapper fish cooked on the charcoal grill a la talla style or garlic style, hand make corn tortillas, salad, spanish rice, salsas, ,garlic shrimp, lobsters, and steaks or chicken cooked on the charcoal grill, all set-up your table under a typical caba\u00f1a on the beach in front of the ocean.  \n\nI still remember sitting around that table and seeing 5 happy faces (scored some big daddy and husband points!).

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto Entrada por restaurante Los Pavorreales

382031193.name: Birders, this is for you
382031193.author: a TripAdvisor user
382031193.reviewBody: Birds, birds, birds.  Unforgettable tour.  Got to try casting a fishing net and got a mud face mask.  Lagoon is fascinating.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto Entrada por restaurante Los Pavorreales

372468421.name: Lagoon bottom is interesting

372468421.reviewBody: We found safe boats to sail the lagoon at almost the end of the Barra Vieja road, right off the shore of the Restaurant "Godoy" and enjoyed a very pleasent tour where we were explained all about the lagoon, the birds island, etc. we collected some black mud from the bottom.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto Entrada por restaurante Los Pavorreales

371612495.author: a TripAdvisor user
371612495.reviewBody: Besides the boat ride on the lagoon, learning about turtles being an endangered species and how the people here are helping by saving the eggs from being destroyed and hatching the baby turtles to be released into the ocean in hopes of surviving and coming back to lay more eggs.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto Entrada por restaurante Los Pavorreales

363706230.reviewBody: Custom boat tour with the kids. Th kids got to clay on them, and lily pad flowers. Lots of birds. After we got a homemade lunch with fish caught that morning. Then the kids played soccer with the workers. Nic  attraction!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto Entrada por restaurante Los Pavorreales

Such humble and welcome family..We got to jump out of the boat and play around with the clay/mud.. Such great fun. We finished off with an amazing home cooked Mexican lunch which was the best meal I had on this holiday cooked by Felix\'s wife and daughter in law. \nGo with an open mind, relax and enjoy what may..

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto Entrada por restaurante Los Pavorreales

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto Entrada por restaurante Los Pavorreales

314419427.name: Water sports and eco tourism. Alternative accommodations with lagoon view.
314419427.author: a TripAdvisor user
314419427.reviewBody: This place is ideal to practice water skying in all modes. Jungle trips or tours by kayak or larger boats are available in the area. Less expensive accommodations can be found around Laguna de Tres Palos, staying close to Puerto Marques, Punta Diamante, and 30 min away from the Acapulco costera.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto Entrada por restaurante Los Pavorreales

222808149.name: Mangroves, water lilies, sea birds, nature...
222808149.author: a TripAdvisor user
222808149.reviewBody: One of the nicest nature tour in Acapulco. Water taxi took us on the "jungle tour" weaving through the waterway seeing a lot of nice sea birds sitting patiently to prey on the fish (I suppose) and fishermen competing with them by casting nets all over the place, causing a bit of inconvenience as the boat needed to lift the motor/propeller each time we crossed the net in order to avoid damaging it. The whole area is surrounded by mangrove trees and a number of trees are infested with termites that built their nests on the branches. We got to this huge area full of water lilies or lotus flowers, the boat operator picked out a flower and with the long stem she managed to make a necklace out of it.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto Entrada por restaurante Los Pavorreales

192959798.name: La Laguna Trip
192959798.author: a TripAdvisor user
192959798.reviewBody: We had an hour boat ride around the lagoon.  It is a wonderful scenic place, with many birds to see  Part of the tour was lunch in a nice restaurant, a swim in the pool and time to relax on the beach.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto Entrada por restaurante Los Pavorreales

189804375.name: Relaxing and fun day
189804375.author: a TripAdvisor user
189804375.reviewBody:
Great chance to enjoy nature. Birds, flowers gorgeous scenery and a relaxing boat tour. Our guide Baldo Gomez took us there and then ate the fresh fish caught and cooked on site. 
Three cheers for Baldo. We email him to pick us up at the airport and enjoy his van and knowledge when we are ready to move from the pool and the beach. Reliable and caring.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto Entrada por restaurante Los Pavorreales

139191065.name: Gorgeous!
139191065.author: a TripAdvisor user
139191065.reviewBody: This is a huge lagoon.  We were told it is 4 times the size of Acapulco Bay.  It is a bird sanctuary and one of the most peaceful places on earth.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto Entrada por restaurante Los Pavorreales

134944579.name: Swimming in Tres Palos
134944579.author: a TripAdvisor user
134944579.reviewBody: The entire lagoon Tres Palos has no beaches. Too shallow to swim, muddy.\nBut, constructing a beach would be possible, with dredging and pouring a few truckloads of sand and rocks. Tom Simunovic, Niagara Falls

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto Entrada por restaurante Los Pavorreales

130428140.name: Acapulco\'s Amazon
130428140.author: a TripAdvisor user
130428140.reviewBody: When you want to get away from the huslte and bustle of the city come to this spot. Your worries drift away as you take a boat ride through the laguna. All is peacefull as you travel along calm waters where you can see locals fishing and wildlife in their habitat. \n\nYou feel like you are in the Amazon while you are only a short drive away from the airport and the city.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto Entrada por restaurante Los Pavorreales

128186964.name: Despite security concerns we felt safe . . .  and the trip was excellent!
128186964.author: a TripAdvisor user
128186964.reviewBody: Thanks to our friend and driver, Max Salinas, we made our way to laguna de Tres Palos for a trip on the lagoon. It was one of the most relaxing days ever, and the beauty of this place, the opportunities for photography, and the delightful meal after was well worth it. Rest. Los Bou Bous prepared a wonderful meal and we ate heartily!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto Entrada por restaurante Los Pavorreales

126070772.name: Bird watching & people watching
126070772.author: a TripAdvisor user
126070772.reviewBody: And bargaining for your fish! The local fisherman will sell you his catch for an amazing deal (in Pesos of course). If you have access to a kitchen & prefer to cook it yourself - do it! Fresh caught fish, take it to the nearby restaurant for a few pesos & they\'ll clean it & ice it for you to take back to your hotel to fry up!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto Entrada por restaurante Los Pavorreales

125156212.name: a great Lagoon tour and fantastic lunch at Los Bou Bous courtesy of Baldo Gomez
125156212.author: a TripAdvisor user
125156212.reviewBody:
Baldo does it again!!! 
on our last day in Acapulco, Baldo suggested that we go to the lagoon and have lunch at this fantastic place called los Bou Bous. This restaurant they take your order, you select a fresh swimming fish, and they cook it for you two different ways (chili and garlic). While they are cooking your food, you jump on a pontoon boat and go with Felix to tour the lagoon and the many narrow passage ways.. this slow tour to look at the birds (flamingos, cranes, storks, grey herrons, tri colored herron, and many more) was extremely relaxing.. And the perfect way to end the day is to go to Los Bou Bous to have an amazing fish and shrimp dinner. Felix's wife cooked amazing fish, and then a dozen shrimp couked a couple of ways.. On top of that we have the best Sopas i have ever eaten.. 

And once again,. Baldo has shown us the the hidden treasures of Acapulco. Los Bou Bous is definately a hidden treasure.. Thank you Baldo (baldo-work@hotmail.com) for the crowning local experience of our trip!.. and the week was hard to top! from diving with Las Mantarayas, a city tour with super secret locations to get all important panorama shot of Acapulco, more diving and snorkeling, to fantastic meals at local restaurants and not to be missed tourist attractions.. Thank you for a memorable day Baldo..

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto Entrada por restaurante Los Pavorreales

124118967.name: A very worthwhile day trip, especially for bird watchers
124118967.author: a TripAdvisor user
124118967.reviewBody: My wife and I spent several hours on a pontoon boat with local guide maneuvering around this unique lagoon outside of Acapulco. We saw numerous flamingos, flocks of pelicans, some beautiful huge storks, hundreds of herons and egrets, eagles, hawks, kingfishers, and many more varieties of birds. We then had lunch at the pontoon guide\'s family restaurant on the shoreline. Very rustic, but also very delicious seafood right from the lagoon. We were driven on this daytrip by a great local tour guide named BALDO GOMEZ. Very experienced guide with great English skills. Would highly recommend. His email address is baldo-work@hotmail.com. He is a trustworthy guide with a wealth of local knowledge.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto Entrada por restaurante Los Pavorreales

14819395.name: A great way to spend an afternoon.
14819395.author: a TripAdvisor user
14819395.reviewBody:
My experience was February 17th 2008 & we made prior arrangements with Sabastian Hernandez a professional guide to show us the sites for the day.
 
  The Lagoon tour was 10.00 USD per person & lasted about 90 minutes.  The wildlife was extremely abundant with many different species of birds & a very ample supply of fish. Our Guide was very knowledgable in the identification of the birds that inhabit this Lagoon as well as all the beautiful flowers & greenery that grows in this area.
 
  The boat tour launches from where the restaurant Beto Gadoy is located in Barra Vieja. After returning from our excursion we headed over to Esmirna Del Mar for lunch & to enjoy the rest of the day swimming & relaxing.

 We ordered Red Snapper Ala Talla which was out of this world along with some other appetizers & drinks for the rest of the afternoon. This location is a very nice little gem in Barra Vieja & my family & I enjoyed the day very much & highly recommend a day spent in this quiet section.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto Entrada por restaurante Los Pavorreales

6648329.name: Wonderful for bird-watching
6648329.author: a TripAdvisor user
6648329.reviewBody:
In Jan. 2007, we went on a boat tour of the Tres Palos lagoon to birdwatch. To arrange the tour, we basically just hopped in a cab at our hotel and told the driver what we wanted. The driver said it was no problem. He took us to a restaurant beside the lagoon. A couple of phone calls were made, and within a few minutes, a boat arrived.

The lagoon tour was outstanding. There are beautiful water lilies and uninhabited islands, and we went silently through areas of mangrove swamp to sneak up on the birds. We saw so many birds—water birds like egrets and herons, many different types of ducks, wild flamingos, and gorgeous kingfishers. Our guide, Guillermo, knew the names of all the birds in both English and Spanish. We also watched local people fishing and catching crabs in the lagoon. The tour was U.S. $45, and we really enjoyed it. 

After the boat tour, we disembarked at La Isla del Chaneque, the palapa restaurant. It’s in a lovely location right on the water. Lunch was cheese and shark quesadillas, a huge plate of guacamole and chips, 2 waters, and 2 Pepsi Light—all for only 104 pesos. We enjoyed our afternoon at Tres Palos very much.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto Entrada por restaurante Los Pavorreales

666520734.name: Everything in my his great avenue !
666520734.author: a TripAdvisor user
666520734.reviewBody: Runners, families, vendors, great weather, gun for all ages, Starbucks , ice cream, tacos, carraiagea with horses decorated with lights great public transportation with air conditioning \nJust walk and enjoy \n

664507736.name: Good beach strip
664507736.author: a TripAdvisor user
664507736.reviewBody: The Costera is the beach strip around Acapulco harbour. Here you will find all your main hotels, bars, restaurants, nightclubs, casinos, malls, stores - it is a hive of activity. The beach is okay though it is very crowded, especially weekends. The hotels all have pools as you would expect. \nYou can have a very long walk through the Costera in complete safety with no hassle from vendors - there is though a very large militaristic police presence here, but we did not feel unsafe. A good place to walk around.

648140908.name: Safety in Acapulco
648140908.author: a TripAdvisor user
648140908.reviewBody: Just a few quick points about safety.  They way my friends and news media spoke I thought I would be dodging bullets in Acapulco.  The only thing my wife and I were dodging were joggers and families with baby strollers.  This was always around 8 or 9 pm.  We walked an hour every night, on the main streets of course, and not once did we feel unsafe.  Anything could happen anywhere, Jane and Finch in Toronto, or in the streets of Chicago and Detroit.  The Canadian and US governments should put out an advisory in their own back yards because we\u2019ve had gang violence in our streets as well.  Now we know first hand that we would go back and just watch out for the joggers and strollers.

617414981.name: Vacations
617414981.author: a TripAdvisor user
617414981.reviewBody: Very nice to walk by the beach and see the old Acapulco and see how they caught the oyster and fish to take it straight to the table and cooked 4 u .Many bars , restaurants and clubs .

613606037.name: Beautiful View
613606037.author: a TripAdvisor user
613606037.reviewBody: This coast is beautiful & has many options of things to do. One can swim in pools or swim in the ocean if you wish.

599618523.name: Nice breach day
599618523.author: a TripAdvisor user
599618523.reviewBody: There is a nice open beach and there is a lot of people asking to do q massage or a tattoo so we rent an umbrella with a kid and he brought beer and snacks we also got some souvenirs while we were there.\n

559253700.name: A busy avenue but offers everything for everyone
559253700.author: a TripAdvisor user
559253700.reviewBody: The Costera is the main drag in Acapulco it has restaurants for all budgets, boutiques, outside vendors, the best Ice-cream (Michoacan) and more

558704315.name: The place to walk
558704315.author: a TripAdvisor user
558704315.reviewBody: Costera is the heart of tourist area of Acapulcoo. It follows the shoreline and its lined with hotels, restaurants, shops, service outfits, etc. One can walk on it and go back along the endless beach. Taxis, buses and "collectivos" ply along it every few seconds.

557234692.name: Perfect for the single tourists or couples
557234692.author: a TripAdvisor user
557234692.reviewBody:
The Costera is a nice place to stroll stopping for margaritas and happy hours .There are  restaurants,  bars and the sound of music . It's not elegant nor uptown , but makes  for a pleasant day or evening stop. You can find decent food . Happy hour drinks are usually 
A bit watered down . It's still good when you are alone or with your loved one . If you want elegance head up the hill to Las Brisas where there are gorgeous restaurants 
And delicious food. The Costera  has some good hotel bars. Not great shopping. . Acapulco  nights start later 10  PM and later . Tourists  usually go from 7 on . Weekends will fill up with Mexicans from Mexico City a 5 -6 hour drive . Never go on Easter Holidays it's crowded 
I would not recommend  Acapulco,for tourists at this time since the USA embassy has travel warnings . its better to go to Cancun, Mayan Riveria, Ziahuatanejo Puerto,Vallarta now . Things change so google the American Embassy travel warnings . It's a very good source. Mexico is fantastic .

552805252.name: New Year\u2019s celebration in Acapulco
552805252.author: a TripAdvisor user
552805252.reviewBody: Acapulco has always been a favorite place of my family to spend the end of the year. The place is normally very busy and at times not very clean. I was pleased to see that this year was not crowded yet a lot of people and cars. I would love to see a tram or a monorail going along the boardwalk, it would improve the transit and could become an attraction like the ones in Orlando, Florida. Some of my favorite beaches are Condesa, Francia and Icacos, I would like to see better bathrooms and showers working properly, even if I have to pay money. These beaches are great to swim and do water sports. The fireworks show at New Year\u2019s Eve is good but it could be more organized and synchronized!

551714896.name: Lively place
551714896.author: a TripAdvisor user
551714896.reviewBody: Very busy street. Crowded to walk after 5pm. But it has a lot of shops , mimi supermarkets, a couple of malls and several restaurants of different price range. Be careful with manholes, some may he open!

551626781.name: December Vacation 2017
551626781.author: a TripAdvisor user
551626781.reviewBody: This is the beautiful Bsay of Acapulco beach.  It is clean, the water is warm.  There were not strong currents like in other tourist cities in Mexico on the Pacific Ocean.  The water water was warm and quite enjoyable during the month of December.  This is also a nice beach to stroll in the evening to watch the sunset.

550597415.name: Main street
550597415.author: a TripAdvisor user
550597415.reviewBody: If you are visiting Acapulco you must see this street. It is located along the ocean coast...it has variety of night clubs, restaurants, bars and stores and of course street vendors. The only downside of it - it is very busy... the car traffic is enormous...

540178721.name: Five days in Acapulco
540178721.author: a TripAdvisor user
540178721.reviewBody: The Costera has a lot of nice hotels for a very low price compared to other beach resorts.  My husband daughter and I loved the bars and restaurants on the strip.  Took a lighted horse carriage ride for 200 pesos plus tip.

534614361.name: beautiful view
534614361.author: a TripAdvisor user
534614361.reviewBody: \nwhen you have the green fields and mountains behind you and the sea in front of you , this is simply Costera

518191914.name: Beautiful views!
518191914.author: a TripAdvisor user
518191914.reviewBody: My boyfriend and I walked along the coast for about an hour and got to see amazing views from the beach. Definitely recommend going earlier in the morning with less people around. Be ready to be approached by beach vendors ever few minutes trying to sell you food and souvenirs . Umbrellas and plastic chairs are all along the beach which you can pay to sit at.

505647663.name: Overpopulated
505647663.author: a TripAdvisor user
505647663.reviewBody:
Every inch of the beach has tables and chairs to rent.  You have to walk in the water as no sand is left. Ridiculous!

People were selling food on trays in the heat and humidity. I can't imagine buying prawns. A good case of dysentery! Disgusting. Even the restaurants looked dirty. No way is eat there.
There was nowhere to wash the sand off our feet. It was black and stuck to our feet. 
Very disappointed in this so called tourist spot.

503720186.name: Tour boat
503720186.author: a TripAdvisor user
503720186.reviewBody: Well at the Grand Mayan in Acapulco Mexico it was suggested by our tour guide Baldo Gomez to take the boat tour around the island of Acapulco it was beautiful you must see the different coastlines for all three sides it is so pretty in you do this in the evening about 4:30 it is spectacular

493031614.name: One of the most amazing bays ..feels abandoned
493031614.author: a TripAdvisor user
493031614.reviewBody: We walked on a Monday at 11 am along the costa de oro, my wife and Baby and we where amazed to see we where the only tourist around. Acapulco feels very abandoned... last time i was there i was nearly a teenaber and remember the destination being full of life... not this time.. old buildings, left out bars and restaurants, garbage in a lot of places... a little heart broken form this experience...

491315761.name: A little bit for everybody
491315761.author: a TripAdvisor user
491315761.reviewBody: This avenue coming from caleta beach a little bit different  place. then you will see\nLots of hotels, all kind of businesses, restaurants and much more when crossing downtown (stop there for a little time walk there fell the town ) and continues in to this very interesting when the traffic allows .\n

471770671.name: Fantastic walk, But watch your step
471770671.author: a TripAdvisor user
471770671.reviewBody: The Costera is a vibrant avenue filled with restaurants, hotels night clubs. It is a great walk both night and day. Totally safe and alive. Be careful walking because there are many holes in the sidewalk and the street. I almost walked into an uncovered manhole that was being worked on but NO safety fence around it or anything!  It could have been very bad .

471490644.name: Everything That You Are Looking For Is On The Costera
471490644.author: a TripAdvisor user
471490644.reviewBody: We were here in April 2016 and now it is March 2017 and we are back in beautiful Acapulco. We can\'t believe how much has changed on the famous Costera! Starting at the Naval base near Walmart where you enter the Costera , the City has done a major overhaul of the Costera! They have added many new trees, shrubs, lights, pedestrian crosswalks, sidewalks, new grass, sculptures a new monument and more! In front of the Convention Center they also added a new pedestrian crosswalk that is wheelchair accessible and it is so much easier to cross the Costera! Our favourite addition is the new Monument that they just finished put up in the last week of March and it is located next to Commercial Mexican in Costa Azul area. This Monument stands very tall and in the night time it is beautifully lit up with many lights that keep changing colour! They also planted new trees and shrubs here and they also have lights shining on them. You can see that the locals are very proud of this new Monument  because they are taking lots of photos and videos of this new site and everyone likes the new benches that were installed here as well. As we continue down the Costera we also noticed that there are new Oxxo\'s, bars, restaurants, stores, souvenir shops and more new additionsalong the way. The Costera in La Diana area is the place to be if you like none stop action, bars, clubs, restaurants, movie theaters, shopping malls and people watching! Whatever you need or like, you will find it on the Costera, not to mention that the beach is just a stone throw away and you can take in the beautiful sunset from anywhere on the beach!

470192406.name: Visited Costera today
470192406.author: a TripAdvisor user
470192406.reviewBody: We told our taxi driver that we wanted to do some shopping and have lunch. We ended up being taken to a mall across from the Ritz. We took in the sights, the kids played in an arcade, then we wanted to have lunch. We tried eating at the restaurant in the Ritz, only to learn that it was all inclusive and we couldn\'t eat there. We strolled further to Bocano Beach Papagayo. We enjoyed our meal, the atmosphere was pretty loud. We saw the beach, and got a taste for the flavor of the area. I\'m glad we went.

469754713.name: Precioso paseo en Acapulco
469754713.author: a TripAdvisor user
469754713.reviewBody: Amazing place to walk during the evening full of life clubs and beautiful places to eat and enjoy, don\'t show off to much blend in and you will have an amazing time !!!

469163681.name: painful
469163681.author: a TripAdvisor user
469163681.reviewBody: the waves are rough, though small, and the sand is coarse. I would recommend going much, much farther away for less crowded, nicer beaches by the airport or in diamante.

465115740.name: Amazing views!
465115740.author: a TripAdvisor user
465115740.reviewBody: There is so much to do! If you can, take an afternoon/night and just walk down La Costera. There are so many restaurants, shopping, and things to do. An amazing experience.

459717136.name: a magic place
459717136.author: a TripAdvisor user
459717136.reviewBody: Best seen from a suite from the hotel play suites in the middle of the bay. Fantastic view of the whole bay

458297995.name: Vacation January 24-312017
458297995.author: a TripAdvisor user
458297995.reviewBody: I stayed with a friend in her condo from January 24-31  I enjoyed Acapulco very much you can walk just about every where and if you want you can take the bus for 95 pesos the weather is beautiful always hot and not a cloud in the sky\'s there are so many restaurants and bars you have a great choice the beach is assessable from just about every street corner if you like hussle and bussel and if your looking for a great time you should visit Acapulco at least once !

457708861.name: Love Love Acapulco the best hotel and service on the water is the RIZTsI stayed at 3 different hotels so far
457708861.author: a TripAdvisor user
457708861.reviewBody: Mexicans are the most friendly people I have met.  Food is excellent and yes you have to be able to say NO to many vendors but it is still my no, 1 destination and I have travelled all over the world.

453622945.name: Nice Drive To Town
453622945.author: a TripAdvisor user
453622945.reviewBody: If you have run out of something to do or just want to take a drive this is as good as any.  Why take a tour when you can hire a cab for 70 pesos to take you to "old town" walk about and then return.  It\'s cheap-take time to tour the marina.

453085598.name: Noisy with heavy traffic.
453085598.author: a TripAdvisor user
453085598.reviewBody: If you can avoid coster while in Acapulco do! As it offers access to all stores, restaurants and night clubs it also is very noisy, full of street vendors and heavy traffic all the time.

439637574.name: One of my best vacations
439637574.author: a TripAdvisor user
439637574.reviewBody: My trip to Acapulco was really amazing. We came back after 10 years and everything was incredible and affordable, rich of flavor and the services really good. I truly recommend this place.

436466184.name: Vacation
436466184.author: a TripAdvisor user
436466184.reviewBody: Take a taxi along the costera beautiful views it\'s a Highway that runs through the heart of Acapulco and takes you all the way into town and further

436396854.name: stunning by night and day
436396854.author: a TripAdvisor user
436396854.reviewBody: Just spend two weeks there and the sun shone every day and the attractions, food and sights were great. The locals were helpful at every turn and nothing to much effort.Long way from Australia to have a holiday but it was certainly worth the 3 plane trips to get to Acapulco

435998830.name: Bay Area is up!
435998830.author: a TripAdvisor user
435998830.reviewBody: Multiple hotel accommodations are found along La Costera avenue. The Bay Area is perfect for jet skis, boat parachute, sun bathing, and swimming. Average prices, not luxury but worth it due to proximity to clubs and restaurants. More friendly and relaxed atmosphere during the day. Fruit/coconuts vendors are numerous, contrary to punta diamante where you can rather ride horses and four wheelers. La Costera is a long street for healthy walking and 3 malls are located there as well.

433667950.name: Beautiful Bay
433667950.author: a TripAdvisor user
433667950.reviewBody: I love Acapulco and it\'s bay.  We took our last trip there this past June 2016 and we felt safe where ever we went.  I know there are some challenges that are going on in this area but they did not affect us.  We are fortunate we have family in Acapulco and spend a lot of time with them also.

431644784.name: A classic drive
431644784.author: a TripAdvisor user
431644784.reviewBody: Costera is the road that goes along the sea and around Acapulco. It\'s where all the large hotels, restaurants, and businesses are located in Acapulco. It is usually crowded and full of life and unless you just go to your hotel, close and lock the door you will have to drive through it to get anywhere around town.

425377084.name: Completely full of vendors
425377084.author: a TripAdvisor user
425377084.reviewBody:
The "Costera" has been always known by its commercial facet, but now the last time I visited this place, is full of people trying to sale you something: coconut oil, temporary tattoos, food, touristic services and even massages!!!

I understand that the people needs earn money and they do what they can, but is annoying saying NO all the  time they approach several times.

In the other hand, there are many options of food, entertainment and stores where you can find whatever you want, specially souvenirs; if you want a advise, don't pay the price the ask you the first time, always try to negotiate.

424544551.name: Number one Avenue
424544551.author: a TripAdvisor user
424544551.reviewBody: This is the main Avenue of Acapulco where most of the popular hotels and restaurants are located. Travelers use the disco and a/c buses to travel from Walmart to Caleta beach from this Avenue.

408965355.name: improvements made
408965355.author: a TripAdvisor user
408965355.reviewBody: When Starbucks opens a cafe every third block, you know that better restaurants will follow. Carmenere, Bento, Pescao and Suntory REstaurants  are all excellent and within blocks of each other.

403037822.name: Love the energy
403037822.author: a TripAdvisor user
403037822.reviewBody: All kind of activities day and night, very crowded, all type of food, street food stands selling traditional dishes. I loved the Costera. It is also very protected by Police and Army

400009908.name: Fun at la Costera
400009908.author: a TripAdvisor user
400009908.reviewBody: If you enjoy the beach and like the water activities here you will find that. You can just have fun on the beach or rent a jet skie, banana, parachute, or boat. All kinds of vendors for all the your needs, like the delicious mango with lemon and fruit chili powder. I hope you find this review helpful and just enjoy la Costera at the beautiful Acapulco Bay

391339135.name: Nice beach
391339135.author: a TripAdvisor user
391339135.reviewBody: This a very nice beach. It\'s a public beach and don\'t have to pay to get in unless you want table and chairs. This is a good place for seafood. There are many restaurants along the beach to choose from.

388898860.name: Great fishing for kids
388898860.author: a TripAdvisor user
388898860.reviewBody: This place is a good place to take your family and to fish in the evening, and experience the culture but one problem was that there needs to be a fence to keep kids from falling into the water .

374967755.name: It\'s still the Costera!
374967755.author: a TripAdvisor user
374967755.reviewBody: I have been to Acapulco five times, beginning when I was a kid in the late 1970s. Yes, the Costera has changed. There are many more people, many more shops and the 1970s glamour is gone. Also you will see military guys driving around keeping the area safe from narcos. But I felt like it was still my old Costera with plenty of places to eat and drink, huge hotels and, of course, the gorgeous beaches alongside. I am a middle aged US woman and, despite all the warnings, have not felt a bit threatened.

373361948.name: Vacations
373361948.author: a TripAdvisor user
373361948.reviewBody: During my visit a lot of soldiers a long the Costera; I did not listened or saw anything strange but the soldiers were there... I was not very happy to see them all around

363355408.name: Over(crowded, rated, selling)
363355408.author: a TripAdvisor user
363355408.reviewBody:
Let me first of all say that I am originally from the Caribbean Island of Saint Lucia, so I know the beach scene.
- The sand was coarse and basically left my feet blistered
- The beach was overcrowded with locals selling their wares
- Im okay with selling but being CONSTANTLY bothered and bombarded with people asking you to buy things (and they were consistant...they would PESTER you if you did not buy the stuff)
- The food was WAYYYY expensive

Overall a NO NO!!!

362586403.name: Beautiful, but crowded and busy.
362586403.author: a TripAdvisor user
362586403.reviewBody: I stay at a resort outside of downtown largely because the beautiful beach is much more beautiful (to me) when it is not full of people, noise, vendors hawking goods, etc. Great if you like crowds. Otherwise, not so much.

362584908.name: Everything You Need Is On The Costera
362584908.author: a TripAdvisor user
362584908.reviewBody: The Costera is the main drag of Acapulco and it has everything that you may need! It is loaded with Restaurants, Bars, Discos, Supermarkets,  Variety stores, a hug Walmart, McDonalds, Star Bucks and so much more! It is a great street for early morning walks and in the evenings when all the lights are on because it is so pretty. This is a very safe place to be and there are always people walking and standing around, especially on the weekends. The beautiful Acapulco Bay awaits for you just off the Costera!

361182508.name: Acapulco Bay
361182508.author: a TripAdvisor user
361182508.reviewBody: Too many people on beach drinking, throwing garbage on beach, stranded wild dogs, drunks, people using drugs and not safe.  Had condo there for 20 yrs right in the centre beside CCpark "Torre Coral"just sold it and went to sty ay BanyanTree and WOW would rather stay there ten Costera.

356413014.name: Like this part of bay the best
356413014.author: a TripAdvisor user
356413014.reviewBody: Lots of umbrella and chairs. Food and drinks brought to you or you can set in one of the number of restaurants on beach. Jet skiing, parachuting, nice part of the bay to walk the beach. Weekends it gets busy here with the Mexico City people. Lots of vendors selling goods, fresh sea food. Ocean drops off fast here but that is ok for most

355110326.name: The Best of Acapulco;  Your 2 feet and the Costera = unlimited possibilities!
355110326.author: a TripAdvisor user
355110326.reviewBody: There is so much to say about the Costera. It\'s the main thoroughfare through the heart of Acapulco. Your 2 feet and the Costera = unlimited possibilities. From the awesome sprawling beach to flea market like settings where you barter for what ever they are selling to fantastic restaurants and bars. Its awesome. If you like people then this is the place for you.  The banks are very secure as we only use banks ATM\'s for our cash resource. The have some of best rates but again you can find that it varies from one institution to another. The streets begin to hustle by 8am, hear birds singing, actually lots of birds. you\'ll see people headed to work, lots of joggers and walkers. By evening you begin to see more families out for the night especially on the weekend. I\'d recommend that you find an awesome place like (El Fogon) we you can set and watch life go walking by as you eat some authentic food, have a beer or margarita and just enjoy! It\'s truly so wonderful to see while your eating watch themed dawned carriages (Frozen, Micky Mouse, etc) go  by drawn by clip clopping horses. As the sun set it takes on yet another vibe. You can tell that this is the place where it all happens. The same carriages now twinkle with led lights illuminating them, you can see the excitement in children\'s eyes. Is so cool. I have seen things about safety, and YES WE FELT SAFE ALL THE TIME. It was never a concern. Coming from the United States you might be surprised to see Police walking & riding around with guns in their hands. By your safe. Typically in Mexico this is normal as we have traveled extensively in Mexico.I say go enjoy yourself, relax, take in the sights and enjoy. Be smart in the same ways that you would visit any major city in the USA.

353937465.name: the Land of excitement
353937465.author: a TripAdvisor user
353937465.reviewBody: The hotel is on Costera Blvd in the heart of all that is happening.within 3 blocks are the most noisiest and fun night clubs. Starbucks is right next door. The military has a real presence. 3 guards stayed infront of the hotel at all times.OXXO (like 7-11) is directly across the street. Soriana\'s, a grocery store , is a 50 peso cab ride and Walmart maybe 100 pesos. and, if you are a walker you can walk to Soriana\'s but you may need a cab to carry your stuff back. I enjoyed the area. I like being in the middle of action.

351328628.name: Always beautiful!!!
351328628.author: a TripAdvisor user
