351328628.reviewBody: I have been going back for over 30 years.  The Bay has been etched in my mind since my first visit!!!\nIt\'s a shame that Acapulco has gotten bad safety reviews. So sad to see that the tourism that they thrive on has diminished over the years. Personally, I feel TOTALLY safe!!

347345278.name: If you enjoy walking
347345278.author: a TripAdvisor user
347345278.reviewBody: This is my favorite part of Acapulco.  I really enjoy walking in the business district and shopping the stores and the flea markets.   The vendors are always friendly and bartering is a must.   The price is usually about half of the initial asking price.  I also enjoy stopping at the farmacias for cold beverages.   One not of caution, daylight is best and you are well advised to stay in the tourist areas and not stay too long after 9 pm

346417221.name: Nice beach.
346417221.author: a TripAdvisor user
346417221.reviewBody: Whilst staying in acapulco this is the local area to the hotel. The beach is very clean and offers water sports such as parasailing and jet skiing. The prices are very cheap when converted from pesos back to pound sterling. There are numerous beach vendors trying to sell sunglasses hats etc and trying to make a living. The beach vendors are very nice, they understand no and do not try to hassle you. The only reason I have not given a 5 is because at the moment it is  still a little lost in time. When tourism strikes hard again this place will be a little gem.

343688853.name: Loved walking the Costera
343688853.author: a TripAdvisor user
343688853.reviewBody: Enjoyed the experience of being out on the Costera mornings and evenings Walked the Costera in the mornings before 8am. Lots of joggers out before the sun starts to come out. By 8am the sun is shining and glaring in your eyes. By this time the store workers are hosing down the sidewalks in front of their area shops. Their are lots of hotels, restaurants, shops, flea markets and clubs to explore. Evenings are great to walk on the Costera. Enjoyed the atmosphere. So much action going on. People standing on the sidewalk waiting for the next person at the bungee jump attraction to be dropped down hanging by their feet screaming. Passing by the open air bars with girls dancing on a platform out front enticing you to come in. Watching the disco buses whisk by with their colorful neon lights and music blaring, Always enjoyable watching the Calandrias decorated with colorful lights(Cinderella coaches pulled by a horse) trotting down the Costera. It was even more fun taking a ride in them.

341049174.name: Long, good walking, and safe
341049174.author: a TripAdvisor user
341049174.reviewBody: Don\'t believe everything you read in the US newspapers.  Acapulco is safe in the tourist areas.  And the food is delicious.  With good prices in hotels and food.  Take advantage of the yellow journalism.  It is a bit hot, 85F if your trying to get away from the cold.

339537293.name: Paradise at affordable price
339537293.author: a TripAdvisor user
339537293.reviewBody: Nice and spacious beach. There are not many people in October and the beach is almost desert (compared to Miami beach). Like all around the Acapulco coast you can bathe 24 hours a day - there are floodlights shine all night.\nPlenty of restaurants won\'t let you get hungry.

338969686.name: Enjoy the walk
338969686.author: a TripAdvisor user
338969686.reviewBody: Great to walk at night, to see some locals having an enjoyable evening. Many restaurants, bars and market.

338794191.name: Top ten in the world
338794191.author: a TripAdvisor user
338794191.reviewBody: Acapulco is one of the best kept secret in Mexico. The costera is the king pin of that secret. 25 km. of fine blond sand without rocks or weeds, the waves brake at 100 meters from the beech so that your kids are safe to play on it. It is mostly condos that are unoccupied most of the time so that there is no traffic. Worth the trip

338283738.name: Fun
338283738.author: a TripAdvisor user
338283738.reviewBody: The main street in downtown Acapulco. Many restaurants and bars.. Markets and shopping. Good for walking at night.

337809525.name: One of Acapulco\'s main attractions
337809525.author: a TripAdvisor user
337809525.reviewBody: La costera is a nice attraction in Acapulco. It is the Main Street of one part of Acapulco with lots of hotels, shops, restaurants, golf courses and many other attractions.

337515365.name: Nice Place Nice view
337515365.author: a TripAdvisor user
337515365.reviewBody: Is good place to know, the beach is big and the weather is hot. Food around is not good and expensive is better try to investigate reviews before surprises.

336003120.name: Needs a lot of control traffic!!!
336003120.author: a TripAdvisor user
336003120.reviewBody: The view is good, a lot of restaurants, convenient stores, night clubs, hotels, etc. You can make a good deal with the guys give up flyers or coupons for a good dinner or entertainment; if you rent a car be ready for a crazy bus drivers or slow traffic. Everybody parks on a yellow line or double line and nobody cares about others so I recommend to pay for coastline bus or regular bus (very cheap) to translate place to place.  Calandrias or Cinderella cars are good experience.

333372381.name: Beautiful Bay, Lovely to Look At, I wouldn\'t swim in it!
333372381.author: a TripAdvisor user
333372381.reviewBody: Have been visiting this beach for 30 years, but never seen so much raw sewage pouring into the bay from various small creeks and overflowing sewer covers.  The smell alone will keep you out of the water, not to mention the scum on the surface.  Such a beautiful spot...why can\'t the city see the need to care for it?

332043939.name: Tourist walking dream
332043939.author: a TripAdvisor user
332043939.reviewBody: Walking the Costera is always fun; especially for tourists!  So many restaurants and shops and the weather is ALWAYS wonderful!  The people are friendly too.  You should try to find a little restaurant instead of one of the big ones for a more traditional experience.

322741078.name: Enjoyed scenic drive
322741078.author: a TripAdvisor user
322741078.reviewBody: The bay is spectacular and a scenic drive from end to end is well worthwhile. Views are great as is peering at the fine homes on the hillsides. Recommended

322684787.name: Cheap and hot
322684787.author: a TripAdvisor user
322684787.reviewBody: I have been to Costera about four or five times,  for work commitments and once because our group had booked a fraudulent , non-existant apartment on the other side of Acapulco and we had to find something instead quick.\nCostera in Acapulco is warm and it "feels" like holiday for somebody that comes from northern hemisphere.  As you walk along the main avenue, you will find a lot of places of very cheap margaritas and beers. This is also a place were you will find many average, non-descript hotels an empty Starbucks, and dolphin show - all along the main avenue.  But long are gone the days of glory and glamour of Acapulco, especially Costera, instead it is a destination for lower middle-class Mexican families, and by family I mean: the aunt, the cousin, his friend and friends girlfriend, plus grandparents and newborns all together. Because of all the recent beheadings and violent fights between police and "narcos" in Acapulco state, you will probably get a very economic price for a hotel and most of them are OK. There are nice areas close by so it is not all doomed.

320722019.name: Everything at a glance!!!
320722019.author: a TripAdvisor user
320722019.reviewBody: Here you can find somewhere to eat, shop, pamper yourself or go dancing.....it is very safe to walk thru the COSTERA......it\'s quite an experience...

308587724.name: Cool to Drive Down
308587724.author: a TripAdvisor user
308587724.reviewBody: The Costera is the place to be since that\'s where most things are lcoated.  The outter areas of Acapulco are becoming more popular BUT the Costera is still IT.

308343439.name: Back in time
308343439.author: a TripAdvisor user
308343439.reviewBody: La Costera of Acapulco transport me to another era, 40-50 years ago (of course I see that thru the movies). There is a beautiful touch of nostalgia, of remembering. This stop is a must if you want to understand the country. I been visiting this place for decades and never get tired of it.

306122112.name: Main St., Lively Acapulco
306122112.author: a TripAdvisor user
306122112.reviewBody: One review says it\'s dangerous and while the presence of Acapulco police was very present there was no suspicious activity seen and we felt very safe during our stay in Acapulco. We did hire a guide in Acapulco (Roberto Alarcon) which was a very wise decision not only for our experiences but for the fact that as many reviewers state, driving in Acapulco is absolutely insane. Our drivers had the utmost patience and knew their way around the city and we were able to drive down the strip and go to the beach and other activities with ease. The strip is very lively, filled with many happy people, sellers, restaurants, bars, and houses very nice views of the beach and city. We mostly drove through for other events other than to stop for 2-3 hours at the beach for sea-dooing.

306099156.name: Playa La Costera
306099156.author: a TripAdvisor user
306099156.reviewBody: Playa La Costera or the Costa as the local people call it is beautiful with a beautiful beach sceneries and cant miss the Sunset as it sets..one of the best sunsets at the Costera.  This is one of the many beaches in Acapulco but a very popular one.

296333728.name: Main Drag
296333728.author: a TripAdvisor user
296333728.reviewBody: Part of a day long tour, we just drove through it.  Very busy and crazy drivers.  It was interesting and modern and not scary at all.  There just wasn\'t a need for us to stop.

287118685.name: Beach is for me
287118685.author: a TripAdvisor user
287118685.reviewBody: Awesome place if staying at an all inclusive resort. If you love the beach, warm weather and tropical, local. you will love this place.  Actually stayed here before Aug. 2014

286752306.name: go elsewhere
286752306.author: a TripAdvisor user
286752306.reviewBody: many junk vendors trying to sell on beach, hotels are large, sometimes a little dirty, trucks full of police & federal troops all over Acapulco, murders every day

284745108.name: All the exciting things in Acapulco are here.
284745108.author: a TripAdvisor user
284745108.reviewBody: The costera is the road that takes you around by the beach, you will find restaurants, the hotels, stores and much more. Day and Night this is the most interesting activity in town.

277853572.name: Main Street in Acapulco
277853572.author: a TripAdvisor user
277853572.reviewBody: When I lived here the Costera was the place to be!  It\'s where all the disco\'s and hotels are so it\'s safe and so much fun!

275018876.name: Stop
275018876.author: a TripAdvisor user
275018876.reviewBody: Traffic is something to be desired especially since the traffic lights don\'t work most of the time.  It seems the public have the right of way if you are brave enough to just walk out and hope the cars will stop which they surprisingly do.  You get used to it quickly.

268734970.name: Beautiful but horrible traffic
268734970.author: a TripAdvisor user
268734970.reviewBody: If you go to acapulco, have in mind that traffic is disgusting, landscapes are beautiful but traffic ruins everything.

267612871.name: Nice people but!
267612871.author: a TripAdvisor user
267612871.reviewBody: The people we encountered were friendly and helpful but the place is filthy, we noticed both locals and Mexican tourists discarding rubbish in the street with no thought.\nThe area is rundown due to the lack of tourism but it should not be an excuse to treat it in this way.\nVery disappointed.

261808937.name: CRAZY TRAFFIC
261808937.author: a TripAdvisor user
261808937.reviewBody: You have to hope you are on the the side of the street you want to be as getting across is a RISK. They drive like crazy fools. trying to cross is like risking your life, There are very few lights , but you may have to walk several long blocks to cross safely. While we were there there also were several demonstations which really tied up traffic.We hated going anywhere because of it

255895062.name: I used to rate it 5 but now only 2
255895062.author: a TripAdvisor user
255895062.reviewBody: The Costera has needed an overhaul before there was even the drug cartel problem. My beloved Acapulco has broken my heart. I used to go there when the Hyatt Hotel was NOT a dump like it has been for the last 20 years. The Bay gets more polluted every year. There are no more nice clothing and sports shops on the Costera. I have traveled much of the world and Acapulco was always a favorite  because it is the only place that had guaranteed hot sunny weather every day of your vacation. (except rain season August Sep. Oct.) You could read a book and chill, or dress up and enjoy a great night life at the discos, jet ski, rent a 4 wheeler and ride it along the beach. The food was fresh and delicious for all budgets etc. Now it is such a dump. Thank you Mex government for letting the cartel take over your country and lossing tourists making your happy people with no way to earn a living. Now, I am exploring wonderful Colombia. It is spectacular, safe and has really come a long way while still in many ways havaing much virgin territory to discover that is brathtaking..

255885709.name: Excellent view
255885709.author: a TripAdvisor user
255885709.reviewBody: Great view of Acapulco. There are some sites by the avenue. for photos. Take the time for a great pic.

255235720.name: So much to do and see!!
255235720.author: a TripAdvisor user
255235720.reviewBody: Take a walk down the costera  or ride up and down in a horse drawn carriage. There is so much to do and see, bring a note pad to write the things down that interested you and then visit again.

255098434.name: A great strip!!
255098434.author: a TripAdvisor user
255098434.reviewBody:
The Costera from one end to the other is filled with many bars , Restaurants or shops to stick your head in for awhile. 

On the weekend especially you still get a good crowd of walkers along the way. This city still has so much potential it's sad that the international tourist do not get here as much as they should. 

Acapulco is a terrific city and extremely safe for tourists who want to have a good time and enjoy good seafood and Mexican dishes that you won't find in other cities. Anyway still the best kept secret.

249767890.name: This area needs an overhaul
249767890.author: a TripAdvisor user
249767890.reviewBody: There are lots of big hotels, but they cannot charge much because the traffic is terrible, the streets are a mess, the stores and restaurants are mostly uninteresting, and the night clubs are so loud that it is hard to sleep, even with earplugs. Because it has a great beach, it has potential, but it needs a lot of leadership and money to make it what it could and should be. It is far behind many other beach cities in Mexico. We stayed here for 2 nights and then moved down to theLas Brisas area, which is much nicer in every way.

243007439.name: Acapulco Rediscovered
243007439.author: a TripAdvisor user
243007439.reviewBody:
Acapulco has received some bad and undeserved press of late. People give too much credit to the media that tends to exaggerate and make the exception the rule.
Acapulco is a town that in its heyday was the creme de la creme of vacation destinations. It has suffered from some government neglect of its infrastructure but it is recovering nicely.
The positives are that it has one of he most beautiful bays in the world. The bay is huge and provides all the water sports, romantic view day and night, and excellent dining experiences. In addition, it is very inexpensive and the US dollar goes a long way.
Walking on the Costera could not be safer and, most important, the people are friendly and accommodating.
It is silly not to experience this wonderful resort town. Stay in one of the beach hotels on the Costera, not at the Pierre Marques or Princess or any place out of the city. You want to experience the Bay.
The weather in Dcember through March is perfecto: no rain and 80-90 every day.

238810777.name: Like A Mexican Carnival
238810777.author: a TripAdvisor user
238810777.reviewBody: If you can\'t find it along the Costera it probably doesn\'t exist in Acapulco; well almost. We heard Home Depot was not on the Costera. We loved it, shopped there, ate there, got our crafts there and our hotel was there. Probably the best location in Acapulco especially if you like the busses or want to keep taxi costs down.

227732430.name: Nice view
227732430.author: a TripAdvisor user
227732430.reviewBody: The view is awesome, you may see how converge past and present buildings and nature and the majestic sea

208982462.name: Good to take a long walk, watch your wallet
208982462.author: a TripAdvisor user
208982462.reviewBody: Costera has been for many years the place to walk from bar to bar or hotel to hotel being mostly safe, enjoy the walk between 6-9 p.m. and you will not have any problems, usually full of police keeping order just exercise caution at all times.

200580040.name: Costera
200580040.author: a TripAdvisor user
200580040.reviewBody: This is considered the main drag of Acapulco. Buses and taxis abound, along with shopping and restaurants. If you miss home, you can find Applebees, McDonald\'s, and KFC! The American university is on Costera d"alleman, along with malls and casinos. Great spot for marketplace, mall, and boutique shopping. There\'s something for everyone!\n

199620537.name: Beautiful!
199620537.author: a TripAdvisor user
199620537.reviewBody: Walking on the costera is like a gift, you can discover part of the city.So many restaurants, bars, stores, you can choose as you wish. It has changed with the years but always something new to see and to tell the truth it is a lot cleaner then it was many years ago. We have to go back!

198288941.name: Want to go again
198288941.author: a TripAdvisor user
198288941.reviewBody: Beautiful is short for its title! In Acapulco Ulll always find something to do or enjoy with the people are great the history the landmarks are hermoso

196043435.name: The strip still special
196043435.author: a TripAdvisor user
196043435.reviewBody:
The costera surely isn't what it used to be even from the late 80's but it still has the appeal that stretch from the Calinda area to just past the Diana near the Emporio hotel. 

There are as many bars, restaurants and stores as any other destination you will find and loads of fun all in between!!

Visit Acapulco you won't be dissappointed.

190786248.name: Acapulcos Back bone!
190786248.author: a TripAdvisor user
190786248.reviewBody: When driving along this road you will see and find anything and everything for your stay in Acapulco. It stretches al along the Acapulco Bay. You will find restaurants, plazas, hotels, night clubs, pharmacies. It is as important to Acapulco as the Vegas Boulevard to Las Vegas, Nevada

190453351.name: Everything you need for a fun vacation !
190453351.author: a TripAdvisor user
190453351.reviewBody: Here you can find all type of restaurants,to stores,shopping centers,bars and clubs .Several hotels from different ranges  and ratings.Easy access to public and private beach fronts.A little hard to find free parking spaces. Very safe with lots of Federal Police Officers patrolling day and night. In other words lots of fun when on vacation.

181038216.name: Interesting Places!
181038216.author: a TripAdvisor user
181038216.reviewBody: 2013 was not the best time because of construction for the new buses! Hopefully it will be mostly done in 2014. Many local places to see along the way. Lots of small restuarants and flea markets along the way..\nQuite safe I would say..Take a bus trip down the Costera, relax and enjoy the scenery.\nEasy economical transportation to the Zocalo & Caleta.

167189726.name: Awesome experience
167189726.author: a TripAdvisor user
167189726.reviewBody: It is well worth the trip so see the divers. It does however take an eternity to get through the downtown traffic with all the construction. so watch out. The shows are hourly from 7-11pm.

154967048.name: To know it is to love it
154967048.author: a TripAdvisor user
154967048.reviewBody: On first sight, the costera appears to be a traffic laden main street in a big city, with some areas along the way, shall we say, not meticulously maintained.  Upon closer inspection, however, it is replete with many, many attractions and lots of character.  We have also found the costera to be very safe either traveling by bus, taxi, or on foot.   With the traffic, one must be very careful upon crossing to the other side.

153160010.name: Some ok restaurants, not very pretty
153160010.author: a TripAdvisor user
153160010.reviewBody: The costera is considered the "main" tourist street in golden Acapulco. You can find almost all types of restaurants depending on the area, since is is quiet long. At night there much more people, this includes sales people who WILL get in your face. This, along with an infinite number of honking taxis make walking along the costera a pain in the neck. I recommend you arrive by taxi where you want to go, and maybe walk a little afterwards to get a sense of wheather you like it or not.

151658752.name: Beautiful
151658752.author: a TripAdvisor user
151658752.reviewBody: What a joy it is to walk down Acapulco\'s Costera more so at night when it\'s cooler. The wonderful shops,lights and a few yards and you on to the sandy beaches with its warm sands even at night and crashing waves and light lit mountains.

147406823.name: Good place to spend some time
147406823.author: a TripAdvisor user
147406823.reviewBody: Long long avenue full of shops, cafes and nightclubs. Ideal to spend an afternoon away from the sun. There is also a Walmart on the Costera if you aare self catering or if you just want some goodies!

140786642.name: Hectic
140786642.author: a TripAdvisor user
140786642.reviewBody: This is a very busy 4 lane highway with tons of hotels, nightclubs, restaurants, tourist markets, and of course, the beach.  Take your time to savour the sounds, smells, and sights as well as the food and especially the Mexican hospitality.

127317894.name: The main avenue in Acapulco needs more attention
127317894.author: a TripAdvisor user
127317894.reviewBody: It needs more care, many of the restaurants and buildings now are deserted. Heavy traffic and police is not controlling it. Buildings block the sea view.

124355745.name: Still safe
124355745.author: a TripAdvisor user
124355745.reviewBody: Wonderful place for a walk, day or evening. Especially from the Flag to Diana Circle. So much to see and eat.

123577345.name: The life of Acapulco
123577345.author: a TripAdvisor user
123577345.reviewBody: The main street of Acapulco with all attractions on it.

123328067.name: Handicrafts & souvenirs and also nightlife
123328067.author: a TripAdvisor user
123328067.reviewBody: Acapulco, as New York is a  city that never sleeps. so if you decide to walk down Costera Miguel Aleman, at every corner there is an "antro" for drinking some tequila\u00b4s shots, and dancing as well.

123228099.name: The action is her
123228099.author: a TripAdvisor user
123228099.reviewBody: This is a great place to walk at night and get some great food... from tacos to crepes and churros

122840874.name: Hold onto your seat and enjoy!
122840874.author: a TripAdvisor user
122840874.reviewBody: These things are not at all for those who prefer to travel around in luxury.  They\'re loud, dirty, and the seats are more or less uncomfortable at times.  That being said, they are so much fun.  They blare music, drive a bit recklessly, and have strobes and graffiti decking out the bus.  SUCH a fun experience!  It\'s basically how I traveled everywhere!

122048462.name: Hustle & Bustle
122048462.author: a TripAdvisor user
122048462.reviewBody: For a funtime take the bus with disco just a blaring away.

121933175.name: Travelling the Costera
121933175.author: a TripAdvisor user
121933175.reviewBody: On advice from another Trip Advisor member, we jumped on the bus for 5 pesos to travel down the Costera. If you want a flavor of Acapulco you have to do this! It was great and ended up the only way we traveled afterwards!

633384977.name: Wonderful Time and fond memories!
633384977.author: a TripAdvisor user
633384977.reviewBody: A few years ago when my mother was still alive she and my son swam with the dolphins...........one of a kind expierence and would do this one again! Big thumbs up!!!!!!!!!! Enough said for now......Carmen Fera

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

567807057.name: Do the dolphin swim!
567807057.author: a TripAdvisor user
567807057.reviewBody: Highly recommend the dolphin swim and the water slides are fun. There is a water park for climbing and two large tipping buckets for the kids not keen on slides. The water dumping hits firm though.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

555303003.name: Our favorite place!
555303003.author: a TripAdvisor user
555303003.reviewBody: When asking my kids what was their favorite part of their trip? Swimming with the dolphins at El Rollo. Everybody working at the park was super nice. The entrance, waitresses by wavepool, dolphin trainers, dolphin pics people, and the people who assisted with the rides. We really enjoyed the kiddie pool because it was freshwater and fun for kids. The wavepool we liked but it was saltwater. They also let you re-enter same day with your ticket. My kids really wanted McDonald\'s outside the park for lunch, so it worked out great!! I definitely recommend El Rollo!!!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

491978853.name: Swimming with the dolphins!
491978853.author: a TripAdvisor user
491978853.reviewBody: This was much more than we expected!  We booked an hour with the dolphins and were able to hug, kiss, swim and interact with the three dolphins.  You even get to have two dolphins come up behind you, put their noses on your feet and push you up and across the pool. It was amazing! I highly recommend the one hour.  The thirty minute group only did a few things and then had to leave.  The bonus to all this was that with the dolphin experience you get to enjoy all the rides/ slides at the park all day. We were here durning the slow season, so it was like our family had rented the park for ourselves.  No lines anywhere!  We kept sliding all day.  Our two teenage daughters loved it all!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

465110682.name: Great experience
465110682.author: a TripAdvisor user
465110682.reviewBody: I have come here on several occasions, since I was 6 or 7 years old. It was changed from Cici to El Rollo, but it still is very much the same. I booked the swimming with the dolphins, and I\'m glad I did. I was able to swim with dolphins and everyone was helpful and pleasant. The park itself does not allow people to swim if they are in t-shirts, but I suppose that\'s fair. My only real complaint is the insane amounts of bees and wasps. They like to follow you around if you have a sweet drink. Other than that, it was a very pleasant time, and I would come again.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

456975967.name: Very Nice
456975967.author: a TripAdvisor user
456975967.reviewBody:
We booked the El Rollo Swimming With Dolphins Experience. I was somewhat sceptical because I'm not very keen on wild animals being kept in enclosures for our viewing pleasure etc. I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised at how the dolphins are being treated here and their handlers really love working with them. I had an amazing experience and would definitely recommend it. 

The park itself is fine as well. Some of the slides were closed because of it being a weekday but all the employees were very friendly to us and we almost had the whole place to ourselves. 

Thanks for the memorias CICI!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

455007420.name: Swiming with the Dolphins
455007420.author: a TripAdvisor user
455007420.reviewBody: The kids had a great time with the private swim with the dolphins they also enjoy the slides.\n\nI suggest going during the week so there will be les people we went during the thanksgiving week

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

453824740.name: Not all rides open during week, also Dominoes treated us very rudely
453824740.author: a TripAdvisor user
453824740.reviewBody: We went on a Wednesday, and there was hardly anybody there. Three or four of the slides were closed, which is understandable due to staffing needs and people in the park. Admission was very reasonable, and the rides that were open we\'re fine. The dolphin show was actually really good, and they performed some tricks that I never previously seen. However,  one blemish that I will not forget, with the we were  treated at dominoes. We were in line waiting for over five to ten minutes, and the staff seem to ignore us. As soon as some locals, came up for service, they immediately attended to their needs, what acting like you weren\'t even there. We had to basically demand service and basically force them to help us. I won\'t go as far to say as we were discriminated against, but it sure seemed that way. This was very disappointing, but beyond Dominoes the rest of the staff was nice and cordial. Would probably never go back again.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

453083122.name: Older water park but still fun for kids when you are tried of beach and sand
453083122.author: a TripAdvisor user
453083122.reviewBody: Dolphin show that is included with the basic ticket price was fun for my 3.5yr. old and my self. The pools were ok, I wish there was more slides and activities for small kids. This is a good place for children 5 and up.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

358318739.name: Very Pleased with the interaction during the one hour Dolphin Swim.
358318739.author: a TripAdvisor user
358318739.reviewBody: One of the activities I wanted to do during my stay in Acapulco was to swim with the dolphins.  Our taxi driver Miguel #4, made my reservation and provided transportation to and from the park and also back again to pick up the CD & photo 3 hours later.  There was a large group, but I was very impressed with the activities and interaction we were able to have with the dolphins.  You could choose between a 30min package or one hour package.  The one hour was well worth it.  Was able to give hug, kisses, hold the fins, get foot push ride, and a ride on the dolphins belly while holding fins.  I was very disappointed in the CD & photo.  You were only allowed to pick one photo and limited time to do so.  When I picked it up, there was another person in the picture who was next to me doing his dolphin swim.  And I was so excited to see the CD, but I had to wait to view until I got back home and again another disappointment.  The CD had everyone in the group in it, doing the first initial interaction (holding the fins), that was it.  I was really bummed, none of the other activities were on the CD, like the foot push and belly ride.  I thought they could of done a better job with the picture taking and CD/video.  Also the dolphin pool and deck could use some cement repair.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

347945614.name: nice place
347945614.author: a TripAdvisor user
347945614.reviewBody: this is a fun place but I would not want to spend more than a few hours there.  the place is clean and well kept.  another reviewer stated to go midweek and not during the holiday.  that is very good advice as the tourists from Mexico city flood the place and it gets very crowded

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

346484942.name: Awesome day
346484942.author: a TripAdvisor user
346484942.reviewBody: Swimming with dolphis was great. Firendly staff, absolutely safe. If you pay swimming with dolphins, even just for 1 person, all the family can stay in water park all day log.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

346248248.name: Great for kids
346248248.author: a TripAdvisor user
346248248.reviewBody: Better to visit off season midweek, pools are very clean. $200 pesos entrance fee, you need to buy food inside

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

341198558.name: Great for kids
341198558.author: a TripAdvisor user
341198558.reviewBody: Went one day with the Friends of Acapulco. It was a special day for the children. Friends of Acapulco help sponsor different children\'s homes. There are many different water activities and also a beach area. Many water slides and a wave pool.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

310344839.name: Just fun for kids.
310344839.author: a TripAdvisor user
310344839.reviewBody: Coming to this place without kids was a bad idea. I\'ve enjoyed water parks as young adult in many places, and expected to enjoy this one too, but it lacks a "big" attraction. All the slides end very quickly and none of them are high enough or speedy enough to provide a thrill for an older audience. \n\nI did see kids having a blast so if you\'re a family, this warning is not for you. .

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

275929477.name: wonderful aqua park
275929477.author: a TripAdvisor user
275929477.reviewBody: Fantastic aqua park in a beautiful area.  You can spend all day in this park. Delphin show was ok. Swim\n with dolphins was a wonderful experience, but very expensive if you pay for 1 hour as we did. The staff didn\'t care about you and sent out from the water after 40 minutes.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

259152298.name: Water Park BLAST!!!
259152298.author: a TripAdvisor user
259152298.reviewBody: One of the best waterparks in all of Mexico!! Fabulous wavepool, great, fast, fun slides of all kinds. Swim w/dolphins!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

255234361.name: Swim with the Dolphins
255234361.author: a TripAdvisor user
255234361.reviewBody: I\'ve swam with the dolphins in several different cities in Mexico and Cici\'s was by far the best of the best as far as a great experience. You have to try and it doesn\'t matter if you are young or old,  you will love it!!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

248171509.name: Swimming with Dolphins not what it used to be
248171509.author: a TripAdvisor user
248171509.reviewBody:
We've done the swimming with dolphins for the previous 4 years and this year was truly disappointing.

In all the previous years you got to "fly" on the nose of two dolphins, kiss them on the nose and do almost a whole lap of the pool hanging on to them.

This year they didn't offer any of those... just petting them, feeding them, shaking their flippers.

It was the same price and less than half the entertainment.

Cici has changed ownership and now belongs to a chain called El Rollo and presumably that has something to do with it.

So any repeat visitors or folks who are recommended by previous visitors beware, the dolphin swim is nothing like it used to be.

That apart, the remained of the park is much the same as the last 4 years but the kids pool has had an upgrade with more fun equipment for the kids to use.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

233676509.name: Well worth the small price of admission and lots of fun for the kids.
233676509.author: a TripAdvisor user
233676509.reviewBody: The water slides are great but the best part is the show that they put on with Dolphins. Also families really enjoy to swim with the Dolphins. It is worth the visit while in Acapulco!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

226298800.name: Acapulco - down memory lane
226298800.author: a TripAdvisor user
226298800.reviewBody: Going loco in Acapulco -  trip of a lifetime and some wonderful happy times - looks like it has not moved from the 50/60 era but was well worth the viewing\n

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

223535822.name: Young ones fun water park.
223535822.author: a TripAdvisor user
223535822.reviewBody: My daughter in her 30th and my 20 years old niece very much enjoyed this place They took some funny fun pictures.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

222777016.name: Waterworld!
222777016.author: a TripAdvisor user
222777016.reviewBody: Water slides abound .Kinda worn out but Good for Kids .Acapulco\'s answer to Marine land.Only for Kids

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

198118384.name: Swimming with the dolphins
198118384.author: a TripAdvisor user
198118384.reviewBody: My kids had a blast they loved this. Everything was being re-painted so they had scaffolding every where. The workers do not speak English at all.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

192718421.name: Swim with Dolphins
192718421.author: a TripAdvisor user
192718421.reviewBody: This place has seen better days, but my wife really enjoyed swimming with the dolphins. Admission is not expensive and the staff were really nice.There were many families with young children and they all seemed to be having a good time and so were we. I guess that is all that is important.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

186197494.name: Perfectly trained dolphins, cute park
186197494.author: a TripAdvisor user
186197494.reviewBody:
I went with my husband and we swam with Junpo and one of his podmates (Ma... :( I wish I could remember!). The dolphins were extremely well trained. They were careful not to knock us around, they patiently let us pet them, and they seemed to be having a pretty decent time. 
This place is the price of 1/3 or 1/4 a regular florida half hour for a full hour! It was about $100US each (1350 pesos) and the trainers and staff were super nice even though we spoke about 3 words of Spanish. I can't believe I got to pet a dolphin, and for a full hour! 
Delightful, and very patient sea mammals.

The water park didn't have all of the slides on, but with the amount of water it must take per slide not to mention staffers, vs. the number of customers, I don't blame them. Everything is a bit faded but still functional, and safety staff were a priority at the end of the slides. Everyone was very nice and polite even though we were kind of dumb tourists. Next time I'm in Acapulco, I'm going to know Spanish.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

167723687.name: Nice experience but Rude service.
167723687.author: a TripAdvisor user
167723687.reviewBody: I enjoyed swimming with the dolphins at Cici. My review is mostly for the dolphin swim because thats what I went there for. I found the staff to be very standoff-ish. I was the only non Spanish speaking participant and they did not bother to give instructions in English prior to the Dolphin swim. When I asked about it they reacted as if I was bothering them. If you don\'t want a DVD and just want pictures of your swim be sure to point this out before you pay because they will try to sell you the DVD pkg because ti costs the most. I liked the fact that while you wait for your pictures you have access to the beach where you can get a chair an umbrella for only 20 pesos and can also order a nice cold drink & enjoy the beach.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

153160155.name: The place and crowd are not the best...
153160155.author: a TripAdvisor user
153160155.reviewBody: I do not recommend going here at all. The place can be very crowded during the weekend and there is not much to do there any way. The people that do go, are mostly lower income families. Expect line cutting, rude attitude from guest as well as staff and over-priced food.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

151659575.name: Great fun for all the family
151659575.author: a TripAdvisor user
151659575.reviewBody: Well worth a visit there\'s baby slides ,slides for older children and more extreme slides for the more adventureous with nerves of steel.Take plenty of sun cream and look out for discount tickets in the supermarkets Real fun to be had by all  ( they even sell beer for the dads )

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

150603843.name: Good Family Fun
150603843.author: a TripAdvisor user
150603843.reviewBody: We visited this park in March of 2012.  We had a blast.  We swam with the dolphins and went on the water slides.  I am from Canada and have been to Mexico a few times.  The place doesnt look that great from the outside and the slides look a little sketchy.  My husband was a little leary to let us go on them.  Well, we went on them and had a fantastic time.  They are faster than anything you will ride in Canada.  They weren\'t shaky or falling apart on the inside.  We did not buy food there due to the water issues.  We brought our own snacks.  We will be going back this year just to ride the slides for a few hours.  For 8 bucks you cant go wrong.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

145564591.name: Very sad waterpark!
145564591.author: a TripAdvisor user
145564591.reviewBody: Only good point is that you can swim with dolphins CHEAP. Installations are poor and food selections are weak. NOT RECOMMENDED for a trip to the waterpark!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

140785951.name: tired
140785951.author: a TripAdvisor user
140785951.reviewBody: This is getting a bit tired but still a fun place if you are visiting Acapulco with the kids.  They need to repaint the exterior walls to clean up the image a bit.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

140536531.name: Swimming with the Dolphins
140536531.author: a TripAdvisor user
140536531.reviewBody: My daughter and her wife and their 4 year old had never swum with dolphins before and it was amazing to see the joy on their faces as they interacted with the dolphins.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

139190958.name: Fun swim with the dolphins
139190958.author: a TripAdvisor user
139190958.reviewBody: What a treat to see our 4 year old and her moms playing with the dolphins!  I will never forget the grin on our daughter\'s face when the dolphins gave her a ride.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

136749848.name: water park yes, but dolphins were even better,
136749848.author: a TripAdvisor user
136749848.reviewBody: This is a nice place to get away ride the slides and such, but the ability to swim with the dolphins and their interaction with us was excellent.  Gil, who volunteers with the dolphins says he just loves going in the tank with them after hours and just swimming with them and playing.  It shows.  These folks are protecting the dolphins fist, then concentrating on pleasing the guests, and we were all very pleased in our group. 28 people  no shortage of smiles

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

125800618.name: Swimming with Dolphins
125800618.author: a TripAdvisor user
125800618.reviewBody: First time I went there with my daughter we swam with the Dolphins and had a very heart warming experience. At the end of the holiday she always got to do the one thing she like best one more time and CI CI was her choice.\nThe other water and Giant swing activities are also fun and as it is a private area it is very safe and no worries about loking over ones shoulder or if you dont see the kids for a minute or two.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

125076943.name: Swimming with the Dolphins an experience for the kid in all of us!
125076943.author: a TripAdvisor user
125076943.reviewBody: We went to CiCi water park to swim with the dolphins. We had the opportunity to try out a few of the water slide too.. they were good.. but the dolphin experience was AWESOME. watching our granddaughter in water with the beautiful creatures was an experience as she became comfortable with them, swam, petted, kissed, played and fed them. Alex, the trainer was patient informative and engaged.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

123503132.name: Chance of a life time
123503132.author: a TripAdvisor user
123503132.reviewBody: It was much more then just swimming with dolphins, we were part of many activities with the dolphins, be sure you go for the hour!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

11324138.name: Great Value
11324138.author: a TripAdvisor user
11324138.reviewBody: A great way to spend a few hours cooling off in the heat of the Acapulco sun. This park is good for children of all ages & adults alike only 9.00 US$ admission PP plus a tube deposit only of 2.50 you could not beat this for a days fun at a great price...

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

5543702.name: Swim with the dolphins!
5543702.author: a TripAdvisor user
5543702.reviewBody:
Hubby and I were on our first trip to Acapulco (21-24 July) and went to CiCi Water Park on the Saturday afternoon for the 1 hour dolphin swim - last one of the day.  Our Expedia contact in Acapulco advised us to be there one hour before but it really is not necessary!  

After checking in and presenting our vouchers at the entrace to the park, were given tickets to the dolphins and wondered around to pass the time.  Quite honestly this park has seen better days, rather grotty and it was awfully crowded!  The kids looked like they were having a great time though ... 

When it was time to meet the dolphins were were shown into an enclosed pool area with quite a large bunch of people but it turned out most were parents of kids who were taking part.  There were 10 in our group altogether including young children.  We were asked to take a quick shower beforehand (to remove any oils or sunblock residues which harm the dolphins) and for this reason I left my T-shirt on - 1 hour in the water without sunscreen is not a great idea even so late in the afternoon.  Still, I was willing to get a red nose for the chance to kiss a dolphin!  We doned our life jackets (compulsory) and got into the salty pool.

We met 4 dolphins altogether in 2 adjacent pools and it was one of the best hours of my life!  The instructor/handler spoke mainly in Spanish and gave us a quick summary in English ... as a result we were clueless most of the time.  We took care not to harm the creatures and just copied what everyone else did.  We fed them, we sang to them while they danced around, they sang to us and we kissed them (taste kind of fishy!), stroked them, got pushed and pulled along, jumped over, splashed silly ... it was hilarious.  The dolphins were charming, chattering away and squeaking delightfully while they played with us.  The little kids in our group were helped by one of the handlers in the water and they loved it I am sure!  

A video was taken by one of the crew and stills were on offer to purchase after the swim.  An actuall DVD was not available and the photos were to be printed and collected at a later date.  Even though @ US$8.00 each they were reasonable, we had enough pics of our own and opted out.   Here you are permitted to take your own photos/video at no additional cost.  We asked one of the "parents" to take a few with our camera and they came out really great!  Thanks Andy!!!

I recommend this dolphin swim if you have never done it before, and are happy in a salt water pool.  You don't need to be fit!  The water park is right down town and spending an hour with these beautiful creatures is the nicest way to end a day!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

4773935.name: quite
4773935.author: a TripAdvisor user
4773935.reviewBody: This water park was so much fun me and my mother went together they had maybe 6 slides and there was never any lines. the dolphins were the best part of the trip swimming with the dolphins was definetly worth the 80 dollors and i am going to go it every time i go back\n

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

4469397.name: Dolphin Interactive Swim
4469397.author: a TripAdvisor user
4469397.reviewBody:
This is a truly interactive experience. Great fun for kids of all ages. We are fiftyish and we in the pool with children as young as four. 

All had a GREAT time. 

Never thought we would be in such a close proximity of the dolphins interacting for quite a length of time. We petted, kissed, and sang with the dolphins. We also were pulled around the pool, pushed through the pool, jumped over and swam under by the dolphins themselves. 

Couldn't believe it!!!

This is not the Show, this is the Interactive Swim Session. The Show is also good and entertaining but you are not a participant.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

3834810.name: Good experience
3834810.author: a TripAdvisor user
3834810.reviewBody:
Nice place to go with the family. It has a regular size pool with artificial waves, slightly overcrowded. Some toboganes, in good conditions. Everything is a little pricy, so I recommend bringing your own pool stuff. The food is regular quality, and with a good taste.

Dolphins show is very good and you can take many pictures. They even take your children a photograph (or even a photograph with the dolphins) for an additional fee ($5 and $20, respectively).

I don't recommend the balloon fly. Even when you get a good view of the Acapulco's bay, the balloon doesn't move and the trip is therefore very short. I don't think it is a good price/fun deal.

Most importante, avoid the timeshare-vendors in the exit. They will try to convience you to go to some hotel-demostration in exchange for a free meal or boat-trip. Don't go to the Hotel Presidente at any cost. There were a vendor named Alicia which acted very rude when we didn't buy anything.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

3268672.name: Fantastic experience!
3268672.author: a TripAdvisor user
3268672.reviewBody: In February my husband and I swam with the dolphins in two large exhibition tanks at Ci Ci ...we were in the water with them for a full hour and loved every minute.  It is not strenuous (we are both in our 70\'s!); you should be able to swim but by law everyone has to wear a life vest.  They take a video of your entire time with the dolphins and it was a lovely souvenir (just wish they could have captured the sounds the dolphins were making ...as if they were trying to talk to us dumb humans).  Do not wear suntan lotion as it irritates the dolphin\'s skin ...which by the way is lovely and smooth.  The water park is quite large with a big wave pool and lots of water slides etc...a great place to spend the day with children.  It is an expensive encounter but worth every penny in our opinion.\n

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

3231908.name: Yeah
3231908.author: a TripAdvisor user
3231908.reviewBody: Swimming with the dolphins was one of the coolest things i have ever done, go here!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!\n

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

2623749.name: Loved swimming with dolphins!
2623749.author: a TripAdvisor user
2623749.reviewBody: Swimming with the dolphins was absolutely fabulous and intense!  The experience was worth every penny and more...  I highly recommend it!\n

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

2313630.name: All about the dolphins
2313630.author: a TripAdvisor user
2313630.reviewBody: Great fun, and an experience to be had.  At $60 a head to swim at the dolphins, it\'s pretty good deal.  Me and my girlfriend went last february, and were the last people to sign up for the day, we got to swim alone with the dolphins, on top of that, we brought a waterproof camera, and the dolphin trainer finished are roll for us.  Couldn\'t ask for anything more.  Didn\'t used any of the waterpark though, but when you pay for the dolphins use of the the rest of the waterpark is free.\n

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

2188862.name: i love the dolphins!
2188862.author: a TripAdvisor user
2188862.reviewBody:
My angel and I went to acapulco for his 30th birthday last March and had a wonderful time.
We especially loved swimming with the dolphins at Cici waterpark.  We can't wait to go back to visit!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

1481608.name: water and happiness
1481608.author: a TripAdvisor user
1481608.reviewBody: cici is a great place! my little boy enjoyed very much, swimming with dolphins! it\'s really cute!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

739647.name: nice life guard named (paul) in english
739647.author: a TripAdvisor user
739647.reviewBody: all the life guards were lovely, but paul is the one i really like he has my e-mail address and i will be going back next year as i had such i great time. it is also very cheap meaning i could gold go back 4-5 times for the full day the people are so friendly it is unbelievable and the the slides arent bad either!!!! melissa xxxxxx\n

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman S/N Esq. Cristobal Colon, Col. Costa Azul

673127057.name: A must place to visit
673127057.author: a TripAdvisor user
673127057.reviewBody:
This is a lovely spot to visit and here you can see the world famous Cliff Divers.
This is breathtaking stuff as divers take in turns to dive over 100 feet into the ocean waters between the rocks .
They have to time their dives for when the waves come in , we watched about twelve of them do different dives, some with somersaults and the last one the Master Diver dives from the highest point.
There is a chapel up there and they all pray before they dive.
According to our guide they learn from a young age, are professional and belong to an association which has about 60 members. It was great to see, they deserve all the applause they get.

672181967.name: Great place to visit
672181967.author: a TripAdvisor user
672181967.reviewBody: If you\'ve ever watched "Fun In Acapulco" with Elvis Presley, you\'ve seen La Quebrada. Local divers risk their lives diving hundreds of feet into the bay. The only downside is the constant heat and hardly anywhere to cool off. There is a restaurant attached, but the view is best seen from right in front of the diving area. Take an umbrella and a folding chair. It takes quite sometime for the show to begin, but when it does, it is well worth it!

669960884.name: Beautiful and Exciting!
669960884.author: a TripAdvisor user
669960884.reviewBody: This beautiful view point allows you to watch the Cliff Divers show from above, however you can also take the stairs down to have a closer look. The waters here are turquoise and the Cliff Diver show is a very exciting sight to see (it\'s also free to watch)! There is also a restaurant up top with a view for those who have the time to enjoy a meal. Overall, beautiful place!

669856211.name: Breathtaking Experience!
669856211.author: a TripAdvisor user
669856211.reviewBody: We arrived in Acapulco on a cruise ship and wanted to see the divers. This is the home of the divers, Acapulco\'s iconic attraction, who usually perform at 1:00 pm every day. The best views and most comfortable way to see the show is while you enjoy a cool beverage on the viewing platform or have a bite to eat on the terrace of La Perla restaurant at the landmark Hotel Mirador. Watch the divers as they gracefully leap from a height of about 140 feet into the shallow and dangerous waters below. There will be a short folkloric dance performance as the divers make their way back up to the hotel entrance where they wait in anticipation of receiving tips, the only compensation they receive. Yes, it\'s a must see!

669034728.name: Beautiful place, dirty locals and tourists
669034728.author: a TripAdvisor user
669034728.reviewBody:
A place full of tradition that has been completely wasted out by locals.
Getting there from Costera Miguel Alemán is easy, you just drive all the way up to Acapulco downtown or following the route to La Quebrada, just can’t miss it.
Divers start their show at 1 pm and the last jump is at 10:30 (with torches); the show costs $40 from 11 years old and up and $15 for infants under 10.
La Quebrada has got this magnificent, spectacular, blessed view that makes it awesome for tourists. However, trash and rubbishy items come with the waves and float there, making this unacceptable and unattractive to tourists, who keep on dumping their trash on the beaches and to the sea.
No restrooms available, yet they’re being built and promised to be usable soon.
Still a beautiful, awesome, incredible place to visit.

668497358.name: OK show
668497358.author: a TripAdvisor user
668497358.reviewBody: I read that this was a must see. We got there 1 hour before the show & of course had to use the bathroom. There is NONE available. They had some at a convenience store across the street the was extremely disgusting \ud83d\ude37. There was a lot of people outside the area selling souvenirs & tacos with meat that had been sitting out all day. The area around this attraction is pretty dirty, there\u2019s no real parking for this area.  We made our way to the viewing area & the actual show only lasted about 10 minutes. After the show the divers are standing at the exit with a plastic bag asking for tips. The entrance fee was only $40 pesos, but still it was a little tacky.

667930678.name: You cannot leave Acapulco without seeing this show
667930678.author: a TripAdvisor user
667930678.reviewBody: We went twice, the first during daytime, and could not see it because were misinformed about daytime shows.They do 4 shows in the evening. Both times, we ate at La Perla, the restaurant, right above the diving site. It is an impressive feat considering how rough the waters are. If you do not want to dine, there is a viewing area, which costs 40 Mexican pesos, plus parking. You will have the opportunity to take photos with the divers after show. They are so young!!

666519994.name: Woooooooowwww!!!
666519994.author: a TripAdvisor user
666519994.reviewBody:
Nothing like this any where in the world am I have been around ..
Get there a little before sunset you go down thru a stair to the mirador where you have to fight for a spot in the front 
Prepare to be amazed by this fearless divers 
Unbelievable 
Must go !!!!

664987528.name: Divers are Amazing!
664987528.author: a TripAdvisor user
664987528.reviewBody: It\'s unbelievable watching the divers jump off the cliff. We had an excellent view watching them.  I would even go to see them again.

664854251.name: Unique diving experience
664854251.author: a TripAdvisor user
664854251.reviewBody: La Quebrada is the rugged coastline in Acapulco where the famous cliff divers put on a show. The best place to watch the diving show is from the La Perla restaurant perched above the diving show. \nThe diving shows are short, in a twenty minute dive show, you will see only six divers - they each dive once. These dives are done from differing hight and locations on the cliff face. The second dive show only had five divers and was over in 15 minutes - so do not blink or you will miss the dive. Well worth a visit when in Acapulco.

664625057.name: The best !!!!!!
664625057.author: a TripAdvisor user
664625057.reviewBody:
It’s incredible that after so many years this fantastic and unique place and DIVERS
Continue to make this beartiful an dangerous program all day long and at night.
Unique in the whole world and with the opportunity to watch them with a drink and the best warm weather in the world .......
You MUST watch it ......
You will be back...

661631236.name: Great show and food
661631236.author: a TripAdvisor user
661631236.reviewBody: This stop was part of our tour. It\'s a great vantage point to see the close dinners in action. The food was also very light, refreshing, and tasty! As you can see from the pictures, the views from or table we\'re phenomenal!

661439724.name: Amazing
661439724.author: a TripAdvisor user
661439724.reviewBody: you definitely have to have nerves of steel to jump this cliff the water below as very rough and they did an excellent job on there performances

660009212.name: The Classic Acapulco Experience
660009212.author: a TripAdvisor user
660009212.reviewBody: It\'s worth seeing because it is very impressive! It would have been more enjoyable if there was more shade. At the 1pm show it was terribly hot standing in the sun for more than thirty minutes waiting for all of the divers to jump. The divers have shirts for sale and  ask for donations as you leave. It\'s 40 pesos to go in. It would also be nice if visitors could learn about the history of the divers and how the divers learn to do the jumps.

659141536.name: Magical place
659141536.author: a TripAdvisor user
659141536.reviewBody: Witnessing the cliff divers never gets old. And from the restaurant the view is great! The entire family (6 and older) enjoyed the night dives, especially with the torches!!

658922922.name: What a dump!
658922922.author: a TripAdvisor user
658922922.reviewBody: Embarrassed that I insisted on my wife and her two aunts join us for the cliff diving.  My family stayed at El Mirador 57 years ago. There was a series of casitas on meandering footpaths through hibiscus and bougainvillea. We stayed a week  - I saw the diving daily and got a wicked case of Moctezuma\'s Revenge in the hotel restaurant. Very memorable. Today it looks like a maximum security prison with all the charm that implies. The cover to get in is usorious - by Mexican standards. Plus they cancelled the 10:30 show that features flaming gasoline in the water. Don\'t waste your time. Big yawn.

658469883.name: Amazing feats
658469883.author: a TripAdvisor user
658469883.reviewBody: Although one has to walk down many stairs, one gets closer to the water and cliff. Usually 5-8 divers go into and out of water by people lined up to watch. Divers execute dives with different levels of expertise. Quite the experience!

657404438.name: Sandwiches and hamburgers
657404438.author: a TripAdvisor user
657404438.reviewBody: They offered a package for 350 mx that includes divers show ( that doesn\u2019t belong to restaurant) and 5 option lunch . Lunch options included club sandwiches and hamburgers. That is ridiculous:-(

656142590.name: We had great seats
656142590.author: a TripAdvisor user
656142590.reviewBody: We had a guide who took us to the very best viewing area to se the cliff divers. There were five different ones, who did there thing. But after you have seen it once, (5 years ago), then it it no big deal.

655309134.name: Eh
655309134.author: a TripAdvisor user
655309134.reviewBody: Not what expected at all. Needs to be updated to this time. Possibly add a few areas of shade (was +30) fro the young and elderly. Needs annoucements. Ifnot paying attention would have missed

654847465.name: Amazing
654847465.author: a TripAdvisor user
654847465.reviewBody: What an amazing sight, these brave divers scale the cliff barefoot and dive into the sea . It looks really dangerous but these divers are so skilled.It was the highlight of our trip to Acapulco.

653801845.name: An Acapulco tradition
653801845.author: a TripAdvisor user
653801845.reviewBody: We were told that this tradition started in 1934. The divers are quite experienced and it\u2019s not something I would ever want to try.

653602488.name: Exciting
653602488.author: a TripAdvisor user
653602488.reviewBody: We went at night... probably more exciting and not as hot. Beware though, there are many steps to climb!

653593081.name: A must see
653593081.author: a TripAdvisor user
653593081.reviewBody: Sure it\u2019s cheesy but if you\u2019ve ever seen the love boat, you have to go see this awesome show of diving off very high cliffs. We went for the dinner and show.. don\u2019t expect much food wise.. it\u2019s totally serviceable but the show... really something!!! And a lot of great history.

653532088.name: Wow Amazing
653532088.author: a TripAdvisor user
653532088.reviewBody: The divers jump from this spot mid day then again many times after 7:30. They are entertaining and skilled. I think this is a must see sight in Acapulco. At night the are is lit up. Come watch the sun set, then enjoy the divers!

652738460.name: Great experience.
652738460.author: a TripAdvisor user
652738460.reviewBody: Neat experience.  Fun to watch and it\u2019s very hot while watching so make sure you have your sunscreen on.

651910885.name: Great scenery
651910885.author: a TripAdvisor user
651910885.reviewBody: We watched the divers; which was fun.  This is in an area on the edge of the hotel zone; and Mom and I ventured a bit farther out (which with all the problems Mexico is having now; would not be advised.)  Worth a visit; time it to see the divers; who are much braver than I!

651509416.name: The REAL cliff divers
651509416.author: a TripAdvisor user
651509416.reviewBody: Just got through watching a competition on TV from Colombia, where the divers were actually on a platform, not on the cliff;  these in Acapulco actually climb up the sheer cliff to stations on the side, then have to time the tides just right to be able to dive successfully.  Well worth the price of admission;  be sure to hydrate properly before going down the long stairs, or you will definitely suffer on the trip back up!  [ask me how I know!]

650411901.name: Vacation
650411901.author: a TripAdvisor user
650411901.reviewBody: Absolutely stunning and amazing experience to see this fearless divers,\nSafe , great views, awesome restaurant

648640430.name: Acapulco\u2019s living Gods
648640430.author: a TripAdvisor user
648640430.reviewBody:
The show was on our schedule since we booked “Acapulco Historical Tour with Divers Show”. We watched the show from La Perla restaurant, attached to the El Mirador Acapulco hotel. Comfortably seated in the shade, with a great view, we ate and had a drink while waiting for the show to begin. You might like to pay a small charge and watch the show from the crowded observation deck, with no shade. Furthermore, you may want to charter a boat and have a thrilling experience. 

Since 1934, brave cliff divers, “clavadistas” in Spanish, not only strain attention worldwide but hold an iconic place in Acapulco and in the Mexican culture. Watching the fearless divers scaling up to the top with their bare hands is striking.  Landing from 135 ft. in the rough, narrow ocean cove below, requires perfect jump timing with the tide. But the outstanding skills and the jumping decision based on the incoming waves are only a part of the equation. The other part is to have nerves of steel, while daily defying the death.  

Since the divers would greet the viewers at the end of the show, you might tip them and take pics. Definitely, you can’t only visit Acapulco without seeing the utterly astonishing show.

648122925.name: A leap of faith!
648122925.author: a TripAdvisor user
648122925.reviewBody: These cliff divers are true masters of their art.   It takes years of practice and based on the height they dive from, anything could go wrong!   Timing is everything as they are fully reliant on the tides to ensure the depth of the water is just right when they take their plunge!   Extremely impressive to watch.   A trip to Acapulco simply would not be complete without watching this breathtaking display.

646601679.name: A must see in Acapulco
646601679.author: a TripAdvisor user
646601679.reviewBody: I was amazing to experience and see up close. We ate lunch at the Mirador restaurant and enjoyed the 1:30pm show. It was well worth it!

646461760.name: AMAZING!!!
646461760.author: a TripAdvisor user
646461760.reviewBody: I have been here 4 times....once during the day and 3 times at night. The daytime is when the divers practice. It is scary to watch....but you can see their climb up the mountain, which makes the dives all the more amazing. To view this in the dark, you are amongst hundreds of people and cars. I didn\'t rate this as a 5 because of the amount of time it takes to leave La Quebrada, and the congestion we sat in, in the area of Condesa Beach. It took us 2.5 hours to get from La Quebrada to the Diamante area!!!

646053056.name: This is scary to watch live
646053056.author: a TripAdvisor user
646053056.reviewBody: These men jump into the water, then swim across and climb the rock face to the top, approx. 150 ft. When they are sure the conditions are safe, they launch themselves off the rocks, to land in the center of the 20 ft. deep channel. It is a must see.

645574313.name: Divers are amazing!
645574313.author: a TripAdvisor user
645574313.reviewBody: We not only saw some awesome divers but also got to see a few whales offshore swimming around. This is something everybody needs to do at least once. You can buy beers or sodas and food or just stand their and watch. It\'s very comfortable - at least when it\'s not too crowded, which it wasn\'t. Highly recommend this.

644949285.name: Incredible Divers
644949285.author: a TripAdvisor user
644949285.reviewBody: Had an opportunity to watch these brave and amazing young men dive from different parts of the cliff. This take courage and skills.

643412628.name: Hotel El Mirador Restaurante la Perla
643412628.author: a TripAdvisor user
643412628.reviewBody: We decided to watch the Quebrada divers at 20:30 by making a recreation at the Hotel Mirador, La Perla restaurant (not to be confused with so many restaurants named "La Perla" in Acapulco!). We payed 590 pesos each for a three course meal. We actually saw 3 times the divers without being harrased by the waiters. Food was very good, typical Mexican dishes. Higky recommended.

643123780.name: Saw the cliff divers in Acapulco
643123780.author: a TripAdvisor user
643123780.reviewBody: The divers are fantastic and the climbing of those cliffs is almost as breath taking as the actual dive!  Suggest you sit on the far right of the viewing platform.  Excellent seat and great for watching the dancers that preform after the dives.  Don\u2019t forget to TIP THE DIVERS so many did not and that seemed just not right to us.

642402025.name: Cliff divers
642402025.author: a TripAdvisor user
642402025.reviewBody: Unbelievable!  These guys are very courageous!  \nGet there early to get a good view. There are lots of people selling souvenirs around the area I found that they were very very well priced - you could buy a nice straw hat for about 3 dollars  which you definitely need if you\u2019re seeing the divers during the day time.

635477034.name: Quebrada de Acapulco
635477034.author: a TripAdvisor user
635477034.reviewBody:
To begin with, Mexico is recognized worldwide because it has a wide variety of touristic places. You can find beaches, museums, parks, magic towns, plinths, forests, jungles, cities, archaeological sites and the list goes on. All these amazing places are identified by nature, traditions and cultures they have. We will focus especially in a famous place which name is “La Quebrada de Acapulco”. It is located in Acapulco, Guerrero and the place is in the south of Mexico and next to the Pacific Ocean.
“La Quebrada” is one of the most visited places in Acapulco and is the principal attraction of the tourists who go there. It has a story behind the place we know now; In the XVIII century, the population of Acapulco were sick of a strange disease in the air called cholera morbus that affected people when they went to their crops and brought galeón de Manila. In order to fight against this disease, “a doctor called Francisco Javier Balmis, proposed that with a weapon they throw a considerable part of the mountain so it creates a way to the fresh air to flow and let the disease goes away from the mountain and the heat too” (Mèxico desconocido, 2018). The first shot to create it was in 1799 and it immediately worked for the purpose it was created; they called it “El Abra de San Nicolás”.
They noticed that it worked for the purpose of the fresh air come but the smells of persons or animals who were dead or sick didn’t go like the disease, so in 1876 José María Lopetegui with dynamite and human effort, they opened a gap of 300 meters and was called with the name of “La Quebrada”. Since that moment, “La Quebrada” has been one of the most iconic places of Acapulco.
 
Now we will talk about why it should be considered and recognized over the other touristic places that we can found in Acapulco. The tourism of Acapulco is at the order of the day and is the principal economic income of the area. Another reason of why is do visite is that is the headquarter of the diving world championship, which is a fact that not everybody knows. As everybody knows México is a third world country, thing that should be another reason to visit no just this  touristic area, but visit other areas, if you travel all over the country you’ll improve the mexican economy. 

Acapulco has lots of beautiful beaches, those are perfect for doing any aquatic sport, or just to relax and rest in that beautiful landscape, there also exist many diverse options for the ones that want to know the other side of the city’s, in this case Acapulco, since this is not the exception of the kind of city that has an unknown side. This city was founded in 1550, the pre-Columbian era, which means that there are some touristic places where you can find a historical undertone; and La Quebrada de Acapulco is not the exception to that rule since its creation was decided thanks a historical event.
So, in Acapulco, there are many different and fun touristic activities and that cannot be discussed, but there is no any interesting point like La Quebrada since it has one of the most interesting creations that exist in all the Mexican territory and even when the time pass, is as important now and then.

}Now we will expand the topic with the most interesting activity that represents this place. What is the riskiest activity you have done? You can think risk as many things like taking a ride by a bike or go parachuting or swimming with sharks. You know that is risky but at the end you know it’s worthy.  All these activities are fun but the most entertaining and awesome activity is going to la Quebrada de Acapulco. Even though is risky, going to la Quebrada de Acapulco is one hundred per cent worth it because it´s facts and world recognition.              	
 
La Quebrada de Acapulco is not national but global. “It is one of the most famous cliffs not only in Mexico but throughout the world, for its brave divers. In this place, some of the most traditional shows of the beach and Acapulco, in Guerrero are carried out” (Vía México, 2017). So, it is very common to see divers having so much fun in there.
People also come here with their families to swim and spend some family time. Ask anyone and they would immediately recognize La Quebrada de Acapulco. The activity of jumping from it started in 1934 when only professional cliff divers jumped off after climbing the complete riff with a torch in one hand, eventually, this professional practice was replaced for a cultural practice, in order for kids to ``turn´´ into men they needed to jump off from it. It even has more science that we may imagine, there is a way and technique to jump off safely. Divers see for water very carefully to be on a high level or waving a lot because if they jump off without a high height they could smash their head with the rocks on the bottom of the sea.

José Andrés Orantes Guillén A01174130
Fernando Molina Castellanos A01174143
Paola Salazar Hernández A01174132
José Luis Pascacio Cancino A01174153

635118609.name: There are many fasinitating things to see and do in the Acapulco area.
635118609.author: a TripAdvisor user
635118609.reviewBody: I always have Roberto Alacron for driving my family in Acapulco. He knows the best spots and we have always felt safe with him, English speaking and always available to assist.

634204295.name: Must see in Acapulco
634204295.author: a TripAdvisor user
634204295.reviewBody: Must see show when u r in Acapulco \nBeautiful place and breathtaking performances \nAmazing to watch from the begining( performers r climbing the cliff from the water) to a final jumper

633856383.name: The divers are amazing and crazy
633856383.author: a TripAdvisor user
633856383.reviewBody: Watch the divers during the day. Paid the 40 pesos to walk down to the watching area. This is also were the divers enter and exit the water and cliffs. There were about 5 divers. Really amazing to see, especially to watch them climb up the cliff to get to the diving platform.

631786328.name: Thrilling
631786328.author: a TripAdvisor user
631786328.reviewBody:
High cliffs, narrow inlet, thrilling to see four people diving from 60-foot cliff and one from 80.
It was the 1:00PM dive. However, it actally starts at 1:15. 
Hot, hot, hot while waiting in the rock terraces. Having a hat is a must. There is no announcements. Pretty simple action, but still thrilling.
A touch of show biz type of announcing could generate them better revenue. It was even interesting watching the divers scalling up the rocks in order to get to jump positions.
Must see while in Acapulco.

630776009.name: Day view
630776009.author: a TripAdvisor user
630776009.reviewBody: Impressive to see the divers climb up the cliff and plunge into the ocean from such high altitude. breath taking

628595144.name: WOW!
628595144.author: a TripAdvisor user
