After LA QUEBRADA, and as you drive back towards the downtown area, there are lots of places to dine out, and venues for dancing or just people watching..Acapulco is a vibrant city!!

451057098.name: A MUST WHEN YOU VISIT ACAPULCO
451057098.author: a TripAdvisor user
451057098.reviewBody: you have to go there at night. very good excellent! great show! great divers they say they have a timing when they have to dive otherwise they will hit the rocks.

450980094.name: Nice Show, too crowded
450980094.author: a TripAdvisor user
450980094.reviewBody:
The show is nice and the divers are excellent, however, the place does not have comfortable facilities. On high season you must stand behind 2-3 lines of people and probably you wont see anything, on the other hand, there are several shows so you can wait and get a better spot for the next show. 

For watching the show you need to go down many steps so no wheel chair access and if you need the bathroom you need to go all the way up stairs.

In general, if you are in Acapulco, you must come and enjoy the show, ask for the schedule

450548636.name: High Cliff Divers - A Must See
450548636.author: a TripAdvisor user
450548636.reviewBody: Did the tour of the city and finished it with the High Cliff Divers.  Amazed with the bravery of these young divers (including a woman). If you aren\'t stunned by this.  Just imagine that they climb over the rocks up to their diving platforms in Bare feet.  AMAZING!

450467433.name: Playful divers
450467433.author: a TripAdvisor user
450467433.reviewBody: be prepared to walk many stairs, there is a platform where  you can see some views but not the actual drivers going into the water. It is beautiful and the divers very engaging and will pose for a tip! We enjoyed going with Roberto our tour guide and highly recommend him , small van,  air-conditioned van,  tequila, water  and beer! Better to go with small group them busload of variety of ages!

448909695.name: It Is A Must See Event
448909695.author: a TripAdvisor user
448909695.reviewBody: My family got to watch the cliff divers.  My son and daughter walked down to be closer to the divers.  Older people or handicapped folks cannot go down there.  We watched from a shaded balcony in the restaurant. The show was delayed by an hour.  The restaurant was a nice cool place to visit with clean restrooms.  We did not eat there. We did enjoy the show.  My son got some great pictures.  Cruise people need to know that unless you are very energetic and can do a lot of stairs you will not be close to view the cliff divers. We were there in late November in the day time.

447820049.name: Impressive
447820049.author: a TripAdvisor user
447820049.reviewBody: It is impressive how these young divers jump so far down. We went at night and looks great. They really do very well.

446382302.name: Breath taking
446382302.author: a TripAdvisor user
446382302.reviewBody: We just froze when we saw these young boys going off these rock face, its a must to see, be aware thier timed shows, we walked up from the harbour when we berthed and only just managed to see the last of it!! I wouldn\'t walk again, easier to book a local taxi and go, they know the score and will make sure you get to see it all properly, as our friends did!!

442280324.name: My first visit to the La Quebrada
442280324.author: a TripAdvisor user
442280324.reviewBody: My friend took me here on my first day in Acapulco. It was pretty great. Heads up, there is a fee to enter the diving area. However, when I went it was open. So, make sure to call them, if they have a number, and find the hours of operation.

441490027.name: Best thing ever!
441490027.author: a TripAdvisor user
441490027.reviewBody: Young boys jumping from a cliff in a very narrow space into the sea. Soooo scary! If you do one thing in Acapulco, make it this one.

441483615.name: Jump my Hero!!!
441483615.author: a TripAdvisor user
441483615.reviewBody: Quebrada is where you watch the best divers in the world as they jump on a sharp edged cliff to the delight of the crowd. Dangerous yet captivating

441003522.name: cliff divers performance.
441003522.author: a TripAdvisor user
441003522.reviewBody: the food was very good an the service was great.very nice place watch the cliff divers. We enjoyed the view with  a few drinks,

440970930.name: amazing cliff divers
440970930.author: a TripAdvisor user
440970930.reviewBody: these guy\'s are the bravest entertainers you could, see. the lunch time show is amazing very hot. best to buy a drink or lunch and watch from the restaurant. great view.

440627563.name: Take a leap into Acapulco\'s Epic Era
440627563.author: a TripAdvisor user
440627563.reviewBody: Great experience! However do not fall for the tourist trap of eating at El Mirador hotel or any of the other restaurants surrounding La Quebrada. I\'ve seen the day and night show and would definitely recommend doing the night show.

440322468.name: The famous Clavadistas of Acapulco
440322468.author: a TripAdvisor user
440322468.reviewBody: It was a nice experience to see the famouns Clavadistas. We went to a restaurant were we had a good view, it was very exiting to see them from soo close. Specialy after seeing the insane hight they jump from and how narrow it get !!\nif you have the possibility great experience !

439172182.name: Must see.
439172182.author: a TripAdvisor user
439172182.reviewBody: Must see, enjoyed the divers speedy free form climbing to the dive platform.  40 peso fee per person.

438539249.name: Classic
438539249.author: a TripAdvisor user
438539249.reviewBody: If you have the time to go watch this it is a classic thing to do, this has been going on for many years and the views are stunning. This is a place you want to go when there is a sunset. If you are in Acapulco try to make the time to see this.

438392335.name: Impressive
438392335.author: a TripAdvisor user
438392335.reviewBody: Went there on a boat with family and friends to watch the cliff divers jump. It\'s a very dangerous jump but these people are just fearless and have mastered it. Definitely a cool spot to stop for a drink and watch.

437290123.name: WORL FAMOUS - AN ATTRACTION IN ACAPULCO THAT YOU MUST SEE
437290123.author: a TripAdvisor user
437290123.reviewBody: I have been to the cliff divers o many times that I have lost count. Will definitely go again in January, as my granddaughter (who has seen them) is coming to visit me in January with a friend that has never been here. It is very staged, but very dramatic and quite dangerous. There are so ways to see the show. You can go on a tourist boat, go on a city tour, or go yourself. Warning, if you cannot walk steps, ask the management and they will take you to a hidden area.

436365016.name: divers great
436365016.author: a TripAdvisor user
436365016.reviewBody: the divers were great, but the dinner was poor(airplane food at best) and not a venue you would book dinner and get a two selection menu of mass pre cooked fair

433576908.name: Nice place
433576908.author: a TripAdvisor user
433576908.reviewBody: Really nice place, even they charge $20.00 pesos per person to see the guys jumping but it is really cool!!!\n

433062277.name: Awsome place and views.
433062277.author: a TripAdvisor user
433062277.reviewBody: After a horrible food experience,  we went down and went down to la quebrada. This place is awsome and beautiful,  definetly recommended. They did have the attraction of the divers in to the ocean.

431791079.name: Truly amazing
431791079.author: a TripAdvisor user
431791079.reviewBody: When you are in Acapulco don\'t miss this amazing experience! Not only the impressive show of the cliff divers but also the setting, the amazing view this place has to offer. The show ends at 8pm and it\'s very beautiful in the night. Entrance is 40 Pesos and a bunch of taxis are waiting there as well. There is also the option to watch it from the restaurant there which is 120pesos with a drink included. Enjoy!

431644270.name: A classic
431644270.author: a TripAdvisor user
431644270.reviewBody: This is a classic and a must visit while in Acapulco. You see the divers jump off the cliff in almost any movie made in Acapulco. It is a beautiful cliff and I still enjoy today watching the divers jump off into the sea. It\'s a must visit while in Acapulco.

429803276.name: Amazing divers
429803276.author: a TripAdvisor user
429803276.reviewBody: The divers climb up the cliff and then they dive off the cliff.  There were 5 divers and they all did different dives. You must see this show.  It takes about 30 minutes.  They climb up the cliff rather quickly and then they spend some time warming up .  One by one they dive.  The view of the ocean and the cliffs is breathtaking.\n\nWe went to the 1pm show.  The sun was intense so I recommend bringing an umbrella.  It costs 40 pesos per person to go down to the viewing platform. There are several vendors selling crafts and treats. It costs to park at the top of the cliff.  Come early.  People start coming about 45 mins before the show.  We were there in the off season, so it wasn\'t too crowded.

429030014.name: Diving Daredevils!
429030014.author: a TripAdvisor user
429030014.reviewBody: This is a must see in Acapulco! These guys are amazing!! We sat in the viewing area in the Hotel Mirador - for about ten dollars or less you get a national beverage of your choice and a great view of the divers. It is a great deal - better than than the 4 dollar platform down below where you bake your head in the sun and get nothing to drink. It was a very quiet time of year so we were all alone. It is quite the spectacle and we were glad we didn\'t miss it! I really want to see a night time dive but that will have to wait until our next visit!

425877724.name: Cliff diving
425877724.author: a TripAdvisor user
425877724.reviewBody: Excellent - had a wonderful time watching the amazing cliff divers whilst in Acapulco. It\'s a must see whilst here \n

422637068.name: Cliff Dives
422637068.author: a TripAdvisor user
422637068.reviewBody: Best if seen from the ocean as you get a closer look but also can be seen from the Hotel. Incredible guys diving off the cliff from almost 40 meters up. A tradition in Acapulco for years.

420372105.name: Stunning !
420372105.author: a TripAdvisor user
420372105.reviewBody: Fantastic experience and one not to be missed. I have heard a lot about the brave boys from La Quebrada, but to see this in person is a fantastic experience. We booked seats in the "La Perla" restaurant, which offers the best "comfortable" views from your table. I would not recommend the place for dinner, but it is perfect place to watch the show without being pushed by another hundred people. I am sure that the main viewing platform offers better views, but as we were with kids, this was the perfect place.

419627173.name: The Divers
419627173.author: a TripAdvisor user
419627173.reviewBody: Sat at a restaurant called La Perla that over looked the "Quebrada" and watched the incredible diving that took place........wow, such brave and skilled young men. Later met them for a photo shoot with us.  They were incredible better than I thought

418426642.name: Brave boys!
418426642.author: a TripAdvisor user
418426642.reviewBody: we were on a cruise and one of the ports was Acapulco. It was incredible to watch the boys diving from the high cliffs. This is something not to miss and definitely doesn\'t disappoint!

417979252.name: thrilling experience
417979252.author: a TripAdvisor user
417979252.reviewBody: we went on a city tour and saw these cliff divers, it was really amazing and I would recommend this for all tourists to see.

417743471.name: Cliff diving
417743471.author: a TripAdvisor user
417743471.reviewBody: When I was a kid I used to watch cliff divers on Wide World of Sports. Now to actually be here in person, Wow

416958625.name: Different......
416958625.author: a TripAdvisor user
416958625.reviewBody: ...and a great sunset view to boot!..., these men offer a great show, likely to never forget. 5 shows a day. We went at the 7:30pm one, and exceeded our expectations. Arrive early to choose a good spot.

416825867.name: The Nerve!
416825867.author: a TripAdvisor user
416825867.reviewBody: This where the cliff divers dhow takes place.  The divers climb up the cliffs like it is the thing to do and the dives are great!

415034530.name: Worth a visit, very cool and nice view
415034530.author: a TripAdvisor user
415034530.reviewBody: Went to see the divers/jumpers, lasted for about half an hour, costed 40 peso to get a really good view! Super cool, well worth a visit!

408479913.name: Acceptable
408479913.author: a TripAdvisor user
408479913.reviewBody:
Acceptable 
Looking nice to watch for one time 
Is better to stay inside the resturant 
But don't expect good food 
Usually one juice is fare

407966264.name: Awesome!
407966264.author: a TripAdvisor user
407966264.reviewBody: To me, the must thing to see in Acapulco. You can watch for free from different vantage points or you can pay a little and walk down the steps to get really up close and personal. If you eat at La Perla you can watch the show from the restaurant and then watch a later show down the steps for free. I did the restaurant when the sun was still out and then saw an evening show from right in front down below. Glad I did both because the divers are amazing! Seeing the full view from my table was awesome. Then seeing the speed at which they hit the water up close was unreal! Total respect and admiration for them. They will take pictures with you after the show, and when I was there, they offered T-shirts for sell. It helps them out and I was happy to get one. This is still an incredible experience and I\'m really glad I got to see it.

407614748.name: Great show!
407614748.author: a TripAdvisor user
407614748.reviewBody: The cliff divers were great! We sat inside with the 2-drink deal... didn\'t eat there.  It was a great show, we were in the shade with a perfect view. A must-do if you are in Acapulco!

406551548.name: Its a must!
406551548.author: a TripAdvisor user
406551548.reviewBody: This is the most exciting thing I have seen in Mexico,maybe at all. You see different ages men jumping from a click.The story is interesting, the place-restaurant is nice, and the show is amazing.

403399541.name: Quick, but spectacular
403399541.author: a TripAdvisor user
403399541.reviewBody: This is another "must see" in Acapulco.  These guys do an amazing work at cliff diving.  You must be really passionate to do this or I imagine that it remains within a couple of families as a tradition.  I saw a kid that did not look any older than 12 doing it.  Good performance!

402872391.name: Great to see!!!
402872391.author: a TripAdvisor user
402872391.reviewBody:
Recommended and impresive.

It's is a big performance twice per day! It's a must in acapulco!

Go earlier because it is very crowded

400010065.name: What a show
400010065.author: a TripAdvisor user
400010065.reviewBody: Wow what a spectacular show. You definitely need to arrive early because we went to the last show at 10:30 pm and the little ones can\'t see well because of the amount of crowd you pay 40 per adult and 25 per children.

399985518.name: La Quebrada
399985518.author: a TripAdvisor user
399985518.reviewBody: In this attraction you see people jumping off a clief that is like 30 m tall it is a fasinating and exiting so you shouldn t miss it

398137298.name: La Quebrada beautiful place
398137298.author: a TripAdvisor user
398137298.reviewBody: It\'s a place to have a time to relax and look the beautiful scenario. There you can see the waves shocking on the rocks. It\'s very beautiful.

397419136.name: Cliff Diving
397419136.author: a TripAdvisor user
397419136.reviewBody: A spectacular show which now includes a woman diver as well. She is the daughter of one of the older cliff divers. It\'s one of a kind. The thrill of victory!!

396435867.name: One of the highlights of Acapulco
396435867.author: a TripAdvisor user
396435867.reviewBody: This was one of the highlights of our trip. We were there for the first show of the day (near one o\'clock) and it was great. I would imagine that it would be ever better at the sunset. The youngest diver that day was a nine year old. The entrance fee is forty pesos, and when you leave the divers encourage you to give a tip. The view is beautiful, and it\'s quite impressive to see this first-hand.

396231726.name: Crazy kids
396231726.author: a TripAdvisor user
396231726.reviewBody: I guess when you are in Acapylco you have to see this. It is quite amazing when you see those young men jumping down the cliffs. The full "show" is over after 15 minutes, but it is worth to see it. Entry fee is 40 pesos per person, so not a lot and in my opinion worth the money.

396018845.name: You can\'t visit Acapulco without a trip to La Quebrada!
396018845.author: a TripAdvisor user
396018845.reviewBody: This is one of those iconic activities always shown when you see travel info about Acapulco. And it did not disappoint! It was exciting to watch the divers climb the rocks to the top, and you could feel the tension as they prepared themselves for the dives. A lot of fun.

394874337.name: Awesome
394874337.author: a TripAdvisor user
394874337.reviewBody: The shows that these young men put on is totally awesome. From the smallest to the biggest, these young men do some of the best dives I have seen and off of the cliffs.\nOnce again AWESOME!!!

391330368.name: Beautiful place
391330368.author: a TripAdvisor user
391330368.reviewBody: It\'s a beautiful place to go walk and spend an evening. You can pay to see the divers jump from the cliffs up close or just watch from afar. There are many street vendors to buy food, drinks or souvenirs.

387276415.name: Great Show & Good Food
387276415.author: a TripAdvisor user
387276415.reviewBody: Our guide took us by here to see the show and eat lunch.  Divers jump in on one side, swim across, then climb up 142 feet in nothing but a speedo, and then do flips, tricks, and dive back down in-between massive waves. Lunch is only $15 p/p American and includes one domestic drink as well as chips and salsa.  The wife had the fish tacos and I had the shrimp; but the fish tacos were incredible!  Eating lunch also gets you an amazing view of the show and it\'s in the shade.

387261023.name: Awesome experience
387261023.author: a TripAdvisor user
387261023.reviewBody: Enjoyed very much.  we Watch the divers from the restaurant while eating  A great lunch.  Afterwords we were able to get pictures with the divers   Highly recommend taking in this experience

387113786.name: A paradice  on earth.
387113786.author: a TripAdvisor user
387113786.reviewBody: I was there for 7 days  staying at the crown Plaza A+ and my activities was to see Acapulco. So I went on a sea trip for 3 hours fantastic whith music  a live performance, I discover The baie of Accapulco. After that  I wnt chopping in Acapulco for souvenir what a great day I like barginning whith the local.After that during the week  I saw the festival of music in the streat of Acapulco thousands of student playing music dancing they where from different part of Mexico.The food over there is spicy be careful  one day I was sitting in a terrasse and I saw a couple the young men was trinking  something that attrac me  I ask the server what  is that he say Biere and clamato serve together and I order  one  superbe drink.Every morning I went to sanborn caf\u00e9  near my hotel .Breakfeast is superbe whit pastry in a basquet fresh  a nice caf\u00e9 not to strong I like the place A+ Acapulco in day time is safe  no problem. At night  dont go far from your hotel theres lots of place to enjoy yourself after 2.am be careful  the taxi driver  charge you  3 time the original fare and they say is for your protection. Bad. But for the rest  at Acapulco  very nice. ( for going in acapulco I took  3 planes  the trip took 8 hrs but the waiting 9 hrs sitting inside aeroport to long  and to go back 2 plane 6 hrs flight waiting in Mexico aeroport 10 hrs 45 minutes . There no direct flight . Well Am coming back in Mexico  but am going in Cancun Ottawa direct flight to Cancun  what a relief. coming back to direct flight  whith Westjet.

386936492.name: Worth visiting amazing divers
386936492.author: a TripAdvisor user
386936492.reviewBody: La Quebrada is located in the Old Acapulco it is very easy to access by taxi. There is the public area where you 40 pesos and the restaurant La Perla. If you want to see the divers closer then the public area is the best, if you arrive early you have a great view. Now the restaurant\'s view it further and you can not see the divers when they descend. You can have pictures taken with them. The show at 7:30 allows you to see the sunset from the public area.

383230934.name: Amazing performance
383230934.author: a TripAdvisor user
383230934.reviewBody: We watched the show at 730pm from Mirador restaurant.  You could also choose to pay 40 pesos to stand at the podium just opposite the cliff where they jump.  At the restaurant you pay more for drinks - 180 pesos for 2 drinks including entrance to view the jump.  The view was great also from the restaurant and the performance was great!  started with the introduction of the divers and it was amazing to see how fast they scaled up the cliff to the top point!  You see individual jumps, duo jumps and even trio jumps!  The last diver jumped from the highest point and was the highlight of the show.  Ended within 20mins and when you exit, they stood outside to take photos and collect tips from you.  Worth it!

382893593.name: A must in Acapulco!
382893593.author: a TripAdvisor user
382893593.reviewBody: We watched the night divers show and it\'s a must thing to do when in Acapulco. We watched it from the La Perla restaurant and had a great dinner food (chicken fajitas were amazing). Mind you that there is a cover charge if you want to watch from the restaurant. It\'s $120 pesos which includes a drink. Overall if you are in Acapulco don\'t miss the La Quebrada

382013891.name: eat here if you want to get sick :(
382013891.author: a TripAdvisor user
382013891.reviewBody:
we went back the week after having been here 10 years ago
its is very run down the restaurant was a ghost town
no one eating there but a handful of people.it was pretty sad.
the worst part is my order was given to me wrong 3 times!!!
i sent it back showed him what i wanted point and said it off the menu and wrong again and wouldn't give me a refund!! then gave me a free drink but everyone had eaten already i didn't get to eat at all they never fixed my order! my sister,niece and husband got sick from the food so don't have the fish the chicken was undercooked also i hope they change there ways if they want customers cause it does have the only good thing the cliff divers!!!

381248123.name: Wonderful evening in Acapulco
381248123.author: a TripAdvisor user
381248123.reviewBody: We had a wonderful evening at La Perla watching the Acapulco divers. The cover charge is $120 pesos to get into the restaurant and for one drink. It\'s $180 if you want two drinks. There is a 3 course menu for about $400 pesos per person which includes the cover charge. We paid the $120 each and then ordered off the a la carte menu. Food was fantastic and not too expensive (we got the chicken fajitas to share between two). Divers were impressive. We went around 7:30 and saw both the 7:30 and 8:30 shows. You can stay as long as you want and watch all 4 evening shows if you want to stick around that long. Highly recommend

381136917.name: Cliff Divers
381136917.author: a TripAdvisor user
381136917.reviewBody: As part of our city tour, we went to see the afternoon performance of the cliff divers. There is a restaurant on site and there are packages that include dinner and the evening performance. This without a doubt was the best part of our city tour. These young men are amazing to see. \nThere are many stairs that go down to two different levels to watch the divers. The lower the level the better the view. However, just remember you have to come back up. This may be an issue for some visitors.

380951139.name: Great views bad food
380951139.author: a TripAdvisor user
380951139.reviewBody: It has the best views to see the show (clavadistas),but the food wasn\'t what I expected. First of all it was cold. We orderes the 3 course meal. And you would expect it to be the great, but its nothing special. It waa tasteless I didn\'t even finish it. Maybe order from the menu or just go for drinks and enjoy the show. The show is great!

379608253.name: Do not miss this place!!! Divers are amazing!
379608253.author: a TripAdvisor user
379608253.reviewBody: This was one of my top 3 memories in Acapulco! 40 pesos to watch the show from the observatory; show is more than 10xs the value you pay !!! Enjoy \u2764\ufe0f\ud83c\uddee\ud83c\uddf9\ud83d\ude4f

379509052.name: Defintely a MUST SEE!
379509052.author: a TripAdvisor user
379509052.reviewBody: We viewed the 1st afternoon session for the divers and were amazed and entertained. Had lunch at La Perla while viewing and as part of the city tour hosted by Sebastian Hernandez. Lunch was surprisingly good (shrimp tacos for the adults/burgers for the teens). Several flights of steps with no elevator option for those needing activity info. One of the best activities of our Acapulco trip. Divers came to restaurant afterwards to pose for pictures and to allow for tipping them. I\'m betting the night time dives would also be awesome & would have you on the edge of your seat!

378642198.name: A must see! Can\'t leave Acapulco without seeing the divers!
378642198.author: a TripAdvisor user
378642198.reviewBody: We paid the $120 Pesos to have drinks and seating inside the La Perla restaurant and the view was perfect.  For $40 Pesos you can walk down a long winding staircase and watch the divers up close but since my mom could not walk down all those stairs and back up we chose the the restaurant.  It was totally cheesy experience and fun at the same time.  The divers parade down the long trail of stairs, dive off the side between the viewing area and cliffs.  They then swim over to the cliffs and scale the wall to the top where they do a little prayer and wait for the waves to come back in and dive.  Our whole family loved it and Nana got to take a photo with all the divers who hang outside the restaurant after the show.

377985457.name: Bucket list
377985457.author: a TripAdvisor user
377985457.reviewBody: This is a must do activity.  We went for lunch and saw the divers from above, but the real show is later at night down below.  It is amazing.

377134030.name: Divers Delight
377134030.author: a TripAdvisor user
377134030.reviewBody: We enjoyed the divers show from the bottom of a long steep staircase, later moving halfway up for another angle. They have nerves of steel or are crazy.

377106885.name: Highlight of Acapulco
377106885.author: a TripAdvisor user
377106885.reviewBody: Wow!  These guys are unbelievable.  We went to the 1 pm show and watched from the public viewing area.  I\'m glad we did not watch from La Perla since it\'s really quite far actually from where the divers enter the water.  I think we paid @ $5 each and this was one of the best things we saw in Acapulco!

376286324.name: Dinner at La Quebrada
376286324.author: a TripAdvisor user
376286324.reviewBody: My husband and I went for Dinner at La Quebrada the last night we were in Acapulco after two weeks vacationing there.  The steak we ordered was very good.  The show the Cliff divers gave was excellent.  It was very romantic.

374967914.name: If you go during the day you can shake hands with the divers
374967914.author: a TripAdvisor user
374967914.reviewBody: My understanding is that there is one daytime show. I went the other night and returned today to get better photos. I preferred the nighttime show but it was fun getting photos and meeting the divers!

371888125.name: Sunset Show Was Amazing!
371888125.author: a TripAdvisor user
371888125.reviewBody:
We were brought here by family that live in Acapulco, so we knew this was going to be good before we even got there. Wow, we are so glad we went! Admission for the balcony (non-hotel) that the divers actually enter from is only 40 pesos for adults (cheaper for kids but I don't remember the price), not expensive at all. There is a parking lot with an attendant who will direct you to a space, I honestly cannot remember if we paid to park but I don't feel like we did.

The ticket counter is just past the giant metal statue of a diver and the two cannons, and the prices are posted on a giant banner over the entrance. You buy a ticket and enter, immediately surrendering your ticket to a diver at the entrance. Then there is a trek down a good number of stone stair cases to the viewing platform. Some of the sections of stairs are steep or uneven and are mostly full of people, watch where you are stepping!

This is a beautiful place to take pictures, especially at sunset! If you are taking pictures over the balcony edge (say, of the divers in the water), I would take extra care to hold tight to your phone or camera, people push near the edge a lot.

When the show begins, there is epic music and the divers come down the same staircase you entered from with torches in their hands. They climb down the wall you're standing at, jump in the water, and climb up the huge cliff on the other side. While you are waiting for the diver to reach the cliff on the other side there is an announcer spouting facts about things such as how fast they're going by the time they reach the water. This is awesome unless you don't speak Spanish, because it's all in Spanish.

Once all of the divers are there, they take turns diving. Some dive backwards, some in tandem from different heights, some do somersaults. They are all amazing! If you go after dark, I think it's the 10:30pm show, they dive with the torches in their hands!

Regardless of what time you go, be sure to find a spot to stand early and stand your ground there carefully. I think we were 20 minutes early and there was room to stand by the wall at the front but it filled up quickly. You can only see the divers full descent into the water if you are actually standing by the wall itself.

I would stand a little to the right, closer to the snack stand than the ocean because if you're closer to the ocean, you'll get wet when the divers come back up the wall after their dive. That's right, they jump in right by you and come back out right by you, no special backstage entrance here!

People will try to push their way around you to the wall, I was stepped on by a local who thought I would move away because I'm a little white girl. I'll say again, be careful!

After the show the divers have a bag for tips and they stand on the stairs as you exit by them. Some of them are available for photos there if you want one.

There are food vendors and souvenir shops near the entrance and throughout the parking lot if you get hungry or thirsty. There is even a table where you can pick a shell or plate and have it painted with a scene of the divers right there in front of you. We waited 10 minutes for one of these and only paid about 3 USD for it. They wrap your item in plastic wrap so it can continue drying and then again in another plastic bag so you can carry it.

There is also a public bathroom right by the ticket counter, but just like any other public bathroom in that area, there is no toilet paper, and there is a lady sitting outside the bathroom who will ask you for 5 pesos in exchange for a good handful of it. I personally always carry wipes in my bag and do not pay to use the restroom, but they will totally give you dirty looks and talk about you if you turn them down. Your choice.

PROS:
Amazing show, amazing view, great photo op, cheap admission, food and drink available, souvenirs available, easy parking

CONS:
Steep stair climb down and back up, pushy audience, fun facts are all in Spanish

Overall we really enjoyed ourselves! We are planning to go back every time we visit and will definitely be bringing friends and family!

371610737.name: Cliff Divers
371610737.author: a TripAdvisor user
371610737.reviewBody: The food was okay, but watching the cliff divers was amazing!  By going in the daytime, I could really see them jump in the water, swim to the other side, climb the wall and prepare for their dives.  Afterwards, they were eager to sign autographs and take pictures.

370113887.name: Cliff Divers
370113887.author: a TripAdvisor user
370113887.reviewBody: The cliff divers were amazing...what we could see. We were in the restaurant at night. The food was excellent!

369920701.name: Must see
369920701.author: a TripAdvisor user
369920701.reviewBody: Excellent show. Did the 1 PM show with lunch, ate at La Pearla. Great food great view. Get there early and get a good seat. You will not be disappointed.

367409673.name: Great Divers
367409673.author: a TripAdvisor user
367409673.reviewBody: Really enjoyed the Divers\' Show. Short (about 15 minute show). Was very hot and there isn\'t any shade. Many stairs so if you have problems walking, I don\'t recommend you walk down the many many stairs.

366874394.name: Great view
366874394.author: a TripAdvisor user
366874394.reviewBody: Good place to stare at the sea, the show if the divers too. The shows are at 7pm, 8pm and 9pm. There is a small area full of small booths with vendors selling beautiful art pieces from clay dishes and monuments to food. And lots of taxis to take you back to your hotel.

364697979.name: Spectacular Night Show.
364697979.author: a TripAdvisor user
364697979.reviewBody: Skip the "package" and order off the regular menu! Excellent service and we watched 2and a half diving shows.

364230435.name: A must see
364230435.author: a TripAdvisor user
364230435.reviewBody: We came to see a 1pm showing and arrived about 12.40pm and paid 40 pesos each to stand right across from the cliffs. It was hot and sunny and we wanted to keep our places at the front so didn\'t want to move to shade, so bring a hat and a drink! Watching the divers so closely was an incredible experience, they are so daring, it was so tense and we could not take our eyes off them. We were pretty much shocked the whole time. Really really worth a visit. Other than attending a wedding we had specifically come to Acapulco for this was definitely the highlight of our trip.

363721732.name: La Quebrada divers
363721732.author: a TripAdvisor user
363721732.reviewBody: We walked through the city to the headland where La Quebrada hosts the divers. We went to the 1pm dive which had about 5 divers, the youngest of whom was 15 years old, and had been training since he was 8 years old. I was very moved by the simple prayers the divers did before their dangerous dives.

362585521.name: You just have to see this.
362585521.author: a TripAdvisor user
362585521.reviewBody: The Acapulco Cliff Divers were the attraction on the first-ever episode of ABC\'s Wide World of Sports, 55 years ago. They are no less spectacular today. Personally, I find the barefoot climb up the cliff from the water more miraculous the the dive itself, and when you see these divers up close, it is amazing to see how lean they are, and the wide range of ages. If you get a chance (not necessarily on the same trip), see them from land and see them another time from a boat. Especially from land, go at night cuz the sun is brutal (and the dives in the dark is just that much more amazing!

361151078.name: Cliff divers
361151078.author: a TripAdvisor user
361151078.reviewBody: We saw this as part of a city tour and although I was some what sceptical it ended up being very enjoyable. Our driver indicated he thinks the best viewing was from one of the restaurants at the top, and cool off a bit and have a nice lunch. The view was amazing and we also got a chuckle out of the boats that come roaring up at the last minute to watch the divers. Sitting at this location. Gave us terrific viewing of the divers sailing through the air. Nice way to spend an hour or two.

360719732.name: Brave Divers
360719732.author: a TripAdvisor user
360719732.reviewBody: These people are amazing, I saw a kid jump of a cliff in the water. nothing but respect for these jumpers....

360491954.name: Right on top of the tiny cove, and the divers!
360491954.author: a TripAdvisor user
360491954.reviewBody: If you are not a sufferer of vertigo, you will really enjoy these divers making their cliff dives into the ocean swells below. They actually learn to time their jump and their impact with the rise and fall of the water that surges back and forth in the cove. Pretty amazing to watch!

359446918.name: Cliff Divers....Awesome!!!
359446918.author: a TripAdvisor user
359446918.reviewBody: We traveled to see the cliff divers on day 3 of our trip and we were completely astounded by how agile the divers were climbing up the side of the cliffs to their diving positions and then how graceful the were actually diving. It was quite a site.

358837935.name: Exciting
358837935.author: a TripAdvisor user
358837935.reviewBody: So much more impressive than watching it on a film or on TV, absolutely thrilling.\nThere are lot of stairs to get right down to the bottom but we had a great view from near the top.

358747798.name: cliff divers
358747798.author: a TripAdvisor user
358747798.reviewBody: see the drives by day and night.  get there early and pick your spot.  skip the junk they sell and buy post cards of them in the air.

356923479.name: Watching the cliff divers
356923479.author: a TripAdvisor user
356923479.reviewBody: Very exciting to watch these young men climb up the rocks and dive into the writhing water! Very brave young men.

356841320.name: Definitely worth seeing!
356841320.author: a TripAdvisor user
356841320.reviewBody: I enjoyed seeing the divers.  If you\'ve never been, it is definitely something to include in your plans.  Once you\'ve seen it, you probably won\'t need to see it again.

356806178.name: pleasant end to our city tour
356806178.author: a TripAdvisor user
356806178.reviewBody: Nice lunch, great margarita, fun to watch the divers. Enjoyed the signature wall full of old Hollywood legends.

356725349.name: Wow! The divers are brave!
356725349.author: a TripAdvisor user
356725349.reviewBody: I visited this attraction several years ago, made very more famous by the Elvis film \'Fun in Acapulco. I am pleased I have seen this attraction, beautiful scenery & brave divers.

356494084.name: Awsome for Grandsons
356494084.author: a TripAdvisor user
356494084.reviewBody: Went during the day, had refreshments in the restaurant, saw many divers, an amazing experience. Grandsons will never forget.

356026677.name: A piece of movie history
356026677.author: a TripAdvisor user
356026677.reviewBody: Arrive early and go to the restaurant right in front of La Quebrada to have a great view of the divers. The spectacle is great and amusing. Don\'t expect a fancy restaurant, it is very simple but quite enjoyable.

355758354.name: Daredevil divers
355758354.author: a TripAdvisor user
355758354.reviewBody: We saw the divers from the Mirador Hotel but when you see them from La Quebrada you realize how dangerous the dive really is.  The divers earn their living from the entrance fee, so please do not begrudge them this money.

355616044.name: Amazing
355616044.author: a TripAdvisor user
355616044.reviewBody:
That 's  an amazing show
The guys jump from a mountain to the beach.
Incredible! 
The Night show is more beautiful !

355090683.name: The Famous Cliff Divers
355090683.author: a TripAdvisor user
355090683.reviewBody: This is one of those tourist attractions that is a must to see... everyone goes here on their visit to Acapulco. But with that said, it is overpriced, the lunch we ate while waiting for the "10 minute show" to begin was probably the worst meal we had while staying in Acapulco, and the divers hover around you, waiting for their tip afterwards. Glad I went so that I never have to do it again.

354486704.name: Must do
354486704.author: a TripAdvisor user
354486704.reviewBody: Had been many years ago and viewed by boat.  Went by private car this trip at night.   Lots and lots of stairs so keep that in mind if your just going to pay the $40 peso to view.

353941600.name: Cliff Diving Show
353941600.author: a TripAdvisor user
353941600.reviewBody: Be prepared to traverse a LOT of stairs unless you watch from the hotel.  I\'m glad we watched from the platform below, but I had to stop a couple of times to catch my breath!

353650412.name: Amazing divers
353650412.author: a TripAdvisor user
353650412.reviewBody: We have seen the show at all times of the day and night. The best show is the last one, where they turn out all the lights and dive with torches. A must see if you are in Acapulco!!

353174510.name: Not for someone that has a hard time walking
353174510.author: a TripAdvisor user
353174510.reviewBody: We went about 1/2 way down and could gone all the way down but would still be down their because would not be able to make it back up

353083699.name: One of the things to do in Acapulco!
353083699.author: a TripAdvisor user
353083699.reviewBody: World famous cliff divers, had to see! We had to wait for some time in very hot temperatures for the divers to prepare but it was worth it. Divers are all ages and dive from various heights off the cliff face. There are two main viewing areas outside and also from the hotel. We walked down the 70 steps to the lower level where the divers accessed the cliff. It was amazing to watch them climb the cliff bare foot yet alone dive off it! They then return to the top of the steps looking for tips.I am pleased I saw it for myself in reality.

352525991.name: Dinner and Dive best show at 2130
352525991.author: a TripAdvisor user
352525991.reviewBody: The best dive show is at 2130...they use torches. We ate at the Hotel mirador (optional) all tables have spectacular views. The meal was a prefixed 3 course menu, and saw two shows while we ate. Food is good but not delicious. Purchased an optional photo for 100 pesos and took pictures with the divers after dinner for a tip.

352497263.name: Cliff divers.
352497263.author: a TripAdvisor user
352497263.reviewBody: Worth the visit. Spectacular dives! Young men apparently train for years, starting with Olympic high fives in a pool. Beautiful cliff location. Interesting drive to the dive location through back streets of old Acapulco.

352252594.name: Amazing Divers
352252594.author: a TripAdvisor user
352252594.reviewBody: I went to La Quebrada as part of a shore excursion from Acapulco.  We had seats in one of the local restaurants so the view was just perfect and we could wait in comfort for the show.  The divers climb up the rock face with bare feet, pray and then take their turns diving off the rock into the water.   Just before the divers starting diving off the rock some large speed boats showed up to get a closer look.  it was interesting just how close these boats got to the divers.  \n\nAfter the show some of the divers came to the restaurant so we were able to see them up close and give them some tips.  I would definitely recommend this as one of the things to do in Acapulco.

351364343.name: Time Travel
351364343.author: a TripAdvisor user
351364343.reviewBody:
I took a Peruvian friend to do "something you must do in Acapulco"
Obvious choice La Quebrada.

Over the years I have come to see the fearless divers that need to time their jump perfectly so the right depth is waiting for them when they reach the water surface. They must jump when there is little water below, talk about valor and a little bit of craziness.

My dad took me here, I took my kids and so many other people. 

The feeling is always the same, amazement, wonder and sadly, a sense that this could be much better if the setup around the area would be better maintained.

It's a shame that this been a world class experience, second to none, the place is not as clean as it could be and there are way to many street vendors.

Some people would like this saying its its character and probably is but still, it could be in better shape and not loose it's soul.

351198409.name: A must, once in a lifetime
351198409.author: a TripAdvisor user
351198409.reviewBody: I took my teenage kids and smal children (2-3 years old) everybody enjoyed the divers show.\nDives start st 1 pm, 7 pm and 8.\nPrices 40 pesos adult, 20 kids.

349843210.name: Fearless Divers
349843210.author: a TripAdvisor user
349843210.reviewBody:
You couldn't visit Acapulco and NOT go to view the cliff divers.  Seems I have heard about them my whole life, my daughter was amazed by that.  

What surprised me was how young these fellows are, some had braces on their teeth.  They are so cute and so sweet when they come up to the platform to meet the viewers.  Of course they collect their tips but they are not pushy at all.  You can take photos of them if you like and they will willingly pose with you.

I would recommend going in the evening, as it is very hot and sunny during the afternoon.  The shows can vary in the number of dives that are performed.  We walked up from the zocalo, otherwise it is a quick cab ride.

349785934.name: Nothing like it!
349785934.author: a TripAdvisor user
349785934.reviewBody: How do you describe the amazing feat of scaling a rock face barefoot and then diving into the uncertain waters below?!  Graceful, stunning, crazy!  We ate at La Perla Restaurant and were able to just turn our chairs to see two complete well-lit evening shows.  The 3-course meal was $400 pesos, including 2 drinks.  Good food in a cliff side setting, and a decent value we thought.

349487216.name: It was okay..
349487216.author: a TripAdvisor user
349487216.reviewBody: Day was hot so made standing there waiting for the divers a little uncomfortable. Views amazing. Lots of steps to get to the best spot to watch the divers.\nDiving show Okay. As soon as they hit the water they are up for tips..it\'s cool..they deserve them. Lots of hawkers around including kids can be overwhelming.

348942587.name: Gorgeous, Fun!
348942587.author: a TripAdvisor user
348942587.reviewBody: Beautifully scenic and fun! Many steps down to get close to divers, or there are a few chairs under shade just a little way down the steps, near the toilets. Be sure to tip the divers - only the most experienced get wages from the entry fees. A fun excursion!

348327207.name: amazing people with heart
348327207.author: a TripAdvisor user
348327207.reviewBody: These young men put a show on worth seeing, every dive is worthy of seeing, they put themselves at risk every show ,one mistake would be fatal as there is no safety net.

347905899.name: Amazing view!!
347905899.author: a TripAdvisor user
347905899.reviewBody: Went to see the cliff divers as part of a Sunwing excursion. Great show!! Something I wanted to see all my life and wasn\'t dissapointed! Would recommend!

347267817.name: Great show, excellent meal.
347267817.author: a TripAdvisor user
347267817.reviewBody: 3 couples went to dinner and watch the cliff do version, we had a blast. We each had the pre-fix menu which included 3 courses for $25.00 each plus tip. It also included 2 drinks per person. Everyone\'s meals were excellent, the service was good and the divers were incredible.

347011140.name: Breathtaking
347011140.author: a TripAdvisor user
347011140.reviewBody: Watching the cliff divers (we watched from the restaurant at the top of the cliff) is really a thrill. It\'s a short but impressive show.

346484472.name: Wow...must see :-)
346484472.author: a TripAdvisor user
346484472.reviewBody: A breath - taking experience. We loved it. Best at the night, with fire show. Be careful about pocket thief /sorry, don\u00a8t know if it"s right in English/

346436816.name: Watching the five cliff divers was interesting.
346436816.author: a TripAdvisor user
346436816.reviewBody: Young boys dive a few hundred feet to the ocean below. They take their time to dive when the waves come into the passage way for their safety.

346252072.name: Amazing, loved it
346252072.author: a TripAdvisor user
346252072.reviewBody: My husband and I loved this and were so glad we stopped off to see the clavadistas here in acapulco. We had lunch at the restaurant which included the viewing platform which others say is a rip off but the food was good and we had a great uncrowded viewing point. The place was pretty empty, it all feels like the hey-day has long gone but that doesn\'t take away from the daredevil feat of diving into a rocky ravine with not a lot of water at the bottom! Have read here that on occasions the divers have prepared and not dived so can only assume it was deemed too dangerous on that occasion - very disappointing to those waiting but rather that than a death i would have thought.  We chatted to some of the divers after and were very impressed at the organisation - they obviously do treat it as a serious job and have to be acknowledged (and tipped!) for what they do. Well worth it we thought.

346248046.name: Divers
346248046.author: a TripAdvisor user
346248046.reviewBody: Visited here to watch the famous diver of Acapulco.\nVery reasonable for drinks and lunch and to watch the divers.\nHave to visit her if you are in Acapulco

346247685.name: Always a great show
346247685.author: a TripAdvisor user
346247685.reviewBody: Took a taxi from the hotel, $100 pesos, $40 pesos entrance fee, midweek night show is better, it is not crowded.

345743071.name: Amazing and terrifying. And you can meet the guys afterwards!
345743071.author: a TripAdvisor user
345743071.reviewBody: Amazing view, the diving show is spectacular. A must see while you are in Acapulco. You should definitely talk to the divers afterwards. Ask them how many injuries they\'ve had.

345283715.name: Not worth a special visit but it should be in tour Acapulco bucket list
345283715.author: a TripAdvisor user
345283715.reviewBody: Visited here as it was on my list of must see places, you cant visit Acapulco unless you do so ! Show was ok if a kittle drawn out , 45 minutes to see 5 divers is a little excessive. Divers where ok but nothing that impressive. Be warned, you will most likely be hassles to purchase t shirts by the divers and hassled again when you leave by street vendors outside.

345278418.name: It was good but lacked a little something
345278418.author: a TripAdvisor user
345278418.reviewBody: I was always told you couldn\'t visit Acapulco without seeing the cliff diving. The divers were good however it was a little boring. The show was dragged out quite a lot with not much really happening. I am pleased that I went as it\'s a part of visiting Acapulco but I wouldn\'t go again.

344601712.name: Crazy!!!
344601712.author: a TripAdvisor user
344601712.reviewBody: This is fascinating, and it is amazing the precision with which they must dive.  A must see while in Acapulco.  We also ate lunch at the restaurant there, and it was delicious.

343766870.name: Amazing Pacific ocean view
343766870.author: a TripAdvisor user
343766870.reviewBody: Cliff divers, great icecream, amazing view, weather, only 40 pesos to see the show. If you are in Acapulco you must come here.

343686033.name: Worth Viewing
343686033.author: a TripAdvisor user
343686033.reviewBody: Got to the viewing section at 12:50pm on a Sunday for the 1:15pm show. We were lucky to get a viewing spot. Better to get their early enough to be able to stand as close to the wall to see when the diver hits the water. Otherwise you will only be able to see from anywhere them diving off the cliff but not when they touch the water. It was also interesting how they maneuver climbing up the cliff to get to the top. At the end of the show they are at the top where you entered holding a plastic bag to put tips in. I put in 20 pesos.

343680152.name: A classic.
343680152.author: a TripAdvisor user
343680152.reviewBody: Have dinner at La Perla. Live music, good food and an excelent view of the cliff divers. Watching the divers at night is bretahtaking... simply a must.

341329955.name: Half the fun is watching them climb the cliff
341329955.author: a TripAdvisor user
341329955.reviewBody: It\'s a lot of waiting to see a half dozen dives.  Certainly brave young men, but sort of like watching Evel Knievel.  BTW, there is no need to go to the restaurant with their $15USD cover for two drinks.  For 40 pesos (+50 peso tip to the divers), or $6, you can walk down, and back up, 250 steps and be right on top of the action.

340760455.name: Great show but a bit short
340760455.author: a TripAdvisor user
340760455.reviewBody:
Second time seeing. First time in 2012, and it was a 20 minute performance. In January 2016, the performers jumped/dove only three times but it was a Wednesday night with only a few spectators.Watched both times from La Perla restaurant. Paid $30 pesos per person for entry, which included a free drink. You can also watch the show for free from a platform a few dozen steps down a hill. 

The divers are pretty brave and deserve the tips they ask for at the end of the show. Keep some pesos in a pocket separate from your wallet to tip the divers without baring all your cash. If they see it, they will ask for it.

Neighborhood near La Quebrada is slightly less safe than other areas so ask your taxi driver to wait - they don't use rate meters in Acapulco and cabbies will quote you a fixed price ahead of time. We paid approximately $20 USD/400 pesos for most taxi rides, regardless how far we traveled. The cabbie often offered to wait for us while we dined or shopped and didn't charge anything additional. We tipped them well for looking after us.

340716750.name: Great show!
340716750.author: a TripAdvisor user
340716750.reviewBody: If you are visiting Acapulco this is the attraction you must see! Impressive diving! Great iconic location

339966056.name: FEARLESS DIVERS
339966056.author: a TripAdvisor user
339966056.reviewBody:
We chose to pay the extra money to eat in the restaurant and watch the show from that vantage point.

We ordered 10 minutes before the show was to begin.  The diving did not begin until 30 minutes later.

We enjoyed the diving experience, but the service at the restaurant was terrible even though there were very few guests.  We did not get our drinks until the show was almost over.  The food came later, after the performance.

339812551.name: where to go!
339812551.author: a TripAdvisor user
339812551.reviewBody: A real show, difficult to find in the city! The swimmers are amazing! The place is a little bit old fashioned.

339774680.name: Wotherspoon seing.
339774680.author: a TripAdvisor user
339774680.reviewBody: Th\u00e9 best place to Watch the show is at the restaurant facing the cliff. For 220 pesos you can have a lunch ( fish is very good ) and a drink and see the divers. Go during the week for the 1 o\'clock show. That way you get first row.

339726812.name: Cliff Divers
339726812.author: a TripAdvisor user
339726812.reviewBody: This has always been a highkight of Acapulco. The skill of these divers, who have been training from very young age, is amazing

338964521.name: Show
338964521.author: a TripAdvisor user
338964521.reviewBody: I have been to This location three ways... The first from the belvedere, the second by boat, the third the restaurant La Perla! All three experiences were worth it. From the belvedere, the divers walk by you, cute guys... From the boat, they swim to you for money, cute guys but soaked lol, third from the restaurant, fun and enjoying a meal.

338283088.name: Interesting
338283088.author: a TripAdvisor user
338283088.reviewBody: Been many times. Been in the day and at night. I prefer day as you can see more. At night they dive with the torches. Take house guests when they visit. Unbelievable how they do what they do--and only for tips.

337669846.name: Neat to see
337669846.author: a TripAdvisor user
337669846.reviewBody: really interesting place.  It is good to see once but not twice.  you need to cab it there and back.  I is located in the older part of town and caution should be used.  go at night.  You pay an admission fee, but the ticket is worth a beverage.  the divers meet you at the end of the show and for a fee you can take a picture.

337548576.name: A Must Attraction!!!!!
337548576.author: a TripAdvisor user
337548576.reviewBody: This is definitely a MUST attraction when visiting Acapulco!!! The divers put on an amazing show day and night!! I do recommend going in the even, it\'s beautiful and of course less hot;)!! Great family event. You should GO!!

337056409.name: A must see
337056409.author: a TripAdvisor user
337056409.reviewBody: Amazing show....simply incredible. Daring divers will take ur breath away. You cannot visit Acapulco without going to the Quebrada.  Elvis Prestley filmed \'fun in Acapulco\' there!

336821801.name: Very skilled divers
336821801.author: a TripAdvisor user
336821801.reviewBody: We took a tour from our hotel to view the diving.  While it was an amazing display of talent and daring it was not worth paying the $15 usd we paid to have a seat at the hotel and watch.  They said it was a 30 minute show.  Well, they dived six times in all.  Again, amazing but not what I would have described as a show and not worth the money.  Would have been better to pay for the cheap viewing platform which I think was 40 Pesos.

336273102.name: Amazing!!
336273102.author: a TripAdvisor user
336273102.reviewBody: This is another attraction that have decades in Acapulco, if you don\'t visit it is like you never been here! These guys climbed all the way to the top to dive; they just follow theirs senses to see when is the right time to jump, if they make a small mistake can died instantly! The only payment they get is the tips from the public and the big applause, so when you come think about how risky this job is. The fee that you pay is for maintaining  and conservation of the premises. The diver or Clavadistas appreciate even a small coin. Taxi cabs can give you a lift for 3-4 dollars. A lot of Mexican curious and food, you will get a good time, enjoy it!!

335208001.name: Evening view of the divers was excellent we were at the 8:30pm show
335208001.author: a TripAdvisor user
335208001.reviewBody: Ticket price 40 pesos each. We were able to stand in the handicap area as there were few people. This area has an excellent view without the stairs but maybe not always available. The parking was filled and we were happy we took a taxi.

334992165.name: SUCH A HOT SHOW
334992165.author: a TripAdvisor user
334992165.reviewBody: This is a good place to visit during your stay in Acapulco. It is always impressive both the place and how brave the divers are.

334598259.name: If you visit Acapulco the Cliff divers is a must see.
334598259.author: a TripAdvisor user
334598259.reviewBody: Acapulco is mostly visited by Mexican people, some Americans because a lot are worried about safety. Perfectly save resort, particular if you stay in hotels at the edge of the city.

334219804.name: Exciting to see!
334219804.author: a TripAdvisor user
334219804.reviewBody: We sat  in the restaurant at the cliff, great view spot! We had some drinks while waiting for the divers to start. I really enjoyed it! it was crazy! the water was anything but calm! they had to time their jumps  to avoid injury! As we left the restaurant the divers young and old were waiting outside for their tips. I think they earned it :)

333797562.name: I have always wanted to see this and I was not disappointed
333797562.author: a TripAdvisor user
333797562.reviewBody: The diving show is quite short so don\'t be late.  The diving is very impressive, but I was amazed at how fast they can climb up the cliffs.  Be prepared to give them a few pesos, they deserve it.

333785582.name: Short, but good!
333785582.author: a TripAdvisor user
333785582.reviewBody: It is definitely a must do, but don\'t expect a big show. 5 to 10 divers (young and old, skinny and fat) climb the ledge and perform the dangerous dive. It\'s a great tradition and worth while. There are many "shows" during the day, so pick one according to your itinerary and get there early to get the best views. There is also a night show which makes it more amazing.

333359268.name: Must see!
333359268.author: a TripAdvisor user
333359268.reviewBody: The men that dive from these cliffs are brave. The night dive is better to see as they really light the place up!

332550611.name: Crazy people
332550611.author: a TripAdvisor user
332550611.reviewBody: Awe inspiring show in a great location at the restaurant on the cliff.  Price included two drinks, on the shaded balcony and the view was breath taking.

332368430.name: Cliff divers!
332368430.author: a TripAdvisor user
332368430.reviewBody: Very amazing.  I wouldn\'t think of doing that, but I loved watching them. Sat in restaurant sipping virgin daiquiris.  What fun!

332297890.name: Of course, a must see...
332297890.author: a TripAdvisor user
332297890.reviewBody: Our driver Roberto Alarcon, got us the best seat in the house. The food at La Perla Restaurant was delicious. We had a few choices and we picked the fish fillet and it was delicious. We even got a picture with the cliff divers!

331899637.name: NICE ENTERTAINING SHOW
331899637.author: a TripAdvisor user
331899637.reviewBody: It is so fun to see how the little kids dive into the ocean! And the professionals al awesome! \nIt is better than circ do solei

330072056.name: Amazing place
330072056.author: a TripAdvisor user
330072056.reviewBody: I came back to this fabulous place and still find it so interesting watching these guys making that dive.

329846256.name: Dive!
329846256.author: a TripAdvisor user
329846256.reviewBody: To watch these guys is one of the only free things available in Acapulco. Well worth the visit. Athletic young men risking everything then climbing back up the rocks like Elvis. \nChill, relax, enjoy. Then wonder if you could do it yourself.........................?

329614347.name: A show you should not miss
329614347.author: a TripAdvisor user
329614347.reviewBody: Going to La Quebrada is a must when in Acapulco. Very traditional feat from very brave men. You will continue to talk about this for days.

329281291.name: No old ladies please !
329281291.author: a TripAdvisor user
329281291.reviewBody: My wife appeared to be far more interested in the muscular toned fine young men diving , top effort and a thrilling site, tip generously please it\'s how they earn a living.

328619878.name: The Cliff Divers!
328619878.author: a TripAdvisor user
328619878.reviewBody: Very cool you have to do it. One afternoon show at 1pm. The show is pretty fast 30 minutes or so, don\'t be late.

327271106.name: One of the most amazing feats you\'ll ever see!
327271106.author: a TripAdvisor user
327271106.reviewBody: The cliff jumping in Acapulco is a must-see! I have seen it both from the land, and from a boat at sea.In either case, these young people are in amazing physical form and will amaze you as they leap off the cliffs and scurry back up the rocks to go again!

326558045.name: Worth the Trip
326558045.author: a TripAdvisor user
326558045.reviewBody: The divers have been doing this for decades and it is definitely something to see in Acapulco.  The daytime (1:30pm) show is more worthwhile than an evening shows (7:30pm and 8:30 pm), although we didn\'t go to the 10:30 finale where they dive with torches.  Each show is different with 5 or 6 divers; usually only 1 from the highest point.  The angle of view is better if you pay the extra few pesos to watch from the bar/restaurant.  You will be asked for a donation to the divers when you leave but still well worth it.

326244253.name: WORTH IT
326244253.author: a TripAdvisor user
326244253.reviewBody: If you would like to see 4 to 6 men arrive by water and scale the rocks and then dive- this is definitely for you.

325153586.name: Astonishing
325153586.author: a TripAdvisor user
325153586.reviewBody: Very nice  spot,  with parking lot. The view area amazing. I wish I could jump from there like the native ones.

324517569.name: Incredible!
324517569.author: a TripAdvisor user
324517569.reviewBody: We watched from the hotel overlooking the divers - for 5 pesos you can buy a ticket to their patio and it comes with two drinks. The divers make almost all of their income from admission and tips - on the way out, they waited in their swimsuits to talk to visitors. It was worth the trek!

324487043.name: Stunning
324487043.author: a TripAdvisor user
324487043.reviewBody: The drivers are unbelievable. There is a great viewing area/accommodation for people unable to walk down the steps. Divers are phenomenal!

323784943.name: cliff divers
323784943.author: a TripAdvisor user
323784943.reviewBody: 6 Divers climb the rocks like goats before leaping off the rock face some 40 mtrs high and into only 4 mtrs deep water

323784484.name: A death-defying Mexican tradition right in front of your eyes
323784484.author: a TripAdvisor user
323784484.reviewBody: The cliff diving itself is truly spectacular and even more impressive to see it live than in the many quintessential Acapulco promotional photos. The people who manage the venue as a tourist attraction really need to invest in a sound/light system from this century, but their deficiencies, while distracting, are not enough to detract from the 5 star rating so well deserved by the divers

323775970.name: Don\'t go at night to LA PERLA
323775970.author: a TripAdvisor user
323775970.reviewBody:
Without doubt the Acapulco Cliff Divers have been one of the most renowned attractions of that Mexican City and many of us remember those old Hollywood black- and-white movies where the protagonists are sitting at LA PERLA having their cocktails and watching the cliffdivers' show. But that's the past and Hollywood.
Today everything seems to be quite commercial and disappointing.
Sure - those young men still do a great job risking their lives and pleasing the tourists. But if you go to LA PERLA at night you will not see much of them because with the spare light and the color of their bodies resembling the color of the rocks you may have difficulties to really see the show very well- let alone take some pictures.
So go there in the afternoon and try to get a good  view from the platform below.

323253453.name: Excellent lunch and view of the cliff divers
323253453.author: a TripAdvisor user
323253453.reviewBody: Our guide, Baldo Gomez made arrangements for us to have lunch and watch the cliff divers. The food was excellent at the restaurant where we sat to watch.

323199745.name: Cliff Divers Ravine
323199745.author: a TripAdvisor user
323199745.reviewBody: We went here for the 7.30pm cliff divers show which is a must see whilst in Acapulco. It is a lovely place in the evening and the divers are amazing

322739595.name: Impressive
322739595.author: a TripAdvisor user
322739595.reviewBody: Even though it was not as spectacular in real life as it can be shown on TV or in movies, it was still impressive. Main dangers seem to be ensuring enough forward distance to clear the cliff face and only diving when the channel has enough water depth. Will leave it to them

320544077.name: Fearless divers!
320544077.author: a TripAdvisor user
320544077.reviewBody: We\'ve been here several years ago to watch the cliff divers and were very impressed. It was just as spectacular this time around! They put on a very good show. The young men pray next to the little chapel on the cliff before each dive. At the end of the show, they come up to the viewing platform so you can meet them and make a donation. \n\nWe went to the 1pm show and it was incredibly crowded. Find out the times they dive in advance so as not to be disappointed in missing the dives. The area is very pretty and picturesque but the show is a must see in Acapulco!

319963246.name: Great Show, a must see!
319963246.author: a TripAdvisor user
319963246.reviewBody: The show was amazing, I went to the 930 pm show and paid a little more to watch it from the restaurant; the view was amazing and so was the weather.

319250120.name: Enjoyed lunch and a show, was in our top five favorites of Acapulco
319250120.author: a TripAdvisor user
319250120.reviewBody:
Lunch and show package is priced okay. Lunch was okay, service outstanding, and outdoor seating was very comfortable. 

We arrived an hour before show and got the best seat in house. If your don't order lunch you sit in the peanut gallery.

Show was pretty good, but 25 minutes late and lasted actually about 20 minutes. IS still worth going. Is good for families, couples or loaning it. 

Divers wanted tips after the show, was kind ambushed upon exit.

318117838.name: A must see when in Acapulco!
318117838.author: a TripAdvisor user
318117838.reviewBody: A must see when in Acapulco! These young men are so brave and put on a wonderful show. Find out the times and get there early to get a better place to view.

317609063.name: Iconic location. You will hold your breath in awe ( and fear)!
317609063.author: a TripAdvisor user
317609063.reviewBody: Great iconic location. Excellent by day and night. Get there early and get a great spot. Or take a drink in the nearby hotel overlooking the cove. Awesome by day and magical by night.

315679117.name: LA QUEBRADA WATCH THE DIVERS  DIVE
315679117.author: a TripAdvisor user
315679117.reviewBody: When in Acapulco this is a must for every one,visited a while back.. It was fantastic to see these brave divers dive so far above the sea.

315621987.name: A must see in Aca
315621987.author: a TripAdvisor user
315621987.reviewBody: just do it! awesome spectacle, really worth the trip. we went to the lunch time show, not sure if the evening one would be more spectacular....                                      \n

314456750.name: A must see for Acapulco
314456750.author: a TripAdvisor user
314456750.reviewBody: If you stand at the border of a 12 story building, you will feel what these divers may feel before jumping in to the abyss. Not for nothing La Quebrda divers are renown around the world, watching them jump of the cliff is a must see.

311396293.name: Guts
311396293.author: a TripAdvisor user
311396293.reviewBody: It was a sight to see.  To jump off that cliff takes more guts than I will ever have....makes me wonder how they "work up to it".

310360490.name: You must go, that\'s an order.
310360490.author: a TripAdvisor user
310360490.reviewBody: Watching this is incredible because it\'s not only a matter of diving. You see these guys (I don\'t think they are older than 25) to climb this massive cliff Wall, and then just jump it like is a flight of stairs. \n\nYou pay $30 pesos to park and $40 peson per person to go down to the diving site. We averaged like $5 dollars per person. Well worth it.

308711108.name: the classic Acapulco cliff divers
308711108.author: a TripAdvisor user
308711108.reviewBody: the cliff divers are now young teens who dare jump from the cliff into the turbulent waters\nthe cheaper way to watch the divers is from the view deck across from the cliff

307860819.name: Excitement! Friendliness! Happiness!
307860819.author: a TripAdvisor user
307860819.reviewBody: La Quebrada a really beautiful exciting friendly world heritage site as per our evaluation - safe and secure for children- revealing!awesome! Be there for the scheduled dives - el mirador restaurant - exciting dining!

307633348.name: OLD SCHOOL ACAPULCO
307633348.author: a TripAdvisor user
307633348.reviewBody: Old School Acapulco.  Must see.  Divers are pretty brave dudes. I ate at a restaurant that has views of the diving area.  It was OK but did offer the best views.  Don\'t forget to tip the divers.  They surely won\'t forget to ask.

305928729.name: Cliff Divers
305928729.author: a TripAdvisor user
305928729.reviewBody: It was amazing watching the dives scale the rocks and then dive into the water.  Boats from the ocean kept coming in too close to where the divers jump, so divers had to wait for them to move.  Each diver, and there were six, only dove one time, so I was a little disappointed that the show was so short!

303516745.name: Ocean with fire
303516745.author: a TripAdvisor user
303516745.reviewBody: Get there early and enjoy the show in the la perla restaurant.. thats the best way to see the show. I recommend the 10pm diving show because they have ^antorchas`^ with real fire as they dive into the ocean.

303100993.name: Men with a lot of courage...
303100993.author: a TripAdvisor user
303100993.reviewBody: As most of the reviews said, it\'s a cheap car park, 3 minute walk down, you will find around 3 to 4 jumps and the boys that do it, do a great job

301555435.name: Tourist trap
301555435.author: a TripAdvisor user
301555435.reviewBody: While interesting, you would be better off finding an old episode of Wide World of Sports to get a better view. The only vantage point was from within the bar/restaurant, and they were more concerned about selling drinks (of course). Can\'t blame them, but don\'t plan on just being able to see the cliff divers for the cost of admission.

299676059.name: Hard to find and park near but cheap and fun
299676059.author: a TripAdvisor user
299676059.reviewBody: Cheap 25 peso beers and a 20 minute show of cliff diving. If you can find the place take a look, maybe even stay for the last show with torches. Then move on, fun and cheap but nothing special

298570874.name: Amazing Divers!
298570874.author: a TripAdvisor user
298570874.reviewBody: The divers at La Quebrada were exceptional.  We had lunch at the restaurant overlooking the cliff and had a front row view of the divers.  I would have loved to have gone back to see them at night as they do a sunset dive show as well.  Another fun historical activity to do while in Acapulco.

296711258.name: Interesting
296711258.author: a TripAdvisor user
296711258.reviewBody: Very nice place to watch the Mexicans dive in very shallow water.  Always many people there, good atmosphere....

296689920.name: Great Views
296689920.author: a TripAdvisor user
296689920.reviewBody: This is a beautiful place to visit. The views are awesome and if your lucky you get to see the locals diving. Really nice place to visit but I won\'t be diving any time soon!!

296332457.name: Divers
296332457.author: a TripAdvisor user
296332457.reviewBody: This was part of a day long private tour.  The vendor\'s are ferocious.  Our driver was not allowed to stay but he sat us in the shade on stools.  I was grateful for that.  Some people walked down further but too hot for me.  Our view was great.  It just took a really long time for them to actually start diving.  The children cleaned the inlet for debris.  Afterwards, the divers waited for us at the exit to leave a tip.

293487555.name: La Quebrada Cliff Divers
293487555.author: a TripAdvisor user
293487555.reviewBody: Went here to see the cliff divers, we chose to visit through the La Mirada hotel. you pay a small admission and get two drinks and a tableside view of the cove and divers. Bonus: the lower floor to the patio is covered in autographs and memorabilia of the famous celebs that have been there. Saw a photo of Ronald Reagan as an actor there! That\'s a long time ago. people are nice and the drinks are great. this is the place made famous by ABC Wide World of Sports in the 70\'s.

293031986.name: jumping off the cliff
293031986.author: a TripAdvisor user
293031986.reviewBody: stayed at the La Perla restaurant to watch this divers. It was a 10 US dollar entrance that comes with 1 free drink. There was a group of 8 divers, some of the divers were probably 9-10 years old, jumping from different levels. It was exciting and at the same time dangerous. But it\'s one of the few attractions available  at Acapulco

292758154.name: Cool
292758154.author: a TripAdvisor user
292758154.reviewBody: Every traveler must go there. Is one of the coolest things to visit in Acapulco. Brave men jump from a really high height to the ocean and then they climb again in the rocks.

292089804.name: LA Quebrada
292089804.author: a TripAdvisor user
292089804.reviewBody: Legendary Quebrada! the view is amazing and the show is spectacular! This is one of the main reasons why so many travel to this paradise beach to see the young men sacrifie their lives as they dive into the beach from very high altitudes.  Very impressing! A must!

291790336.name: Thought I would have enjoyed it better
291790336.author: a TripAdvisor user
291790336.reviewBody: I have had the yearning to see the divers for a long time, since I saw them on Wide World of Sport as a kid. There were 8 divers and without a doubt they are brave souls but I was left a bit hollow from the experience of the \'show\' which lasted about 10 minutes. Worth having a look at though.

287447281.name: Astonishing!
287447281.author: a TripAdvisor user
287447281.reviewBody: First time I\'ve seen such show. Cliff diving...nightime!!! Thumbs up for the FEARLESS cliff divers of La Quebrada.

287358303.name: Still WOW
287358303.author: a TripAdvisor user
287358303.reviewBody:
16°50'46.51"N 99°54'51.84"W

These are the coordinates for the parking  of  La Quebrada. Once there, you can choose to go  all the way, midway or even, if you are old enough, (golden age) in the mirador at the top where you have an excellent view and where you are not alone but close.
You can even choose to go at the hotel and view the show from there. There is an additional cost for that.

The parking will cost 10 pesos and the show 40 pesos.

There are public bathrooms, food and beverage stands.

To best view the show, you have to wait for all the divers to be at the top of the cliff, where there are two Virgens to protect the divers.

Then, wait to see one or two divers raise their hands. This indicates that they are ready to dive. Keep your eyes on them or you might miss the dive. 

Watching the dives is like looking at a work of art. It will literally take your breath away. This is grace and elegance at it’s best.

Warning :
If you are not from Acapulco, do not go to Acapulco in your car or a rented car. Your chances of getting a ticket are very good. If you get stopped by a cop, do not let him know that you are in a hurry or returning somewhere far. If you do, the amount you will have to pay in mordida will be astronomous. For example, I paid 3,000 pesos for something I didn’t do: crossing a pedestrian passage without stopping. This is an interesting infraction since nobody stops. It’s as if it was created for tourists. (Note: If I hadn’t paid the cop in cash, my papers were seized, the cost of the ticket would have been 5,200 pesos, I would have had to sleep another night in Acapulco etc.)
Also, take the bus, not a taxi. If you must, ask the price BEFORE you enter. The trips are a lot more expensive than those in Mexico DF and taxis do NOT have taximeters. Open season on tourists on foot. One Mexican tourist we met was charged 70 pesos for a trip of 800 meters. We were charged 80 pesos for a 3.2 kilometers trip. Mirta and I thought this was a rip off. And Acapulco has the gall of having a publicity that says “Habla bien de Aca”. Before I “Talk well of Acapulco”, Acapulco should install taximeters and crack down on crooked police.

286750545.name: go somewhere else !!!!
286750545.author: a TripAdvisor user
