286750545.reviewBody: dangerous city, 800 + murders a year, mainly drug related, be careful traveling around city, stay on main streets & highways

286241412.name: Watch your purse and stay with a group ladies
286241412.author: a TripAdvisor user
286241412.reviewBody: The divers are crazy!  It was worth seeing once but so touristy and so many vendors following you and hitting you up to buy their goods; it was almost uncomfortable from that aspect.  But unique still!

285370947.name: Amazing
285370947.author: a TripAdvisor user
285370947.reviewBody: A beautiful spot to see what I had heard about for so many years. These are true athletes! We had a great lunch at the hotel while we watched.

284741832.name: If you haven\'t been here you can\'t say you\'ve been to Acapulco
284741832.author: a TripAdvisor user
284741832.reviewBody: My grandmother choose the hotel on the mountain for her honey moon, and I believe this place hasn\'t lost the charm. You will find here the clasical image of Acapulco, people diving from the mountain into the sea. An exciting thing to watch. Be aware there are many steps up and down.

284600218.name: A great attraction
284600218.author: a TripAdvisor user
284600218.reviewBody: I like it, it has been the same since I was a small kid, it is amazing to see those men jumping from the top rock counting the waves when the sea is higher so they don\'t hit down. Great athletes that start since childhood.

283743997.name: impressive
283743997.author: a TripAdvisor user
283743997.reviewBody: the show is definitely worth going to. the guys who dive from the cliff are definitely well trained and very brave. just watching them was scary, can\'t even imagine how they dive and stay calm:)

283239011.name: Wow
283239011.author: a TripAdvisor user
283239011.reviewBody: These are certainly brave lads and ladies. Watching them jump is really something. You can go in the afternoon and enjoy the sunset too.

283203807.name: A place from another time
283203807.author: a TripAdvisor user
283203807.reviewBody:
Sure, its corny as hell, and feels like something out of a 50´s movie, but being there, and feeling the general vibe of awe after a daredevil jump from the cliff really makes one wonder...

I mean, these people, the high divers come from generations of daredevils, that high dive for mere donations, many have died for nothing, and still they keep doing it, as tradition, as a means of survival.

Watching some of the younger ones jumping form that cliff late at night with torches in their hands, not only made me question my life choices, but also, made me feel that I had not lived my life to the fullest, and for that, no praise can be enough.

So be sure to visit the place when in Acapulco, you wont be disappointed, life and death leap to the unknown for your enjoyment, and for an instant, time stands still, until they resurface and get ready to do it again...

282910395.name: Still to this date is a great attraction
282910395.author: a TripAdvisor user
282910395.reviewBody: We really liked the show and scenery.  It is well put together and gives tourist a great show of local divers that make friends with nature and strive to become the best divers in the conditions that mother nature allowed.  We went to the hotel and had couple of drinks with very nice live music performances between the diving

282894963.name: Touristy but worth it
282894963.author: a TripAdvisor user
282894963.reviewBody: Find a seat by the edge of one of the restaurants and watch the divers.  Area is touristy but this "show" has been going on for decades.  Pretty impressive overall.

282384890.name: Naaaaaa...
282384890.author: a TripAdvisor user
282384890.reviewBody: I was not impressed with La Quebrada.. and i will tell you why. wen we got there they sold us the seats to see it around $10 dlls per person. then at the end of the show they ask you for Tips $ 5 dlls more, and after before you get out form the area they DEMAND for Tips for the show crew $ 5 dlls more. wen we where getting back to the hotel the taxy driver was telling us the next time just go to the FREE area where all the locals go.\nREALLY !!!

281977392.name: Great views
281977392.author: a TripAdvisor user
281977392.reviewBody: The divers are awesome. The dive from height into churning dangerous waters and then climb the cliffs and dine again. The have a day show as well as the night show...both are great.

281247879.name: the location and the view
281247879.author: a TripAdvisor user
281247879.reviewBody: We went there on our own,by taxi,we had a good position to see the divers,and it was very much interested to be there,the divers are young,and  very professional specially when climbing the cliff and jumbing in the right time it is very amazing and a must to see that in Acapulco.

280427684.name: Must see in Mexico
280427684.author: a TripAdvisor user
280427684.reviewBody: You may have seen video of these cliff divers, but nothing takes the place of in person viewing. From your vantage point above the cliffs, you can witness the divers as they swim over and climb the cliffs and begin their dives at about 75 feet up and progress all the way to 125 feet.\nIt is necessary for them to time their dives with the waves to ensure safety. You will receive details of the divers and their society along with many facts and stories. The Diver\'s work for tips and you will want to donate to their skill.

277504960.name: Cliff divers
277504960.author: a TripAdvisor user
277504960.reviewBody: As a part of our City Tour, too us here approx.1 pm..as the cliff divers , do this 4-5x a day, as the last one 11 pm, most spectacular, with lighted torches..\nThere were 8 of them, but only 5 climbed up the steep cliff & waited til right timing to dive in, it was definitely awesome to see!!!

275927432.name: exciting
275927432.author: a TripAdvisor user
275927432.reviewBody: We found it hardly, but was our fault as walked from the hotel.  The show was exciting maybe less what we expected.  Very brave kids and people.  Great experience, must go there if you are in this area.

275732637.name: Unique emotion!
275732637.author: a TripAdvisor user
275732637.reviewBody: When I was waiting there to see the divers preparing to jump from the cliffs - 40 to 80 ft high - and praying and waiting to the "right" wave to come, it\'s something that I cannot put into words. You have to SEE !  and uff, when they reach the water" UNIQUE! \nUnfortunately Acapulco itself has lost its old glamour of the 50s but to those who like it, the night life is still going up. Take a bot ride along the bay, where the millionaires used to live.

275137697.name: Not what expected
275137697.author: a TripAdvisor user
275137697.reviewBody: It was more the hype than what went on. I guess I\'m used to elaborated shows and this wasn\'t very attractive. \nI respect those who do the jumps, but I think they should include something to make it more amusing other than seeing people jump.

275040061.name: Expensive trip
275040061.author: a TripAdvisor user
275040061.reviewBody: Long trip from Encanto by taxi, so expensive. Quebrada divers/restaurant and two drinks on top of that made it very expensive and food not more than one star.\n\n

272593239.name: Cliff Divers
272593239.author: a TripAdvisor user
272593239.reviewBody: I remember watch these dives as a kid on Wide World Of Sports. It was disappointing to see this in person.  Nice way to take up a couple hours, the night diving was ever better.

271860186.name: Cliff Divers-An Experience
271860186.author: a TripAdvisor user
271860186.reviewBody: One of the highlights of visiting Acapulco is the Cliff Divers At La Quebrada. They only dive at certain times of the day and they are not precise. We were there at the 1 PM show which actually took place at 1:35. However it was worth the wait. There is a viewing area far down below the restaurant and even further coming back up. We went to the viewing area with chairs next to the restaurants and a great view for a cost of 40 pesos each. If you want to eat at the restaurant there a special meal of tacos and a drink for $17 each. The divers have to jump in the water from the restaurant side and swim over to the dive side, climb up to the diving area. They all say prayers at a shrine at the top before diving. There are single and pair divers. It was a thrill to watch them. There were 7 in the group that we saw. After diving they will come around asking for tips.

270621747.name: Acapulco - Cliff divers
270621747.author: a TripAdvisor user
270621747.reviewBody:
Having seen these guys on TV years ago (and in an Elvis movie!) we were excited to see them up close and personal. They did not disappoint! These young men risk their lives putting on a show for tourists. If you ever go, give them a big fat tip!

Thanks to the divers and the staff at the hotel, great fun and excitement.

Dan and Phyllis
Denver, CO

270436345.name: THE BRAVE ONES
270436345.author: a TripAdvisor user
270436345.reviewBody: Very exciting to see the boys jump from the high cliffs.  The restaurant was being remodeled and the rain kept us from sitting close to the railing, however, we were well accommodated toward the back of the patio.  The view was excellent, however, it took the divers awhile to climb the cliffs and finally jump. The food was good and the drinks were super.  It was Jay\'s birthday and they brought him a shot of tequila. Really funny waiters!  Worth the price of everything. Make sure you have change or bills to give the divers when they greet you at the door as you leave. Be generous, this is the only way they make money.

270157126.name: Cliff Divers!!!
270157126.author: a TripAdvisor user
270157126.reviewBody: Enjoy a GREAT meal and watch the cliff divers do their thing!  It\'s a GREAT family evening attraction and the restaurant really is kid friendly even though it\'s higher end.  \n\nEvery time I visit I MUST see it!

269725852.name: SIT IN FIRST ROW FOR SEEING THIS ATRACTION
269725852.author: a TripAdvisor user
269725852.reviewBody:
Famous for many years, it is always a great spectacle, to see how this brave men and woman jump from the cliff in a narrow split in the coast.
The best place to look at it, is from the terrace of the hotel, which once belonged to Mr. Teddy Stauffer, the famous band leader in the 50th. I think, Johnny Weismüller, the first actor in the Tarzan films had also his share in the hotel.
Consider to stay 20 more minutes in the hotel, to look at the pictures of all the famous people which stayed here and the signatures written by them on a wall.
The hotel today is run down and needs a lot of maintanance to be done, but you are here to see the cliff divers!.
The entrance fee includes also 2 drinks, to make pass time easier.
So sit down and enjoy the show from a front seat.
There are two other ways to do it also. One is to climb down all the steps to the platform, from where the show begins. Not recomendable, if you have trouble to climb so many stairs. One of the advantage is, that you can take pictures with the cliff springer and yourself if you want.
The other way is, to walk up the scenic road in front (or do it by car, if you have one), and see it from there. You should bring binoculars if you choose this location, as it is quite far away and you will see the cliff divers at the size of an ant. But you will not have to pay an entrance fee.
Check in your hotel the performance schedule!

269083548.name: Wasn\'t what I expected
269083548.author: a TripAdvisor user
269083548.reviewBody: First, kudos to those crazy enough to do this.  It takes some big ones.  Wish there would have been an announcer/MC We went at night and had dinner at La Perla.  Service was outstanding, food sucked.

266729401.name: Incredible \ud83d\ude01
266729401.author: a TripAdvisor user
266729401.reviewBody:
Our family went to the evening dinner 🍴 show; it was better than I thought; as the reviews I had read weren't so favourable... Our family enjoyed the dinner & dessert, and the view was so ❤️ incredible! The staff was very good and the Divers were Sensational!
Also I read reviews on divers about tips...
this is their pay; they deserve it! 
Expect to tip them😊  (if you are thinking of going you should) Enjoy, Awesome Memories ❤️

266645393.name: Historical Cliff Divers
266645393.author: a TripAdvisor user
266645393.reviewBody: Absolutely amazing, great to be a part of such a wonderful experience.  The Cliff Divers put on a spectacular show, a must see when you visit Acapulco.

265350878.name: Just go
265350878.author: a TripAdvisor user
265350878.reviewBody: Great place to enjoy even without the divers, especially at sunset. Good views of the whole city. The divers are a plus.

265077193.name: history
265077193.author: a TripAdvisor user
265077193.reviewBody: if you remember old Tarzan Movies you will enjoy the visit. the dives are very impressive, At the Mirador restaurant you will find wall with many Hollywood stars going back many decades. 154 steps to the bottom

263798875.name: Scary!
263798875.author: a TripAdvisor user
263798875.reviewBody: Truly a feat of athletic prowess. Congrats to theseyoung men. Way too scary"..just  the strong power of the ocean tide had me on edge

262459423.name: The most iconic show in Acapulco
262459423.author: a TripAdvisor user
262459423.reviewBody: There are so many things to say about La Quebrada and the show, but it has been the must show in Acapulco for decades. The show is impressive and when you hear the stories about the divers, you find out there are so much passion and effort. Tip the divers ;)

261801980.name: Amazing
261801980.author: a TripAdvisor user
261801980.reviewBody: Amazingly skilled divers!  They dive off a 125\' (35m) cliff into 3m of water without the incoming swell... Awesome!

260843397.name: Excellent show
260843397.author: a TripAdvisor user
260843397.reviewBody: This was my second visit to Alcapulco Mexico but my first stop at La Quebrada to see the cliff divers. \nWorth the visit. I was here during a cruise ship stop and the divers did their show several times in a short period of time.\nThe steps here are many and very steep. My parents and in-laws were able to get up and down them with a pit stop half way up and half way down as well. Their is a restaurant at the top that is very accessible for $18.00 with a complementary drink included. Here it was only $7.00 with a free bottle of water and there are several places to watch the divers if you do not or can not make it all the way to the bottom. But the bottom is the best viewing place in my opinion, and I stopped and watched them from several different vantage points.

259221396.name: Very good
259221396.author: a TripAdvisor user
259221396.reviewBody: My fourth time seeing La Quebrada.  The steps going down to the viewing area can be difficult. I don\'t know if there is wheelchair access

258945346.name: An Adrenaline Rush With Lots of Recoup Time Between Dives
258945346.author: a TripAdvisor user
258945346.reviewBody: See full, detailed review under day tours.  Considering the risks involved (scaling the sheer cliff face to the shrines at the pinnacle of the mountain, to the dives themselves) this show was well worth the hour it took for the four dives: 2solo dives, a pair dive, and a 3-man dive. NOTE: don\' feel you have to walk down the 75 (appx.) feet to get \'the best\' viewing in the semicircular area just above the water level. We shot our GoPro movies and 400mm Canon pictures from the first level down from the parking lot, and our viewing from eye level to the shrines atop the cliff are perfect from the divers praying at the shrine to the moment of splats down which we both saw and heard.

258939327.name: Worth seeing from restaurant
258939327.author: a TripAdvisor user
258939327.reviewBody: We watched this show from the restaurant for a fixed price of about $22 for lunch, 1 drink and a great view of the divers.  I think I enjoyed the meal more as the divers only did about 6 dives and then left.  You get ambushed by the divers for tips on the way out of the restaurant too, which was a bit of a turn off.

258377688.name: Worth seeing!
258377688.author: a TripAdvisor user
258377688.reviewBody: Whilst we expected this to be a bit commercialised and a bit tacky, it was definitely worth seeing.  The cliffdivers are a big part of Acapulco\'s heritage and the tradition has obviously been passed on through generations of families.  You truly have to respect the skill and courage involved.\nAt only 40 pesos entrance fee, it was worth seeing a show during the day time (12.30pm) and then again at night (10.30pm) when they dive with torches and the cliffs are all lit up.  Diving from about 35 metres, there are usually 5 or 6 divers - and they gratefully receive tips at the end of the show.\nIf you\'re in Acapulco, you should not miss this experience.

258307055.name: The Top Attraction In Acapulco
258307055.author: a TripAdvisor user
258307055.reviewBody: We visited the cliff divers twice, once in the daylight and again the next night for an evening show.  Both performances were spectacular.  It is amazing being there so close and seeing the divers right in front of you compared to watching a TV program.  It is a relatively short but uphill walk from the Zocalo or an inexpensive taxi ride. The entrance fee to the viewing area was 40 pesos. You do not need an organized tour. There are several eating places around the parking area or at the famous El Mirador Hotel.  After the night performance walk to the main road junction behind the parking lot to catch a taxi.  After the dives, the divers will pose for photos with the tourists and seem grateful for any tips.  No one is pushy.  This is truly a must see attraction.

258264670.name: Arrive early if you are paying for the close up views, respect for the divers but a bit of hype too.
258264670.author: a TripAdvisor user
258264670.reviewBody: Went up to see the cliff divers, famed in Acapulco. We were glad we went to see what the fuss was about, and I do respect the risks they are taking, but I felt it was all a bit hyped up. You can pay to get a close up view, but you need to arrive early, or else you could arrive towards the end of one show and wait the hour to get the next show and you might get a spot at the front of the crowd. We just walked back on of the streets where there were hundreds of people watching from a distance. Hung around until the end of the current show and we weren\'t willing to hang around the extra hour (or return) for other shows.

258215058.name: every bit as amazing and classic as you\'d imagine
258215058.author: a TripAdvisor user
258215058.reviewBody: the divers are just amazing.  very nice too- were happy to let us take photos with them.  fantastic service, fair price.  classic setting with many options to sit.  (You can view for free but for a small fee you can be seated at the hotel for a nice cocktail or dinner.)  essential for every trip to aca.

257704896.name: Wow, amazing skills
257704896.author: a TripAdvisor user
257704896.reviewBody: Lots of steps, so be prepared for that (and it was quite hot and humid). But the view is amazing, and the guys that do the diving? They\'re out of their minds, that\'s a long-long-LONG way down!! Really enjoyed the show and got some good pictures I\'ll try to remember to post.

257455744.name: Danger clifftop Divers wanting tips!
257455744.author: a TripAdvisor user
257455744.reviewBody: We sat on a scorching hot beach outside the old Fiesta Americana hotel. We\'d had a few Coronas and wondering what to do next when a guy raced up on a speedboat and asked if we wanted to go see the divers at Quebrada. Do birds fly? Off we went at top speed as it was due to begin and we didn\'t want to miss it. We managed to get there without throwing up, and it was a frightening and awe inspiring sight to see them dive off the cliffs without killing themselves.\nEven more awesome was the divers surfacing next to our boat for their tips!!!!

257373236.name: All I can say is wow
257373236.author: a TripAdvisor user
257373236.reviewBody: these guys were awesome they claimed these cliffs so fast and with such agility it was almost as amazing as the diving . Happiness our guide brought us here on our first day .. He was the best !

256997620.name: Inspiring, impressive, amazing, and a little terrifying- a must see!
256997620.author: a TripAdvisor user
256997620.reviewBody: The cliff divers at La Quebrada are so amazing. You can google them, and learn all about how the diving between this little rock crevice from over 100 feet in the air has been passed down from generations.  I held my breath the entire time, as I watched these incredibly talented people do flips and synchronized dives down this little space between two cliffs. It\'s awesome and beautiful and so impressive!

256395548.name: Divers
256395548.author: a TripAdvisor user
256395548.reviewBody: Great restaurant in La Quebrada overlooking the diving cliffs.  Every night 7:30 and 8:30 you get to watch the divers do their thing.  Great way to spend an evening

255717317.name: Classic & amazing
255717317.author: a TripAdvisor user
255717317.reviewBody: A place not to miss in Acapulco. Since 1934 !!! The view from the hotel is better than the public site, because you see jump and fall. In public place go in advance for good view.  Hotel has price that  because you see the jumpincludes drink. At 1pm first show. 7 - 9 & 10 pm.

255425974.name: great Cliff divers show
255425974.author: a TripAdvisor user
255425974.reviewBody: Its a short 10 min cliff jump show. The cliffs are around 140m high and there are 5 divers that jump from the high cliffs into the water canal underneath. Its a tradition to jump from the cliff and a way to earn their living. Some of the divers are young guys who are learning to continue the famous tradition of Acapulco.There are alot of stairs down to see the cliff so dont bring strollers. There are also public restrooms located there. They charge 5pesas to use the bathrooms.make sure you have coins handy.We watched the day show,but therr are also evening/night shows which ive heard are better because of the lights.But the day show was eqaully good.There is a pharmacy located here so keeping your self hydrated comes handy.

255334982.name: Don\'t miss the Clavadistas de La Quebrada !!
255334982.author: a TripAdvisor user
255334982.reviewBody: Always a great show. We have watched the divers so many times I can\'t even guess how many. Never miss it every year.

255094424.name: wonderfull, never tired to watch it again
255094424.author: a TripAdvisor user
255094424.reviewBody: best to watch it from a boat,or from the terrace of the hotel.The Cliff dive is over in a few seconds, but you have a beautiful view and you have to come early for a great spot.

254804828.name: Has beautiful scenery along tge pacific coast with a view of Dieo and Rita Diegos home as well as great cliff diving
254804828.author: a TripAdvisor user
254804828.reviewBody: I usrd to live down the street so i can say that i am probably not the best to give my opinion. \nI seen it the cliff divets and view almost on a daily basis. Fantastic beautiful scenery of the coast of you don\'t look to closely at the negative.

254286790.name: Cliff divers attraction is breathtaking
254286790.author: a TripAdvisor user
254286790.reviewBody: Worth to see and breathtaking. But if you want to see something come earlier because there is lot of turists.

252921855.name: Quebrada by boat
252921855.author: a TripAdvisor user
252921855.reviewBody: See if you an hirew a boat to take you to La Quebrada.  No better way to watch the divers... and they may even swim over to your boat for a tip, so you might meet one or two.

252662781.name: Must do in Acapulco
252662781.author: a TripAdvisor user
252662781.reviewBody:
We went to the lunch show first and had lunch in the Mirador Hotel and a good view of the divers. The meal cost 205 MX and included a drink and a meal, we had tacos. The divers were amazing and we enjoyed the hotel resturant. 
We enjoyed it so much we reurned on a different day for the evening show and stood in the viewing area, that cost 40 MX to go in. It was also excellent and you can see them climb up in the dark. For photos the day time dive is best, but we enjoyed both.
You can easily walk from the zocala, if you don't mind walking up hill. We stayed at the Los Flamigos hotel and walked back part of the way until we got a taxi to the hotel. For the evening show we got a Volkswagen taxi and it was 20 MX each way. 
A must see show when vitiating Acapulco.

252174931.name: Never miss this experience!
252174931.author: a TripAdvisor user
252174931.reviewBody: Be ready to take a photo and be awed at the artistic demonstration of diving!  Never have I seen such an incredible piece of showmanship!  You will be proud you experienced this show!

252162791.name: Cliff Divers
252162791.author: a TripAdvisor user
252162791.reviewBody: A must in Acapulco to see the Cliff Divers. I prefer the night time show with Floodlight highlighting the Divers walking down the stairs before jumping into the water and climbing up the cliff wall for their dive. The last dive in total darkness with torches. Spectacular

252086524.name: Divers are great
252086524.author: a TripAdvisor user
252086524.reviewBody:
So we were staying on the south side of Acapulco.  The cost to go to the evening show was $1400 a piece which included the ride, and a dinner at the hotel overlooking the cliffs.  $1400 MX pesos is about $100 each.  A taxi to the location is about $300 pesos if you do not sign up for an excursion.  I believe the cost without the taxi is about $80 US for the seat and the meal.

I must say that the hotel there, the El Mirador, is quite unattractive.  It apparently had its hay day in the ’60’s and ’70’s when numerous movie stars haunted there, but now it is a run down place.  The restaurant is part of the hotel.  It has tiered seating, so most everyone can get a good table overlooking the cliffs.

The meal we received included two drinks.  The meal was quite average and the hotel disappointing which is why I am giving this 3 stars.  I was told by the driver that you can alternatively pay about $5 per person for general admission to the viewing patio which is much closer to the divers, directly on the other side of the cliff for excellent viewing.  I can see from other reviews that you can get the meal for about $10 if you go there yourself and sign up for an excursion.  Makes me feel foolish for having signed up for the excursion there.

I give the divers 5 stars as they were excellent.  My advise, just go there and do not sign up for the excursion with the meals.  And as we were leaving, we were told that the tip is not part of the $1400 pesos each.  Normally, excursions handle everything, so we gave them a tip.  This bugged me as I was not ready for it.

Buyer beware!  Don’t do an excursion.

252016542.name: Watching the Cliff Divers
252016542.author: a TripAdvisor user
252016542.reviewBody: I went to see the Cliff Divers, which are just a short uphill walk from the centre of Acopulco, thinking that the dive was going to be spectacular. But for me, what was more amazing was the cliff climb from the bottom to the top or where they were going to dive from. This was done without any guide ropes or support with bare feet and hands in bathers. The tricky part is to time the dive with the incoming waves to ensure safety, I suppose. Seeing this is definitely worth while in Acopulco. You can get a good view, if not better from the car park opposite the cliff without going into the hotel terrace nearby.

251962418.name: Cliff divers
251962418.author: a TripAdvisor user
251962418.reviewBody: Interesting at first but as the day got hotter and the divers procrastinated longer the allure soon wore off.

251003899.name: heartpounding show
251003899.author: a TripAdvisor user
251003899.reviewBody: These guys have guts and skill and should be on everyones bucket list. Use Roberto Alarcon to take you, he is a fantastic tour guide

250768908.name: Short show at 1:00
250768908.author: a TripAdvisor user
250768908.reviewBody: this was a great venue to see the cliff divers. We had the choice to view it from the restaurant, 140 p with a free drink included or from the veranda in the sun that you see in the left side of the photo, 40 p no shade. We opted for the restaurant. Because our tour included a meal at another venue we were told to only have a drink. I can see this might have been enjoyed as a luncheon or dinner venue. The dive show was fun and engaging, but short. I expected more dives then 3.

250654979.name: amazing spot is something that you cant miss! there is a restaurant right in front of the place
250654979.author: a TripAdvisor user
250654979.reviewBody: This atraction in particular is great, the ability of this gentlemen is amazing and you can be in the first row of the action near to the cliff

249918957.name: An Acapulco tradition so a must see
249918957.author: a TripAdvisor user
249918957.reviewBody: I\'m in my sixties and have seen the divers many times on TV and it is the one thing that I think of when I think about Acapulco. Even though it was only 6 divers spread over 25 minutes, it was worth it. We chose to eat lunch at the Hotel Mirador restaurant overlooking the cove and watched it from there. Even though it was a little further, the view as still good, the meal was cheap (20 pesos each), and we were in the shade. The hotel is proud of its celebrity visitors, but almost all were from the last century (where didn\'t Elvis visit?), and the hotel looks like it hasn\'t been repaired since. Still worth it.

249903428.name: Worth seeing
249903428.author: a TripAdvisor user
249903428.reviewBody: This was place was made famous because of the cliff diving line ago.  It\'s worth seeing and I enjoyed the table we had at La Perla.  One of the best parts of the trip!!

248639695.name: Cliff Divers in Acapulco
248639695.author: a TripAdvisor user
248639695.reviewBody: If you visit Acapulco I highly recommend that you see the cliff divers.  We went to the last show of the evening and the last dive is done with torches.  We think we were the only English-speaking Americans there on Dec. 25 so were really immersed in the Mexican culture.  You do need to pay a small entry fee in pesos.  We did not have any but our taxi driver loaned us some. Go down the steps as soon as the last show has ended and try to get a place right behind the wall for the best view.  We were too late for that so went farther up the steps where we could see the beginning of the dive but not the water level.

248420449.name: An amazing show!
248420449.author: a TripAdvisor user
248420449.reviewBody: There were too many people at the same time, so I could not see everything properly. Also photo shooting was impossible. But you could see these amazing divers doing those incredible and   adventurous dives. They are so talented!

248170087.name: Another wonderful spectacle
248170087.author: a TripAdvisor user
248170087.reviewBody:
For the fourth year in succession we went to watch the cliff divers from La Perla restaurant in the Hotel Mirador.

The show was as great as ever, with the late show featuring the final diver making his dive whilst holding lit flaming torches in his hands, with the lights turned out.

The food in La Perla was also as good as ever, lobster, prawn, avocado, and the weather was excellent this time with little breeze coming in from the sea.

If you haven't seen this spectacle, you should.

247898867.name: Great for watching cliff divers
247898867.author: a TripAdvisor user
247898867.reviewBody: Watching these daring divers drop off cliffs and plunge 100 feet into the water is a great sight to behold. The view from the top of the Mirador Hotel is spectacular and so is the view from boats nearby. It is not as easy to see from the viewing area though. There is some pushing and shoving. Be careful. Watch that you don\'t get shoved over the edge!!!!! Getting as close as possible though is well worth the effort.

246628325.name: I met the divers.
246628325.author: a TripAdvisor user
246628325.reviewBody: I even went to one of their weddings! There are several places to observe these men and boys perform their majestic and dangerous dives. The least expensive and most common is via the main La Quebrada entrance. Another is as a passenger on one of the yachts on the ocean below that gather for performances, The very best places are either while having a drink at the Hotel Mirador, or even better, from your own balcony as a guest at the hotel. I was actually able to chat with some of the divers on the cliffs in my broken Spanish, and that\'s how I ended up dancing at one of their weddings. The most experienced guys dive from 115 feet into water that is at most16 feet deep and as little as six feet, depending on the swells, so their timing has to be perfect. They formed their association in 1934, so some are generational and all are consumate professionals. During their night shows they dive with torches, which adds equal amounts of flare and romance.

246453520.name: Quebrada by boat es mejor
246453520.author: a TripAdvisor user
246453520.reviewBody: Our family rented a boat with a driver which I highly recommend. He nudged us right up close in between the rocks where they dive. The divers swim up for tips beforehand. Best of all on the way back after  we drove past old-Acapulco we saw dolphins and a whale come up for air then arch his back and flap his tail on his way back down.

245764942.name: A must-do while in Acapulco
245764942.author: a TripAdvisor user
245764942.reviewBody: You can\'t go to Acapulco and not see this at least once.  The divers are amazing.  And what they do is dangerous!  There is nice walking areas surrounding the cliff.  There are a lot of pushy sellers here as well.

244644483.name: Not worth the buzz that it gets.
244644483.author: a TripAdvisor user
244644483.reviewBody:
The hardest thing that we can get used to its that we need to get to the schedule of the city, this city its pretty much dead in the morning around noon its like the wakey time, i didnt know that so i was here at 11 am, was lucky to find a place to have lunch.

Anywho, you pay 40pesos to get in (at least that was the fee that day because over there fees change from minute to minute)  you have to downstairs, make sure u bring an umbrella because its direct sunlight that will get you sweating like a pig.

The show its, just.. like.. about the guys climbing up the altitude on the rocks and taking forever to take a dive, i dont know it didnt seem more than 50 meters and the deep on the water was good enough.

Its something that you must do when you visit, so .. ill will leave it at that

242850848.name: WOW
242850848.author: a TripAdvisor user
242850848.reviewBody: It was breath-taking to see these young men climb the stone wall,calculate the waves, and soar down into the water. They ask for tips afterwards and they are well deserved.

242571979.name: Acapulco Must See
242571979.author: a TripAdvisor user
242571979.reviewBody: It is obligatory.  You CAN NOT visit Acapulco without seeing the cliff diver show.  After the show, for a small tip, you can have you pictures taken with the divers.  Bring a good telephoto lens and a camera that can do burst shots.  Unless you are starving, avoid the La Perla Restaurant and just pay the 40 peso admission fee.\n\nIn most pictures of La Quebrada, you will see a boat just outside the mouth.  We got a bit of a bonus as two or three small whales passed with just a few feet of the boat.

242480393.name: Fun In Acapulco
242480393.author: a TripAdvisor user
242480393.reviewBody: Our taxi driver beat the tour buses here. We had great seats to view these dare devil divers. Always wanted to see this spectacle since I saw the Elvis movie Fun In Acapulco many, many years ago. Spectacular scenery. Saw about 8 divers do their thing. Over too quickly. The price including a drink has increased to $7 per person. A tip for the divers is appreciated since they are not paid to perform the dives.

242458314.name: Not only the divers but also interesting for the sunset observation
242458314.author: a TripAdvisor user
242458314.reviewBody: As said besides the fearless divers You can observe beautiful sunset while a group of schoolkids sings nice melodies

242055296.name: This is a bucket list item.
242055296.author: a TripAdvisor user
242055296.reviewBody:
If nothing else go to Acapulco  just to see these amazing young men doing back flips from 200 feet above from cliff tops  down into the ocean below.  These young men are fourth generation cliff divers and must first  practice for 15 years.
 Before each of the 8  young takes this dive they to a prominent virgin Mary at the very top of the cliff. 
The very best time to go is at night when the light up the cliffside rocks, the ocean below and the divers.  
Abut $4.00 per person for entry.

241787411.name: A classic in Acapulco
241787411.author: a TripAdvisor user
241787411.reviewBody: I\'ve been watching these divers since I was 5.  I was amazed by all of them and I still am!\n\nTipping can become a little something if you are not strong enough when you have to put your foot down.

241419945.name: Daredevil Divers!
241419945.author: a TripAdvisor user
241419945.reviewBody: No one should go to Acapulco and miss seeing this timeless spectacular of young divers taking off from a cliff down into a narrow inlet of the ocean.  Truly amazing.  It\'s a tradition handed down from father to son.  Be sure to tip them on your way out, they deserve it.

240770772.name: The "must see" in Acapulco
240770772.author: a TripAdvisor user
240770772.reviewBody:
You can't come to Acapulco and not see these guys - we have all seen them on telly and to see them in real life is a real buzz !

Watch out for the link to get there from Tripadvisor and use Google Maps instead.

I was told by my hotel that they dive all day and that 4pm was the best time.  They were wrong !  Luckily I decided to go around lunchtime and was happy to see there was a show almost immediately at 1pm.  The other shows were after dark which I don't think I would have liked so much.

240107001.name: every time we visit acapuco we go to la quebrada
240107001.author: a TripAdvisor user
240107001.reviewBody: we mostly like everithing,no complaints at all.we also had a nce dinner at the restaurant el mirador and some nice and cold beer,and my wife had very good taste pina colada,waoo,i just think about it and make me crave.

240045243.name: FANTASTIC ATTRACTION
240045243.author: a TripAdvisor user
240045243.reviewBody: What a great time in la Quebrada with a fantastic view and the divers are very good. They jump just in time when the ocean water is up or high so is safe to dive. But if you jump when the water is low then you have a problem with the rock at the bottom. There\'s a Hotel bar and restaurant so you need to visit.

239007912.name: Amazing meal with a great view of the divers
239007912.author: a TripAdvisor user
239007912.reviewBody: Our fabulous driver and tour guide Roberto Alarcon took us to this location so we could have lunch while watching the famous cliff diving show. The chicken enchiladas and the garlic fish was absolutely amazing. The show was quick but spectacular. The view was absolutely gorgeous! It\'s a must see while in Acapulco!

238015419.name: Cliff Divers
238015419.author: a TripAdvisor user
238015419.reviewBody: This is a tradition for many years that has been enjoyed by many.  Watching the divers jump from a point high up into a small area of the ocean.  The timing has to be perfect.  Its a Beautiful setting in the old part of Acapulco.  We live here in Acapulco and we have been taking friends and family to share in this experience for many years.  Its also fun to see this from a boat in the ocean.

237108336.name: Beautiful view of the Pacific overlooking the Cliff Divers performance
237108336.author: a TripAdvisor user
237108336.reviewBody: This is a fabulous location to enjoy an excellent lunch or dinner overlooking the Pacific Ocean and the cove and cliff where the local divers perform and compete. The steps are very steep... It is not handicapped friendly. Even if you can\'t schedule your visit during the show, divers dive throughout the day practicing for the events and aspiring young divers dive from lower levels for coins thrown in to the water. It is truly a must-see show when visiting Acapulco. If staying at the Princess, it is almost an hour long drive to get there so plan your taxi ride accordingly.

236934196.name: WOW!
236934196.author: a TripAdvisor user
236934196.reviewBody: this was something incredible to see. guys that do this wait for the tide to be appropriate to throw themselves from 45 metres high up!! it is worth the 40 pesos entrance

236134349.name: Vintage charming place
236134349.author: a TripAdvisor user
236134349.reviewBody: The divers in La Quebrada give an amazing show. A must see once in Acapulco. They have shows at four time slots during the day so you can do it before going for dinner or before going out.

235964618.name: The late on is my favorite, but you cannot leave without seeing it
235964618.author: a TripAdvisor user
235964618.reviewBody: You have to see this! I highly recommend the night show where they shut the lights off and dive with torches. Its fascinating to see the athletic abilities as they scale the walls. The practice and precision is unbelievable. Bring a camera. Take video, it happens so fast. I highly recommend seeing it as close to the wall as possible or grabbing a drink at the old hotel to watch it. The hotel has history of famous actors and celebrities. It needs some updating but its incredible to see the view from higher up without someone\'s head being in the way. Also, to see the history of the divers and even meet them after.

233097489.name: Beautiful!
233097489.author: a TripAdvisor user
233097489.reviewBody: This a must if you visit Acapulco, I really like 10:30 Show, because of the dive with torches, but anytime is great.

232595652.name: Cliff Divers!
232595652.author: a TripAdvisor user
232595652.reviewBody: We were lucky that a shop owner had ventured to watch and gave us alot of inside information about these daring men who cliff dive.  The only draw-back is the constant onslaught of vendors (many of them children) trying to get you to buy their trinkets.

232190814.name: Best seen from the water
232190814.author: a TripAdvisor user
232190814.reviewBody: Been going to Acapulco for 29 years in a row, already purchased tickets for Feb 2015 (and yues, it\'s safe there). I\'ve been here to see the cliff divers many times. The best view can be from the water. Take a taxi down to where the fishing boats are and get one, much cheaper then going thru your motel, where they get a kick. You can see the boat your are renting and barter a price (have cash in hand). These divers are unreal, realize they have to hit the water in a wave or they will hit the bottom, timing a MUST!

229495828.name: wow
229495828.author: a TripAdvisor user
229495828.reviewBody: the divers were the highlight of our trip. they are fearless. i couldnt believe that they climbed up the side with no shoes on. they didnt have a big crowd but the show was like they had a thousand fans. they didnt disappiont.

229337159.name: Divers in Paradise
229337159.author: a TripAdvisor user
229337159.reviewBody: Divers jump in to ocean when the waves are right \nThe height depends in their ability  of the diver\nAt night the divers use torches so you can see them jumping

227731593.name: Try it
227731593.author: a TripAdvisor user
227731593.reviewBody: It\u00b4s a nice show but gets really crowded and sometimes you can\u00b4t enjoy it as you would expect. I recomend the tlavelers to take your own seats with you

226648475.name: Good show
226648475.author: a TripAdvisor user
226648475.reviewBody: We payed about 3USD for the entrance, it was a very good show, it was pouring terribly and still the show went on, it was quite impresive, we would have loved not to be raining that heavily because we were not able to take pictures :(

226439250.name: Beautiful View
226439250.author: a TripAdvisor user
226439250.reviewBody: Awesome view of the Sun Set.  Evening shows are the best.  Arrive early to get a great view.  Have camera ready at all times.

226208223.name: La Quebrada
226208223.author: a TripAdvisor user
226208223.reviewBody: It\'s worth watching these divers towards sunset - what an impressive show that is just a little scary to watch! Don\'t forget to tip the divers at the end!!

225088665.name: One of a Kind Show
225088665.author: a TripAdvisor user
225088665.reviewBody: Never seen such young men jump off a man-made stone steep structure & jump into raging waters, only to climb up another stone cliff and do it again. It took some time because they had to wait for a large wave but it worth the drive out and the wait. \n\nEduardo was our driver and guide, arranged by the Grand Mayan Hotel tour desk. I would not recommend him. He will talk your ear off and then some. Even he told us several times that he will be outside, waiting for us, after the Diver\'s Show & our dinner, he never lingered around and kept telling us about the divers. It was annoying and unwelcome and we couldn\'t wait to get back to our hotel room. We might have wanted to stop and take in the night scene, but his non-stoppable talking spoiled our evening and we just wanted to come home.

223535381.name: Tour by Van, guide: Rudy Acapulco
223535381.author: a TripAdvisor user
223535381.reviewBody: Amazing brave men to jump from the high cliff into the choppy water below. A must to see! The view of the sea and the cliff are just gorgeous!

223512183.name: divers
223512183.author: a TripAdvisor user
223512183.reviewBody:
I was amazed to see how young these divers were
and how they risked.
A good thrill show, you hold your breath as you see
the divers.
They have little concession stands and really nice restaurant over looking the cliff

223162727.name: Impressive!
223162727.author: a TripAdvisor user
223162727.reviewBody: Impressive cliff diving show! Place has been adapted very good for the spectators. Clean and shows are on time. I recommend you to see it during sunset and at night.

222909171.name: Unique to Acapulco . . .
222909171.author: a TripAdvisor user
222909171.reviewBody: Spectacular views and even more spectacular athletes . . . these divers perform multiple shows a day, some in the day time and some at night.  The night time shows are the most spectacular.  These young men (and I do mean young -- some look like they are 16 or 17 years old) dive from high upon these jagged cliffs and at night with lighted torches in each hand.  There\'s no elevator or stairs and they climb up the rocks to get back to their perches from where they dive.  There is a viewing point on the cliff and there was also a terraced restaurant/lounge where you can sit at a table and enjoy a drink while you watch the show.  It is a tradition that you cannot miss if you are in Acapulco.  If it is important to you that you have food or drink when you are there, I would suggest that you check before going to LaQuebrada as the restaurants and bars in Acapulco seem to open and close on a frequent basis in the recent years.

222785452.name: Takes a lot of courage to jump!
222785452.author: a TripAdvisor user
222785452.reviewBody: Kudos to the gentlemen who perform there! My legs would go limp just overlooking from the top, someone would have to push me to jump from that height. Whether you watch from the restaurant La Perla (same level as where they jump) or from the special viewing area that\'s only about 10 ft from sea level, you will enjoy the different vantage points. Now food at La Perla is so-so only, you gotta consider whether US$19 is worth the meal itself plus the show. I wouldn\'t have paid that much if it wasn\'t just the two of us.

222776724.name: An Acapulco Legend!!
222776724.author: a TripAdvisor user
222776724.reviewBody: Elvis was here in "Fun In Acapulco" A Must see ,it\'s a oncw see thing kinda overdone but a tradition .A spagetti restaurant and a once CP hotel overlooks ,

221426473.name: Divers
221426473.author: a TripAdvisor user
221426473.reviewBody: Awesome show. Several divers diving from a cliff into the sea. When I was child, I had seen a film of Elvis Presley and always wanted to see.  Although at the time it seem more spectacular was worth it for the courage of the divers.

220130307.name: Spectacular
220130307.author: a TripAdvisor user
220130307.reviewBody: Really worthwhile while in Acapulco to visit La Quebrada.  It is very nice to watch it from a boat if posible.

219090045.name: very impressive
219090045.author: a TripAdvisor user
219090045.reviewBody: The view from hotel Mirador was indeed spectacular but the \'ticket\' for two drinks was expensive. On the way out there were lots of street sellers around  which made the atmosphere a bit weird

215881242.name: La Quebrada
215881242.author: a TripAdvisor user
215881242.reviewBody: Very Nice place at night they have a show with fire.....if you rent an boat you can watch the Jump from the ocean

213528911.name: A must!
213528911.author: a TripAdvisor user
213528911.reviewBody: The most important site in town, legendary and breathtaking experience. Visit the Boca Chica Hotel and restaurant near the Quebrada

212912196.name: Not big deal...just ok
212912196.author: a TripAdvisor user
212912196.reviewBody: If you have the opportunity to come to this place, great; but if you miss it, it is not a big deal. At La Quebrada, there is a restaurant where you can eat and see the diver\'s show in the evening. The last show is around 10:30 pm with fire torchs and it is very popular. Parking is difficult. Take a taxi to go there. There a entrance fee of around US$4.

212844296.name: La Quebrada
212844296.author: a TripAdvisor user
212844296.reviewBody: i have watched the cliff divers many many times and it always is wonderful! i have watched this during the day and at night.  It is spectacular at night!  This attraction is one of the musts when visiting Acapulco.

209614625.name: Full respect!
209614625.author: a TripAdvisor user
209614625.reviewBody: It really takes a lot of courage to jump off a cliff like that! Great show, much better to what you might have seen in the movies! Remember to give them a nice tip, I hear that they don\'t have salaries and live of tips

208982077.name: Depending on the day it could be cool experience
208982077.author: a TripAdvisor user
208982077.reviewBody: Usually this place gets pack with locals and tourists in the evenings, plenty of space to see the guys throwing themselves from the rocks to the ocean but in the summer it can get too packed and hot if no wind around.\nBetter to buy a drink from the restaurant above and have great views all by yourself.

208263409.name: Old tired Hotelhere  with so much potential if renovated.The diving Amazing !!!
208263409.author: a TripAdvisor user
208263409.reviewBody: THE DIVING IS AMAZING !!!!  Hotel is dated and securirty was lax as our room was broken into after I had already mentioned the flimsy broken balcony lock. Great plae to watch the high diving from while having a meal. staff all that helpful or friendly.

207689873.name: Well worth a visit
207689873.author: a TripAdvisor user
207689873.reviewBody: This is one of the attractions that is a must to see after travelling all the way to Accupulco from the United Kingdom just to say you have seen it.\n\nIt is a well rehearsed show by the young divers

205471354.name: Enjoyed our time there
205471354.author: a TripAdvisor user
205471354.reviewBody: WOW ,what a show!!!! We meat friends there and was there first trip to Aca, they loved it and want to return.....

204131521.name: Synonymous with Acapulco - La Quebrada Cliff Divers
204131521.author: a TripAdvisor user
204131521.reviewBody: Synonymous with Acapulco is the world famous La Quebrada Cliff Diver show. Considering the climb of 125 feet, crucial timing of the tide, shallow depths averaging 12 feet, and jagged rocks, these divers are expert divers and showmen. Your trip to Acapulco would not be complete without witnessing this world class demonstration. La Quebrada presents a breathtaking view of the ocean and the cliff divers are spectacular.

202810328.name: 4 dollars of fun entertainment
202810328.author: a TripAdvisor user
202810328.reviewBody: Such showmanship, several guys dived from the rocks into the water, with golden bronzed bodies. They gave thanks to the little shrine and expertly plunged into the sea. The whole performance to place for approximately 20 minutes, to the amusement of the crowd, check the show times as extra show were put on for the cruise ship passengers.

200203515.name: Cool, but not very much show
200203515.author: a TripAdvisor user
200203515.reviewBody: We took the $50 peso ride from the hotel to La Quebrada. We paid the entrance fee ($40\nPesos) and then the show was over in 5 dives. Very cool in form and strength, but short program, no music, no "show". Not sure it was worth the trip up the mtn. We did enjoy the sunset there

199987522.name: Cliff Divers
199987522.author: a TripAdvisor user
199987522.reviewBody: Always great to see the cliff divers.  Lots of vendors down there.  Best place to watch the divers from is the Mirador restaurant.

199674885.name: Cliff divers are amazing!
199674885.author: a TripAdvisor user
199674885.reviewBody: Make sure if you visit Acapulco to go to La Quebrada and see the cliff divers! This is an incredible must see show! Go all the way down the stairs and pay the $4 per person to watch from the facing cliff side - it is more than worth it!

199202284.name: An Acapulco Classic and must do
199202284.author: a TripAdvisor user
199202284.reviewBody: The Cliff divers from "La Quebrada" have been performing this show for 80 years. Initially pure daredevils. The tradition has evolved into a school of divers with close to 70 participants and daily shows. They dive from a height of a 8 story building into a tidal pool of only 12 feet deep that swells and shrinks wave after wave. So, they must swim across to reach the cliff braving strong currents. Then, they need to get out of the water to start climbing the rocks avoiding being smashed or pushed suddenly by the fierce waves. Then, climbing barefoot all the way to the top. Finally, the dive with some flips, avoiding a free fall into the rocks and coinciding with a swell to avoid a dive straight to the bottom. Fascinating. There are shows every day. I recommend paying the 110 pesos to seat at the terrace of the Hotel El mirador. They will give you a free drink and you will avoid the crowds. Shows are every hour from 6 to 10:30 P.M. At  night the dive is with torches.

198571744.name: Cliff divers of Acapulco
198571744.author: a TripAdvisor user
198571744.reviewBody:
Brilliant seeing these daredevils dive from The cliffs. The rocks are craggy and the swell from the sea gets huge
It is an amazing sight, you have to see it to believe it! We went during the day and also in the evening when they dive with torches.
The divers will pose for photos with you afterwards, be sure to tip them!
A must see definitely

197473477.name: La Quebrada
197473477.author: a TripAdvisor user
197473477.reviewBody: One cannot go to Acapulco without seeing this. Our family (over 25 guest) spent the evening at the restaurant watching the divers all the way to the last dive (10;30pm) in complete dark with torches. Stunning and incredible! You can meet the divers after who come to the front door of the restaurant and take photos with you. Don\'t forget to leave them a good tip, it is their only income, no one pays them for this spectacular show, which will take your breath away! Olympians dont even dive from this high! The food was surprisingly very good. The service was very slow, but they were short staff and our waiter really did his best. Don\'t wear high heels to go there, you will going up and down many steep stairs. The setting is perfect, the entertainment at its best and the food was really good for a tourist place. It is one of the most memorable show I have seen, and seen all Cirque du Soleil, this is a MUST!

197437223.name: Wonderfully
197437223.author: a TripAdvisor user
197437223.reviewBody: I liked everything\'s ,I liked of people, very hospitality and lovely  the city and mountains so gorgeous.

197107652.name: Best of the cliff divers
197107652.author: a TripAdvisor user
197107652.reviewBody: We took a picture of the perfect sunset before the divers. It is a must see in Acapulco. Dont need to eat at the restaurant but go down to the bottom of the steps and enjoy

197005195.name: Not to be missed
197005195.author: a TripAdvisor user
197005195.reviewBody: This is the event of Acapulco! Other reviewers give great advice. The platform is cheaper but we prefer the restaurant for a full Mexican experience. Arrive early to be assured of good seats and you can often see two dives. They are breath taking!

196946783.name: These guys are great!
196946783.author: a TripAdvisor user
196946783.reviewBody: We went to La Perla for dinner and to watch the divers. It was a breathtaking experience. Based on other reviews, we got there at 7 pm on a Tuesday, which was a little after the sunset, but the sky still had great colors. The divers did a great job and we got to watch the show twice during dinner. After the second show, the divers were out front of the hotel, and I got a picture with one of them. They asked for tips, but not in an uncomfortable way.

195765636.name: One of the many worthwhile visits in Acapulco
195765636.author: a TripAdvisor user
195765636.reviewBody: Visiting the cliff divers at La Quebrada is a very worth while stop when your in town. Aside from the world class divers the view just like in other parts of the city is incredible.   15 peso admissions for children and 40 peso per adult is a bargain to watch from the platform. The daytime show is at 1pm and would recommend at least 30 minute prior arrival and for the evening shows perhaps as much as 45 min to get a good spot. Shows run hourly at 7:30 8:30 9:30 and the final show they jump with tourches at 10:30.

195692591.name: Impressive diving
195692591.author: a TripAdvisor user
195692591.reviewBody: Impressive Diving. Tickets cost 40 pesos (February 2014). Get there early (preferably at the end of the previous show) to get a good spot to be able to see both the dive from the top and where they\'ll enter the water.

195505760.name: You\'ve Got to Go if in Acapulco
195505760.author: a TripAdvisor user
195505760.reviewBody: Such an icon of Acapulco you\'ve got to see a show.  The divers put on a great show, from the perilous climb up the cliff to the spectacular dives.  Thanks to the recommendation of our tour guide Roberto Alarcon, for a reasonable few pesos we were escorted to an ideal perch for the show -- as good or better than La Perla without having to eat the mid-quality food of that restaurant. Be ready to give an appreciative tip to the divers, no matter where you view the show. Don\'t leave Acapulco without seeing this.

193255001.name: A must see in Alcapulco
193255001.author: a TripAdvisor user
193255001.reviewBody: In my view, there are few more memorable evenings anywhere in the World than having dinner on the terrace of the El Mirador Hotel as the cliff divers perform. Just about everyone has seen the divers, whether it was on the old \u201cWide World of Sports\u201d program in the U.S. or in an Elvis Presley movie. Regardless of where you are staying in the Acapulco area, call and make a dinner reservation at the El Mirador and request a terrace table with a view. After performing, the divers will walk through the restaurant for tips and just about everyone if more than happy to give them a few bucks. The restaurant food was reasonably priced and more than satisfactory but you are there for the show. I have seen the show three times and it never gets old.

192684308.name: Worth the visit!
192684308.author: a TripAdvisor user
192684308.reviewBody: It was part of the City Tour we took, so that included seats in the shade to watch the divers. Couldn\'t believe that they climbed straight up the sides of the cliff (bare hands and feet!). Got some great pictures of these amazing men!

192378873.name: Do the dinner at La Perla-Best View
192378873.author: a TripAdvisor user
192378873.reviewBody: We visited off-season so no reservations needed.  Divers jump at 1:pm, 7:30, 8:30, 9:30 & 10:30pm.  We arrived @ 7:00 & got a great table; few other guests. A 4-course dinner & "show" pkg. with several nice menu choices was approx. $38.00 p.p. US.  We dined liesurely & saw the 7:30 & 8:30 dives.  Wonderful!

191476866.name: Worth seeing, but get there early
191476866.author: a TripAdvisor user
191476866.reviewBody: This is an amazing thing to see, particularly in light of the history of the sport (dates back to 1934) and the relative youth of some of the divers.  It\'s easy to get there and easy to park, but I do recommend arriving at least 45 minutes to an hour before the show.  Once you pay the nominal entrance fee, you have the option to stand along the length of a walled and very broad stairway that leads down to the viewing platform.  The best views, however, are at the base of the viewing platform.  Anywhere else, you will see the divers jump from the cliff but you won\'t be able to see them enter the water for the full effect.  Since the viewing platform fills quite quickly, you will want to get there early to stake out a spot.  Note that you will be standing so wear comfy shoes.

191317970.name: Cliff Divers
191317970.author: a TripAdvisor user
191317970.reviewBody: Great place to visit! Been wanting to see this since the Elvis movie Fun in Acapulco and it was worth the price to see these crazy divers hurtling off the cliffs into a narrow band of water. Take a bus, or cab or walk from the centre of town and be early for the 1pm show to get a good spot at the viewing gallery.

190943189.name: Cliff Divers
190943189.author: a TripAdvisor user
190943189.reviewBody: A must see! I went to see the daytime dives. It is a fantastic feat of courage for those guys to dive between the cliffs. They are very talented.

190785891.name: Beautiful night show.
190785891.author: a TripAdvisor user
190785891.reviewBody: We attended the night show. It was awesome to see the divers jump of the cliffs. It takes courage and experience to execute their job. The nice thing about the night show is that the torches the divers light before they jump look spectacular.

190600201.name: look at the schedule before going
190600201.author: a TripAdvisor user
190600201.reviewBody: you have few viewings a day and it is in the old part of Acapulco.\nDon\'t forget to carry on to Caleta which is kind of what Acapulco really is about.

190452814.name: Nature at its best.
190452814.author: a TripAdvisor user
190452814.reviewBody: The divers show is amazing. A must see when in Acapulco.Ocean views are wonderful.Safe place to visit but a little hard to find.

190397141.name: Divers
190397141.author: a TripAdvisor user
190397141.reviewBody: not well organized, hard to see - but a must-do in Acapulco. Key would be to get there EARLIER. Not half an hour, but ONE hour early to get good spots

189154681.name: Best thing to do in Acapulco
189154681.author: a TripAdvisor user
189154681.reviewBody:
Pretty impressive stuff - big cliff dives that evoke the Elvis movies of yesteryear. Need a taxi to get there because the surrounding streets are a little disorientating. You can either pay 40 peso to watch from the viewing area - or go to La Perla for a meal/drink. Id recommend la perla for the comfort and views!

Overall the diving is pretty impressive. Starts with smaller dives before the more death defying top of cliff dives.

This is clearly the best thing to see in Acapulco - although it is a relatively low base

188617301.name: Cliff Divers of Quebrada
188617301.author: a TripAdvisor user
188617301.reviewBody: The show was 40 pesos and well worth it. The view is incredible and the diving is world class. It\'s worth paying for the ticket to go lower and see the view from up close.

188446180.name: Spectacular
188446180.author: a TripAdvisor user
188446180.reviewBody: We had never seen the night dive (with torches).  It is spectacular.  Our driver David Alcaraz arranged for a front row seat on a private balcony (not the restaurant).  If you need a driver/guiide  can contact him at - davidalcaraz822@gmail.com

188091710.name: great show
188091710.author: a TripAdvisor user
188091710.reviewBody: You got to see this, it is truly unreal, the height this guys dive and into a not to deep ocean its scary.

187425004.name: A Must-see
187425004.author: a TripAdvisor user
187425004.reviewBody: Since I was a kid and first heard of "Acapoco," I had always wanted to see these divers. They were as expected, and the most impressive part to me was how easily and quickly they scaled the cliff before diving. The show is only a half hour, but it\'s cheap and part of the Acapulco legend, so I\'d recommend attending once.

185124778.name: Cliff Divers
185124778.author: a TripAdvisor user
185124778.reviewBody: These guys are very brave and it is fascinating to watch from the cliff and then we also watched it from Jerry\'s boat which was even better.

184279820.name: Can\'t miss it if you are in Acapulco
184279820.author: a TripAdvisor user
184279820.reviewBody: You may not like diving. Your may not like sports at all. But not watching this world renowned spectacle is almost like you\'ve never been to Acapulco. Having heard that food was not good there, we had dinner somewhere else and then went for drinks to the restaurant by the cliff. The view was great. It didn\'t take much time to see quite a few guys diving down this 100 foot drop. Quite impressive!\n

181598361.name: If you visit Acapulco as a tourist and you don\'t see the cliff divers, then why did you bother to come to Acapulco?
181598361.author: a TripAdvisor user
181598361.reviewBody: It is a very touristy experience, but it is one of a kind and it is the tradition of Acapulco.  Seeing the divers climb the cliff wall is as much fun as watching them dive off of it.  Enjoying a meal and a drink at the Mirador restaurant during the diving show makes a great evening.

181060815.name: heart-stopping experience
181060815.author: a TripAdvisor user
181060815.reviewBody: This diving event is heart stopping.  You make a sign of the cross as the divers make their final leap into the sea below - hoping the water is at the right level - if not, they will crash into the rocks and head for death.

178116230.name: Crazy
178116230.author: a TripAdvisor user
178116230.reviewBody: It is lovely to see and really really interesting but I did worry about the guys life. You see them jump just like that it is breth taking but.... scary. You have to see it and apreciate what they are doing.

176179902.name: Have to go!!
176179902.author: a TripAdvisor user
176179902.reviewBody: This is a must see when going to Acapulco. We go every year but I do have suggestion, rent a boat, I get a few couples and rent a nice 40 foot cruiser. Go dwon to docks to set up a couple days before, don\'t go thru hotel, they jump the price!!

175625212.name: Cliff divers
175625212.author: a TripAdvisor user
175625212.reviewBody: It was an awesome show. We decided to not eat in the restaurant (due to bad reviews). We were so glad that we did and arrived early to be right up in front to see the night show. The cliff divers walked right past us, over the cliff, and into the water to prepare for the show. It was definitely worth the trip and the admission fee.\n\nFYI: Since there was so many of us we decided to walk, from where the bus dropped us off in the centro of Old Acapulco. We 10 of us walked through the streets of the neighborhood to get there. I wish we had taken the cab like we intended because the neighborhood was a bit rough.

174751751.name: La Quebrada is Acapulco
174751751.author: a TripAdvisor user
174751751.reviewBody: Another place you shouldn\'t miss in Acapulco.\nRudy our guide took us there, we were sitting in the shade with the best view!

174218029.name: Just right
174218029.author: a TripAdvisor user
174218029.reviewBody: It was fun and interesting about the cliff divers. That is our very first time to watch them and see some people that are crazier than us lol

171634894.name: not to miss it!
171634894.author: a TripAdvisor user
171634894.reviewBody: Maybe the most traditional show in Acapulco, it\'s really impressive how these men just jump into the sea.  The show in the night with the torches is amazing.  \nYou can also buy some handcrafts outside.

171328795.name: Cliff Divers
171328795.author: a TripAdvisor user
171328795.reviewBody: The show of the cliff divers is a must see in Acapulco. I don\u00b4t rate it with 5 stars because the two places from where you can watch the show (The hotel and the terraces built on the cliffs are worn down structures) The hotel is probably the best place but don\u00b4t go for meals because it is not good. Settle for cocktails and enjoy the show. On your way out from either place you will find the divers asking for tips. I don\u00b4t like it very much to be intimidated to give away some money to people who are almost blocking your way out. Nevertheless go and enjoy it.

169814829.name: Places to visit in Acapulco
169814829.author: a TripAdvisor user
169814829.reviewBody: A must see because of the history and the daring.  Most shows are in the evening on the half hour.  It\'s safe there also.

167722475.name: Must See!!!
167722475.author: a TripAdvisor user
167722475.reviewBody: This a must see if you are in Acapulco. The divers are unbelievable. I watched 3 shows back to back, 8:30; 9;30 and 10:30. Just don\'t eat at restaurant, the food is awful. The view from the restaurant is amazing but eat elsewhere before the shows and just have cocktails there.

164509883.name: overpriced
164509883.author: a TripAdvisor user
164509883.reviewBody: like the landscape but the dives are not that impresived, you can look at them from outside the place without paying the rate

164414127.name: Visting AGAIN and AGAIN and AGAIN =]
164414127.author: a TripAdvisor user
164414127.reviewBody:
Never get enough of this beautiful and natural attraction.

Watch it during the day, sunset or night, everytime you are going to be impressed. This is my third time in Acapulco, and after arriving to my hotel *Mishol* the firts thing that wanted to do is to La Quebrada. 

It is also a good place for meeting real mexicans.

162216638.name: Always spectacular and breathtaking.
162216638.author: a TripAdvisor user
162216638.reviewBody: This is the one sight to which I am always happy to take visitors to Acapulco. Having actually stood on edge of the diving patform once, I have seen up close the bravery that these guys need to actually throw themselves off the 30 something meter cliff. \nYou can watch the dive surrounded by Mexican and foreign tourists up and down the Quebrada steps, or pay for an over-priced drink and watch it from the Mirador Hotel bar, or you can rent a yacht down town and watch from the ocean which might or might not be fun depending on how calm it is.\nHowever you decide to do it, please just DO IT!!!

159451857.name: FALLING IN FOR ACAPULCO
159451857.author: a TripAdvisor user
159451857.reviewBody:
There is a divine Trinity about La Quebrada Acapulco: 

1. It is an incomparable place for the view of the sunset,
2. It is a magnifiscent scenario for romance,
3. The show of the divers is just amazing and flamboyant. Definitely worth for the little you pay for!

With this in mind, my girlfriend and I headed for la Quebrada after spending the day at the Bay and a nice lunch of sea-food. Now here is the thing: to see how 5 or 6 guys come down the stairs to climb down the rocky way,then swim across the big tide and climb up without any rope or climbing gear like total professionals to finally dive in olympics style, this is just something you have to see and witness for yourself.

The dangers of what these men do are incredibly high, in an instant of doubt and miscalculation (they have to wait for the high tide to dive in) means immediate death! 

It is something I literally fell for!

157436127.name: Daredevil divers
157436127.author: a TripAdvisor user
157436127.reviewBody: We finished the day in Acapulco by going to Quebrada to see the divers who have one performance around 1 pm, and three shows later at night in the dark.  They charge 40 pesos (USD4) to watch the performance, paid in advance to a guy selling tickets.  People dispersed when the ticket seller came round. Our vantage point was a public viewing area built on one side of the small bay where the divers jump from a different side.  There was piped music and a Spanish commentary.  The youngest diver was 7 years old, about which his proud grandmother, who was standing next to us, informed us.  They dive from three different stages from the cliff, and reach these by climbing up the cliff face from the sea.  Although being told the performance would be at 7pm, then 7.20pm, the show actually started at 7.40pm.  This performance is quite impressive, not least because of the height of the cliffs from which they jump, but also due to the narrow gap between the cliffs into the sea.

157373204.name: nice touristy thing to see while in acapulco
157373204.author: a TripAdvisor user
157373204.reviewBody: this is a must see while in acapulco for 2 reasons, its one of the only things to do, and not many places in the world can you see this. acapulco is fmaous for this and its pretty cheap. go to the night show theres a surprise at the end. only neative is that it is hard to find we got lost from the signs.

157305822.name: You should probably see this if visiting acapulco
157305822.author: a TripAdvisor user
157305822.reviewBody:
It was a neat experience to see the cliff divers do their thing. 

Typical thing a tourist should do if in Acapulco for the first time.

We went in the daytime, and wish we would have done night. It was very hot out. 

Also, the roads leading to downtown are under construction so if you're coming from Punta Diamante area plan on about an hours drive. We almost didn't make the show!

157016526.name: Amazing - Divers Have Nerves of Steel
157016526.author: a TripAdvisor user
157016526.reviewBody: There are several diving exhibitions each day that start at 1:30 pm.  Six or eight divers climb the steep cliff from the churning water and position themselves at various heights.  One by one they dive into the sea.  Viewing areas accommodate lots of people.  Two are shaded, one is in the blazing sun.  The restaurant looks very run-down, not sure it is even open.  It costs 40 pesos per person to view the divers.  Parking is very tight - take a taxi.

155114119.name: No narrative
155114119.author: a TripAdvisor user
155114119.reviewBody: We saw the show from the restaurant as I was feeling ill.  We had a nice view on a beautiful day.   However the divers are not accompanied by any narration or music or anything.   I would\'ve liked to hear about the history, or the depth of the water, or about the divers... or anything.   So just watching 5 people Dive is just OK.

154561123.name: Cliff Divers
154561123.author: a TripAdvisor user
154561123.reviewBody: We enjoyed the 1330 hours show and had two drinks while we watched the cliff divers but the night show is excellent with the divers carrying torches just before they dived.

152972121.name: Better at daytime
152972121.author: a TripAdvisor user
152972121.reviewBody:
We went at night and have dinner at the hotel La Quebrada. Seeing with your own eyes is different from the pictures you shot.
I have been there at day and night,  and at day is much better.

151660242.name: A must
151660242.author: a TripAdvisor user
151660242.reviewBody: Now you can\'t go to Acapulco without going to see The Cliff divers. Get there early to avoid dissapointment SPECTACUAR is not the word

151107822.name: Loved the divers but forget the restaurant
151107822.author: a TripAdvisor user
151107822.reviewBody: I really enjoyed the divers. Not only do you get to witness the diving itself (into shallow water in a narrow area) but you get to see the divers climb up the steep mountain sides. This is a show in itself! They are utterly amazing. One of the divers was a very young boy and one seemed a somewhat older gentleman.. the ages seemed to be quite a spread. It is fascinating just knowing the training necessary to do these dives. One thing I would definitely recommend is to forget the restaurant. I thought the food was mediocre at best. We had a great view from the restaurant in a shaded area but for $19 per person, the meal was most forgettable.

150395072.name: Great to see divers
150395072.author: a TripAdvisor user
150395072.reviewBody: This place is awesome, while there\'s lotsa vendors (of course) it\'s incredible to see them divers go in with flame torches!\n\nwill repeat.

149993520.name: just ok
149993520.author: a TripAdvisor user
149993520.reviewBody: i guess it is a must see in Acapulco, but i will not come back.  40 pesos per person to see 5 guys jumping from the cliff.  it is amazing to see go u p the wall, but i am not sure if it worth your time.

149208265.name: Best viewed from El Mirador restaurant, "La Perla"
149208265.author: a TripAdvisor user
149208265.reviewBody:
I've seen this show from both La Quebrada balcony for 45 pesos / 3 USD and now the restaurant La Perla for 180 pesos (which includes 2 drinks) that's located directly in front of the diving/cliff area, and i have to say the restaurant views are the best. 

The balcony views that La Quebrada offers aren't too good unless you're early, and found a spot at the bottom of the balcony in front of the divers. Otherwise, watching it behind people, fighting your way for a view, or from the staircase is the worst. You can't really see anything.

The restaurant views from La Perla are awesome. If i had a high res camera, would of captured great shots, but my hand held/phone camera isn't that good at night. The views from teh restaurant you can at least see the waves below, the guys climb both walls, and watch the full dive as opposed to watching front view dives (which is tough). The restaurant service was pretty bad, but again i was there for the views, not the food (that i heard was pretty bad). Also, sitting at a table, with a drink and music is much better than standing at a balcony ~ in my opinion!

149132236.name: whats the big deal
149132236.author: a TripAdvisor user
149132236.reviewBody: hard to get a good view. go and see it so that you can say you did it and then move on. i didnt think it was all it was cracked up to be. Sorry to anyone who feels it changed their life.

147631930.name: Great show from brave (or crazy) men!
147631930.author: a TripAdvisor user
147631930.reviewBody: Great show on the cliffs of La Quebrada. We saw both day and night shows and it made for heartstopping entertainment. The last diver on the night show is the best but I won\'t spoil it!\nThe meal is average at best but it gets you a decent seat for the diving!

146504568.name: Stunning views
146504568.author: a TripAdvisor user
