146504568.reviewBody: As always, it\'s fun to watch the divers. Take sunscreen and water. We drove in a rental car -- it\'s easier to get in and out that way and see the sights along the way.

145887732.name: THE thing you must see in Acapulco
145887732.author: a TripAdvisor user
145887732.reviewBody:
Was only in Acapulco for a day.  
Had my cab driver take me here. Im really happy I did.  Grabed a beer...got a place along the wall and watched the divers.
you have 2 options.  the wall or the restaraunt.  i picked the wall....had a spot right along it so was good.  if you dont...consider the restaraunt as you will have a better view.  

if you go to Acapulco you must go see this!  Its cool!

145776559.name: This is Acapulco!
145776559.author: a TripAdvisor user
145776559.reviewBody: This is a must see!   My husband and I, along with two other couples, enjoyed the 8:30 show from La Perla restaurant.  We payed 181 pesos each, which included two drinks for each of us.   We loved the entire event.  FUN IN ACAPULCO!

145564625.name: Very cool!
145564625.author: a TripAdvisor user
145564625.reviewBody: Nice history and nice time in a romantic area. I was very impressed by the divers. Highly recommended to watch from La Perla restaurant though!

144005082.name: An Acapulco must
144005082.author: a TripAdvisor user
144005082.reviewBody: Watching the Clavadistas is an Acapulco definite. It\'s not expensive and you can stick around for multiple shows (hourly on the half from 6.30pm). The shows have gotten shorter since I first came but still a great spectacle.

143623508.name: A must-do!
143623508.author: a TripAdvisor user
143623508.reviewBody: You\'ve seen it on tv, but to see it in real life is amazing. Each diver took our breath away. For only 40 pesos ($3.20) you receive a memory you won\'t forget.

143273332.name: Great Show
143273332.author: a TripAdvisor user
143273332.reviewBody:
We were staying in Acapulco for a bunch of days. Of course the Cliff Divers were on our list. My wife has seen them before, but she said it's nice to watch it again.

So we came here for the show at lunch time. We accidently came over an hour too early, but like this we also had still a lot of space to choose from.
There's a small entrance fee to the show and after it donations to the divers (they are lining up personally) are welcome.

The cliffs here are beautifully located. Sunny weather, great water and high cliffs. It's perfect. Before the show you might catch some divers practicing (there were some younger ones jumping quite a few times when we were there...and no tourists around yet).
The show itselft only takes about 30 minutes, but it's really something. The last dive here is the highest and most impressive.

There's shows throughout the day with the last show in the evening (with torches). La Perla restaurant does a lot of advertising, because it sits right on the cliffs. But we went in there to check it...and the view wasn't that great or much different. It's not really worth it to spend a lot of money for drinks and food just because of the show. The regular watch points along the cliffs are good enough.

If we're back in Acapulco we surely would go watch again. Wanna know more about my trips? Check my profile (where you'll also find my website with more info about my travels).

140785757.name: Divers
140785757.author: a TripAdvisor user
140785757.reviewBody: The divers never cease to amaze me.  They do have a lot of skill and courage to be able to do this dive each and every day and evening for very little pay.  Please be generous.

137838939.name: You must see it at least once in your life!
137838939.author: a TripAdvisor user
137838939.reviewBody: It is breathtaking! The courage of the divers is incredible! Try to get there early to have a good spot to watch the whole show. It is definitively worth it!

137824037.name: Cliff Jumpers risking Life & Limb for pesos !
137824037.author: a TripAdvisor user
137824037.reviewBody: You know if you are in Acapulco, you have to check this out !  We have checked out other divers up the Pacific Coast of Mexico but these guys are the Cliff Diving Icons.  Also we took in an awesome Sunset and where we sat, (A small amphitheater facing the Quebrada) was one of the more interesting, people watching spots in Mexico !  Extremely well worth, a long Look !  SkippyFrizz !

136515834.name: Home of a princess
136515834.author: a TripAdvisor user
136515834.reviewBody:
La Quebrada is the home of the perfect woman, and I am fortunate enough to know her!
If you ever have a chance, take a walk in the neighbourhood and if luck is on your side, you might just be lucky enough to meet her in the street....please give my regards

136036851.name: Don\'t leave Acapulco without a visit to La Quebrada!
136036851.author: a TripAdvisor user
136036851.reviewBody: If you visit Acapulco, be sure to visit La Quebrada. Catch the late night show, because that\'s when the divers will give you their best performance -no lights on but a torch- and they dive from more than 100 feet high into the ocean\'s darkness, only guided by the sound and their experience with the movement of the waves. Get there early, because the place gets packed. There is a very small fee you\'ll have to pay to see them, but I highly recommend it. You can even order drinks and food if you like.

134197117.name: Very brave men
134197117.author: a TripAdvisor user
134197117.reviewBody: It was an amazing show that the divers put on and they are very talented and brave.  Highly recommended !

130771375.name: Needs more upkeep (and this goes for all of Acapulco)
130771375.author: a TripAdvisor user
130771375.reviewBody: You have to visit this place to understand where Acapulco comes from.  At the height of its time (50s/60s) this was THE place all of the celebrities went to.  Frank Sinatra, John Wayne, Tarzan, etc.  But it would be great if the government of Acapulco could help these 1950s gems to revitalize them to what they once were.

130465421.name: Amazing and brave
130465421.author: a TripAdvisor user
130465421.reviewBody: Well certainly I wouldn\'t choose to dive 150 feet from a rock at night with only torches to light the waves... these guys have to even calculate the moment the tide comes in to have enough water to dive in to and not hit the rocks at the ocean bottom of this cliff. Very spectacular. Crowded popular place. Get the dinner with a view of the divers show.

129857127.name: more commercial place
129857127.author: a TripAdvisor user
129857127.reviewBody: I visited thise place at 18:00, every good places for visitors were full, if you want to take some fotos or video clips you have to come very early.

128949877.name: Cliff Divers
128949877.author: a TripAdvisor user
128949877.reviewBody: I have been many times and each time the show changes.  It is always amazing though.

128294685.name: amazing performances
128294685.author: a TripAdvisor user
128294685.reviewBody: This spectacular event is always heartstopping, fun and exciting.\nThe professional divers, carrying lighted torches, is a sight to behold and every visitor to Acapulco should see this!

128177006.name: Everybody talks about it . . . you have to see it
128177006.author: a TripAdvisor user
128177006.reviewBody: What may have started as a cultural event certainly has become an opportunity for commercialization. However, in truth, all of the food and knickknack stands add their own flavor. It was something I would not have missed.

127829297.name: Wide World of Sports
127829297.author: a TripAdvisor user
127829297.reviewBody: Its kinda like the opening shot of that old Saturday but taken to a commercial level.  Most of Acapulco shows up to watch the spectacle.  If you want to see it walk (a long hike) or rent a skooter.  Traffic is insane...

127314813.name: The most popular place in Acapulco worlwide
127314813.author: a TripAdvisor user
127314813.reviewBody: Acapulco\'s top atraction. Can I say more? with a bit more of care can be again the nices place in Acapulco.

126673675.name: Classic Acapulco
126673675.author: a TripAdvisor user
126673675.reviewBody: A must see, just like the old movies. Dinner at the Restaurant with the Divers Show is a must.

126602903.name: Execellent
126602903.author: a TripAdvisor user
126602903.reviewBody: Breathtaking diving and cheap drinks! This was well worth drive across Acapulco, accompanied by Luiz our taxi driver

126158089.name: A short show, but impressive and a must see.
126158089.author: a TripAdvisor user
126158089.reviewBody:
The cliff divers are known around the world, so i think they are a must see. I understand some people being dissappointed that it doesn't last longer, but they can't just keep diving all day and night.
There are usually 5-6 dives each show, but with only 1 from the very highest 35m point.
I think that the setting, the small landing area, and the height of the cliffs make it pretty special. 
I went a couple of times.
The general admission is 40 pesos, but i think the view from La Perla restaurant is a little better - especially if u like photography and want to see the divers out in the air without the cliffs in the background.
La Perla is more expensive tho. Lunch with a drink and the 1pm show is 201 pesos.
I enjoyed the show first, then relaxed and had lunch with a fantastic view and an ice cold corona with lime.
I think the 1pm day show is better - again especially if u want any decent photos - as the lighting at night isn't enough for photography, and i also don't think you can appreciate the whole setting amongst the cliffs nearly as well.

125938061.name: CRAZY divers!
125938061.author: a TripAdvisor user
125938061.reviewBody: Cannot imagine how anyone could make this dive!  GREAT views and well attended; well worth any $$$ to see. This was part of the city tour.  Nicer shops nearby, too.

125280722.name: A few good shots from the highway
125280722.author: a TripAdvisor user
125280722.reviewBody: Was able to get a good view from the roadway leading to the Sinfonia....Free only from where we happened to be standing...

125085204.name: They did WHAT??? Amazing Cliff Divers
125085204.author: a TripAdvisor user
125085204.reviewBody: Baldo Gomez (our taxi/tour guide - [baldo-work@hotmail.com]) took us her to see the show during our day tour that he organized, and said that this was a must see (touristy-- but must see) Amazing to see what these med do.. i can imagine the precision that they must have to go through because they had to time to the waves. they were diving into just 10 feet of water (without waves) from up to 115 feet high.. when they jumped.. you have to hold your breath.. it looked like they were going to hit the cliff when they did the back flip.. Amazing work!!

123884389.name: A must see tourist attraction; even fancied by locals.
123884389.author: a TripAdvisor user
123884389.reviewBody: On the way to this attraction you will see the street lined with locals and tourist to see the cliff divers.  My recommendation is to find your way to the top and eat at the restaurant.  While the food is just OK the view is perfect.  The restaurant itself is pretty cool in the sense that it is built into the mountain side.  I traveled with children and adult family members.  Even those that have seen it before still marveled at the diving abilities (cejones) of the divers.  There is no cost for the attraction unless you dine.  They tried to hit us up for a cover charge but some swift negotiating took care of that.  We went at night so we enjoyed the diving finale with them using torches.

123850351.name: Boring
123850351.author: a TripAdvisor user
123850351.reviewBody: Terribly disappointed at this cliffdiver show that lasts 5 minutes, and we spend more time clapping the divers than watching them dive.

123577447.name: Divers show
123577447.author: a TripAdvisor user
123577447.reviewBody: Beautiful ocean view, spectacular sunsets, good divers show.\n\nYoung people risk their lives in that divers show.

123228208.name: Awe Inspiring
123228208.author: a TripAdvisor user
123228208.reviewBody: It is amazing every time I go here to see these guys dive into the ocean.  This is a must see if you go to Acapulco.  I have been going for over 15 years now and I see this attraction every year.

122978855.name: Cliff Divers
122978855.author: a TripAdvisor user
122978855.reviewBody: Cliff Divers with their daring feats are a must for any trip to Acapulco.  The hotel told me the time for the show was at 1:30 but fortunately another guest on the beach told me it was 1:00 PM.  It\'s a good thing because it was all over by 1:15

122928787.name: Amazing Death Defying Divers!
122928787.author: a TripAdvisor user
122928787.reviewBody: Very unique experience.  Hot, Quick, Cheap, and Easy.  A Must do!

122637145.name: This Kids are very Brave
122637145.author: a TripAdvisor user
122637145.reviewBody: We had dinner and watch the divers, oh Boy! they are brave.

122456435.name: Don\'t miss this World Known International Spot - It\'s Acapulco!!
122456435.author: a TripAdvisor user
122456435.reviewBody: A must see! Known all over the world as Acapulco\'s Fame!

122375476.name: Dated entertainment from aanother era
122375476.author: a TripAdvisor user
122375476.reviewBody:
In an era before base jumping, bungee, and other extreme sports, this performance might have been considered thrilling. By today's standards, however, it's little more than interesting.

The divers were panhandling between shows in the parking lots in the area. It was sad, but they were aggressive so we gave them nothing.

Stay away from "la pearla" restaurant (read reviews).

122004921.name: every one whant see it !
122004921.author: a TripAdvisor user
122004921.reviewBody: enjoy the show at super time whit friend do not forget your kodak or video camera

121257806.name: Very good outing !!
121257806.author: a TripAdvisor user
121257806.reviewBody: A must-see attraction in Acapulco, they charge $40 pesos per adult and $15 per child. I like that because the area is superclean and they\'ve built different levels to make room for people to watch the dives. First show at 12:45pm, only one with daylight. First show at nighttime starts at 7:30 with a brief movie shown against the cliff that gives you a little bit of the diving history and illustrates the many movies that had been shot there during the Golden Era of mexican movies, back in the 50\'s. The narration is all in Spanish. Be there early because the place gets packed !! Torch lit show is at 10:30pm.

120688121.name: Historic tourist attraction but well worth it!!
120688121.author: a TripAdvisor user
120688121.reviewBody: Cheap entrance fee ~MX$40, these guys need to make a living and they risk their lives!!!, Amazing cliff diving feats and rock climbing to match. Incredible back flips from 35m into shallow water below!... Just need to have better access to rest rooms MX$5, each time you want to go in.

120621991.name: Get there early
120621991.author: a TripAdvisor user
120621991.reviewBody:
It can get crowded pretty quickly, so if you see room against the stone wall filling up, get your spot and park there. You need to be against the stone wall so you can see the divers climb, down, swim over, climb out, and eventually splash down. 
If you are late, you'll see someone's back and miss a good part of the show.
The night time dive with the torches is OK, but the early show is great.
You'll be surprised how young some of the divers are.
After the show, the divers wait on the steps to have picture taken with them for a fee.
Small fee to use the washroom.

119895553.name: Spent lots of money
119895553.author: a TripAdvisor user
119895553.reviewBody: The proprietors are pleasant and bought us beers.  This a series of shops and stores.  Slightly upgraded from your standard El Pueblito-style shopping area but the women loved it.  The men that were there spoke good english and french and were very happy to have our business.

119290583.name: Nostalgic awe
119290583.author: a TripAdvisor user
119290583.reviewBody: This is a must see in Acapulco! It is actually one of the best ways to see the sunset and a nice and original show, the divers do it from a rocky cliff into the raging sea, while one watches from a viewpoint with a nice drink.\nIt brought back childhood awe to me.

119090641.name: WOW!!!!
119090641.author: a TripAdvisor user
119090641.reviewBody: We went to La Quebrada to watch the cliff divers. I had to cover my eyes watching them - it was crazy. Even just climbing up the cliffs was scary enough but diving into the water from that high up when it was pretty rough and windy was amazing - it just wouldn\'t happen in Australia. It was a really good experience even though it turned my stomach. I don\'t know whether they are really brave or just stupid!\nWe paid a little more to go down the steps which was definently worth it as we were right up the front. We then walked down to the markets and Zocalo.

118332801.name: Always impressive
118332801.author: a TripAdvisor user
118332801.reviewBody:
Be careful due to the current security situation

Everytime i see the cliff divers it feels like seeing the show for the first time. Whenever possible pay the cover necessary to go to the logest viewing spot, it's even more impressive.

Get there by 7:00pm so you can watch the daylight show and then the night show at 8:00pm

116530750.name: GREAT EXPERIENCE!!
116530750.author: a TripAdvisor user
116530750.reviewBody: I took my mom to Acapulco for a mother-daughter vacation and this was such a great evening!! We made reservations months in advance at the La Perla restaurant at Mirador hotel. The service was attentive and friendly, food was good but nothing spectacular. We got there before the show started and we enjoyed looking at all the Old Hollywood memorabilia since we are both buffs. I am interested in Aztec history so really enjoyed the traditionally-dressed performers and their dance/performance was great. The cliff divers are spectacular--it\'s hard to imagine how they are able to scale the face of the cliff!\nAnyone who visits Acapulco MUST make reservations to enjoy this!

114626176.name: A must do and see when in ACApulco....
114626176.author: a TripAdvisor user
114626176.reviewBody: We watched the divers from La Perla for lunch.  We had been told La Perla was not good for dinner but our driver Sebastian Hernandez, said there was a different cook for lunch so we could try that if we wished.  Sebastian arranged everything and they were waiting for us upon arrival...it was 195 pesos per person for a choice of 4 different meals, chicken, hamburg, fish and enchiladas I think, and also one drink per person.  We had enchiladas and fish and a beer and margarita.  The food was fine, tasty, prepared well, good quantity,  and the drinks were cold.  We  found our seats to be great, front and center, under cover in shade, seated comfortably for the show.  The 7 divers of course are fantastic and take such risks.  We felt we could not visit Acapulco without seeing this show.  I highly suggest checking out this show, having lunch at La Perla, and using Sebastian for your driver.  We pre-arranged everything with Sebastian  (-------) before our arrival which made for a much smoother trip.

105874270.name: Amazing
105874270.author: a TripAdvisor user
105874270.reviewBody: The divers are amazing and it would be a shame not to see them in Acapulco...just don\'t waste your money at La Pearla. Watch the boys dive and eat at one of the local rerstaurwnts down the road. \nThe views from La Quebrada are worth the visit alone and the 7 young men are spectacular

97009695.name: view from the acarey and the cliffs of la quebrada
97009695.author: a TripAdvisor user
97009695.reviewBody: the best view of the quebrada cliffs and sinfonia del mar is from the aca rey yatch. Also the sunset is gorgeous lasting only 5 minutes. Nice time!!!

95351715.name: very impressive , brave young men
95351715.author: a TripAdvisor user
95351715.reviewBody: Got there early so had good place to view right down at the front at the bottom of the steps , it is worth the effort doing this since you get a good closer of the divers as they climb the cliff to get upto the two little religous alcoves where they pray for success before diving. .\nThere were 7 of them  and they dive off in turn ( not all from the top )4 on their own and 3 in a group. The dive height is impressive and it is not a straight cliff but inclines from top to bottom where it is furthest out so the dive has to clear the cliff face .\nWell worth money , tips accepted afterwards by divers for signing T-shirts or posing for photos or simply if you think they deserve it.

93393475.name: get there early, cool experience
93393475.author: a TripAdvisor user
93393475.reviewBody: We went here as part of a tour - if we could have chosen we would have gotten there sooner to get a better view.  Really there are lots of places to view from but it just would have been less stressful to not have to try to squeeze in as much.  So if you can control when you get there try to get there earlier rather than later.\nThat being said it was quite a fun experience and amazing to watch divers.  Definitely something you have to do when in Acapulco.

81810590.name: Iconic place with the cliff divers - Watch from La Perla
81810590.author: a TripAdvisor user
81810590.reviewBody:
After years of watching the Elvis movie "Fun in Acapulco" and the ABC "Wide World of Sports", we always wanted to see the cliff divers in Acapulco.  We were not disappointed in getting a chance to visit Acapulco and go to where they dive. 

You can get up close to watch them dive off the cliff by going to an observation area opposite from the cliff where they climb up and then dive off. This is out in the open and you are exposed to the sun. We decided to go to the La Perla restaurant where they have tiers of seatings that are all in the shade and faces the inlet into which the divers take the plunge. You get a great view and can sit back and have a few drinks while waiting for the show to start.

After the divers finish their show, they come up to the top of the stairs to greet you and look for tips. It is a heck of way to earn a living.

34660234.name: Impressive!
34660234.author: a TripAdvisor user
34660234.reviewBody:
The cliffdivers at La Quebrada are an absolute must-see. The divers' daring and skill is impressive in the extreme. They jump from approximately 200 ft into an inlet that is only 12 to 15 ft deep! The water is very rough as well.

We stayed for two shows which took about 30 minutes each.

We were very surprised that the youngest diver is only 8 years old! Most of them, in fact, are teenagers. They were proud to announce that they have added their first female diver to the group but she was not present on the day we visited.

We were pleased to have the opportunity to meet the divers after the show and ask them some questions. They were happy to take pictures with us as well.

We saw their show from La Perla which is the restaurant and bar attached to the hotel Mirador. It is pretty much the only way for a disabled person to get a good view of the diving. We enjoyed our time there but really disliked the meal we had so I would recommend against eating there.

19970885.name: Divers train for years for this dangerous sport
19970885.author: a TripAdvisor user
19970885.reviewBody: Our tour included a stop to see the world famous cliff divers.  Truly an amazing sport, dangerous and even if done perfectly causes brain injuries from hitting the water.  The divers are famous in the city and honored for the profession.  I was amazed at their abilities.  We got to say hello on the way out and give them a small token of our great appreciation.  They had added a young lady to the team and it was truly a pleasure to meet her as well.

19285814.name: Very good experience
19285814.author: a TripAdvisor user
19285814.reviewBody:
This is one of the best attractions in Acapulco. You can go there in car, bus or taxi. The entrance costs only $35 MXP and it includes a bottle of water or a soda. They offer several shows at different hours. You better arrive early to win a good place.

We didn't tried the restaurant, but it's a little far from the actual diving place, so I recommend to just pay the ordinary observatory rate. The divers descend the rocks from one side of the water and then climb the other, where they dive from differents heights. There are two divers who jump together.

The whole show takes about half an hour, and you can take plenty of pictures and video. There are bathrooms and a little grocery store there. You can even hire the divers for special shows.

14212000.name: Pretty Amazing
14212000.author: a TripAdvisor user
14212000.reviewBody: The Cliff Divers, as so many others have pointed out, are really a must-see while in Acapulco.  Unfortunately, we got there just before the 7:30 start time and didn\'t feel like battling the crowd down below so we watched from the road.  Though we could still see the action and didn\'t have to pay the entrance fee ($3.50/person) it would have been much more of a show had we gotten there earlier to get in the front row!  We had two taxi drivers actually tell us to avoid La Perla restaurant (the restaurant just up from the divers) because it is quite expensive (around $30.00/person) and not worth the money.  Go see the cliff divers and then head back into town for dinner.

13436707.name: Avoid the restaurant and enjoy the show
13436707.author: a TripAdvisor user
13436707.reviewBody:
The only good thing that happened on this excursion was we got to see 3 cliff diver shows, I got my daily stair-stepping workout and get to know other couples in our group.

A group of us went in two buses to the show and this restaurant and were sorry we did. The show was very worthwhile but the restaurant was just awful. Although we had reservations for our group they were not prepared for a group our size and there was a group of 175 waiting on buses behind us. This caused the restaurant to ask us to leave before we had a chance to eat. So we were at the restaurant for 2 1/2 hours and did not get to eat. We waited 30 minutes outside in line to get in only to find out the prices for our group had been increased over what had been quoted to us. The price went from 36/person to 39/person. You pay up front before you get your table. When they ask if you want drinks, which is extra, they don't mean just alcohol that includes soda, coffee and water. Once we were seated it took 20 minutes to get our menus and that was after complaining. Then we ordered our drinks another 20 minutes passed before we got our drinks and that was again only after complaining (Side note, since the restaurant is built into a cliff, the manager and cashier are 5 stories up a set of stairs but you do get to walk by the bar :-) ). Others in our group had already ordered, been served and finished and leaving on one of the buses. When we were able to place our order and after 30 minutes we still did not have food and my wife's blood sugar was crashing so I had to beg for food from other tables that had been served. Our group coordinator was able to get our money back after waiting for the manager for 30 minutes. The staff does not speak English and the manager very little which is very interesting for a Mexican restaurant that only servers American food. Oh yeah, don't go hear expecting to find guacamole or fajitas on the menu. They have Salmon, steak and American food.

There is a platform where you can for a small charge watch the show and it is a better vantage point then anywhere in the restaurant. My strong recommendation is to avoid the restaurant and enjoy the show.

11214921.name: Unforgetable place to be
11214921.author: a TripAdvisor user
11214921.reviewBody: Great place to visit and incredible divers who riks their lives to give a fantastic show!!!

7586415.name: Well worth the 3.50
7586415.author: a TripAdvisor user
7586415.reviewBody: I took a cab from my hotel (baby\'o/Walmart area) for $35 to see the cliff divers.  I made a reservation at the restaurant and was seriously sorry I did.  The show was amazing, but I wish I would have paid the 3.50 and watched them outside.  You get to watch them dive and climb back up the cliff about 3-4 times.  After my horrible dinner, I came upstairs where I was greeted by one of the cliff divers and got a picture.\n

7218634.name: Value for money
7218634.author: a TripAdvisor user
7218634.reviewBody: We got the bus to the zocolo and then walked up the hill to the platform there are no signs as such but people are happy to give you directions. when we got there we were pounced on by staff from the hotel near by trying to get us to go there for lunch for 70 pesos each which included watching the dive. we oppted to watch it from the diving platform like everyone else it was 35 pesos which included a small soda or beer. The show was ment to start at 12:45 but of course we are in mexico so we go to watch the divers entering the water and testing it out for 15 mins or so then we waited for the boats to get into postion after that they were climbing up that cliff then they went to pray to the virgin guadalupe before jumping. 7 divers jumped from different hights and 2 jumped together. very cool.\n

6616505.name: Impressive
6616505.author: a TripAdvisor user
6616505.reviewBody:
We arrived at La Quebrada in time for the 12:45 cliff diver show (which actually started at 1:00). Admission was U.S. $3.50 per person, which includes a cold drink. The divers also give you the opportunity to tip on your way out. 

We stood about halfway down, and had a good perspective for pictures. We were as impressed with the athleticism when the clavadistas climbed up the rock, as we were with the actual dives! The dives were a spectacle, and we also enjoyed the natural beauty of the area, and seeing the boats lined up for the show.

4443366.name: La Quebrada Cliff Divers Great!
4443366.author: a TripAdvisor user
4443366.reviewBody:
We were there on a Friday, 3 Feb 2006, and it was a wonderful show--incredible to me.  We stayed for two shows.  There are more shows on the weekend nights and the last of the evening apparently is done with divers holding the torches extinguished as they hit the water.  We did not stay for that, maybe next time.  Or, possibly negotiate for a boat out to watch at night.

The higher platform gives a view of the entire area of the sea into which the brave dove.  If you go lower, you must lean over others including children and short people who should be in front anyway.

Advice......don't forget your camera or binoculars, as I did!

2313615.name: 4* if you go at for the last show
2313615.author: a TripAdvisor user
2313615.reviewBody: Something you must see, I went for the last show, @ 9pm.  Costs $3 for the viewing platform, by far the best view.  At night they jump with torches and the area is very well lit. $3 cab ride from anywhere in acapulco, if you try hard you can get there for two. I say a definte must go.\n

2265113.name: The complete Acapulco Experience
2265113.author: a TripAdvisor user
2265113.reviewBody: Everyone has heard about them -- so if you\'re in Acapulco, you need to go. The show takes place once in the afternoon and then a couple times at night. My husband and I just paid the $3 to watch from the observation deck -- we did not eat there. The view was totally fine. The whole show lasts about 25 minutes. We went to the 7:30 show and the sun was just starting to go down; so we didn\'t have sun in our eyes. It was perfect and made for some great pictures. With the $3 you also get a drink -- beer, soda, or water. It\'s just something you need to see. There is also a very nice (but pricey) silver jewelry shop there, but it is only open during the day.\n

1771644.name: Don\'t Miss?
1771644.author: a TripAdvisor user
1771644.reviewBody: Everyone says it is the one thing you must do in Acapulco. Um, ok, maybe. but I would suggest that taking a cab to La Perla (the restaurant built inot the cliffs that offers the best view) may not be the best choice. Charge will be about 15 bucks a person that will include two drinks, but you\'ll probably only be there for about 30-40 minutes so not everyone will be able to toss em back that quickly. $30 bucks or so will get you dinner but I saw that the folks behind me seemed to have the equivilent of "good" airline food. Better off just going to the viewing platform and tip the divers as they come up (going to La Perla won\'t save you from this process either). There is a boat that will charge you an arm and leg to get up and real close, but the water is a bit rough at the mouth of the cove and the idling boat can be pretty shaky stuff.

628593095.name: Great family orientated place to visit
628593095.author: a TripAdvisor user
628593095.reviewBody: Nice friendly place to visit.  Lots of families enjoying the walk around and visiting the zoo animals.  Great place to spend a few hours.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

563774854.name: Villa Artesanal Silver Mine, Workshop and Jewelry Shop
563774854.author: a TripAdvisor user
563774854.reviewBody: We took a tour with Rudy and George (Rudy Tour by Van Acapulco) to look at silver jewelry. This is the first place they took us and we loved it. We toured the workshop and mine, Polo was very informative. We were guided up to the shop where I had my first margarita (not a fan of the salt rim but the drink was nice). We were shown lots of gemstones and their abilities to change colour through light or temperature. We bought 4 necklaces, a bracelet and two pairs of earrings. Amazingly sparkly jewelry.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

560742495.name: Cats and birds
560742495.author: a TripAdvisor user
560742495.reviewBody: We stopped in to check out this free park/zoo today. I was very impressed at what they had to offer for free!! We strolled around, saw turtles, Cats, and talked to a parrot. It said Hello in English and Spanish. There are lazy feral cats everywhere and they were not shy. They have a lot of water features and we also saw a crocodile. We were really in the area for the beach across the street so we didn\'t stay long. There is a lot we did not see.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

551966263.name: worth the stop
551966263.author: a TripAdvisor user
551966263.reviewBody: the park is a lerger place and worh the walk to go through it  small children will like the rides an d similar attractions

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

491451104.name: Great time for the whole family!
491451104.author: a TripAdvisor user
491451104.reviewBody: We have small children who enjoyed this park very much! The best part is it is FREE! The only part that costs is the water park side. We didn\'t go into the water park but it looks amazing, hoping to get there soon. Our children enjoyed playing on the huge jungle gym and visiting the zoo. It\'s a nice shaded place with great landscapes.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

476192949.name: A Big Park With Lots To Do & It\'s Directly Across The Beach!
476192949.author: a TripAdvisor user
476192949.reviewBody: Parque Papagayo is a large Park in the heart of Acapulco and it has something for the whole family to enjoy!\nYou can shop for Silver and costume jewelry and the kids can enjoy all the water activities in the Park. There are plenty of trees if you want some shade while having a snack. On one side of the Park you have the Costera and the Beach and on the other side of the park you have the City where there is plenty of shopping.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

472692473.name: Lots of fun for kidsw
472692473.author: a TripAdvisor user
472692473.reviewBody: A little scuffed-up around the edges, but a unique, fun and inexpensive way to spend a few hours exploring traditional attractions of natural amusement park

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

462586936.name: Shady retreat
462586936.author: a TripAdvisor user
462586936.reviewBody: This is a lovely park!  There is so much shade, you can stroll around and enjoy the peaceful atmosphere.  There are cuatriciclos for rent and also paddle boats, and a small zoo to view.  \nWonderful respite for a few hours from the hustle and bustle right outside.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

457380361.name: Nice park, average jewellery store
457380361.author: a TripAdvisor user
457380361.reviewBody: The park is attractive, with large shady trees.  Inside there\'s a store that manufactures and sells silver jewellery.  In my opinion, there are better jewellery shops in the town itself.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

452661470.name: Fabulous artisanal silver jewellery store right in the Parque Papagayo!
452661470.author: a TripAdvisor user
452661470.reviewBody: Really worth tracking this place down.  They do a nice little tour of their jewellery workshop and their little mine, which is interesting, then the store!  It\'s filled with some really nice silver jewellery and pieces.  A world away from the cheap tacky stuff sold on the beach.  We were helped by Ezekiel Molina and he was a lovely gentleman, helpful and knowlegable.  I bought a number of great items, bangles, rings, a key ring which were beautifully bagged up and will make splendid gifts.  All proper 925 silver as well.\nThey also serve a welcome drink!  Margeritas were excellent!\nAddress is Juan Sebastian El Cano No 2, Hornos-Insurgentes,, Acapulco.  Don\'t pay to park just tell them at the Parque gate you are going to the jewellery shop

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

387829880.name: Lots of shade, great to take a walk
387829880.author: a TripAdvisor user
387829880.reviewBody: I\'ve been visiting Parque Papagayo since I was a toddler, just by looking at its giant pinata would gave me a sense of happiness. There are many old trees and some caged animals such as crocodiles and iguanas. It is a great place to take a walk, seat in one of the many benches in the park and maybe read a good book.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

382460354.name: For a nice walk around the park
382460354.author: a TripAdvisor user
382460354.reviewBody: It is a nice place to take a long long walk. There also is a kids water attraction that is very popular. Do go take a walk it is free and the aquapark is not too expensive.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

362478087.name: Lot of places for dinning out and walk,beautiful beach
362478087.author: a TripAdvisor user
362478087.reviewBody: Very sutible for long vacation particulary in winter.Beautifull beach.All levels of prices so you can choose.Good city tour by Costa.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

332047557.name: Water Park for a Change
332047557.author: a TripAdvisor user
332047557.reviewBody: If you want to do something different than just the beach come to the water park and let the kids run free!  There are a lot of different activities for the kids and they\'ll definitely wear themselves out if you spend the day here!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

324160262.name: Parque Papagayo, October 17, 2015
324160262.author: a TripAdvisor user
324160262.reviewBody: The main purpose of our visit was to see the giant, metal, pinata sculpture.  It is on the backside of the park (opposite the Costera side).  It is huge and impressive.  We also discovered the beautiful green park benches with the park\'s logo inscribed and painted yellow, along with a few other interesting photo ops.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

322055401.name: Its a zoo kind of park
322055401.author: a TripAdvisor user
322055401.reviewBody: Lots of animals but to be honest they look mistreated and miserable. Right across the beach my favorite part was all the food- corn, raspados, chicharrones etc..  While there I did witness 2 young men trying to steal a young ladies necklace right in plain sight and during the day!!! That was the only bad experience during my 2 month stay in Acapulco so I wouldnt say that I would not go back to Acapulco but I would deff try to stay away from this park.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

308588341.name: Fun Water Park!
308588341.author: a TripAdvisor user
308588341.reviewBody: I love the water park and it definitely gives the kiddies a place to cool off outside of the beach.  It does get crowded so pack a little patience with your towel!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

305972825.name: A lovely, serene & secluded place in heart of city
305972825.author: a TripAdvisor user
305972825.reviewBody: A lovely almost hidden park with many interesting sites.  Amazing to see the parrots flying overhead and landing right there in the surrounding trees.  Just a few steps from the beautiful beaches & waters of Acapulco Bay.\nEasy to walk thru and take in all the interesting surroundings.  Unfortunately, it is NOT so good to visit Acapulco lately.  Hopefully, one day soon things will return to peacefulness & safety for residents as well as visitors.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

303516966.name: Dont do it
303516966.author: a TripAdvisor user
303516966.reviewBody: HORRIBLE, don\'t go there unless you like being really close to people if you want the best of acapulco go to acapulco diamante.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

288477509.name: The Love of Jewelry
288477509.author: a TripAdvisor user
288477509.reviewBody: We did not go to the park, but inside the park is a Silver Jewelry Shop (Villa Artesanal) where they make gorgeous silver jewelry.  This is a must see!!! Ricardo and everyone that works there were gems.  We spent 2 hours in the store looking at their gorgeous jewelry.  This is a type of silver that will not turn your skin green.  They have everything from the Mexican fire opal (only found in mexico), opals of all colors, topaz of all colors, and zultanita, which is a stone that changes color in different light.  Pure beauty!!  Whether you are looking for a simple silver bracelet, earrings, or necklace or all out bling...this is the place to be.  Cocktails are served as you roam the store, as well.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

277853767.name: Fun park for kids
277853767.author: a TripAdvisor user
277853767.reviewBody: This park is not something you would think of doing but it\'s REALLY fun!  Also gives you a nice alternative to the beach for a day.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

253749732.name: Refreshing
253749732.author: a TripAdvisor user
253749732.reviewBody: I can\'t believe people wrote bad about this park. We loved that it was clean, centrally located and w a zoo!!! The water park looked like fun but for kids and we are not. Considering the way they maintain nothing els I was way surprised. It is a blessing for the local people.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

244218488.name: Skip the park.
244218488.author: a TripAdvisor user
244218488.reviewBody: This park is forgotten and in an area of town that you don,t want to go.  Is Acapulco dangerous ??? Nothing happens until it happens, and its better to stay in the New Acapulco close to the airport and do not go further than the residential area of Las Brisas.  I\'d rather be in Playa del Carmen !

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

222776902.name: Good for KIds
222776902.author: a TripAdvisor user
222776902.reviewBody: Once nice ,but run down .Originally the historic site of the Hotel PAPAGAYO>An original famous Acapulco landmark. Features rides for the kids!!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

200753299.name: Bring it back!!
200753299.author: a TripAdvisor user
200753299.reviewBody: I was there when they first open this park and it was so beautiful!! Now it\'s sad to see that they are letting it go, there\'s trash and there is not many animals plants look like they need trimming and water badly, still pretty but needs work and care

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

200575143.name: Ap"parrot"ly perfect!
200575143.author: a TripAdvisor user
200575143.reviewBody: Great place to visit with a variety of activities and water sports. If you enjoy lush and green, this is the place for you! Just walking around the grounds gives a sense of serenity. My husband and I wandered and found a wonderful Chinee restaurant to which one has access from the park! Serving sizes are huge, so be sure to choose an entree to split!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

200266024.name: Parque
200266024.author: a TripAdvisor user
200266024.reviewBody: You can do all sort of activities in the park. Bicycle, paddle boat, walk, see a zoo, swim, shows, ride on a train, etc. . At the time we went, they were remodeling part of the park. Each year, they are improving the area. If you want some shades, it is the place!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

172259217.name: Spend a couple hours...
172259217.author: a TripAdvisor user
172259217.reviewBody: Papagayo is a great place for walking/jogging, sightseeing (particularly nice view up by the iguana house), visiting the tiny zoo, sitting by the little lake, and an excellent place to visit if you have young children.\n\nBut, keep moving! There are mosquitoes galore in the shade, and you\'ll get bitten up pretty bad if you stay still for too long. The park isn\'t all that big, and it\'s not so different from a small park you might see in the states, so you can spend a good two hours here and then move on.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

154441849.name: We had a blast here.
154441849.author: a TripAdvisor user
154441849.reviewBody: We rode the paddle boats and had a squirt gun fight with everyone we passed.  Really fun place to see in Acapulco.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

154341934.name: Family fun
154341934.author: a TripAdvisor user
154341934.reviewBody: A great place to wander about in a shady environment and a wonderful place to bring children.  I remember when the tunnel went under the street here on the Costera but now, since the disasterous mud slide that no longer exists.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

145461236.name: Great park for kids old and young
145461236.author: a TripAdvisor user
145461236.reviewBody: Great park, clean, lots to do for adlts and children. FREE WIFI, exercise classes, live animals, lots to see an do.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

127313501.name: Needs a lot of care.
127313501.author: a TripAdvisor user
127313501.reviewBody: Only for locals. The stores there are a tourist trap. Nothing worth to see.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

120619980.name: Lion
120619980.author: a TripAdvisor user
120619980.reviewBody: We walked to the park around 8 am some mornings to do a few laps. One morning we heard the lion roar, and I was surprised at how loud it was.\nThis park is just FULL of animals. Some in little cages, and some in large fenced areas, and some on a little island. Excellent variety of animals.\nThe paved walkways are quite busy in the early morning with walkers.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

34656752.name: Very Sad
34656752.author: a TripAdvisor user
34656752.reviewBody: We were encouraged to visit the park by our resort as a fun family outing. At best it was a waste of our time. The park was packed dirt and the water features were all dry. The "zoo" consisted of one alligator, two ancient deer and a monkey named Charlie who is out on an island. The day we visited it was oppressively hot with no breeze. The kids\' rides were not operational and there was nothing to hold our interest. Perhaps it is nicer in the winter months but I would not recommend this park to anyone.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

6693796.name: Worth a visit
6693796.author: a TripAdvisor user
6693796.reviewBody:
We visited Parque Papagayo in Jan. 2007. It's a pretty place to walk. The park is shaded, landscaped, and has many exhibits to look at, including islands with uncaged monkeys swinging through the trees! Also alligators and caimans, a lion, paddle boats and bicycle carriages for rent, children’s play areas, families strolling, teenagers necking, lakes, and pretty flowers. 

There is a fenced area that is a combination of petting zoo, aviary, and mini-zoo. When the keeper, Benjamin, saw us debating whether it was open to the public, he graciously invited us in, gave us a little tour, and told us the park was “our house” to enjoy. What a nice guy! Some of the animals were rehabs that couldn’t survive in the wild. Benjamin had trained the coyote to jump up on a stand, and he showed us how the little Mexican foxes would beg him for dulce de leche candy. We were shaken down by a giant bunny that followed us around the enclosure, begging for snacks. There were also small deer and peafowl (including an albino peacock) running loose. Two jaguarundi, some raccoons, and several coatimundi were on display. 

We enjoyed the park very much—and it’s free!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

5025446.name: Parque Papagayo - A Welcome Oasis
5025446.author: a TripAdvisor user

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

2313634.name: Walked in, walked out
2313634.author: a TripAdvisor user
2313634.reviewBody: A ruin, may have been nice in its hey day, now a little scary. Not worth going to see at all.\n

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

2289107.name: is not a park anymore is a dump site.
2289107.author: a TripAdvisor user
2289107.reviewBody: Very sad to see this park go to waste, I used to live in acapulco 10 years ago and I remember going to the park for a good place to relax and entertain. I went back last year May 2003, and it was so awful, all the  artificial lakes were polluted with drainage, garbage ( tires, plastic containers, beer bottles etc. ) i saw several dead fish as well as fish stuck in all the plastic containers, there was a dead dog as well as dead birds. The grounds were dirty and smelled of sewer.  The poor animals that were kept for display were in terrible condition as if they were sick. There was no lush gardens and grass as it once were, furthermore the  outside theater  which at one time had some wonderful plays and concerts, it is now littered with human excrement and garbage. My son and I had to get out as quick as possible before we got sick. I would not encourage anyone to visit this park, but to maybe write to the Tourism bureau of Acapulco and hopefully they would try to revitalize this once beautiful park.\n

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente a Playa Hornos

654414956.name: Much improved
654414956.author: a TripAdvisor user
654414956.reviewBody:
I do not get to PM every year but I can say from the 1st visit perhaps 10 years ago and even 3 years ago the area has cleaned up considerably. 

As soon as we made our way in there were no fewer they 10 or so workers sweeping up the curbs and sidewalks.

All the restaurants and shops look a bit more vibrant then a few years back and there were people everywhere. 

Worth a stop to see another part of real Mexico!!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

648047018.name: Great part of real Mexico
648047018.author: a TripAdvisor user
648047018.reviewBody: real Mexico located just outside of touristy Acapulco, loaded with beach bars, local vendors -great beach in a bay where the surf is not so strong\n

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

644579511.name: Good place to get out of tourist areas
644579511.author: a TripAdvisor user
644579511.reviewBody: This is a great beach: sandy, no waves due to the cove. There are few non-nationals there, but the food is amazing and the beer cheep and cold. We went to a restaurant that does not seem to come up on Trip Adviser: Don Tomy: get the Octopus in love it is wonderful; Margaritas are so small but so powerful. Sit in the sun and take a dip when you get hot. There are many venders so practice: "No  gracias"; " cerveza por favor" banios. \nGetting there: contract with a cab you trust, some will wait others will come back; try to get out before dark as people can get pretty drunk later in the day (we used whats app) there is only one road in and out so expect some traffic. Mega is on the way out if you need to supply.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

558697047.name: Wonderful sandy beach crystal clear waters
558697047.author: a TripAdvisor user
558697047.reviewBody: We have visited the beach and it\u2019s marvellous. Much clean waters than Acapulco shore small restaurants with shadow not much people was sun bathing though if you have small chidren or looking for some seaside with clear waters you should go there

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

553280724.name: Was a Gem... at one time...
553280724.author: a TripAdvisor user
553280724.reviewBody: We hit this beach one day - because from the road it looks amazing! I feel that many areas in Acapulco are either all rich people or all poor people...not much in between. We are average people - not rich not poor ....thrill seekers and over all well seasoned ....our experience at this beach was not good. The area is VERY POOR and people are RUNNING up to your car on the drive in trying to get you to eat at their restaurant and buy things. You have to choose a place because there is no other parking available. We selected a restaurant with beach chairs and a bath room. The locals were nice but the bath rooms were not clean at all!!! I can deal with basic but not filthy and no T.P. The food was ok but we couldn\'t converse due to the 100s of vendors walking by us trying to sell their goods. I think the Mexican Gov should pass a law or make vendors stay on the beach and OFFER their goods but not push them on tourists - it was sickening. ( EVRY 10 sec they would hit you up and they WOULD NOT take NO for an answer.) I understand they are trying to do their job...but they dont seem to understand they are driving tourists away! Upon leaving - our bill was incorrect and my husband ( who is Mexican ) tried to sort it out with the owner and they would not adjust the prices to match what was in their menu - basically they were over charging us. My husband and I felt ripped off and would never go back. Too many other nice places to hit for beach view and food - such as Barra Vieja. We feel that in 5 to 10 years that whole area will be scooped up by a hotel chain and turned into condos. ( sad to say ) I feel bad for the locals - but it all goes back to Education and they dont know any better. It was a depressing experience. If you just want to hit the beach - I suggest the Diamond beach area and Barra Vieja. We ate dinner at Barra Vieja and the locals there told us "they didn\'t even like" the Marques area. I hope the future generations of Mexico in this area all get a GREAT education so they can become the best restaurant and hotel owners and lift themselves out of this mess. I LOVE MEXICO and wish to see all of them succeed!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

458934089.name: Relaxing
458934089.author: a TripAdvisor user
458934089.reviewBody: Took some friends from out of town. It was very relaxing. Nice gentle waves. Ate at Maria Teresa. Good. Just did cerviches, octopus in love, topas. Just be prepared for all the peddlers.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

456975697.name: Vacation
456975697.author: a TripAdvisor user
456975697.reviewBody: Very nice place for a day trip nice beaches nice food nice people very relaxing spent the whole day there would like to go every time that I visit Acapulco

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

451260507.name: Extremely crowded
451260507.author: a TripAdvisor user
451260507.reviewBody: If you have time (and patience) like I did, it\'s interesting to visit the area, mainly frequented by locals. Being there during Xmas holidays, I found the place really overcrowded, only took some pics and left. You can have a look at the nearby lagoon, populated by crocodiles.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

433582864.name: Good beach
433582864.author: a TripAdvisor user
433582864.reviewBody: The beach is nice i think is one of the most cleanest beach in Acapulco. restaurants are good price too.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

426429092.name: Best water
426429092.author: a TripAdvisor user
426429092.reviewBody: Entire family went there few time during our two weeks stay, from Grand Mayan.  Beach water there is so clear, sand is so clean and high quality  sand ( I like really heavy - kind of course grain ). Lots of choice food , beach vendors craft shopping- all reasonably priced. We liked a restaurant,  in English,  called " Crazy Marlin " run by a family Dona. Red snapper is the best there.One of cheepest jetskey too by one of her son. Entire family has something to offer you to keep you active at the same time they will leave you alone , if you like, all day for low price to use their chairs and tables with your own food and drink under their coconut leaf shade, use their rest room. When you drive in ( or go by a taxi) it will look poor and dirty pluss too many people calling you to stop at their business  ( which is a norm most poor areas of Mexico) may make feel area may not be safe - that feeling goes away once you chose a place. You also get one of the best water coconuts there - try the jelly too. Do not eat too much jelly if you are not use to or have week stomach.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

402749559.name: Very close to paradise
402749559.author: a TripAdvisor user
402749559.reviewBody: This is a smaller and more secluded bay, adjacent to Acapulco Bay.  It is still crowded, but less so.  Location is fantastic.  Very scenic and colorful.  You can reach it by road or by boat.  Very special location.  It\'s a must visit for anyone planning a trip to Acapulco.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

401055517.name: Puerto for a day
401055517.author: a TripAdvisor user
401055517.reviewBody: Me, my aunt and my cousin (8 years) went there for a day. It was good we park our car on a private parking lot for 3 USD. We eat and rest on a chair over the sea and for 5 beers and a ceviche was 20 USD. The only problem was that there is no good bathrooms and no showers.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

353939599.name: interesting to see
353939599.author: a TripAdvisor user
353939599.reviewBody: This was the place to shop for souvenirs - MANY opportunities to get "stuff." I did buy some movies from a street vendor but that was all. The beach looked most accessible but I didn\'t . We just drove down and around the streets. Amazing homes in the area - affluent homes around that part of the bay. It is amazing how the indigenous peoples homes were rather invisible. Never even thought about it until now. their little "shops" are open air and plenty busy. As far as I know their homes may have been attached or , at least, part of their shop. the store keepers were not super aggressive like in many of the Caribbean Islands. they were more laid back and allowed you to truly look at their products. I am told during Holy Week this area is SSOOO crowded you can\'t even drive down the main street. It could be quaint if there were not SSSOOO many shops. But- if you like to shop this is the place.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

346668273.name: Crystal Clear Warm Water
346668273.author: a TripAdvisor user
346668273.reviewBody: We heard many negative things about the Acapulco area and were totally shocked when we arrived here. The water is beautiful! We are travelling by sailboat and have seen the entire Pacific coast of Mexico from the southern tip to Puerto Vallarta. Nothing has been as clear and beautiful as this bay. Many Mexicans are utilizing this beautiful area so it is not calm and peaceful. There are many restaurants, seadoos, banana boats, etc. There is beautiful water and a great beach here to enjoy as long as you don\'t mind sharing with numerous locals.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

341044611.name: as they say, Muy tranquilo
341044611.author: a TripAdvisor user
341044611.reviewBody: Almost completely Mexican families, very low key, with 50 or more restaurants all wanting to give you a place on the beach to drink their cold beer, and eat their fish.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

338966868.name: Been there done that
338966868.author: a TripAdvisor user
338966868.reviewBody: One year we went to this beach and were very sorry of our decision. The restaurant Ok Ok was good but surroundings very busy with locals. Even had a guy with an aligator and a snake and I am scared shitless of snakes... Was stressed for the whole couple of hours there. Too many boats and seadoos, could hardly swim always a motor something comin our way. Not sure we will go back...

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

329962041.name: Very nice, clean, enchanting beach
329962041.author: a TripAdvisor user
329962041.reviewBody: We spent almost the 1 whole day here. The water is warm and clean. The sand is golden. The view is amazing. This is like a natural pool, very little waves. The small restaurants offer great inexpensive food, drinks, beer and shelter right at the water\'s edge. What else could you ask for. Take cash to get great stuff from vendors and very, very discounted prices. Especially silver jewelry.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

314453763.name: Little Acapulco
314453763.author: a TripAdvisor user
314453763.reviewBody: This place is near Acapulco Costera, lest than 30 min away. Here you can find easy waters (no waves), grate for swimming, cayaking, skying, or to rent a wave runner, in summary a good place for water sports. There are plenty of restaurants on the beach, serving the catch of the day, really fresh.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

300395679.name: Beach attractions, swimm in a real beach pool..  this is Puerto Marques
300395679.author: a TripAdvisor user
300395679.reviewBody: This  is  a  largest pool in Acapulco,  many  beach to do, if  you like  fly, race on water,  have  a fun  in a fast  banana, have a local food  lunch  on beach. and to have all beach attractions in one place them  this is the right place.  Here, you can have   a classical day beach in Acapulco..

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

249756402.name: Typical poor Mexican village, but we like the authenticity
249756402.author: a TripAdvisor user
249756402.reviewBody: My fianc\u00e9e is from Mexico and we have been to places in Mexico. We both like less developed areas, especially small towns, because we enjoy how nice the people are, and we enjoy the authenticity. Much of Mexico is this way and we don\u2019t like the pretense and Americanization of many tourist spots (not just in Mexico). Cabo is an example. \n\nIf you don\u2019t mind driving 5 miles an hour down a quarter mile stretch of open air shops and restaurants run by locals where guys are constantly jumping in front of your taxi to get you to stop, you\u2019ll be fine. I do not have the same perspective of most tourists because my Mexican fianc\u00e9e is treated like family, which is especially enjoyable. I think it is worth a visit, but I would eat elsewhere.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

244218000.name: Great location but a bit dirty.
244218000.author: a TripAdvisor user
244218000.reviewBody: This beach is getting better although there is a lot of cleaning that still needs to be done. The small palapa restaurants are neglecting  the beach.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

219886035.name: My favorite beach in Acapulco
219886035.author: a TripAdvisor user
219886035.reviewBody: Puerto Marques is one of the nicest beaches I\'ve ever been to - anywhere. The narrow mouth of the bay keeps the waves down, so it\'s safe and fun even for the littlest kids to swim. The main road is a rutted mess with shops on one side selling bikinis, floaty toys, and coconuts; restaurants on the other side trying to lure you in to sit under their beach palapas; and buses double parked in the middle. I like to take this road all the way to the end to Playa Majahua, where local families hang out. Sundays are quite crowded, other days more relaxed. You can rent a table under an umbrella or in one of the beach restaurants for a pittance, or  you can bring your own umbrella. (With the intense Acapulco sun, you\'re going to want a bit of shade.) Food and beverages are reasonably priced, or you can bring your own. There\'s a roped off swim area that the boats mostly respect. Be careful if you wander outside of this area, but there is nice snorkeling along the rocks on either side.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

219672595.name: Puerto Marques
219672595.author: a TripAdvisor user
219672595.reviewBody: my 2 week vacation to acapulco is never finished until we all go to Puerto Marques!  The beer is cheap the food is good and the beach is wonderful!  If you want to sit under an umbrelled table or sit in the sun and shop for anything and everything that is Puerto marques!  This is the place for cheap souvenirs and getting to see the locals.  i have been there every year for the past 18 years and have never had an issue, however when the cab driver (usually Benjamin) drops you off it doesn\'t look like much until you walk thru the restaurant onto the beach.  You can make your deal with the restaurant for tables and chairs and your beers.  Great experience  love it!!! My husband loves it no walking to shop.  The locals love to negociate with you but if you are not interested you just tell them no!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

190941201.name: Great little beach
190941201.author: a TripAdvisor user
190941201.reviewBody: We go to Puerto Marques every year.  People so friendly and honest.  Feel very safe.  Love to stop for beer, sangria, and sopes.  Some of the restaurants were wiped out in the hurricanes in Sept, but many are still there and in good shape.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

188573805.name: Great out the way place!!!
188573805.author: a TripAdvisor user
188573805.reviewBody: Went here to snorkel and lay on beach for the afternoon. Once again Senor Baldo!!!  Hooked us up with hugo and his boat! This guy is a fish! He took us out to the mouth of the bay to snorkel and it was great!  Once again not the crystal clear water of cancun but very nice just the same!!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

176179274.name: every year
176179274.author: a TripAdvisor user
176179274.reviewBody: The resteraunts here are fabulous, a must for us every year, 27 in a row now, 28 this Feb. Might want to go there more then once and try a few while getting a tan on the beautiful beach.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

156416719.name: Ehat a find!!!
156416719.author: a TripAdvisor user
156416719.reviewBody: We have been going to this area since 1980 and have faithfully followed our favorite waiter from restaurant to restaurant. Cheato is our man!!!... However, we felt really guilty this year because we found "Blue Water" and we could not resist the owners and staff not to mention the oven baked pizza and fish.... They even let us bring our French herbs for the fish to have it baked in the style we like. The bathrooms are clean and they encouraged us to leave a zip drive of American style music so we could dance the night away.  One particular evening we women left early and the men could not get a taxis... To our surprise the owner sent the fellows back up to Torre Blanca in her SUV.  The little wading pool is a treat and if you want sun the deck is lovely...Or maybe you want to sit in the sand under the deck or the palm umbrellas... They have it all. We can\'t wait to go back next year. We took several groups and the only time we were not really comfortable was on a very windy day....however no place was comfortable that day.  I suggest you call ahead or let them know when you are wanting pizza. We took folks and when the huge pizzas arrived realized we could have ordered half as many.. The best pizza around...  Please try the Blue Water......

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

155967477.name: A Bit of relaxation!
155967477.author: a TripAdvisor user
155967477.reviewBody: Ok Ok and Blue Waters restuarants are our favorites. Cold beer and good food.. Beach is little hard to walk in this area as the sand is soft. Nice to change it up once in awhile out of the city.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

154555778.name: went to Mamies ,small place ,water  and beach beautiful you can walk  far in the water,sand is really nice there.
154555778.author: a TripAdvisor user
154555778.reviewBody: the people r friendly,but there r alot of them who want u to buy there things, but do not buy there jewlery its fake.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

154341291.name: Shrimp quesadillas anyone?
154341291.author: a TripAdvisor user
154341291.reviewBody: My annual trip to Acapulco is not complete without a taste of the unique shrimp quesadillas that they make here.  Crispy and light.  I love them.  A nice beach here but a bit overwhelming sometimes with the vendors.  If you are firm with your no thank you right away they don\'t get pushy but if you express an interest some of them can be relentless.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

153465010.name: Best spot in Puerto Marques Blue Water restaurant
153465010.author: a TripAdvisor user
153465010.reviewBody:
This is our 2nd visit to Blue water in just over a year and happy to say the place is still there and planning to add to the location. We were able to get there from mid bay in about 25 minutes as traffic was non existent on this Monday morning. 

 We were there for breakfast and a late afternoon lunch and there are many things to recommend starting with the Shrimp ajo diablo at 140 peso for 6 large shrimp (Menu says 12) but they tell you it is 6 prior to ordering. They were delicious with a nice kick to them also served with rice and frijoles I would recommend. 

 Breakfast, Lunch about 7-8 corona for about 470 peso plus tip....not too bad for a side trip. The bay was very rough more so then normal with the full moon the prior evening we determined to be the reason. Still swimmable though and we were out there much of the day.

 Blue Water has 10x the menu of others in the area some high priced many reasonably priced but this is as stated in a prior review the class of Puerto Marques by far. The vendors IMO are much less pushy in this area and the local shops much cheaper if you care to browse.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

152972929.name: Embark on a boat a take look around the Bahia
152972929.author: a TripAdvisor user
152972929.reviewBody:
Rent a boat, and take a trip around the bay for US $ 100. The locals will tell you all about the houses of VIPs at seashore, and some special rocks (SeaLion, The Frog, etc)

You can land at any of the small beaches and have lunch!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

151659347.name: Relaxing
151659347.author: a TripAdvisor user
151659347.reviewBody: A must if you travel to Acapco relaxing plenty of restaurants bars hotels and a nice bus ride through the mountains.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

151619883.name: Calm waters and good places for lunch
151619883.author: a TripAdvisor user
151619883.reviewBody: Since the suf can be very high at the Acapulco Malibu hotel, many hotel guests will go to Puerto Marques for the day to play in the quiet water and eat at one of the many beachside restaurants.\n\n

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

150126480.name: Back for another season of fun in the sun at Blue Water...........
150126480.author: a TripAdvisor user
150126480.reviewBody: Back again for another 6 months in Acapulco Yeah!!  Reporting from one of our favorite go-to places, "Blue Water".  Nothing has changed, the same great owners and help. The stainless steel kitchen is spotless and the cooks were busy tending to our meals. 12 of us enjoyed another great day eating fresh tortillas, fish, rice and beans. Yum, Yum!.  Blue Water also has a well stocked bar with many selections including non- alcoholic and soft drinks or cold bottled water. Of course swimming in the Bay and small fresh water pool is always an enjoyable way to have fun in the sun.  A day on the beach would not be the same without the beach vendors..... so we were ready to wheel and deal. Today was basket day and we all left with one or two in tow along with bracelets, purses and other great treasures. We enjoy telling our Acapulco adventures and stories while basking on the beach or by the pool to each other especially looking over the beach at Blue Water..... where the beer is cold and the owner and staff are warm. Le vaya bien!(have a good day) and no preocupe (no worries) as our Blue Water friends continue to meet our every need season after season.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

127868237.name: Blue Water restaurant @ Puerto Marques
127868237.author: a TripAdvisor user
127868237.reviewBody:
I was hoping that by this time the restaurant had it's own listing on TA but apparently the ownership has not gotten around to doing so yet. This restaurant is less then 1 year old and located exactly in the middle of the strip of all the restaurants in PM.

 Blue water is top shelf for this area and as my friend Andy aka Drew22 stated in his review below we are very comfortable in lesser type of establishments and many times prefer the simpler places. Having said that BW is a great place to spend an afternoon enjoying the beautiful bay and having a few drinks and meal. 

 The restaurant has 1st rate facilities shower/restrooms (Excellent) for the area and if you know PM it is not best for these in past years experience. The menu is extensive and somewhat pricey in spots but there are reasonably priced entrees and appetizers especially the empanadas with shrimp...A very large and satisfying order for 80 peso.

 The beer was in line with all the other beach front shacks along the way as we priced many of them in the vicinity 5 for 95 peso or about 8 USD not bad huh??. They have an upper deck in which you can sun yourselves with comfortable cushioned lounge chairs and even a small built in pool on the upper deck. 

 As I said entirely out of place for a small fishing village like Puerto Marques but a very welcomed addtion for those liking a more comfortable and less rustic place to spend a day.

 The bottom line we went with about 12 people and we all loved the place and swimming in the bay was relaxing and cleaner then I have ever seen it. PM is about 25 minutes fromn the main bay area of Acapulco and a great place to spend a day. Don't miss out!!!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

127312713.name: THE most beautiful bay with the worst people.
127312713.author: a TripAdvisor user
127312713.reviewBody: This place is famous for the terrible food and tourist trap. They give you a menu with a price for the food and when the check comes they charge you double and show you another menu with different prices. The beach vendors are worst than flies. What a shame! because this could be the greatest beach in Acapulco. I will never come back to this beach.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

126110520.name: Beach side escape, tropical design, relaxing, small pool, spectacular views
126110520.author: a TripAdvisor user
126110520.reviewBody: What a great find in Puerto Marques!  (Monday March 12,2012). 14 of us enjoyed the Bluewater Resturant and Club de Playa (I did let them we had a group coming). We had a super time. The General Manager, Gabriel, welcomed us to Bluewater. It has a great beach front setting.  We decided to sit under the deck on the sandy beach close to the waters edge with soft music playing in the background.  The tranquil vista and tropical breeze was refreshing. We each ordered diffrient venues from breakfast, lunch and even pizza (they have an awesome brick pizza oven).  All of the food was great, especially the pizza Yum!! Yum!.... There are a lot of toys to enjoy at Bluewater from a 10 passanger banana ride, jet skis, or a great one hour cruise of the bay that inclues two complementary cold beers. This is truly a perfect beachside escape. The water was clear and clean, the vendors were fun to work with or you can walk up the main street in front for adventure shopping. The beer was cold, the service was warm and friendly.  The bills at the end of the day were just what each of ordered. No rip offs here.  Parking is available in front of the resturant. On the main floor there is a great deck with a fresh water dipping pool and wonderful chaise lounges facing the bay. Talk about laid-back!  This is certainly the place for a long, long relaxing day. The price was reasonable and the restrooms were spotless. We left with lots of necklaces and stuff we could not live without. We are looking forward to our next trip to the Bluewater Restaurant Bar & Club de Playa in Puerto Marques.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

125262957.name: The discovery of Bluewater Restaurant/Bar & Club
125262957.author: a TripAdvisor user
125262957.reviewBody: We went to visit a friend of a friend\'s restaurant at Puerto Marques. Luckily the service there was poor, otherwise we would never have found Bluewater. This place is like day and night compared to others in the area. We are by no means queezy toward typical Mexican standards in the area but Bluewater was a big draw to International and local customers alike. It is a new restaurant with an abundant staff. There is a huge pizza oven and a first class bar and bartender which is a rare find in Puerto Marques. There is a small pool area upstairs and the restrooms were clean and modern. The beer and food is competively priced with the lesser restaurants but the bar drinks are consistent with a quality bar which it is.\nHave your taxi driver weave through the ambush of customer starved restaurant hawks until you are almost to the end of restaurant row. Keep an eye to the right and you can\'t miss the modern location. At this time there is no wifi.\nI can\'t wait to go back next year to spend more time.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto
