123606019.name: La coste\u00f1ita
123606019.author: a TripAdvisor user
123606019.reviewBody: WE have been going to Acapulco for several years and so far this is the place for food. We enjoy it very much; prices are cheapper compare to other areas. The restaurant La coste\u00f1ita is great! They have been very helpful even when we get there a little late. Usually they open early during the weekends and also during the weeks but they close during sunset about 7 pm.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

120617033.name: Average
120617033.author: a TripAdvisor user
120617033.reviewBody: Parked on public main street, far down past the businesses. Good isolated parking spot. When we returned, the usual story. A guy wanted to be paid for parking. I just drove off and left him waving. This place is getting known for that.\nThe water was full of floating garbage and seaweed. Bits of plastic floating. Otherwise the beach was average. The golden zone is so much nicer and the water cleaner.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

118391904.name: Calm beautiful water -- but food not as it used to
118391904.author: a TripAdvisor user
118391904.reviewBody: I went this past September after not being there for 10 years. The water was just as beautiful, crystal clear and perfect for swimming. It has barely any waves, which I enjoy for swimming -- not as calm as a pool, not too wavy, so you can still relax and take it slow sometimes. I highly recommend you going there to swim. The only problem is that the food has gotten more "commercial". Last time I had been there, I got "pescado a la talla", which is a butterflied fish grilled on wood with a special sauce. I asked in almost all of them on how it\'s prepared and they all steam the fish now, which was not the same at all. I also got a ceviche and it is not your traditional ceviche. So for swimming and sightseeing is great, for food not as much.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

6628532.name: Beautiful, tranquil bay with a lovely beach
6628532.author: a TripAdvisor user
6628532.reviewBody:
We had the opportunity to enjoy this bay in January 2007. We rented a jetski from the vendors at the Camino Real hotel's beach for U.S. $40 for 30 minutes. We putted around the Bahía de Puerto Marques and got a good look around. This little bay is so pretty and green. It's very picturesque, with big rocks along the water, stretches of sandy beach, and palm trees everywhere. This was our first time on a jetski and we really enjoyed it. The bay was so calm, it was a great place to try jetskiing. 

Later that day, we took a taxi into Puerto Marques. The beach in Puerto Marques is really pretty. Even on that post-holiday Monday, there were still families there enjoying seafood and banana boat rides. There were several spots near the beach that were good for snorkeling. The seafood restaurants smelled great, and prices were reasonable.  We walked through town a bit and saw an open-air tortilla factory, the church, and a small market.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Aeropuerto

646061662.name: Tradicional but very crowded
646061662.author: a TripAdvisor user
646061662.reviewBody: This beach is most tradicional in the city; clean and calm waters are excellent for kids and older people; my only recommendation is not to go in weekends because is very crowded. But certainly is must visit if it\'s your first time in acapulco, from there you can take a boat to La Roqueta Island and have snorkel over there.

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

638038411.name: Great beach, very warm ocean year round.
638038411.author: a TripAdvisor user
638038411.reviewBody: This beach was very relaxing to us comparing to Cancun. Local were great as well. They way better in Acapulco than in Cancun! If you want experience local beach, go here! And No see weed !

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

633387088.name: Nice very nice
633387088.author: a TripAdvisor user
633387088.reviewBody: It has been almost a year in Febuary when the Trip Advisor gang made La Caba\u00f1a our get together we had a wonderful and relaxing day!!!!!!!!! would do this one again very soon. Enough said Carmen Fera

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

567509101.name: Okay
567509101.author: a TripAdvisor user
567509101.reviewBody: Very crowed,  very busy on weekends and does not smell very nice!  To many sales people!! Enjoyed the walk on the beach!

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

553209823.name: Where the locals go to get away from tourists
553209823.author: a TripAdvisor user
553209823.reviewBody: We spent a wonderful afternoon at Playa Caleta, a small beach in an older part of Acapulco.  It felt very safe and was bustling with activity, full of local families with young kids digging in the sand and splashing around in the calm water.  We sat down at a shaded table in a restaurant on the sand, where we had a delicious inexpensive lunch with plenty of cold beer -- but the real highlight for us was people-watching.  Numerous vendors were walking along the beach selling everything from inflatable water toys to homemade candy.  One was out in the water, pushing around a small boat loaded with seashells for sale.  Jet skis and various boat rides were available -- the banana tow boat seemed especially popular.  And to complete the experience, a Mariachi band was strolling from restaurant to restaurant.  What a great day!

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

547690021.name: December vacation 2017
547690021.author: a TripAdvisor user
547690021.reviewBody: I took the bus to Playas Caleta Y Caletilla which is at the end of the bus line.  It is a cute little beach area with many restaurants serving food and drinks.  You can sit at the beach and enjoy a meal or a drink.  A very nice relaxing experience.  You can play in the warm water, take a boat tour, or walk among the several souvenir type shops.

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

484752025.name: Nice beach but crowded
484752025.author: a TripAdvisor user
484752025.reviewBody: It\'s more for locals and it\'s usually very crowded but it\'s a pretty old beach with hotel boca chica close

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

479843428.name: Mid-week only!
479843428.author: a TripAdvisor user
479843428.reviewBody: This is a lovely calm and quiet beach mid-week, a very good beach for small children as there are only (usually) gentle waves. There are a number of beachfront restaurants but the best, by a long way, is La Caba\u00f1a.\nThis beach should be avoided like the plague on weekends and public holidays, as it is hugely popular with tourists and locals and can be very loud, dirty and very crowded.

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

466134345.name: Great beach
466134345.author: a TripAdvisor user
466134345.reviewBody: Went snorkeling out of Caleta and had a great time.  When we returned we went to a small beachfront restaurant, I can\'t remember the name but you can\'t miss it, for lunch.  A friend had the fish fillet in mango sauce.  On our trip home she commented it was the best lunch she had during our two weeks.  If you get a chance, it is well worth the trip.  Great restaurant, great swimming beach and great people to wait on you.

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

444695005.name: Sweet little beach
444695005.author: a TripAdvisor user
444695005.reviewBody: I went out here on a day trip, and so glad I did. Take a glass-bottom boat (fondo cristal) ride out into the harbor, 85 pesos, (about $5USD). Lots of neat tropical fish, and people so nice. Rent a beach chair and relax, you\'re in Mexico!

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

427913531.name: Relaxing afternoon at the beach
427913531.author: a TripAdvisor user
427913531.reviewBody: We went to Caleta one day and Caletilla the next day. We have several people in our group that are using walkers or wheel chairs. They picked this beach because it is fairly accessible. At Caleta the older people stayed in the restaurant while the younger ones played in the water.  Lots of umbrellas and tables and chairs to rent. The water is calm and cool (but not cold) and great for kids. Caletilla is next to Caleta. You can either swim under the bridge or walk down the street to get to it. Caletilla is a little bigger. The restaurants there aren\'t as good as Caleta. There are a lot more vendors walking around selling everything you can imagine. We rented inner tubes for 20 pesos and floated in the bay. There were lots of people (Thursday)  but it wasn\'t too crowded. The beach clean. I would recommend going. It was charming.

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

388901324.name: Calmer water for kids
388901324.author: a TripAdvisor user
388901324.reviewBody: Great place to carry kids and cheap for certain activities  and lots of food to buy but don\'t like the washroom and shower area but still will go back anytime .

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

362368820.name: A Humming Local Beach
362368820.author: a TripAdvisor user
362368820.reviewBody: This is pretty well where the famous Acapulco all began and it is still very popular today! The locals flock to this beach, especially on the weekends and with good reasons. The water is calm, shallow and no big waves so it is great for the kids to go swimming. There are plenty of restaurant and souvenier  shops  shops right there. This is a great place to rent a table and chairs ( $4.00 ) and enjoy your day relaxing, eating, basking in the sun and people watching. You will feel the flare of Acapulco here!

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

362330667.name: Popular beach, with many things to buy!
362330667.author: a TripAdvisor user
362330667.reviewBody: This beach is best early in the day, with calm waters and few people.  As others have pointed out, during the busiest Mexican Holiday weeks, it, like all the other beaches in Acapulco become quite crowded.  most other times of the year there are more than manageable.    If you want quiet, go to pie de la cuesta or the beaches of diamante.  \nThere are a lot of vendors - to some that annoys, to me that ads to the charm.  it is no big deal to say no.  \nI love this beach!

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

356026102.name: Too crowded and dirty!!
356026102.author: a TripAdvisor user
356026102.reviewBody: It is a public beach and during vacations or holidays you can\'t even move around. The beach is dirty and there are too many street vendors all over the place.\nIf you are looking for peace and quiet, avoid this beach.

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

351974967.name: Great beach to swim.
351974967.author: a TripAdvisor user
351974967.reviewBody: Spent an afternoon at La Cabana on the beach side and was once again happy to go swimming in the little bay with so many people. The water was the wormest that I had seen in many years..

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

349845168.name: Calm water, nice beach
349845168.author: a TripAdvisor user
349845168.reviewBody: I very much enjoyed my afternoon at this lovely beach.  The water is wonderful, so warm and calm.  A few vendors came around and I purchased a very nice item for far less than I would have expected.  \n\nIt was not too busy the day I was there (a Tuesday), so lots of room to spread out a towel and relax.

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

346248719.name: Great for little kids
346248719.author: a TripAdvisor user
346248719.reviewBody: Water at these beaches are crystal clear and clean, no big waves so it is perfect for little kids. Great food nearby

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

342912610.name: great beach
342912610.author: a TripAdvisor user
342912610.reviewBody: a beach catering to families, very good and affordable restaurants only 10 minutes from downtown, and you can go to the islan of la roqueta in a boat very cheap way to take a nice day relaxing in a island

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

335094500.name: Beach in Acapulco de Caleta
335094500.author: a TripAdvisor user
335094500.reviewBody: This beach in Acapulco has lots of cheap, average restaurants along it & many little stalls selling sandals, swimwear & tourist things. Water warm & clear but beach crowded with local families. Nice atmosphere but just too busy to enjoy.

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

333799637.name: Had a nice lunch here at Cabana de Caleta
333799637.author: a TripAdvisor user
333799637.reviewBody: Stopped here for lunch and a look at the beach.  It is a relatively small but beautiful beach.  I\'m told it is very popular with locals on the weekends

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

332048158.name: Fun Beach
332048158.author: a TripAdvisor user
332048158.reviewBody: This is definitely a family friendly and fun beach!!  Don\'t expect quiet and slow.  There are all kinds of activities to so in the water or right nearby.  Love coming here!

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

329425882.name: Mexican Cococabana Beach
329425882.author: a TripAdvisor user
329425882.reviewBody: Now the old and the new ? The new with sky scraper condo\'s or the Old and quaint, this is the old ! And how very delightful it is , take a Ferry ride in a glass bottom boat $3 or eat at any one of the amazing seafood restaurant,s ( my only Choice is Roberto,s joint the Shark eatery just fabulous ) now if you like the company of other Gringos then this may just not be your scene, and most likely you will be staying in the upmarket side of Acapulco so it will cost you $10 in a cab or next to nothing on the bus.\nWhat made Acapulco great ? This was it and still oozes charm and a pleasant day out, take the swim outfit as the water is great.

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

327291674.name: 24-hour beach
327291674.author: a TripAdvisor user
327291674.reviewBody: The beach is right beside the Acamar Hotel. Despite the many people on the beach it is clean enough. At night the beach is illuminated and you can float all the night. Don\'t be afraid of sharks, nobody saw them there. If you are lucky enough you can find a big beautiful part of a coral.

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

308589670.name: Lovely family beach
308589670.author: a TripAdvisor user
308589670.reviewBody: You really can\'t go wrong with ANY beach in Acapulco.  The water is warm, and the water is very calm.  Fun for kids to play in as well!

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

282722905.name: Great beach to swimm in!
282722905.author: a TripAdvisor user
282722905.reviewBody: We visited this beach because the waves were not as dangerous as the other beaches. It was perfect for my 8 yr old and 13th year old to swimm at without too much worry. It is a crowded beach with locals. However its perfect for kids because of the low waves not much of the high waves. You will be encountered by locals selling their goods. You can get some good deals on certain souverniers.

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

273636240.name: If you like crowds
273636240.author: a TripAdvisor user
273636240.reviewBody: Well, its not where the cosmopolitan people come to take a sun bath, its where the local comes to have a day off, but its not too clean and over crowded.

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

258935322.name: Great Spot
258935322.author: a TripAdvisor user
258935322.reviewBody: This is a great spot for families, with an amazing area to swim in.  There are a few little restaurants nearby and tables and chairs on the beach.

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

209171247.name: Just average full of common people
209171247.author: a TripAdvisor user
209171247.reviewBody: This place is full of average poor people who do not take care of the beaches , they throw trash, come in bundles and do not respect privacy, not recommended until more police presence.

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

200575315.name: Crowded Caleta
200575315.author: a TripAdvisor user
200575315.reviewBody: A wonderful beach for swimming! Therefore, Caleta was more crowded than  other areas of Acapulco Bay. However, it was worth the day spent there. People watching was fun, along with the various vendors at the mnarketplace. Some real deals and the vendors expected you to bicker! Interesting!

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

180482284.name: I don\'t like it...
180482284.author: a TripAdvisor user
180482284.reviewBody: This was one of the beaches that made Acapulco famous when there was practically nothing. It must have been a paradise but now, it\'s too popular and I\'d say dirty. It\'s ok if you want to see what locals and tourists from other states do to have fun. The water is very calm and shallow, that\'s why everybody is in there! They say the water is polluted, so I would only get in during low season and finding out it\'s safe. The food is cheap, and there are good options, but always ask if they don\'t charge extra fees for seating you by the beach. La caba\u00f1a was a famous restaurant there. Last time, I didn\'t eat there.

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

170362761.name: Great view and prices
170362761.author: a TripAdvisor user
170362761.reviewBody: It\'s a public access to a beach so of course it would be crowded, that does not mean it has to be a bad experience. Of your budget is not quite to go to Punta Diamante ths place gives you family entertainment at low rates. The food as well, although I would not eat the shrimps or even the bagged water the rest is acceptable. You can ride a crystal bottom boat to the Roqueta island and a couple steps further you have thr Santa Lucia market where you can buy some of the cheapest souvenirs in town, and eat at low prices. Just make sure to look after your belongings at all time. Nothing happend to me but everyone kept telling me so.

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

151663557.name: Another must
151663557.author: a TripAdvisor user
151663557.reviewBody: As Acapulco has more than 10 named beaches I would suggest you try to see them all .However i would recommend Caleta for families and adults alike

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

130876889.name: Always take time to go there.
130876889.author: a TripAdvisor user
130876889.reviewBody: We love watching the people and having lunch there on one of the two little beaches. I have been there when it was so crowded you could hardly walk and other times when we are almost alone. The little restaurant there has good food and inside as well as beach dining. Spend the day. You won\'t be sorry.

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

127913092.name: Still very popular
127913092.author: a TripAdvisor user
127913092.reviewBody:
While most of the old town has slid a bit from years of past neglect the beaches of Caleta especially still remain very popular with the locals and in thwe winter month those snowbirds from the U.S and Canada.

 I found the water to be extremely clean this past February and you can see many fish swimming around and we we able to get a hold of 2 star fish that were close to us. The vendors here are usually inexpensive compared to the mid bay vendors and are less in your face it seems.

 The restaurant La Cabana sits on this beach and is usually the spot in which we decide to stay for the afternoon...

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

127315237.name: Was the best beach in the 50s
127315237.author: a TripAdvisor user
127315237.reviewBody: Every place is dirty, lot of old boats jst floating in front of you. Bad food, full of vendors. TERRIBLE.

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

125799769.name: Best place to be.
125799769.author: a TripAdvisor user
125799769.reviewBody: Caleta is my favorite spot in Acapulco as there I get the real Mexican feeling, the people are genuine and the vendors don\'t bug you.

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

125137201.name: Good beaches mid week
125137201.author: a TripAdvisor user
125137201.reviewBody: These beaches can get busy on the weekend but mid week are exteremly pleasant, calm and quiet with lots of seafood restaurants to chose from. The water is very calm and would be ideal for small children.

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

125077012.name: Favorite beach of the locals, provides great interactions
125077012.author: a TripAdvisor user
125077012.reviewBody: we dove from Caleta beach.. the beach is wonderfully soft sand, the people who work the restaurants there are friendly, helpful and had a great sense of humor. The beach is clean, the water clear and not polluted. Great place :)

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

122048521.name: Cool Beach
122048521.author: a TripAdvisor user
122048521.reviewBody: Another busy beach with cool Cabana style restaurants

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

120688146.name: Went after dark, but still nice
120688146.author: a TripAdvisor user
120688146.reviewBody: My friends too a swim in the still (pool like) water, I just took my shoes off and strolled on the beach, warn sand has such a nice feeling. Families with kids and even the pet dog taking a swim such a nice family place.

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

120617927.name: New Years
120617927.author: a TripAdvisor user
120617927.reviewBody:
We tend to go here on busy days, when it is busy.
If you want to be shoulder to shoulder with locals, come here on new years day. But bring your own food and beer.
The water is very calm and good for anyone to swim.
Expect an authentic mexico experience.

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

106433696.name: Historical  Caleta Beach
106433696.author: a TripAdvisor user
106433696.reviewBody: If you want to be in an area of Acapulco notable for old construction, dirt cheap prices , a lot of atmosphere, short hop into downtown to the Zocolo where some of the best food is and all kinds of services, stay in Caleta.  I have to travel to Acapulco frequently from Zihuatanejo, and for 19 years have stayed at the Hotel Santa Catalina; rooms start at 25 dollars a night.  Huge, underpopulated except for weekends when tour buses show up, it is owned by a father and son both Notaries, whose offices are at the entrance.  The son is also a congressman. As you can imagine, security is perfect.

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

97012933.name: the best tranquil experience
97012933.author: a TripAdvisor user
97012933.reviewBody: The caleta a place to share with your friends and family. The waves are low so you have peace of mind on the kids playing safe. the beer is cheap in cubetas of ten beers.(160 pesos)

address.streetAddress: Playas Caleta y Caletilla

622993672.name: Very good trip...
622993672.author: a TripAdvisor user
622993672.reviewBody: We took the sunset time trip at the bonanza and it wasn\'t so crowded, so service was pretty good and environment too. The trip includes open bar and it\'s kind of divided into two parts, downstairs and upstairs. Downstairs is a musical group that has the responsibility to lead the fun!! Upstairs there\'s a DJ with recorded music. During the tour they show and describe you the houses of famous people, Mexican and international.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Muelle Central

558932420.name: Beautiful sunset!!!
558932420.author: a TripAdvisor user
558932420.reviewBody: Even though I did this tour more than a few times in the past when I was a tour guide myself for a major travel agency; this last winter my son, his wife and two daughters came from the grey and cold of Paris and The Bonanza sure was the highlight of their and our Vacation. The cruise itself, the commentaries, the attention of the crew, the sights, the music AND(of course) the drinks make the Bonanza Yacht Cruise an unforgettable experience.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Muelle Central

448127122.name: Lousy service
448127122.author: a TripAdvisor user
448127122.reviewBody: I had to wait under the sun for almost two hours, just to see at the last minute how they let people in before everyone that had been waiting. Please do youself a favor and use another boat compant

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Muelle Central

433584999.name: Worse yacht!!
433584999.author: a TripAdvisor user
433584999.reviewBody: Horrible costumer service!!! \nNot enoght chairs, they said it was free drinks all night but to get a cup of beer or any other drink you have to wait like 20 mins because there is a lot of people and only one barman. \nI think they sell more thickets then what they supposed, because you cant even walk!!!

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Muelle Central

382461051.name: When you have never seen the bay
382461051.author: a TripAdvisor user
382461051.reviewBody: It is a very good way to see the bay. It lasts three hours and take you all around Santa Lucia bay, the biggest bay of Acapulco. We always bring our visitors on it and they always enjoy it. The cost is really not expensive and it is all you can drink.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Muelle Central

369664983.name: Waste of time
369664983.author: a TripAdvisor user
369664983.reviewBody: The music is just too loud, and the drinks are terrible, the "open bar" is definitelly not worth the price... Plus there\'s very little to admire at night

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Muelle Central

337670859.name: bay cruise
337670859.author: a TripAdvisor user
337670859.reviewBody: worth it once  you are promised an open bar and snacks.  this really means an open bar and no snacks.  that does not matter in the end.  the cruise is interesting and worth the time and money  the guides show you the houses of celebrities and provide a different view of Acapulco

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Muelle Central

337070499.name: Fun, very fun!!
337070499.author: a TripAdvisor user
337070499.reviewBody: This is a good party boat option, the ride is about 2 1/2 hours with three levels and you can have a chair and enjoy the Acapulco bay from the sea, while you listen live music or DJ\'s. They have dance floor on each level and you are able to dance at wherever you want. They offered open bar but a suggested just drink beers cause they don\'t have bartenders, just people serving drinks on plastic cups. But even with that we had a great time. Also they have performances dancers and doubles of famous singers; you can find tickets all over, at the streets or at your hotel. If you go on vacation season better to be one hour before the departure to get a good sits, prices are very reasonable and kids under 10 are free. Different experience hope you don\'t regret it.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Muelle Central

333800421.name: The Party Boat was fun
333800421.author: a TripAdvisor user
333800421.reviewBody: This was sold to us as "the Party Boat" and it turned out to be a good party.  There was an open bar and some fast food available.  It tours around Acapulco Bay and heads out to La Quebrada where the cliff divers perform.  We were told we wood see the divers but it didn\'t happen.  There are 3 decks.  Top is open for viewing the sites. Middle has a dance floor and a DJ. Bottom has a dance floor and a live band.  There was a guide who pointed things out to everyone but since, I think, we were the only 2 people who didn\'t speak Spanish, we didn\'t really understand much.  It was still really cool to see the sights though.  Then on the was back, a few of the Mexican tourists adopted us and got us up on the dance floor dancing to stuff we\'d never heard before.  What a great bunch of people.  We really had a good time.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Muelle Central

282725209.name: Disco time on the beach!!!
282725209.author: a TripAdvisor user
282725209.reviewBody: Bonanza! is a fun family boat cruise. It will last about 3 hours but you will get to view beautiful Acapulco beaches. The Captain is also pointing out the houses of the rich and famous while in the tour!!! Best of all you get unlimited drinks!!!! yes open bar!!!! from the minute you get in the boat till you leave.  The music is great!!!!! for entaining!!!

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Muelle Central

258214862.name: great views and lovely staff, a must-do
258214862.author: a TripAdvisor user
258214862.reviewBody: we went for the late afternoon tour.  nice mix of people.  great live band.  fun dj music on other level.   informative and entertaining tour guide.  views unbeatable.  staff was very accommodating, providing lovely care to elderly people with us.  clean bathrooms.  food and drink options could be a little better, but unlimited drinks.  cost about US$ 17.  a must-do.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Muelle Central

200266693.name: On the ocean
200266693.author: a TripAdvisor user
200266693.reviewBody: You want to see from the sea the bay of Acapulco, it is a way of doing it! They also offer you all you can drink! Do not forget you are on a boat, be careful! If you take the boat of 4:30, you will see the most beautiful sunset!

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Muelle Central

199122071.name: music, drinks, views and sundown
199122071.author: a TripAdvisor user
199122071.reviewBody:
For years I shied away from going on what seemed a "tourist trap". But once I had dared to go, I can recommend it. Why?
Considering the over two hour trip, the price of around USD 175 (March 2014) is more than adequate. This includes latin style live dance music (interestingly most people dancing where "middle aged plus" women) free drinks (including beer, tequila, rum and soft drinks) and in particular great views. Acapulco looks best from farther away, actually, and you only see some of the nicer villas from the water as you can never get close or into the gated communities otherwise). The combination of water, cliffs and buildings is nice anyway, and: if you take the late afternoon cruise the boat stops at a spot where the sun will set into the ocean right between to islands. That guarantees great sundown pictures (unless you run out of battery power like it did for me).

Some snacks are sold on board.
I did not check the toilets.
Tickets are sold at most hotels (and you can also get them at the pier).
Given the free bar, there is a risk to run into people who drink too much (but I did not experience that the day I took the cruise).

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Muelle Central

3835008.name: Good view, regular service
3835008.author: a TripAdvisor user
3835008.reviewBody:
This boat will give you a good ride at the three Acapulco's bays. It starts in the common Acapulco's bay, showing the principal attractions: the port, naval base, houses of some popular movies stars and celebrities, including Luis Miguel, Tarzan, John Wayne and several others. Then it shows the Acapulco's Diamante bay, including some popular hotels. It finally goes to the old Acapulco's bay, giving a view of La Quebrada and Roqueta island.

The boat includes a bilingual presentation and description of relevant places, and there is live music in the first floor and recorded music in the second and third floor. It includes dance floors for those interested, as well as a free bar and a little shop.

They say the night trip includes a view of the Pie de la Cuesta sunset, one of the most beautiful of Acapulco, but we couldn't see this.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Muelle Central

569724846.name: The best beach in Acapulco
569724846.author: a TripAdvisor user
569724846.reviewBody: We go there often because it is the best place to baith in Acapulco. We normally rent an umbrella and eat at the restaurant Don Camaron. I am so glad we have that beach in Acapulco.

address.streetAddress: Puerto Marques

544121786.name: Not the best beach in Acapulco!
544121786.author: a TripAdvisor user
544121786.reviewBody: Playa Majahua is beautiful to look at but unfortunately it didn\'t do much for us. The location is not that great and the beach isn\'t very clean or swimable. I prefer other beaches in Acapulco to swim in but I wouldn\'t recommend this one, it\'s just great for photos.  Also it\'s said the area is not very safe and there are signs warning people to go with caution because you may be robbed, this also turned us off.  It\'s also right next to lower end hotels where locals tend to party early in the morning and the music is super loud, seems like a run down part of town, wouldn\'t return to swim or hang out at all.

address.streetAddress: Puerto Marques

600821332.name: Nice
600821332.author: a TripAdvisor user
600821332.reviewBody: A nice beach where a little hut with table and chairs are inexpensive. Service for food and beverage at resonable price for being on the beach. The water gets deep fast, but is warm. Frequented by familys and gays. Everyone gets along.  We enjoy our time there. Easy to catch the bus.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

567299440.name: Condesa on downward spiral.   Acapulco is dying.
567299440.author: a TripAdvisor user
567299440.reviewBody: Just returned from visit during the first two weeks March 2018.  This is my 5th visit. Spent a weekday at Condesa, Paradise Restaurant.  About 5-7 people on the entrie beach.  Many more vendors than visitors,  None making sales.  Very sad to see.   Walked north from Paradise and found many abandoned beach front buildings.  Filled with broken glass, urine, feces.   Seems like the State Dept. warnings have chased lots of people away.  Acapulco is dying.   Could not find any direct flights from the US.  Hassel to go through Mexico City.  Few if any cruise ships anymore.  Went to most of the top 10 restaurants.  Only about 2-4 tables with customers.  Most  hotels had few guests.   Consequently everyone is forced to cut corners.   Hire cheaper help (little or no english), serve less quality food, poor service from fewer and inexperienced hotel workers, and lots of other down grading.   Acapulco is active on weekends when the Mexico City folks come in.  But this is not enough to support the town.  Not much improvement in service, just lots more people for two days.   No direct flights, no cruise ships, fewer services, hotels and restaurants fading.   I guess this was my last visit.  Other Mexico resorts town are much better,  Puerto Vallarta, for example.   Sad to see such a beautiful place as Acapulco dying on the vine.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

562969653.name: Typical Acapulco beach
562969653.author: a TripAdvisor user
562969653.reviewBody: nice sand quality and service possibilities with many palapas and restaurants. Water quality is good.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

560603839.name: Great Way to Relax
560603839.author: a TripAdvisor user
560603839.reviewBody: Expect to be hawked wares by the locals, but that\'s not necessarily a bad thing.  The food/drinks/trinkets are very reasonably priced (you also pay about 130 pesos for a table/umbrella for the day).  Very relaxing place to spend the afternoon and early evening. PS - the beach shuts down at dusk, so bring your own drinks.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

472902245.name: Beautiful beach
472902245.author: a TripAdvisor user
472902245.reviewBody: Playa Condesa is a beautiful beach right in the middle of the hotel zone of Acapulco.  There are many bars and restaurants right there.  Also many water activities can be found these. The place is packed on the weekends.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

451262897.name: My favourite playa
451262897.author: a TripAdvisor user
451262897.reviewBody: Right close to the center, not too crowed, despite Xmas time. Golden sand, beautiful view of Acapulco, embelliched by the peculiar rocks in front of it. Too many people trying to sell you any kind of things, as I suppose everywhereverybody else. Windy enough to stand a temperature of about 34\u00b0. Nice restaurant (Paradis) can serve good food on the beach. Moderate prices for a deckchair and a beach umbrella, better bargain.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

429773871.name: Beautiful view of the bay
429773871.author: a TripAdvisor user
429773871.reviewBody:
Our hotel was a block away from the beach. We walked to the beach to take a walk at sunset. It's a beautiful view of the bay.  We also went there in the morning. The water was calm enough for us to paddle board.  There were also people using jet skis. Both can be rented right on the beach. The street by the beach is lined with restaurants and bars. Lots of good food.  

The problem with this beach is that there is no shade except at the hotels. The sun is intense.  The sand is course and you sink into it while walking along the beach.  It would be hard for older people to walk along this beach.

We were there in Oct. and the beach was not crowded at all.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

426623106.name: A nice place
426623106.author: a TripAdvisor user
426623106.reviewBody: A very nice beach, nice sand, clean water, beautiful views. I agree, however, with other Reviewers that getting there may be difficult, depending on the time of the day and a day itself.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

400427357.name: Strong undertow!!
400427357.author: a TripAdvisor user
400427357.reviewBody: A very active beach. Good place to people watch. Very strong undertow. Always keep one eye on the water even if you\'re walking.Lots of restaurants as well as beach vendors. Enjoy...

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

356412115.name: Beach is great
356412115.author: a TripAdvisor user
356412115.reviewBody: Good location, lots of people hang out here, food, drinks available. Like to jet ski you can rent one. Been going g to this beach for years. You will not be disappointed.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

348805126.name: The beach is fine.  Getting to it is a nightmare.
348805126.author: a TripAdvisor user
348805126.reviewBody: Too bad.  The water is clean, but gets deep quickly.  The sand is great.  The other beach goers are fine.  90% of the businesses seem like they are stuck in the past and just wringing out dollars.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

347685400.name: our favorite beach
347685400.author: a TripAdvisor user
347685400.reviewBody: just a few minutes walk from Las Torres Gemelas. 50 pesos to rent chairs and umbrella. lots of vendors walking by, plus the many bars and restaurants - can order and they bring to you. this beach also has a protected area encircled with floats, safer for children.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

332044295.name: Wonderful Beach!
332044295.author: a TripAdvisor user
332044295.reviewBody: Condesa is where most locals go instead of the beaches directly attached to the hotels.  It is a little more quiet but really pretty and the water is really warm too!  Nice beach for the family!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

330606689.name: a moment of distraction
330606689.author: a TripAdvisor user
330606689.reviewBody: It has a good climate, a variety of objects, a wide variety of places to relax and things are cheap. exeden not on the prices of the products they sell there on the spot. Finally I should mention that there are several cheap to stay a couple of days with a wonderful view places.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

327271353.name: A classic and beautiful stretch of beach
327271353.author: a TripAdvisor user
327271353.reviewBody: The beach is so nice here! There are quiet stretches to one side, and in the area where there are hotels, there are services which offer jets rental, diving, etc. A perfect beach! (sometimes you have to look out for rogue waves from the tide, but that\'s anywhere!)

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

317436087.name: Birthday weekend
317436087.author: a TripAdvisor user
317436087.reviewBody: Fist time visited, but such a clean and nice relaxing beach, must visit. Clean water and quiet to relax

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

308588872.name: LOVE THIS BEACH!
308588872.author: a TripAdvisor user
308588872.reviewBody: I love that this is a little more out of the way and more quiet than the "Main" beach.  Water is beautiful!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

308343658.name: Not my favorite
308343658.author: a TripAdvisor user
308343658.reviewBody: Probably not the best beach of Acapulco, personally I prefer Punta Diamante side which is less crowded and with cleaner beaches and sea.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

306099868.name: Time to enjoy some "You time"
306099868.author: a TripAdvisor user
306099868.reviewBody: Playa Condesa is a more subcluded beach not very crowded but beautiful to visit. You can sit there hear the waves and enjoy some "you" time. A very beautiful beach to relax and enjoy the scenery.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

277853979.name: Nice side beach!
277853979.author: a TripAdvisor user
277853979.reviewBody: A little more quiet than the Costera beach and very nice to relax and just be.  The water is nice and the views are amazing!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

262713733.name: Paradise on earth
262713733.author: a TripAdvisor user
262713733.reviewBody:
It's sad that some people are scared to go to Acapulco. Condesa beach is cleaner than ever, the customer service is the best.
Try an afternoon under a palapa at Beto, you'll return every year.  Not only the place is paradise on earth but the waiters are the funniest and the friendliest in the city.
PROOF is most of their customers return every year.
Get addicted to paradise !

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

258400510.name: Best place to hang out
258400510.author: a TripAdvisor user
258400510.reviewBody: Wether you enjoy hanging out with the locals or being a tourist the Condessa is a great area. Lots of things to do from markets to food. Very walkable. People are friendly and buckets of local beers are very cheap.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

258265362.name: Nice beach on Acapulcos waterfront - but a lot of nicer beaches on the Pacific coast
258265362.author: a TripAdvisor user
258265362.reviewBody: Spent the morning at the beach in Acapulco, Playa Francia happened to be closest to our hotel and was recommended to have less of a rip from the waves. The beach is very cramped with lots of zoning off by hotels and acitivity providers. We rented two chairs and a parasol after some haggling. The sand gradient is very steep when you enter the water and the power in the waves can be overwhelming for kids/elderly or poor swimmers, so not massively enjoyable. I went for a 1km swim up and down from our spot. It was only ok as there is a lot of zoning going on by hotels and activity crowds and even at that there are constantly jetskis and boats crossing into swim areas. Even got a good taste of fuel at one stage. There are immensely nicer beaches on this coast to be enjoyed, but we don\'t regret stopping off in the renowned Acapulco for a night/day.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

255895616.name: Great for spring breakers!
255895616.author: a TripAdvisor user
255895616.reviewBody: This is a great hopping wild area for the spring break crowd to hang and flirt and play in the sun. It is busy, there is always music going and lots to look at and do. I am too old for this area now but have many wild, fond memories here.ZZZZZZZZZZZ!!!!!!!!!!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

255095937.name: Great swim spot behind the Fiesta Americana!!
255095937.author: a TripAdvisor user
255095937.reviewBody:
Playa Condesa is one of the better swim spots along the bay if your directly at the Fiesta Americana you have 3 huge rock formations that protect the shore from any large waves. 

Down further by Paradise you have more wave and undertow issues and swimming there at times can be difficult. 

There is usually a good crowd especially on weekends and alot of up beat music as well.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

254774507.name: Good beach, especially if your hotel is along it.
254774507.author: a TripAdvisor user
254774507.reviewBody:
A nice long stretch of beach to walk.  Perfect if you're already staying long this stretch, but may not be considered a great 'destination' beach.  

Plenty of opportunities to sit and enjoy a drink or snack.  Dozens of beach-vendors toting their items for sale; they are respectful and don't hassle you to buy from them, like other Mexican cities. 

Jet skiing, para-sailing, boat rides, etc all available from the beach.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

253373399.name: nice gay beach
253373399.author: a TripAdvisor user
253373399.reviewBody: You can rent a chair under a palapa for 100 pesos ($8).\nI was staying at the gay only Bed & Breakfast named Casa Condesa, it is only 10 minutes walking distance. I also recommend that B&B , very nice staff, nice swimming pool, long chairs where you can sunbath nude with nice boys/men around you. Very relax place, Casa Condesa is a must to go for gay people if you are in Acapulco. If you are in another Hotel in Acapulco, contact Casa Condesa and they will give you a day pass,  I think it won\'t cost you a lot.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

246634565.name: Depends on when you go.
246634565.author: a TripAdvisor user
246634565.reviewBody: Playa Condesa is the most popular beach in Acapulco, for good reason, and has been welcoming world travelers and domestic visitors for decades. In the high season there are hundreds of service workers taking care of the massive amount of beachgoers with at least 20 massage therapists, waiters with menus galore providing beach umbrella service and non-stop vendors of every imaginable item. On this beach, the word "no" only works if you say it three times. A much more effective method is the Mexican style... just wiggle your index finger sideways in the "no" movement and don\'t utter a word.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

244638213.name: Iguess it doesnt get better than that.
244638213.author: a TripAdvisor user
244638213.reviewBody:
I tried to explore as much as i could as far as beach area goes, but if we go on looking on different factors this area its the best around the main coast beaches. 

Playa Condesa its located on an area where there are a lot of clubs and some 3, 4 and 5 stars on the area.

If u arent on the private exclusive area and you like a decent area to enjoy the beach playa condesa will be my best recommendation

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

242342613.name: very nice beach, close to hotel
242342613.author: a TripAdvisor user
242342613.reviewBody: Very safe, has lifeguard.  The surf is calmer here too.   Many vendors and places to order drinks or food delivered to your umbrella   Walk past Fiesta Americana, look for sign Playa Accesso.    Be aware that umbrella rental is 50 pesos. (its not a scam)

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

229496201.name: not what u expect
229496201.author: a TripAdvisor user
229496201.reviewBody: we walked for awhile going to the so called famous playa condessa. no one was there and there was no one on the beach. it was all shops and resturants and one bungie jumping station that was not open.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

223511970.name: Playa Condesa
223511970.author: a TripAdvisor user
223511970.reviewBody: Best place to have an amazing meal, \nThe staff went above and beyond to help you and serve the best they can.\nThe seafood is probably the best grilled seafood I\'ve ever had

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

222776433.name: Best beach in Acapulco.
222776433.author: a TripAdvisor user
222776433.reviewBody: Best beach in Acapulco BUT sadly where the queers congregate .Still a nice spot with the Condesa Hotel above with Fabulous Pool(s)and Great food!!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

209160948.name: Loved it but watch out for the undertow
209160948.author: a TripAdvisor user
209160948.reviewBody: I lived her for 6 years, very unique, lots of vendors, lots of restaurants, bars, hotels....nice to walk everywhere.  Lived in one of the high rises next to Fiesta American, miss this area a lot.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

208982709.name: It\'s ok as long as you stay at your hotel chairs.
208982709.author: a TripAdvisor user
208982709.reviewBody: We stayed at the hotel right by the rocks, lots of chairs, clean place, prices on beverages were average but we found out that this is where the gay population meet so if you do not get bother by gays modeling around at all times, this place is cool and interesting. All kinds of water sports around.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

196150431.name: Busy but Beautiful
196150431.author: a TripAdvisor user
196150431.reviewBody: This stretch of sand is always packed with people, and the beach has some coarse sand, but the views from here are beautiful!!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

196053260.name: Probably the busiest beach along with caleta
196053260.author: a TripAdvisor user
196053260.reviewBody: From Paradise down to the Fiesta Americana many families and friends gather to spend some time at this beach. \n\nThe rock formation just where the fiesta americana is allows for a pretty calm swim but closer to Paradise restaurante it can be very rough with a strong undertow. Use caution when swimming here.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

189213591.name: Always the best view..
189213591.author: a TripAdvisor user
189213591.reviewBody: We\'ve been going to Acapulco every, Feb 2014 will be our 29th in a row. We\'ve always stayed along this beach, last 20 at Playa Suites. The view is beautiful both during the day and at night. Best part for us...the Cross on top of the mountain where we were married in 1995. A must see if you go to Acapulco. Any info you want contact me: deanwal @ a o l. com

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

154441776.name: Best of People watching!
154441776.author: a TripAdvisor user
154441776.reviewBody: I have sat on this beach over 100 times and always enjoyed the people watching and friendly staff that surrounds the many restaurants located here.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

151663400.name: Nice Beach
151663400.author: a TripAdvisor user
151663400.reviewBody: Another of Acapulco\'s nice beaches that is worth checking out more for families with slighty older kids

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

148906512.name: Dirty and overcrowded
148906512.author: a TripAdvisor user
148906512.reviewBody: This beach is not recommended during the holidays (christmas, march break, etc.) because this beach is absolutely disgusting during busy times. People leave garbage everywhere and the ocean is one big dump. Vendors walk buy you selling memorabilia every 30 seconds. During not so busy times it is much nicer. Water-sports such as jet-skiing, banana boating, water skiing, and parasailing are all available on this beach, which is why i give it an average score.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

127313955.name: Great beach, but to many vendors.
127313955.author: a TripAdvisor user
127313955.reviewBody: Acapulco beaches are great. Must take care if you are not a good swimmer because of high surf nad undertow. Eating places there expensive and not so nice.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

123851311.name: Rainbow\'s galor
123851311.author: a TripAdvisor user
123851311.reviewBody: Very friendly beach catering to all walks of life.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

123503043.name: Great day trip
123503043.author: a TripAdvisor user
123503043.reviewBody: Take a bus for 7 peso, get ready to have a fun day snorkling.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

123228291.name: Great Beach!
123228291.author: a TripAdvisor user
123228291.reviewBody: This is the gay beach in Acapulco.  It is very nice and attracts many tourists from Canada, and Mexico City.  It is located next to Betos restaurant.  Ask for Juan and Marisol.  They have taken care of me for 15 years.  They watch over your personals, etc.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

122048482.name: Neat lil Mexiacan family Beach
122048482.author: a TripAdvisor user
122048482.reviewBody: Fun and a great chance to see the Mexican faly warmth

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

120617605.name: Busy
120617605.author: a TripAdvisor user
120617605.reviewBody: This is a busy area, with lots of peddlers. The waves can be quite strong at times. I saw a lady almost drown in front of the Crowne. Her husband couldn\'t fight the undertow to help her, and two locals pulled her out.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

15623565.name: Love the activity on Playa Condesa
15623565.author: a TripAdvisor user
15623565.reviewBody:
Playa Condesa is right in the middle of all the action of the surrounding areas. The weekends on this particular beach tend to be very crowded but as long as you get down there by 11am you should have no trouble getting a spot under a shaded canopy or Palapa.
       This is a good location for watersports Banana boats, Wave runners or parasailing to name a few or just float around in the ocean which is fairly calm most of the time. The rock formation gives it some protection from some of the rougher waves.
      This area is home to many beach vendors hawking there wares which can be a bit tedious from time to time when one is looking to just relax but a quick wave of the hand they are gone.
    The prices for a lounge chair & umbrella tend to vary & your negotiating skills come into play when dealing with the independent merchant on the beach but 60 pesos is what the Fiesta Americana will charge there guests so no more then that should you pay them. You can get both food & beverage from the Fiesta Americana, Paradise, Betos & also an independent group just next to the FA.

                   Enjoy

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

5047239.name: Playa Condesa - A Great Place to Spend a Day!
5047239.author: a TripAdvisor user
5047239.reviewBody:
I've been visiting Playa Condesa for almost 25-years now, and it remains my favorite beach in Acapulco.  My most recent visit was April, 2006.  It's been, for many years now,  considered Acapulco's most "high class" beach - one that's the least congested of the beaches in the city center (as compared to outlying areas), and a wide-range of services are available.  All beaches in Acapulco fill-up at Christmas/New Years and for the Semana Santa/Easter national holiday periods - but, even then, Playa Condesa will be the least congested.

The city requires beachfront restaurants to charge a fee to sit in chairs and under the umbrellas or palapas along the beach, not just at Playa Condesa but at many other beaches in the city.  For the money you pay you get a nice and shady place to sit, and waiters who run back and forth in the hot sand to get you cold drinks, something to eat, etc.  It's a great set-up.  

Some of the city's best-known restaurants are located at the beach, including Beto's and Paradise - both of which offer waterfront service.  Prices for things you buy at this beach will probably be higher than most other beaches in the city, though.  

You can rent jet ski's, take a parachute ride (pulled by a motor boat), ride on one of the "banana" boats, arrange for scuba diving or touring of the bay in a small boat.  A very small portion of Playa Condesa is popular with the well-heeled gay travel crowd, particularly from Mexico City.  It's a family beach, though - first and foremost.  

There are many beaches to go to in Acapulco and the nearby area, and although I don't suggest someone spend all of their time at Playa Condesa, I do recommend it as a place to visit and enjoy - together with the rest of Acapulco.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

3834795.name: Ok, but some problems
3834795.author: a TripAdvisor user
3834795.reviewBody:
We went there in August, maybe this could be an influence.

Even when the springbreak and high-season were over, this beach is overcrowded and full of vendors. You can not get a chair here, unless you pay some beach-overloard $6 and buy him some drinks. This is true even when you are in a hotel like Fiesta Americana (where we stayed), because this is a public beach. Hotel's waitress don't even serve you there.

The water is somewhat dirty. On the other side you can see a very good view of the bay, and it is near of many shopping and dinner places in Acapulco.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman s/n Frente al Hotel Fiesta Americana

657941338.name: Wild Open Ocean in March 2019
657941338.author: a TripAdvisor user
657941338.reviewBody: The beautiful Pacific Ocean is open at this particular beach strip. For us typically the morning had a few small waves with a calm background by lunch time the waves grew larger & stronger.  There is no lifeguard & we were told by security that you should not venture too far out as the current can be deadly. I do agree. We are all strong swimmers. There were many body/boogie board  surfers. They were having a blast. So were we. The beach is clean. The ocean is clean. You can walk for miles. We felt safe. You can rent those sun canopy\u2019s with chairs for approximately $15 per hut for the day.  Otherwise your resort has chairs that belong to them although it\u2019s much closer to the resort rather than the ocean. Wear shoes to walk on the sand as it gets VERY HOT. \nEnjoy. We did.

address.streetAddress: Playa Revolcadero Frente a Hotel Princess

642312164.name: Good day at the beach
642312164.author: a TripAdvisor user
642312164.reviewBody: This beach is incredible clean ... you even can see little fish very near the shore. If you stay near the parking lot is crowded but walking a few meters toward the princess hotel you can find some shades to rent that give you the required comfort. There are boards to rent and you can walk a lot on the beach with the water on your knee. Good and enjoyable family fun.

address.streetAddress: Playa Revolcadero Frente a Hotel Princess

559450053.name: A quiet and beautiful beach
559450053.author: a TripAdvisor user
559450053.reviewBody: We were not exactly in this part of the beach but closer to the Quinta Real area, it was beautiful and quiet.  Rented boogie boards for a little surfing.\nWe did not eat at the places there, enjoyed the beach.

address.streetAddress: Playa Revolcadero Frente a Hotel Princess

555146122.name: Really nice place
555146122.author: a TripAdvisor user
555146122.reviewBody: Went there on a Saturday.  The population in the city proper swells on weekends so it is nice to get away from that.  The beach is very nice we go to the same guy Roberto.   Treats us right.  Just a few vendors.  Be careful in the water as the rip currents can be fatal

address.streetAddress: Playa Revolcadero Frente a Hotel Princess

542540470.name: Nice beach with local charm!
542540470.author: a TripAdvisor user
542540470.reviewBody: Playa Revolcadero is a nice sized warm beach with a local flare! There are vendors with little huts right on the beach selling seashells, food, and souveniers of all sorts.  The waves are sometimes choppy but when it\'s calm you can totally go in the water and ejoy a nice day in the sun! There are many beautiful hotels along the strip and you can just walk and admire the bustling hotels and beach clubs. Loved my time in the water here!

address.streetAddress: Playa Revolcadero Frente a Hotel Princess

538173184.name: Careful of the prices
538173184.author: a TripAdvisor user
538173184.reviewBody: This beach is great for an afternoon of body boarding and pina coladas. However, check all prices before committing. We ended up paying 300 pesos for a sun shade even though we also paid for food and drink. We rented body boards for 100 pesos each and ate the most expensive French fries ever. We had 2 orders of quesadillas, 3 French fried and 5 drinks and paid over 1000 pesos. The previous day we ate 5?full meals including prawns and steak for a similar price in puerto Marquez. The day out on the beach was lively but we felt a bit put out paying 100 dollars for a few fries and sitting down. The best value was a great 45 minute massage for 250 pesos!

address.streetAddress: Playa Revolcadero Frente a Hotel Princess

461827125.name: Good Beach for Walking
461827125.author: a TripAdvisor user
461827125.reviewBody:
Fine dark sand and a constant surf so,,,,,, a good beach to walk but not for swimming unless you are a surf jumper....  LOL
The beach must be 4 - 5 miles long with hotel and local stops along the way to get a refreshment or some local sales people will try to sell you some product made in India, Hong Kong or Pakistan!!!
The dry sand in the afternoon gets too hot to walk on for this Tenderfoot, so you might want to be careful...
Enjoy..

address.streetAddress: Playa Revolcadero Frente a Hotel Princess

425379220.name: Not most beautiful but relaxing
425379220.author: a TripAdvisor user
425379220.reviewBody:
Although the sand is not very clean and the sea is a little brave in this zone, you can enjoy a good day.
I consider for swiming is not a place for kids, only if you have continuous supervision on them, however you can find several activities: ride a horse, beach sports, palapas, etc.

Of course I don't recommend to visit on holidays because is completely full and you can't enjoy.

address.streetAddress: Playa Revolcadero Frente a Hotel Princess

382459716.name: Surfing the waves
382459716.author: a TripAdvisor user
382459716.reviewBody: We go there at least once every winter. My husband loves to surf the waves. The restaurants see you coming and their fast food is expensive but that is the way for them to make money.

address.streetAddress: Playa Revolcadero Frente a Hotel Princess

338970758.name: Nice beach
338970758.author: a TripAdvisor user
338970758.reviewBody: We went there on a Saturday not knowing that locals also enjoy a day at the beach! Was full in a matter of minutes. We had to pay for chairs and a palapa. Was an interesting experience. Never went back on the weekend.

address.streetAddress: Playa Revolcadero Frente a Hotel Princess

337278553.name: nice place
337278553.author: a TripAdvisor user
337278553.reviewBody: the beach is nice and safe.  the main thing to worry about is the current.   getting out too deep is very dangerous and if you step into a hole, swim sideways, don\'t fight the rip tide.  the sand is hot so plan for that.  other than those things, the area is very nice  we always go the private huts that are operated by Roberto.  I like the vendors and they are fewer than in town.  get the French fries on the beach are the best.  the best place to get a taxi to get back to town is in front of the princess or down at the little flea market by the river.  I always made it  appoint to make it back to town before dark.  it is a good place to find some sand dollars and shells.  you can rent a 4 wheeler or  a horse there also

address.streetAddress: Playa Revolcadero Frente a Hotel Princess

294189246.name: Pass  a fun evening  in Acapulco
294189246.author: a TripAdvisor user
294189246.reviewBody: I think  is  one  of the  best beaches  in Acapulco, have  a largest  low  water  level in Acapulco,    you can walk  10 meter  throu the water and  level  is  around  1 meter,   the  waves  comes  to the  beach  fast  depending  of  wind,  so you can  go  with a  type  of table  of surf and let  to  the  wave  back  to you  to the  beach..  a very good place  to  play  with the  ocean water..

address.streetAddress: Playa Revolcadero Frente a Hotel Princess

178116940.name: Brilliant
178116940.author: a TripAdvisor user
178116940.reviewBody: We went to Playa Revolcdero for the day. It is so different from the other side of Acapulco( Las Brisas). The waves are amazing and as far you can see it is just this amazing strip of beach and waves. Lovely.

address.streetAddress: Playa Revolcadero Frente a Hotel Princess

154341561.name: Long Long beach.
154341561.author: a TripAdvisor user
154341561.reviewBody: If you want a long stroll on the beach this is a great starting point.  I think you can walk at least 10 k without interruption along here.  Maybe more.  I will wear my meter next time to let you know.

address.streetAddress: Playa Revolcadero Frente a Hotel Princess

153092606.name: Beach Trip
153092606.author: a TripAdvisor user
153092606.reviewBody: Always enjoy spending a day here, Swimming can be tough and you should exercise extreme caution. Also beach is hot wear scandels

address.streetAddress: Playa Revolcadero Frente a Hotel Princess

127312192.name: It could be much better if you get rid of the vendors
127312192.author: a TripAdvisor user
127312192.reviewBody: The sand and beach is great, the undertow quite dangerous, you must take care. No place to park your car. Beach vendors again as in all Acapulco trying to sell you something all the time.

address.streetAddress: Playa Revolcadero Frente a Hotel Princess

124916798.name: best beach
124916798.author: a TripAdvisor user
124916798.reviewBody: Liked the long wide beach, no one on it during the week, a few people during the weekend.  Can\'t wait to go back!

address.streetAddress: Playa Revolcadero Frente a Hotel Princess

123605881.name: Surfing and food
123605881.author: a TripAdvisor user
123605881.reviewBody: Good for surfing, there is some current that may get strong. Very good food. There are a few ways of getting there the main one is from the main road from the airport to Puerto Marquez and turn left on the burguer king.

address.streetAddress: Playa Revolcadero Frente a Hotel Princess

122926756.name: Best beach in acapulco but has captured by sales people
122926756.author: a TripAdvisor user
122926756.reviewBody: This is by far Acapulco\'s best place to swim in the ocean if you like waves.  If you like a pool-like setting go to the main bay.  Nevertheless a nicer development would be welcome, its a great example of the lack of tourism infrastructure in Mexico.  Instead of some nice shades installed by the city (even if they were charged) you have a bunch of temporary not-so-beautiful garage-like shades set up by random people that charge you 20-30usd for the day.    That said it is still the only beach in Acapulco I swim in

address.streetAddress: Playa Revolcadero Frente a Hotel Princess

121498668.name: Grand Mayan is on the Playa Revolcadero
121498668.author: a TripAdvisor user
121498668.reviewBody: Clear and clean Pacific ocean and white sandy beaches.  It is open ocean so it is rougher water than in Acapulco Bay or Puerto Marques.

address.streetAddress: Playa Revolcadero Frente a Hotel Princess

85657097.name: great beach, nice service, as always be careful with pushy sales people
85657097.author: a TripAdvisor user
85657097.reviewBody: this beach is right across the street from my husband\'s aunt\'s beach house. They have great prices for drinks and food, definitely worth the value! For a small price you can sit under a nice palm branch shaded area. Horse rides and boogie boards are for rent if you would like. The only downside (or upside if you like) is that there are a lot of sellers walking around. Some have good deals, but some will trick you into making something then having you pay for it (a guy came up and asked my husband\'s and my name, came back a couple minutes later with a cute card of two people kissing with our names on it and asked us for money, which we bought because we felt bad and it was cheap, but you get the idea, haha). Overall, amazing beach and love going there when we visit.

address.streetAddress: Playa Revolcadero Frente a Hotel Princess

504580290.name: Clean net waters
504580290.author: a TripAdvisor user
504580290.reviewBody: Pichilingue is definetly worth going and staying, it is far from the traditional and noisy Acapulco but this means you will have your peace and quiet here. It is also a more luxurious area and the waters are a deeper blue and clean.\nIt was a favortie spot for us because you could really take in the beach without too much noise or distraction.

address.streetAddress: Puerto Marques

490313046.name: Vamos al la playa
490313046.author: a TripAdvisor user
490313046.reviewBody: Lets go to this beautiful white sandy beach and enjoy the tropical sun. Relax and sip from your delicious cocktail.

address.streetAddress: Puerto Marques

479842569.name: A lovely little beach.
479842569.author: a TripAdvisor user
479842569.reviewBody: Pichilingue is a lovely little beach that can only be reached by boat unless you are lucky enough to have friends in one of the surrounding mansions mostly owned by the Mexican mega-rich. \nIf you go mid-week off-season you may well find the beach completely empty and it\'s calm waters are perfect for small children, but on holiday weekends boat traffic can be awful, not to mention dangerous.

address.streetAddress: Puerto Marques

454295292.name: Quiet beach
454295292.author: a TripAdvisor user
454295292.reviewBody: A nice quiet and private beach in the bay. Great for a relaxing visit.\nIt is at the bottom of the hill.\n

address.streetAddress: Puerto Marques

438539607.name: Secluded and nice
438539607.author: a TripAdvisor user
438539607.reviewBody: We got here by yacht and it was a wonderful day. We were able to just float around for a few hours and enjoy the day, we had food on the yacht and went swimming. Some in the group went on jet skis and enjoyed that part of the beach also. I would definitely make the day trip here if you can figure out a boat or yacht trip.

address.streetAddress: Puerto Marques

422638217.name: Nice Beach
422638217.author: a TripAdvisor user
422638217.reviewBody: Excellent place to go swimming, the water is nice and calm. You can get here by speed boat from Acapulco bay or by car through Puerto Marques.

address.streetAddress: Puerto Marques

371831334.name: Beautiful
371831334.author: a TripAdvisor user
371831334.reviewBody: Went there by boat. Lovely area in Puerto Marques. Calm waters. Since we were on a boat, there are people who will come and take a lunch order and deliver to the boat. Very nice area.

address.streetAddress: Puerto Marques

287352538.name: Nice lunch
287352538.author: a TripAdvisor user
287352538.reviewBody: Went there for a lunch, and we had a wonderful fish very well cook and tasty. We also had a bucket of beers to enjoy the evening, you can be swimming and playing ball all afternoon.

address.streetAddress: Puerto Marques

262780747.name: family very chilled trip
262780747.author: a TripAdvisor user
262780747.reviewBody: Playa Pichilingue offers a complete idea of a private beach, the only down size is that people come by boat and set up shop there!

address.streetAddress: Puerto Marques

660008066.name: Nice Bech
660008066.author: a TripAdvisor user
660008066.reviewBody: We stayed at the Camelia y Magnolia condos right on this beach for one week. There are swimming zones in the water that are roped off which is nice. Most of the areas of the beach are zoned off for the accommodations, each hotel as their own little section of the beach. There are several options for water sports here. Getting past the area in the water where the waves break is a bit rough especially for children but once you\'re past that area it\'s easy to swim around. The water has been very green while we are here because of the plankton bloom so there is nearly no visibility in the water. The vendors haven\'t been a problem for us, they just walk by.

472476254.name: Great Area For Water Sports And The Sand Is Finer Here!
472476254.author: a TripAdvisor user
472476254.reviewBody: I like this area of the Bay because there are plenty of water sport activities available in this area! The water is not as deep and the kids are always in the water also the sand is nicier to walk on.

464569324.name: crowded too many vendors
464569324.author: a TripAdvisor user
464569324.reviewBody:
we stayed at the copacabana so it was right behind our hotel
it was nice in the morning for a quick swim it crowds up by late morning
and the vendors were pests 
learn to say quithathe aqui ie (beat it)

426624920.name: Beautiful place
426624920.author: a TripAdvisor user
426624920.reviewBody: Absolutely an amazing place, a view comparable to Copacabana and other top beaches. Worth seeing during the day day and at the sunset. One remark - better to book taxi and make it come to pick you up than look for it at the beach.

343212093.name: Icacos, Acapulco Gold
343212093.author: a TripAdvisor user
343212093.reviewBody: The best location, banks, bars, kids entertainment, restaurants & stores, all can be done walking around. The gold sand, warm clean calm beach is beautiful. Almost all days summer time in this place. To rest, for fun or romance is a great choice.

341543291.name: Seen better days
341543291.author: a TripAdvisor user
341543291.reviewBody: The beach (as all the Acapulco bay) is dirty and the swimming is not nice because of the sea-bottom. It used to be the "last corner" of the bay so it was a nice spot even if the NAval base is near to it, but now it is not a pleasant experience anymore.

286758154.name: dangerous place
286758154.author: a TripAdvisor user
286758154.reviewBody: beautiful to look at, but Acapulco is a very dangerous place, stay on main streets, no jewelry, minimum of cash, \nwalk the beach if possible, careful @ night

262981419.name: ONE OF THE BEST ACAPULCO BEACHES
262981419.author: a TripAdvisor user
262981419.reviewBody: Very nice and quiet beach next to the militar base. But you need to go there by sea in a boat. The water is nice for swimming and not to much people. Rent a boat and go there for a nice beach day. Good sand and almost no waves.

255090262.name: Flat board rentals
255090262.author: a TripAdvisor user
255090262.reviewBody:
Took my family and a few friends behind the old cici water park to rent a few flat boards. Basically a wider surf board with paddle you stand on and row yourself around the bay. 

IMO the price was right from the word go i asked is it for 30 min he said 1 hour 20 dollars and i said 200 pesos and he said ok. 

My daughter and wife head out with another TA ' er Drew22 and had a great time. One of the young kids head out there to give instruction for the whole time and didn't ask for a thing. We tipped him very well. 

It's worth the effort to do this and it is at the block prior to arriving at cici as you are headed towards the Diana circle. 

Highly recommend!!!!

This is a no name outfit btw.

562149753.name: For 50 Pesos you can do so much for the nature
562149753.author: a TripAdvisor user
562149753.reviewBody: Come with your kids, give them an important lesson of what they can do to save the community of turtles in  Acapulco area. Come and support this modest place for such a great cause.

address.streetAddress: Benito Juarez # 5 Colonia Alfredo V. Bonfil

548122479.name: Nature at its best
548122479.author: a TripAdvisor user
548122479.reviewBody: We visited this place with our tour guide... if it wouldn\u2019t be for him we would not know about it\u2019s existence.  It is located in the Old Acapulco - Playa Hermosa... At the beginning you will watch the short movie (in Spanish with English subtitles)\u2019 you will get to know the cause of this little place... then you will see how they rescue the eggs of the turtles... wait for the eggs to hatch and finally release the baby turtles to the ocean... The place is run by the family with a big heart for the ocean life... we appreciate the cause and being the part of the turtle release to the ocean... please visit - the cause is great and the baby turtles are just adorable... they also offer the tour for turtle egg rescue - but it needs to be schedule earlier.

address.streetAddress: Benito Juarez # 5 Colonia Alfredo V. Bonfil

669960241.name: Stunning Landmark!
669960241.author: a TripAdvisor user
669960241.reviewBody: This beautiful piece of artwork is a grand landmark in Acapulco and a must-see. We were able to drive up to it and take some pictures alongside the mural. The mural is not located in a busy area so it is very easy to take pictures and enjoy the beauty of the art. The history behind this piece of art is very capturing, and we definitely recommend this sight to all travellers!

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

660005606.name: Fun to See
660005606.author: a TripAdvisor user
660005606.reviewBody: We stopped by the mural on a city tour. I wouldn\'t go out of your way to see it unless you\'re excited about Diego Rivera. It is pretty and colorful.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

659133435.name: An authentic gem
659133435.author: a TripAdvisor user
659133435.reviewBody: Locals, it is Time for some restoration, please.  It\'s an amazing mural.  Don\'t miss this treasure on your visit to Acapulco.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

658471251.name: Amazing mosaics
