658471251.author: a TripAdvisor user
658471251.reviewBody: Two amazing mosaics in part of Acapulco that is in decline. These outside estate where Diego Rivera stayed with mistress. His studio is empty but can see unfinished murals.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

653803808.name: Stunning mosaic by one of Mexico\u2019s most famous artists
653803808.author: a TripAdvisor user
653803808.reviewBody: Our guide brought us to this location which depicts two ancient God\u2019s, fire and rain. The work was done over 50 years ago and has held up beautifully. We were told that someday there might be a museum here to show Diego Rivera\u2019s work.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

651510342.name: Fascinating iconic mosaic murals
651510342.author: a TripAdvisor user
651510342.reviewBody: If your driver knows how to get here, be sure to see it, and take pictures!  The story behind Rivera\'s inspiration is also very interesting.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

648046452.name: GPS helpful to locate, as it is in an offbeat residentioal area
648046452.author: a TripAdvisor user
648046452.reviewBody: We were so fortunate to encounter a neighbor, Juan, who lives across the street and was so helpful and knowledgable, who just happened to be coming home when we stopped there

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

646484502.name: Impressive Mural
646484502.author: a TripAdvisor user
646484502.reviewBody: This mural was large scale but more fascinating than the mural is the story behind it. Ensure you guide is well versed in the story behind the mural as well as the one on the next wall. This is an must see.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

645579789.name: Beautiful work!
645579789.author: a TripAdvisor user
645579789.reviewBody: So glad we finally saw this. We have been to Acapulco so many times and always wanted to see this and finally did. They have kept it up nice, and it is amazing work. I hope it will be preserved forever.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

644576405.name: Connection to history
644576405.author: a TripAdvisor user
644576405.reviewBody: It is free to drive by and take pictures. It is were Diego Rivera had his studio and is one of the best known artists of his time. Take the time to go see it!

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

637504013.name: Must See
637504013.author: a TripAdvisor user
637504013.reviewBody: Art by an important artist, a piece of Acapulco\'s history and an iconic image that everyone should see when in Acapulco.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

636199212.name: Cool History
636199212.author: a TripAdvisor user
636199212.reviewBody: Didn\'t spend much time here but our snorkeling driver was nice enough to take us to see this. Nice to be able to associate my limited knowledge with actual facts.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

631744090.name: Beautiful murals, house currently closed to public
631744090.author: a TripAdvisor user
631744090.reviewBody:
Must see - Diego Rivera mural

How do I get there - hired taxi or by car, this is a strenuous walk from the oceanside hotel strip in old Acapulco

Currently the public is not allowed on the property as the house and garden areas are under renovation. This attraction was a pitstop during a day tour of the city with Asistur Company.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

625139353.name: Great folk art
625139353.author: a TripAdvisor user
625139353.reviewBody: You can view great folk art anywhere in the world and I happen to be partial to mosaic. Renowned painter Diego Rivera left his legacy behind with an elongated mural which is easy to view from the car.  Definitely do not miss.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

625100935.name: Unique Art in a quiet out of the way setting
625100935.author: a TripAdvisor user
625100935.reviewBody: Very nice large tiled wall art in a neighborhood setting off the beaten path. Certainly different from the murals of Rivera\'s seen previously but well worth a visit with the studio next to the wall containing the art work. Easy to miss is a ceiling mural below the studio.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

623581870.name: Historic mural sadly deteriorating
623581870.author: a TripAdvisor user
623581870.reviewBody: Love the drive up the hill to visit this great work of art and how nostalgic to think when this area was indeed the Nuevo Rich area of Acapulco, who knows when the rebuild or gentrification will occur but it will as the views are amazing .\nThe mural still is amazing and when it was completed would have been out standing\nA must see

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

606104097.name: Hidden gem
606104097.author: a TripAdvisor user
606104097.reviewBody: Before going to Acapulco, I didn\'t know who Diego Rivera was.  This mural is still beautiful, even if tourists or weather and age have removed some of the tiles.  A quick stop during the City Tour.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

598045234.name: A hidden Gem in the Traditional side of Acapulco
598045234.author: a TripAdvisor user
598045234.reviewBody:
After watching the cliff divers at la Quebrada or before enjoying the sunset at Sinfonia del Mar, ask your tourist guide or taxi driver to take you to the Inalambrica street to see the Diego Rivera murals.  If they don't know where this is, just tell them it's at the top of the hill.    

Diego did these murals at the House of the Winds owned by Dolores Olmedo, his patron and lover.  The murals are right on the outside walls for everyone to see. They are free and you can visit them in 10 minutes.  There are a couple more inside the house but they're off limits. You can see the one in the second floor from the street.  

The Quetzalcoatl and Kukulcan serpent murals are the best!

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

596240375.name: I caught this on the City tour --
596240375.author: a TripAdvisor user
596240375.reviewBody: I was in Acapulco for my company, Romance International Travel. This is a very cool wall of art - but on a dangerous road, you can\'t safely take photos standing in front of it, and there is not a museum to see. But if you get a City Tour, and have a great driver, he will drive you by this.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

561805539.name: Getaway
561805539.author: a TripAdvisor user
561805539.reviewBody: This was a beautiful mural and Carlos explained the whole story regarding the mural.  It was magnificent and told us to watch the movie Freida.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

558696878.name: Interesting History
558696878.author: a TripAdvisor user
558696878.reviewBody: Our guide Sebastian, of acapulcoforall.com, gave us the history of the art murals and it is very interesting.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

553825067.name: Easy to reach, excellent mosaic
553825067.author: a TripAdvisor user
553825067.reviewBody: It\'s a 5 minute drive from la quebrada and it is an outstanding mosaic mural by Mexico\'s most acclaimed artist. I was shocked that no one was there. And it\'s free!

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

551619633.name: Interesting for Artsy folks
551619633.author: a TripAdvisor user
551619633.reviewBody: Very neat- we are not super artsy people but we enjoyed seeing it and hearing the story.  Very colorful.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

548125867.name: Great mural
548125867.author: a TripAdvisor user
548125867.reviewBody: The Diego Rivera mural is impressive, but the history of it is even more colorful. It was done as marriage proposal to other artist Lola... all depicted animals and characters have important meaning... the building behind the wall is an actual work studio of Lola and is a private property of her family nowadays, sadly it is not available for tourists. But definitely worth to visit this place and expand knowledge of Diego and Lola\u2019s love story.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

542853080.name: amazing work
542853080.author: a TripAdvisor user
542853080.reviewBody: Our tour guide Roberto Alarcon brought us to see the murals and they are simply beautiful and amazing!

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

539576835.name: Mural Diego Rivera
539576835.author: a TripAdvisor user
539576835.reviewBody: We did a tour with  Acapulco for all. Our tour guide has a history major so he  was able to educate us on the mural. We could not go inside to see it but we\'re able to see the mural from the outside and get a small glimpse of the house from the outside. The story behind the mural and then seeing it in person was worth it.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

539550834.name: Beautiful mural
539550834.author: a TripAdvisor user
539550834.reviewBody: We stopped at this location to view this beautiful mural. Our tour guide Sebastian from Acapulco for all provided lots of legend and historical information. It was a great match a wonderful story to match and wonderful mural.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

539394884.name: beautiful mosaics
539394884.author: a TripAdvisor user
539394884.reviewBody: Just on the side of a street, this is a beautiful work of art.  I really think a guided tour (contact Rudy) would be the best was to find it.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

505639992.name: Amazing, you can just drive right up to it!
505639992.author: a TripAdvisor user
505639992.reviewBody: We were driving around Acapulco and next thing you see is this amazing and different artistic right next to the SUV windows.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

494964273.name: Diego was an AMAZING ARTIST
494964273.author: a TripAdvisor user
494964273.reviewBody: we went on as tour of the city and this was one of the stops Diego did many murals like this for world leaders the street is narow and there is almost no place to park but well worth the time

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

485013473.name: Wonderful secluded masterpiece
485013473.author: a TripAdvisor user
485013473.reviewBody: This is Diego\'s last home where he died. The mosaics are on the exterior walls of the house. It is tucked away in what appears to be a faded glorious neighborhood that now seems vacant with scattered empty architectural gems.Although it is now a museum the word on the street is that it is never open.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

478684088.name: Unique art
478684088.author: a TripAdvisor user
478684088.reviewBody: The fact that this artist made it so many years ago and it\'s still here almost in pretty great shape is awesome! Plus he made it for his lover is great too!

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

478015918.name: Great Piece of History
478015918.author: a TripAdvisor user
478015918.reviewBody: I was not overly familiar with this piece of history but my partner was.  This is an incredible story with history weaved in so beautifully.  If you can get a guide to take you there and tell you the stories you will not regret it.  Its a must see.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

473945966.name: Beautiful Mural
473945966.author: a TripAdvisor user
473945966.reviewBody: The Mural Diego Rivera was a beautiful part of a three city tour by Robert Alarcon Tours. Well worth the visit.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

473013327.name: Amazing mural!
473013327.author: a TripAdvisor user
473013327.reviewBody: We viewed the mural and haughty it doesn\'t take long was very interesting!  The history of Diego Rivera was explained.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

471113286.name: Interesting
471113286.author: a TripAdvisor user
471113286.reviewBody: The mural is very interesting in the way it is done. I have heard that they are turning the house into a museum , but visited in February and still not open. That should be very interesting.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

469757726.name: a very different Rivera art
469757726.author: a TripAdvisor user
469757726.reviewBody: Walking distance from the Quebrada, you discover a totally different kind of Rivera art. Anything this gentleman created was extraordinary and this special creation is no exception. Make sure you do not miss it while in Acapulco.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

468163337.name: Hard to find but worth the visit
468163337.author: a TripAdvisor user
468163337.reviewBody: This is a very cool mural not far from where the cliff divers do their show. It\'s absolutely walkable, just be sure you know where exactly it is before leaving. There are a lot of dead end roads and switchbacks (lots of hills) so if you even a little unsure, have a taxi or tour guide take you.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

466945672.name: Mural  of Diego Rivera
466945672.author: a TripAdvisor user
466945672.reviewBody: \nSaw his mural on our city tour with Benjamin Alarcon of Tourist Transportation Service.  We received  so much interesting history on Diego and his life.   Wish the place had been open that we could have gone in and seen the inside but it was closed.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

466381947.name: Walked up to see this unusual art .
466381947.author: a TripAdvisor user
466381947.reviewBody: From the old Acapulco one has to go up the hill quite a distance to see this beautiful mosaic. Initially it was a little difficult to find it since a couple of locals we had asked were not sure where Diego Rivera\'s mural is. It was indeed a moment of joy and "discovery" once we got there and were able to see this unusual but enjoyable work of Diego. On the other hand it is only five minutes one needs to spend with the mural. For persons not interested in art climbing to look at this mosaic may not need to be the priority in Acapulco.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

465191596.name: Diego Rivera Mural
465191596.author: a TripAdvisor user
465191596.reviewBody: As I understood it, the mural is located on the street outside Rivera\'s former home. It is an intricate mosaic, inlaid onto the side of the house. The street is very steep, so one needs to watch your step very carefully.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

463839153.name: Taxi ride in the back of Acapulco
463839153.author: a TripAdvisor user
463839153.reviewBody: This mural is nice, thinking that it is a great artist that made it makes is nicer to my eyes. It is a whole wall in front of a house that was probably his. We went there in a taxi because it is far from everything. We saw that on our way to go see the crazy american house. It is nice to see. Not worrth going only there because you just stand on the sidewalk to look at it. It takes 5 minutes.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

459713609.name: Beautiful Mosaic
459713609.author: a TripAdvisor user
459713609.reviewBody: We stopped at this mosaic as part of  our Acapulco city tour after the cliff diving exhibition.  It was beautiful to see, but you do not need to spend a lot of time there.  It is located on a hillside road, so there is traffic going by all the time.   I would definitely put this attraction on a places to visit while in Acapulco list.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

457661794.name: Hidden Gem
457661794.author: a TripAdvisor user
457661794.reviewBody: Very near where La Quebrada is, you can found this amazing mural painting from one of the greatest muralist from Mexico of the last century, Diego Rivera. It won\u00b4t take you more than a few minutes to enjoy it. It\u00b4s not ver known, but believe me, it\u00b4s really worth it. If you are near, don\u00b4t have any doubts!

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

456994938.name: Dont waste your timr
456994938.author: a TripAdvisor user
456994938.reviewBody: This mural is high up in the hills above the diving attraction looks like the picture honestly not worth the effort or time to get there takes much much longer driving there then you will spend. If you went to see the diving attraction you are at least in the neighborhood but still for me wasn\'t worth the effort

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

455458844.name: Requires a tour guide or prior review to put in contest
455458844.author: a TripAdvisor user
455458844.reviewBody: This is one of Diego Rivera\'s non-political murals painted for his late in life love.  It is very typical of his style

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

451361318.name: Detailed Mural
451361318.author: a TripAdvisor user
451361318.reviewBody: Its a beautiful mural full of colour & detail. It was nice to see on a tour but I wouldn\'t go out of my way to see it unless you like the story behind it or you are really into this type of work!

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

435219932.name: A little surprise
435219932.author: a TripAdvisor user
435219932.reviewBody: This mosaic was so beautifully done.  So different to see it among all of the other mexican buildings surrounding this artwork.  I believe everyone would appreciate seeing this unique mosaic.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

428625645.name: Wedding proposal
428625645.author: a TripAdvisor user
428625645.reviewBody: Absolutely beautiful mosaic. Diego Rivera made it as a marriage proposal. It is huge and the detail and colors are striking.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

425643160.name: Spectacular mural by Diego Rivera
425643160.author: a TripAdvisor user
425643160.reviewBody: I was taken by surprise at how wonderful this mosaic is! I did not know what to expect but I was very impressed. The mural has an amazing story behind it and I hope you see this mural with an experienced guide. The story is amusing and also quite heart warming. It is sad that we cannot see inside this home as apparently the house has tons of mosaics inside as well. This is a must see in my opinion!

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

419020653.name: A well kept secret....
419020653.author: a TripAdvisor user
419020653.reviewBody: Our taxi driver, born and raised in Acapulco, told us that the majority of the locals never seen it!..., not sure if it is true, but we visited the gorgeous mosaic built mural on a Saturday afternoon, and there was not a soul around. Can\'t imagine how such a beautiful piece of art can be left totally unattended and expose to the inclement of the weather. It\'s in desperate need of TLC. Please take the time to see it when in Acapulco, you won\'t regret it!

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

410624219.name: Must see for art buffs!
410624219.author: a TripAdvisor user
410624219.reviewBody: This incredible mosaic mural is at the home where Diego Rivera lived in his final years with his girlfriend. I believe the home is open to the public where you can see the studio she set up for him there. It is on the way to the place to see the cliff divers, so take a moment to stop at least for a picture.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

403400112.name: Very nice mural
403400112.author: a TripAdvisor user
403400112.reviewBody: This is a nice, big mural that it must have taken hours to do.  Although, it is a shame that some parts of it are ruined.  From the information we received from our guide - a millionaire/government bought it and will be renovating it soon.  What are they waiting for?

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

387543653.name: More of a mosaic than a mural, but very beautiful art regardless.
387543653.author: a TripAdvisor user
387543653.reviewBody: Not really too much of an art fan, but it\'s definitely pretty and quite large.  The mural consists of thousands of tiny tiles glued to a wall to create different images with various meanings behind them. I would not have gotten as much out of the visit without my local guide Sebastian Hernandez explaining it all to my wife and I. If you book a city tour, its worth a stop and photo opportunity.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

374967216.name: Worth a stop!
374967216.author: a TripAdvisor user
374967216.reviewBody: Fun stop if you are driving around Old Acapulco! Interesting that he lived in Acapulco for a year. The mural of of Mexico\'s legendary plumed serpent.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

367411551.name: Beautiful mural
367411551.author: a TripAdvisor user
367411551.reviewBody: We drove by this mural. Actually stopped to take pictures, but didn\'t stay long. Ok if you are driving by, but wouldn\'t pay extra money to make it a "stop" on my itinerary.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

356842156.name: A great mural, but not much else to see.
356842156.author: a TripAdvisor user
356842156.reviewBody: It is a great Diego Rivera mural, and like most Diego Rivera murals, it has great complexity and variant interpretations.  I am glad we saw it, but I don\'t think I will include it on my next trip to Acapulco.  It\'s kind of a "once you\'ve seen it, you probably don\'t need to see it again" sort of thing (unless you are REALLY into Diego Rivera art!)

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

355091387.name: Diego Rivera Mural
355091387.author: a TripAdvisor user
355091387.reviewBody: So much history here! In the old part of Acapulco, off the beaten track. But so hysterical! It is too bad that it is such need repair... lots of tiles missing. But still gorgeous.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

351198281.name: Very beautiful work
351198281.author: a TripAdvisor user
351198281.reviewBody:
We decided to stop off on our last day in the city and ride around and walk to some of the things we wanted to see. 

The Diego murals were something we had not done in quite some time. Just so stunning the work that went into this. 

If your near quebrada an easy walk and also very close to Etel suites. Any cab driver can get you here.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

349842311.name: Beautiful Mosaics
349842311.author: a TripAdvisor user
349842311.reviewBody:
It was very interesting to view this mosaic, especially after reading the history of how and why it was done, and the relationship between Diego and Lola (Dolores Olmedo) who owned the property. 

We liked walking up to the house (it is hot and steep in parts) because it gave us a better feel for the location: a mega-rich person's house with a million dollar view of beautiful Acapulco Bay and the ocean beyond.  

The guard can be friendly and you can ask him questions if you wanted.  Let us hope that it is turned into a museum some day.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

349003879.name: Stunning murals
349003879.author: a TripAdvisor user
349003879.reviewBody: These murals are amazing works of art! I was so glad i had to opportunity to see them after reading about Diego Rivera.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

346425470.name: Should be seen.
346425470.author: a TripAdvisor user
346425470.reviewBody: Visited this as part of our tour. The area itself is very run down. When you arrive at this place you cannot believe that it is sat in the area that it is. We were lucky enough to have a tour guide who explained the story and the history. When you look above where the guard is sat you can see that the mural continues on the ceiling. This should be visited as part of a trip to Acapulco.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

344601990.name: So much history
344601990.author: a TripAdvisor user
344601990.reviewBody: We saw this as a part of our city tour.  So much information that is really fascinating.  The murals are beautiful.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

343876412.name: Art off the beaten path.
343876412.author: a TripAdvisor user
343876412.reviewBody: The neighborhood is run down, then you come across this jewel. Makes me want to buy the house across the road so I can look at it every day!

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

343686529.name: Very Interesting
343686529.author: a TripAdvisor user
343686529.reviewBody: I really enjoyed visiting this site especially since I just saw on TV the movie Frieda for the second time. It is such an interesting story about Diego Rivera the painter and his wife Frieda The murals are very colorful. Very different from the usual paintings of Diego.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

340092255.name: Beautiful tiled murals
340092255.author: a TripAdvisor user
340092255.reviewBody: The tiled murals are gorgeous. If you have a tour or a taxi it is worth it to drive by to see. Next year the house is supposed to be remodeled and converted to a museum. Would definitely be something to go back to see

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

338905614.name: The home of the great
338905614.author: a TripAdvisor user
338905614.reviewBody: Rivera is most surely Mexico\'s most famous painter. His works are a lesson in history of the Mexicain people. He had a summer house in Acapulco which he decorated with his works. The house was abandoned for a few years but the last governor of Guerero decided that the restauration would be good for tourism. Don\'t miss it

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

338256159.name: Beautiful and detailed
338256159.author: a TripAdvisor user
338256159.reviewBody: I love a history story so to think this is the house Deigo Rivera went to stay after his fights with Frida, cool

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

333798374.name: Beautiful work that tells a story
333798374.author: a TripAdvisor user
333798374.reviewBody: Very surprising to find just along one of the little roads.  It is very beautiful but you really should either read up about it first or go with a guide who knows the story. (eg. Sebastian with "Acapulco for All"

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

331832112.name: Fun little piece of history
331832112.author: a TripAdvisor user
331832112.reviewBody: If you are doing a tour with Sebastian from Acapulco for All like we did, you will get to see this mural and hear why it was created.  It\'s a fun story and was a neat little part of our tour.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

329420996.name: Fantastic artwork
329420996.author: a TripAdvisor user
329420996.reviewBody: I would not have have found this without the help of a knowledgeable tour guide. Sebastian Hernanez not only took us there, but gave us details we would have missed.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

327931346.name: Of great interest to Diego Rivera fans
327931346.author: a TripAdvisor user
327931346.reviewBody: We were not aware of Diego Rivera\'s (and Dolores Olmedo\'s) connection to Acapulco until we saw this bas-relief work while on a city tour of Acapulco. Not a typical Diego Rivera piece, but it (and the story behind it, his relationship with Olmedo, and the symbols in the piece) provides some interesting insight into his life.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

326244560.name: A LABOUR OF LOVE
326244560.author: a TripAdvisor user
326244560.reviewBody: Let you guide tell you the love story behind the mural and the choices of the mural characters.  It is a good story.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

325997390.name: Beautiful Mozaic artwork
325997390.author: a TripAdvisor user
325997390.reviewBody: Worth the drive to see this piece of the past . The area is not longer the best and is under construction so I would advise using a tour guide .

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

324525359.name: One of his minor works
324525359.author: a TripAdvisor user
324525359.reviewBody: Diego Rivera was such an outstanding Mexican artist that every Mexican town or city is proud of showing one of his works. But if you know all of his other works in Mexico City you might be disappointed a bit. The relief made of volcanic stones, pieces of ceramics and shells and depicting a part of Aztecan mythology is interesting, without doubt, but not really a "must" when visiting Acapulco.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

323989821.name: Mural by Diego Rivera in Acapulco
323989821.author: a TripAdvisor user
323989821.reviewBody: This is a beautiful mosaic mural on the outside wall of the Casa de Delores Olmeda in Old Acapulco.  It depicts an Aztec serpent god among other creatures and is called "Exekatlkalli".  This home is where Diego had his studio and there are other murals inside not visible to the public.  This mural was completed between 1955 and 1957 just prior to the artists death.  Diego Rivera was twice married to artist Frida Kahlo.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

323200887.name: Diego Rivera studio and mosaic murals
323200887.author: a TripAdvisor user
323200887.reviewBody: It is quite incredible to be taken to these murals which are in a back street in the old town of Acapulco. They have not been vandalised. There is total respect for them and I just wish the whole studio could be opened up as a museum for tourists please

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

307858394.name: Amazing Mosaic Mural by Diego Rivera!
307858394.author: a TripAdvisor user
307858394.reviewBody: Diego Rivera\'s murals at Casa de Los Vientos are impressive!  These colorful mosaic murals depict mythical snakes also known as Quezalcoatl in the Exekatlkalli.  Truly amazing and highly recommend that you visit this historical site!

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

306118671.name: Beautiful artwork
306118671.author: a TripAdvisor user
306118671.reviewBody: The surrounding area is mostly abandoned, closed-off houses. It was surprising to find these murals.. definetly a hidden gem in Acapulco. The murals are something we would not of come across if it had not been for our guide. The trip was included in our city tour. The mural is intricate in detail, made of various material, stone and seashell.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

296330499.name: Mural
296330499.author: a TripAdvisor user
296330499.reviewBody: This was part of a day long private tour.  We didn\'t even get out of the van.  No need to as there\'s nothing else around and it was too hot.  I filmed it and took pictures.  Interesting that it was a private residence.  Someone has lots of time on their hands.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

285371231.name: Great Mural
285371231.author: a TripAdvisor user
285371231.reviewBody: I am so glad that we had a driver, Sebastian Hernandez at acapulcoforall.com to explain what we were looking at.  He made it come to life for us.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

273617877.name: Hard to find but worth the trip.
273617877.author: a TripAdvisor user
273617877.reviewBody: I discovered the Diego Rivera mural 40years ago when I was taken there by an Acapulco native.\nIt\'s at the top of a narrow winding  road of an old residential area.  The street is named for the wireless broadcasting  tower that stood here.  Rivera\'s mosaic mural is on the outside wall of a villa owned by Delores Olmado.  For many years I tried to gain admittance but was always  told that it\'s private property. i understand that Olmado\'s will provided that the city of Acapulco could turn it into a museum.  Last year I was admitted and the caretaker showed us through an area that contained dozens of smaller Diego Rivera mosaics.  The building was also being used for storage so it\'s not really a public museum.  The Olmado home is within the walled area but much higher on  the hill and I was told there was no admittance.  I know of no organized tours that show this but I\'m sure any cab driver will take you  there.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

273015407.name: Good for a photo opp
273015407.author: a TripAdvisor user
273015407.reviewBody: I saw the artwork that is on the walls of the city.  Very pretty.  Need a guide to find it.  Take pictures.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

271238417.name: A Love story
271238417.author: a TripAdvisor user
271238417.reviewBody: Part of the Highlight tour by Sabastian Hernandez. Diego Rivera was an artist, trying to win over a lady that he loved.  He decided to surprise her by making a mural the length of her home\'s outside street wall while she was gone. It took some time to do it but when she returned she was completely taken by surprise. He won.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

269083920.name: Very cool
269083920.author: a TripAdvisor user
269083920.reviewBody: to run my hands all over this tile masterpiece done by one of the best ever was a treat and joy I will never forget!  Awesome!

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

268071562.name: Diego Rivera Mural
268071562.author: a TripAdvisor user
268071562.reviewBody: Very worthwhile to see if you are an art lover. You would need a knowledgable driver. Located in the Qeubrada

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

259754999.name: beautiful murals
259754999.author: a TripAdvisor user
259754999.reviewBody: very near La Quebrada, worth swinging by and checking out! Apparently the Mexican government bought the house, so soon you\'ll be able to see the murals inside, and not just the ones on the wall outside

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

259119619.name: Cool if you are into Art
259119619.author: a TripAdvisor user
259119619.reviewBody: This was a quicky...on the way to other places...it\'s a fun romantic story to go with a cool looking wall art mosaic .  Not a high light, but good for a quick 5 minute stop

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

258380357.name: So beautiful
258380357.author: a TripAdvisor user
258380357.reviewBody: This mosaic by Diego Rivera is a must to see. Our driver Sebastian with Acapulco For All took us by there and it was so beautiful.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

257706067.name: Gorgeous!
257706067.author: a TripAdvisor user
257706067.reviewBody: Beautiful mural, stopped long enough to take a few pictures while on our ship\'s tour. Can\'t believe it\'s just out there like that where anyone could walk up and take pictures, really enjoyed seeing this.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

256506052.name: Must see
256506052.author: a TripAdvisor user
256506052.reviewBody: I hear you can get private tours of the house but don\'t know who does it.  Friends of our got a private tour.  Supposedly the government has bought it and will be making it open to the public soon,

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

254693317.name: Would love to get inside
254693317.author: a TripAdvisor user
254693317.reviewBody: What one can see is inspring. Hopefully some day we will be able to visit the inside of the building.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

252956032.name: Beautiful
252956032.author: a TripAdvisor user
252956032.reviewBody: Beautiful mural, but without knowing the significance of the images, it is just a beautiful mural.  Our driver was able to tell us the story behind the mural which made it much more meaningful.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

252068555.name: Worth the trouble
252068555.author: a TripAdvisor user
252068555.reviewBody: You need to see it with your own eyes. Hard to give it perspective on a picture.\nIn my own opinion, finding this gem up on the cliffs of Acapulco is as rewarding as enjoying the mosaics of Gaudi in Barcelona\'s Guell Park.\nThere are also interesting paintings ans murals inside the house. Would be great if the family would make these accessible to the public.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

251878049.name: Diego Rivera mural a hidden treat
251878049.author: a TripAdvisor user
251878049.reviewBody: It was a special treat to come around the corner in a residential neighborhood and see the stunning Diego Rivera mural.  Of course we had to get out and take pictures.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

250769292.name: Interesting
250769292.author: a TripAdvisor user
250769292.reviewBody: if you\'re a mosaic art fan this is something you should go and see. It was interesting enough unfortunately is not the easiest thing to get to and to enjoy it from the window of our cab wasn\'t a great way to appreciate it.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

247899475.name: Great work of art in the National Palace
247899475.author: a TripAdvisor user
247899475.reviewBody: I liked the fact that the palace is open for visitors. There was no fee. The work of art is truly compelling, and as one traveler remarked to me, "It shows how the Americas were settled."

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

246632393.name: Diego Rivera and El Quebrador
246632393.author: a TripAdvisor user
246632393.reviewBody: This hidden treasure is not hard to find at all if you are in the vicinity of the famous cliff divers at El Quebrador next to the Hotel Mirador. This may be the most unusual Diego Rivera piece you will ever see although perhaps not his greatest. The locals keep it well maintained. Without a good understanding of Mexican culture you can still greatly admire the work without the meanings of the underlying symbol. It\'s best to have someone nearby explain the history and meaning, not only of the piece itself, but also the history of Diego Rivera, his wife Freida Kaho, his fascinating lifestyle, and more.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

241420372.name: Great foto op.
241420372.author: a TripAdvisor user
241420372.reviewBody: You will need a knowledgeable guide or a local person to find this mural, painted on the outside wall of an estate.  Look closely and you\'ll see the signature of Diego Rivera.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

239420091.name: Pure Art !!!!
239420091.author: a TripAdvisor user
239420091.reviewBody: Diego rivera tells  about history in his pieces of art. He was an iinspiration  .... His paintings  are interesting and remarkable.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

235729875.name: Diego Rivera Art!
235729875.author: a TripAdvisor user
235729875.reviewBody: If you know of Diego Rivera you will appreciate these amazing murals.  We were fortunate to have our guide Benjamin explain what the murals represented.  I would recommend hiring a guide to take you around a city to hear the interesting history.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

233269964.name: Wow.
233269964.author: a TripAdvisor user
233269964.reviewBody: If you\'re traveling to see the cliff divers or going to the Fort, ask your driver to take you here.  The mural is BIG and beatiful and apart of the scenery.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

225329046.name: Wow!
225329046.author: a TripAdvisor user
225329046.reviewBody: This was a recommended side "drive by" on our city tour.  It is on the rough side of town, but the mural is awesome.  They plan to open a museum in the future.  This will be so worth viewing, once it opens.  For now, all you can do is drive by and see a mural.  If you are a fan of Diego Rivera, you must view this.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

223535585.name: Tour by Van, guide: Rudy Acapulco
223535585.author: a TripAdvisor user
223535585.reviewBody: Our guide Rudy and Sergio explained the history of this place. The murals are made of hundreds of tiles, they were colorful beautiful art of mosaics. It was one of a kind that I had ever seen.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

222784903.name: If the house is turned into a museum...
222784903.author: a TripAdvisor user
222784903.reviewBody: The mural alone is nice but I wouldn\'t recommend making a special trip up there to look at them. It\'s not even in a very good neighborhood so unless you have a tour guide who can take you there safely, don\'t bother. But if the house behind the wall is really turned into a museum showcasing the art, then that\'s a different story. For now I have to just give it a 3/5 (Average only).

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

204084625.name: Worth the Effort of going
204084625.author: a TripAdvisor user
204084625.reviewBody: To go to Acapulco and not see this is like not seeing the divers.\n\nReally interesting/weird but just do it.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

200409808.name: Sebastian Hernandez from acapulcoforall.com - mural
200409808.author: a TripAdvisor user
200409808.reviewBody: Our family  of four stopped at this mural as part of an Acapulco City Tour by Sebastian Hernandez from acapulcoforall.com   We were very glad to have Sebastian drive us there because it is on a narrow road in a residential area...I don\'t think there would be easy public transportation, nor would you want to drive there yourself.  We got out of his nice van here to look at the mural more closely, and he walked us along this very long mural and explained it.  However, if a person wished to remain in the vehicle they could also enjoy the mural from there.  It is mosaic tile and is very beautiful.  It is the fence of a private home.  We were so glad to see this Diego Rivera mural because we missed seeing the painted murals by Diego when we were in Mexico City the prior day (different tour guide, of course).  Sebastian also does other very interesting tours in and around Acapulco, very reasonably priced because the price is for the whole GROUP of you in the van, not per person.  Check his site acapulcoforall.com and don\'t hesitate to book him...he is absolutely fantastic.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

199368606.name: Very cool mural!
199368606.author: a TripAdvisor user
199368606.reviewBody:
This mural is very cool--it is colorful and pops out, and it has shiny parts, and it is very majestic.  It is also quite large.

We visited the mural as part of our tour with Sebastian, and this was the part that made me especially thankful that we decided to do a tour and not just try to see things on our own, because it was in an area that I would not have wanted to drive to (I tend to feel uncomfortable driving on narrow streets in areas that I'm not familiar with), and although it is pretty to look at, it was way more interesting to see it while we heard about it.  

I don't know if guidebooks have the background story and tell what the different parts represent, but it was very cool and fun to hear about.  

ACCESSIBILITY: This is on a steep hill. You can basically drive right up to it, though.  Our toddler handled the hill fine, and if someone couldn't do the hill, they would be able to enjoy about 85% of the experience without having to go up and down any hill.  From inside or right outside the car you can see all or most of it, it's just a little farther away and you can't see the details as well.  The mural is large enough that to appreciate it best it helps to be able to walk along it as you're talking about it, but if someone couldn't do that they wouldn't have to be excluded.  Overall I think it is pretty accessible.

LITTLE KIDS: This mural is on the outside of a house, in a neighborhood, on a hill.  The main places to stand while you're looking at the mural are along a fairly narrow road.  I felt like we were constantly having to grab our daughter (20 months) to keep her out of the road, in case a car were to speed past (and several cars did go by while we were there).  The mural is engaging and interesting, but she was done with it before we were.

COST: Definitely free.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

198216261.name: Pretty cool
198216261.author: a TripAdvisor user
198216261.reviewBody: Our tour guide Sebastian from Acapulco for All Private Day tours took us here. He explained the whole story about how this mural came to be. I don\'t think the visit would have been as good without him. Look him up!\n\nThe mural is impressive and well maintained. Worth a look!

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

197886852.name: Not What Made Him Famous
197886852.author: a TripAdvisor user
197886852.reviewBody: Apparently this was created towards the end of his life, and is a mosaic rather than painted mural (good thing because its exposed to the weather). It is on the outside on a house which looks like abandoned for decades and is apparently for sale, if you want to own a piece of history. Worth a look if you are at the nearby La Quebrada.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

196745440.name: Sebastian Hernandez Personal Driver
196745440.author: a TripAdvisor user
196745440.reviewBody: Sebastian personalized the City Highlights tour by taking us to the mural and providing us with the rich history of its origin.  The mural by itself is beautiful and the rich history of its orgin fascinating.  This was not a drive-by and look-through-the-window tour; Sebastian stopped and we had an extended visit walking the 200ft length of the mural while Sebastian gave us history and meaning behind each of the scenes represented.  I highly recommend Sebastian Hernandez for all your transportation needs in Acapulco!

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

196204233.name: Diego Personified
196204233.author: a TripAdvisor user
196204233.reviewBody: Beautiful work which still looks as bright and meticulous since its creation. More work is currently being done to establish the house as a museum.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

192377751.name: A Worthwhile Drive-By
192377751.author: a TripAdvisor user
192377751.reviewBody: Our driver took us past this wall in an Old Acapulco residential neighborhood.  Just the drive getting here is fun.  You don\'t have to get out of your auto to see the entire wall.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

178116089.name: lovely to see
178116089.author: a TripAdvisor user
178116089.reviewBody: It was ashame we could not go in but the outside was lovely. I would describe it as interesting but don t expect a museum.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

174751416.name: Hidden art
174751416.author: a TripAdvisor user
174751416.reviewBody:
One of the places I wanted to visit in Acapulco,
Beautiful work of art, too bad the house is for sale.
It looked abandoned , 
I recommend visiting this place.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

167722185.name: Beautiful
167722185.author: a TripAdvisor user
167722185.reviewBody: I saw the murals while on the Acapulco City Highlights Tour I booked with acapulcoforall.com. I was thrilled to see the murals in person but unfortunately there is no access to the house.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

162433962.name: Sadly mostly unknown.
162433962.author: a TripAdvisor user
162433962.reviewBody: I really love this colorful and witty mural made of a mozaic of tiles and seashells and it can be easily seen (in daylight) on the way to or from La Quebrada and it is well worth the little detour where you can also see the old Hotel Casablanca which offers some of the best views in town. Exekatlkalli (the "House of the Winds") was owned by Dolores Olmeda, one of Diego Rivera\'s mistresses and the mural takes up the entire outside wall. Apparently the house will soon become a museum but this hasn\'t happened at the time of writing.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

158239226.name: Hidden gem
158239226.author: a TripAdvisor user
158239226.reviewBody: Unbelievable that this mural is in such great shape after all these years. Our driver took us - no way we could have found it on our own.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

155643303.name: It helps to have a good guide!!!
155643303.author: a TripAdvisor user
155643303.reviewBody:
If you don't know, it will show!!!! Thats what I should have termed THIS review. I have to thank a fantastic friend of mine for introducing me to Sebastian Hernandez, Acapulco for All, because without HIM, we would not have enjoyed Acapulco as much as we did. I loved the fact that he explained--not only the characters behind the mural (i.e. Diego Rviera--the artist, Lola (Dolores Olmedo--the owner of the Estate), but the relationship between the parties and the unique role that Olmedo played in the safeguarding of a good portion of Rivera's work AND Frieda Kahlo. While I watched taxis and other tour guides whizzing clients by and briefly showing the mural and stating: "Diego Rivera did this mural", my family and I got a 30 minute discussion of the story behind the mural, Lola Olmedo's role as an art patron, and the fact that the Olmedo family had sold the property (with this gorgeous mural--and a few others) for 4.5 million dollars. I was so moved by this discussion that I actually blogged the whole experience to my friends back in the US while I was still in Mexico.

I strongly recommend that if you are going to see the mural, make sure you hire a tour guide that can give you the history behind the mural.. cos if you don't, you are wasting your time AND your money.

Sebastian Hernandez tour--Acapulco for All--was well worth the money AND the experience.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

154340670.name: A piece of art history.
154340670.author: a TripAdvisor user
154340670.reviewBody: I have been going to Acapulco for 30 plus years and did not even know about this until I read about it in a travel magazine.  A piece of genuine art history in a quiet residential area.  Who knew?   Beautiful and a must see.\n

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

153635281.name: Great History
153635281.author: a TripAdvisor user
153635281.reviewBody: Make sure you have a tour guide to get here.  There are lots of winding roads to get there and our tour guide Sebastian was the best maneuvering all those streets

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

151498946.name: Who Knew this Treasure Existed!
151498946.author: a TripAdvisor user
151498946.reviewBody: Our tour guide, Sebastien (Acapulcoforall.com) not only showed us this incredible tile mural but told us the romantic and heartbreaking story behind it. We have Diego River murals in the Bay Area and they are nothing like this treasure. We were stunned that this huge, street-level piece of art is in such incredible condition and clearly never touched by graffiti. Don\'t miss this one!

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

151107410.name: Intricate mosaic
151107410.author: a TripAdvisor user
151107410.reviewBody: This mural mosaic is on a very narrow street so be very careful when taking pictures, etc. Our tour guide, Robert Alercon (excellent tour guide if you need a knowledgeable, English-speaking tour guide), gave us great background on the history of these two designs. Very fascinating!

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

149993224.name: loved it
149993224.author: a TripAdvisor user
149993224.reviewBody: i do not like art a lot, but this mural is worth to see!  Our guide, Roberto Alarcon took us there and i am very hankful for that.  Must see

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

146646332.name: Amazing tile work in this mural!
146646332.author: a TripAdvisor user
146646332.reviewBody: We made a stop to see the mural and it was very interesting. Our guide (Sebastian Hernandez) told us all about Diego Rivera and that he made this beautiful mural as a proposal to his mistress.  Very beautiful mural and very interesting story!

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

145563874.name: Unique art
145563874.author: a TripAdvisor user
145563874.reviewBody: It was interesting to see this unique piece of art. Our tour guide provided a detailed history, which helped us appreciate this beautiful piece of art so much more. The home will reportedly be opening in the future as a museum.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

145487559.name: excellent but best viewed with a guide
145487559.author: a TripAdvisor user
145487559.reviewBody: Unless you have read up on Aztec and Mayan culture this mural will not mean much to you unless you know what each character means and why he put the snake,  the frog, his initials, and his reason for during the mural.  I recommend a tour guide to add meaning to the mural.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

144004844.name: with a view
144004844.author: a TripAdvisor user
144004844.reviewBody: It\'s a fair walk up a steady but not insurmountable incline to get there but worth it in my opinion. Take a bus along Av Costera to the park by all the fishing boats and turn up Calle Casa Blanca next to the Pemex and then keep walking. There are some great views on the way up, including out of the multiple levels of a well-cool abandoned palace. the mural is nice to see.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

143491004.name: Breathtaking
143491004.author: a TripAdvisor user
143491004.reviewBody: This mural is not to be missed. Find a knowledgable taxi driver take you there. I can\'t stop thinking about it.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

142888373.name: Amazing Artwork and History
142888373.author: a TripAdvisor user
142888373.reviewBody: We thoroughly enjoyed the beautiful tile artwork that could be viewed on the wall outside this house!! We loved it even more as the history was explained by our wonderful tour guides - Benjamin and Roberto Alarcon. The mural was so much more interesting once you know the meaning behind all the characters Rivera chose and why. Be sure to notice the beautiful ceiling murals inside as well - gorgeous!!

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

140815639.name: Historical Heritage and Contemporary Architecture
140815639.author: a TripAdvisor user
140815639.reviewBody: I truly love the Diego Rivera Wall Mural Mosaic but what really made it special was the love story behind the masterpiece, which Sebastian shared with us...(everyone loves a good love story). "The House of the Wind\u201d  that expressed his love, appreciation of the generosity, friendship, and love that he had experienced through his lifetime.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

140536405.name: Mindblowing work.
140536405.author: a TripAdvisor user
140536405.reviewBody: I have been to art museums all over this country and Europe and I\'ve never seen anything like this!  The detail is remarkable and to think that this masterpiece is just on a wall on a narrow street at the top of a hill!

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

139190828.name: Beautiful mosaic
139190828.author: a TripAdvisor user
139190828.reviewBody: A beautiful surprise to see an original Diego Rivera mosaic on a wall outside a home in Old Acapulco.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

137823326.name: Diego Rivera, a truly unique artist.
137823326.author: a TripAdvisor user
137823326.reviewBody: This mural, outside of his house, is totally worth a stop or a very slow driveby.  The man was an mural icon and this mural is no exception. Supposedly a Rivera sibling still lives there !  I did not stop to confirm !  SkippyFrizz

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

136563940.name: Mural Diego Rivera
136563940.author: a TripAdvisor user
136563940.reviewBody: I really liked the mural, however, you\'re not traveling through the best part of town to see it.  I don\'t recommend trying to find it yourself, but our tour guide Roberto Alarcon took us directly there.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

135851241.name: A diamond in the rough, truly!
135851241.author: a TripAdvisor user
135851241.reviewBody: This was one of Diego Rivera\'s last pieces and in my opinion, the most beautiful. There is a heart jerking Romeo and Juliet story behind this mural and it sits in the back roads of Acapulco, off the beaten path. A turly hidden gem!

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

135570913.name: Wonderful Diego Rivera artwork- tucked away but well worth a visit
135570913.author: a TripAdvisor user
135570913.reviewBody: This mural, executed in sea-shells and coloured stones, was the last mural completed before his death by Diego Rivera in 1956-1957. The 107\' long mural that tourists can see (there are three other murals inside the estate behind the walls that are, sadly, not open to the public) is on the outer perimeter wall facing the street in a narrow street high up above the rest of Acapulco. The house belonged to the last of Rivera\'s patrons, the Mexican business woman, Dolores Olmedo who died in 2002. The house has been on sale for several years and if you have a spare million or two you can buy it; no problems at all. The house, called Exekatlkalli or \'House of the Winds\', is in Inalambrica Street in the oldest section of the city, Acapulco Tradicional. After admiring the three dimensional mural its well worth wondering around the streets of this steep hillside area to look at some of the oldest surviving hotels built in the late 1940s and early 1950s, most of which are no longer in service, sadly.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

134957843.name: stunning treasure
134957843.author: a TripAdvisor user
134957843.reviewBody: Great work of art of a suburban back street, we visited as part of a private city tour with Sebastian from acapulcoforall.com.  Got heaps of great background information on the mural from this guide

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

134196661.name: Beautiful art !!
134196661.author: a TripAdvisor user
134196661.reviewBody: Loved the mural tile design and colors.  Wish I could buy the house that the mural is in front of.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

132694687.name: Nice - love the colors
132694687.author: a TripAdvisor user
132694687.reviewBody: Nice piece of Artwork.  Caution...be careful...I stood on the wall to take a pic & fell :)\nAll my fault, just be careful when taking pics!

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

132106419.name: A Rare Gem
132106419.author: a TripAdvisor user
132106419.reviewBody: Worth a visit to see up close. It is one of Rivera\'s pieces done in a public space that is tucked away in an area that one wouldn\'t normally visit unless with a guide.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

130548029.name: A Piece of History
130548029.author: a TripAdvisor user
130548029.reviewBody: We like to see as much of the local history as possible and this was very interesting as Diego Rivera\'s normal medium was Fresco and get your tour guide to tell you the story that goes with the mural.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

130427874.name: Diego\'s Fine Creation
130427874.author: a TripAdvisor user
130427874.reviewBody: An actual mural painted by Diego Rivera. This is amazing how well preserved it is and amazing to see in person.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

129963707.name: Amazing murals
129963707.author: a TripAdvisor user
129963707.reviewBody: It was great to see Diego Rivera\'s work in person. They were beautiful!

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

128144866.name: An out of the way treasure
128144866.author: a TripAdvisor user
128144866.reviewBody: When one visits Acapulco one often spends time on the beaches, visits the night clubs and perhaps watches the cliff divers. A treasure that should not be missed is Diego Rivera\'s mural. Created in 1956 it is a unique piece of art made from stones, seashells and mosaics.  It is one of the final creations of Rivera before his death and featurs Quetzalcoatl, an Aztec God.

address.streetAddress: Calle Inalambrica s/n A un costado del Hotel Casablanca

665139479.name: Nice church in the plaza near old town
665139479.author: a TripAdvisor user
665139479.reviewBody: Our Lady of Solitude is the main cathedral of Acapulco. It is located in Plaza Alvarez which is the main plaza of the original part Acapulco. \nThe building is coloured a lovely blue and white. It is one of the main historical attractions in a city lacking historical attractions - worth a visit.

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

625029389.name: Beautiful and airy, but chaotic service
625029389.author: a TripAdvisor user
625029389.reviewBody: We went to mass here on a Saturday evening as our cruise ship did not leave Acapulco until late. Set in the old part of the city, behind a popular square full of stalls selling all sorts of goods.A wedding had just finished and at the back of the church at least three christenings were taking place. One of the priests had to urge the photographers and the married couple to leave so the mass could start. All typically Mexican ! \nThe church has a dramatic exterior and inside a large altar piece.

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

566380147.name: The Cathedral
566380147.author: a TripAdvisor user
566380147.reviewBody:
Prayers and mass is celebrated practicallly everyday.
The local bus or a taxi driver can bring you there and the cathedral is so beautiful.
They have a lot of vendors, restaurants and colourful stores to visit and shop which are very close to the cathedral.
Would definitely visit.

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

565145641.name: Worth the walk
565145641.author: a TripAdvisor user
565145641.reviewBody: We walked around 20 minutes from  the cruise ship terminal to the main square (Zocalo) and found this cathedral. You cannot miss it. It\'s quite striking in appearance with its blue dome. The blue and gold theme continues inside.

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

468641142.name: Historical Church and very picturesque!
468641142.author: a TripAdvisor user
468641142.reviewBody: This is a very historical church and it is very active on the weekends. It is located in the heart of the Zocalo square and it is very picturesque!

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

462931440.name: A must see
462931440.author: a TripAdvisor user
462931440.reviewBody: Large space with many artifacts. Splendid valuable metals and art work. We were there after dark would be more pleasing during the day

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

434952075.name: Interesting Architecture
434952075.author: a TripAdvisor user
434952075.reviewBody: As part of a city tour we stopped in the town square (Zocalo) of the older part of Acapulco.  The Cathedral (La Catedral) was built the in the early 1900\'s and has a little different architecture for a church in Mexico. Well worth the time to stop and stroll around.

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

429194900.name: Went to Sunday services (in spanish)
429194900.author: a TripAdvisor user
429194900.reviewBody:
Although, I do not speak or understand the beautiful Spanish language, myself and 2 friends decided we wanted to attend a church on Sunday. 

So we went to this one, our driver translated afterwards the gist of the message.  I loved that this is a local community church it is obvious people come here to pray to the virgin mary, take communion and Sunday is a special day for them to worship.  The Catholic service was beautiful and peaceful.  Having been a long time since I had experienced a Catholic service this one was beautifully done and there was a holy, peaceful presence that enveloped the whole church.

 For someone wanting to see a large grand and impressive cathedral with ornate details or architecture THIS IS NOT the one to visit..however if you wish to be in a city center, with a market and desire to interact and meet locals and see how they live and go to church on sunday, then this is it.  I personally loved it.. Warning . NO AC. So take a hand fan with you at services, as it does get warm.  This is a special place and very peaceful. It was standing room only, literally the huge 12ft grand doors on all 3 side's are left wide open and people were sitting and standing (overflowing) as the seats were full, out the doors...impressive to me.  I only wish churches in America were this overflowing!

I will add pics shortly.

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

419019239.name: Strangely disappointed...
419019239.author: a TripAdvisor user
419019239.reviewBody: We have visited hundreds of Catholic cathedrals in every continent, but none so...., so..., strange. It\'s not even a big church..., more like a mid size chapel. Disappointedly dirty outside and the surrounding area. Worth a quick stop though...

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

358217242.name: Worth one visit
358217242.author: a TripAdvisor user
358217242.reviewBody: This is a charming site with a some beautiful views. That said, it\'s a bit of an uphill walk, and but a small, quick visit.

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

352402907.name: nice walk from cruise
352402907.author: a TripAdvisor user
352402907.reviewBody: About a km from cruise dock. Nice small church with a park around it. Seemed safe enough although this city has many many police around with lots of guns

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

346425934.name: Nice to see but not really impressive
346425934.author: a TripAdvisor user
346425934.reviewBody: The cathedral itself is nice to see however the area that it is in is rather run down and not what expected. If you walk from costera the walk is quite long however take plenty of water and stroll as you will see how the pace changes from acapulco main bay into the old town.

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

343876925.name: After visiting the grand churches in Mexico City, this is an ordinary church
343876925.author: a TripAdvisor user
343876925.reviewBody: The best part of visiting the Acapulco Cathedral is the walk through the Zocalo(town square). Stop and enjoy the street vendors. It is all safe.

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

336822859.name: What my idea of a typical Mexican church would be.
336822859.author: a TripAdvisor user
336822859.reviewBody: Lovely seeing the church - still in use - there were baptisms going on the day we passed by.  The market in front of the church is worth a look around - felt quite touristy but interesting with some great food and drinks available.

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

331810338.name: Amazing on "Our Virgin of Guadeloupe day"
331810338.author: a TripAdvisor user
331810338.reviewBody: Parades of locals dressed up and some in ceremonial warrior outfits and headdresses. Very joyful and entertaining family event.\n\n Clean modern looking church in a plaza packed with vendors (some on the church entrance that we thought Jesus would be offended by).

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

323202756.name: The cathedral in Acapulco
323202756.author: a TripAdvisor user
323202756.reviewBody: This cathedral is well worth a visit, very beautiful, very well used and lots of interesting street sellers in the square outside

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

316852897.name: Sanctuary in an otherwise typical coastal city
316852897.author: a TripAdvisor user
316852897.reviewBody: Still looking for the charm and beauty that must be in Acapulco somewhere - thought the azure blue dome was definitely worth the walk, even though the cathedral is at best quaint.  Take your running shoes and jog back along a the \'promenade\' back around the bay at sunset and then your soul and heart will feel better for it.

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

315680336.name: LOVELY LA CATEDRAL
315680336.author: a TripAdvisor user
315680336.reviewBody: While on our trip while back through Mexico we came across some of the most beautiful and amazing Cathedrals and Basilicas and La Catedral is one of them, loved the blue dome

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

249639457.name: Very ordinary church
249639457.author: a TripAdvisor user
249639457.reviewBody: We\'ve been to many churches in Mexico and this one is ordinary and not worth a visit, unless you are right there.

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

248251081.name: Modern architecture in the middle of old town
248251081.author: a TripAdvisor user
248251081.reviewBody: La Catedral is a bright pearl! It\'s somehow surprising to find such a building behind the market place of Acapulco. Mexican churches with their colours, flowers and smells are always "une experience"!

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

234391809.name: beautiful
234391809.author: a TripAdvisor user
234391809.reviewBody: Love the cathedrals in Mexico, everything is gold leaf and immaculate. I really loved just walking around and noticing the pictures on the wall and also walking around the outside grounds.

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

222785671.name: Nice landmark
222785671.author: a TripAdvisor user
222785671.reviewBody: It\'s behind the Zocalo in old town, and Zocalo itself is an attraction for tourists to visit although I didn\'t find it that impressive. The cathedral is uniquely designed and I noticed the Houston Intercontinental airport (IAH) uses it as the landmark representing Acapulco. Took us 5 mins in the out, just snapped some photos.

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

222776114.name: A fallen Lady
222776114.author: a TripAdvisor user
222776114.reviewBody: The area in the Zocalo was a nice piece of old Acapulco .This Cathedral was built as a set for an Elvis Movie I was told .Now its littered with drud hounds and smells of urine and other mysterious pungent odours .

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

208982314.name: Just visit in and out and do not go after 6 p.m.
208982314.author: a TripAdvisor user
208982314.reviewBody: This is a great looking church which you could admire and take pictures of, do not go after 6 p.m. since it is full of pick pocketers, trasvestis and beggars, other than that better worth visit in the mornings.

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

199621176.name: La Catedral
199621176.author: a TripAdvisor user
199621176.reviewBody: Take a walk to the Zocalo and discover this cathedral. It is so peacefull, look at the statues, the art, the people praying etc. At the same time, while you are there, take the time to enjoy the activities around! A must stop!

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

192684439.name: Beautiful!
192684439.author: a TripAdvisor user
192684439.reviewBody: Our "local" (licensed) tour guide, Julio, took us to both the old and new Cathedrals. Loved the art and beauty. Well worth the stop!

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

163000475.name: A must stop
163000475.author: a TripAdvisor user
163000475.reviewBody: Exterior of catedral is not much to look at but the interior is very beautiful.  Filled with statues of saints, the virgen, etc.

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

151620317.name: The Church at the Zocalo
151620317.author: a TripAdvisor user
151620317.reviewBody: This is such a sweet example of an old Catholic Church.  Very tiny and interesting and lovely decorations (and some unusal items also.)\n\nAnd don\'t forget to eat at the Italian pizza restaurant when you are there.

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

149993678.name: unique, different; worth to see it
149993678.author: a TripAdvisor user
149993678.reviewBody: we spent a while at the cathedral and the zocalo. it was good to see how natives live.  the cathedral has bizantine influences, with many ornaments from centro america.  they have a nice virgin from Cuba.  The priest there was happy to talk about the history of the church.  outside, you have several stores that sell religious objects

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

148103946.name: The Cathedral
148103946.author: a TripAdvisor user
148103946.reviewBody: Iv\'e seen a lot of Churches in Eastern Europe and this one from the 17th century was SPECTACULAR!!! A MUST SEE!! Jan Carona knew all of the history, which was so great!! otherwise we would have had a lot of unswered ??

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

140786504.name: Zocalo and Cathederal
140786504.author: a TripAdvisor user
140786504.reviewBody: I have always felt a calming effect when I walk into a church, no matter the Denomination.  This one is sort of the exception since outside there is always activities going on and baloons for sale, and souvenirs for sale.  Having said that, I love this building.

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

137814372.name: La Caterdral
137814372.author: a TripAdvisor user
137814372.reviewBody: WONDERFUL views of the City. It was very peaceful and had some of the most outstanding views that I have ever seen.

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

135609390.name: Catholic Church in the zocalo.
135609390.author: a TripAdvisor user
135609390.reviewBody: This church is beautiful and the setting is in the older part of Acapulco. There is always alot of activity in the Zocalo and you can also do some shopping and probably witness a wedding or communion going on.

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

133163261.name: The Cathedral
133163261.author: a TripAdvisor user
133163261.reviewBody: Our guide, Roberto, took us to the Cathedral and gave us a tour and the history of this beautiful place.  Well worth it, learned alot about the area

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

128176886.name: A place of prayer in a busy city
128176886.author: a TripAdvisor user
128176886.reviewBody: it was amazing to me to see the number of people who had come to spend some time with their God. As they paused to meditate, one could not help but be drawn into the sense of oneness with the universe.

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

127313172.name: Nothing spectacular
127313172.author: a TripAdvisor user
127313172.reviewBody: Downtown Acapulco is dirty and the city does not take care of the main plaza. The Catedral is just an old building with out any sculptures or anything wrth to visit.\n

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

126574240.name: Nice! Muy bien! 100% Worth to visit.
126574240.author: a TripAdvisor user
126574240.reviewBody: I like this Catedral . I feel something magic there. Very beautiful and easy to get and explore. See the pics i made.

address.streetAddress: Zocalo de la Ciudad Costera Miguel Alemán, s/n

649584067.name: Wishing you fair winds and calm seas
649584067.author: a TripAdvisor user
649584067.reviewBody:
A good opportunity to kill two birds with one stone, since the museum location is inside the iconic El Fuerte de San Diego.
