On display, many captivating artifacts and items, with signs in both English and Spanish. 
You may admire a replica of one of the famous Spanish galleons, who allegedly open the first global trade route in the Pacific. 
By the same token, you’ll learn about the history of Acapulco and its role during the colonial period. Enjoy the spectacular views from the fort and don’t forget the sunscreen.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos

647147609.name: Very Informitive
647147609.author: a TripAdvisor user
647147609.reviewBody: The history of Acapulco is very interesting. The Stars of the Stars have all been to Acapulco. The local history will amaze you. This is worth visiting.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos

644576751.name: History
644576751.author: a TripAdvisor user
644576751.reviewBody: Classical fort design of the time. Excellent source of history: early colonialism, protecting capitol from piracy,  and view is amazing. Many other places to tour and go see close by.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos

637505141.name: Worthwhile Visit
637505141.author: a TripAdvisor user
637505141.reviewBody: Most people don\'t realize what a long history that Acapulco has, I\'m not talking about when Hollywood arrived but going back to conquistadors and sea trade with China via Manilla on wooden ships and an era of pirates and forts. It has a colorful history and the museum is well done.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos

563249534.name: Musuem of Interest
563249534.author: a TripAdvisor user
563249534.reviewBody: This museum offered very excellent insight and knowledge that we never knew. Fantastic displays of early success with trade partners from the East going back to 1450 to 1600. The inhabitants were trading with Japan and China when the USA was discovered!

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos

547272839.name: education
547272839.author: a TripAdvisor user
547272839.reviewBody: a great history lesson in an hr. air conditioned, well laid out bays. really aurthentic stuff from the spanish visits. go with someone who knows the place and then its more interesting a good afternoon outing.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos

484897395.name: Over 300 years of history
484897395.author: a TripAdvisor user
484897395.reviewBody: The fort was built to protect the ships that went back and forth to the Filippines for over 300 years to protect them from pirates, etc.\nThe trade between Asia and Mexico was spectacular. Mexico sent a lot of gold, silver, corn, beans, chiles and from China came silk, pottery, and lots more. The fort is spectacular.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos

478018563.name: Proud to display their history
478018563.author: a TripAdvisor user
478018563.reviewBody: Ok maybe its just because I am a bit of a history buff, but every museum in Acapulco is so proud to display their history.  It seem really well captured in this area and is displayed in such an interesting manner.  I can\'t rave enough of how well these museums are done.  It is well worth your time to visit and appreciate what this area has done for North America.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos

467075494.name: Interesting and Educational
467075494.author: a TripAdvisor user
467075494.reviewBody: I live in the east bay of Northern California by San Francisco and we have great museums that take hours to go through.  But this museum is small and quaint and our guide, Elvira, made our tour fun and interesting by pointing out special features of the displays to the people of Acapulco.  I really learned something!

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos

458935069.name: Interesting
458935069.author: a TripAdvisor user
458935069.reviewBody: Took some out of town friends. They like history so they really enjoyed. The views are wonderful in all directions.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos

436369496.name: a must to visit, great
436369496.author: a TripAdvisor user
436369496.reviewBody: The old fort is very well maintained and steep in history through hundreds of years with all information in Spanish and English. Very impressive

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos

435219255.name: So interesting!
435219255.author: a TripAdvisor user
435219255.reviewBody: we went to this museum as part of a Acapulco city tour.  The Fort was amazing and it was so awesome to see all of the artifacts that at the museum.  we were told they were all original.  there is so much history in Acapulco I wish i would have had a whole day to spend at the museum and Fort.  Well worth the time.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos

429038749.name: Terrific Museum!
429038749.author: a TripAdvisor user
429038749.reviewBody: What a wonderful idea! Put your history museum in an historic fort overlooking Acapulco Bay! This is a wonderful museum with interesting and fascinating exhibits and artifacts. Having it inside a historic structure just adds to the whole experience! Air-conditioned and well-kept this is a wonderful museum. One of the best I have seen!

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos

410631552.name: Amazing History and Artifacts
410631552.author: a TripAdvisor user
410631552.reviewBody: Fantastic museum located in the Fort San Diego. Wonderful views of the water and city from the fort. Lovely gift shop with many great souvenirs and art as well as books for the history buff.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos

333798618.name: Inside the Fort of San Diego
333798618.author: a TripAdvisor user
333798618.reviewBody: I already reviewed this under the Fort of San Diego.  I would love to go back and spend more time there.  By the way, the signs are in English as well as Spanish

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos

324525031.name: You can always learn something
324525031.author: a TripAdvisor user
324525031.reviewBody: Before I entered this museum I (as a European) did not know much about the extensive trade between the Spanish colonies and Asia. Acapulco as one of the main centers of this Manila connection with the Philippines, Japon and China has an interesting story to tell about  that time when the big Spanish ships crossed the Pacific Ocean which took them altogether almost one year to transport the goods from the NEW SPAIN to Asia and bring back all the treasures, always in danger of being attacked by pirates and ships from other nations. In the museum we are told part of that story and can identify with the crews of those ships when they sighted the "Jolly Roger" or the "Black Jack" on the horizon. A very interesting museum.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos

306117149.name: Historical, Enriching, Great View Overlooking Acapulco
306117149.author: a TripAdvisor user
306117149.reviewBody: The architecture of the building is very interesting, an old port that used to be held down in Mexico. Windows know cover the posts guards would lay out with rifles and atop of the building is a terrace with cannons. At the top of the museum, the terrace allows you to take in breathtaking views of Acapulco also. The trip here is surely not to be missed.\n\nThe museum is an octagon of rooms, each one filled with various art depicting the history of the region, other rooms designed to convey the life lived and tools used to cook, sew, travel, etc. Glass floors overlay pottery and other art, along with irrigation and pipelines that traveled through the port years ago.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos

276580894.name: For art lovers as well
276580894.author: a TripAdvisor user
276580894.reviewBody: They had a temporary exhibit of impressionist work and Rodin sculptures. Be aware that with a student or teacher ID the entrance is free.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos

257705168.name: Nice visit
257705168.author: a TripAdvisor user
257705168.reviewBody: Interesting and informative....and air conditioning, which we all really enjoyed. Good displays, most of the information is in multiple languages.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos

256992778.name: An interesting and informative museum
256992778.author: a TripAdvisor user
256992778.reviewBody: This museum is a great way to pass a few hours and escape the heat of Acapulco. The signs are in English and Spanish and there is a lot of information on all the boards. The building itself is interesting and information is provided about it\'s history as well as the trade history of the port. This is not like any of the other regional history museums we have visited in Mexico, highly recommend.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos

198118771.name: The history speaks for its self
198118771.author: a TripAdvisor user
198118771.reviewBody: What a beautiful museum. Full of all the history of Acapulco.  The view from the top of the building was beautiful.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos

180486024.name: junk
180486024.author: a TripAdvisor user
180486024.reviewBody: go on a sunday dont have to pay to get in,if you would have paid to see relics,you would be very fed up,lots of empty cases,see much better,i thought the place had been robbed !

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos

178898600.name: Nice place to visit
178898600.author: a TripAdvisor user
178898600.reviewBody: History always been my good subject to know different places was once again got time to see and enjoy in that place

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos

171635403.name: Worthwhile visiting
171635403.author: a TripAdvisor user
171635403.reviewBody: It\'s well organized and there you learn about the history of Acapulco and it\'s importance during the colonial period.  You can learn about the importance of Acapulco for the strong interaction between the colonial Mexico and the colonial Philippines.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos

135569723.name: NIce Little Museum: Worth A Visit
135569723.author: a TripAdvisor user
135569723.reviewBody: The museum is built into the San Diego fortress, the most iconic historic spot in Acapulco.  Well worth an hour\'s visit if you can read Spanish, and the view over the harbour, the Pacific and parts of the city are also worth the visit. Pity that that Acapulco has so little attention paid to its rich past- in the colonial period or in the twentieth century. Take lots of sun screen location if you\'re going to be walking around the fortress itself

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos

134957880.name: great museum in the fort
134957880.author: a TripAdvisor user
134957880.reviewBody: worthwhile museum, very well put together, gives great overview of Acapulco\'s history. Went with Sebastian from acapulcoforall.com who gave us extra information during the visit

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos

127316928.name: Very informative.
127316928.author: a TripAdvisor user
127316928.reviewBody: Located inside the San Diego Fort. It is very informative and interesting. A visit to Acapulco will be incomplete if you don\'t visit this museum.

address.streetAddress: Calle Hornitos

671632332.name: La mejor vista del atardecer en Acapulco
671632332.author: a TripAdvisor user
671632332.reviewBody: Realmente hay que ver el atardecer en esta area; ademas en el rumbo existen muchos restaurantes que ofrecen Pescado a la talla, para nosotros el mejor se llama"Tres Marias" del lado de la Laguna, vale la pena no perderselo.

661181898.name: PLAYA HERMOSA, El Hotel Villas Paraiso Resort, MALO
661181898.author: a TripAdvisor user
661181898.reviewBody: El hotel nada q ver con su publicidad, aunque muy recomendable el lugar y comer en las ramaditas... se come muy bien. Puedes meterte a la laguna o surf en el mar.  Puestas de sol preciosas. Y barato...

601284699.name: Hermoso lugar
601284699.author: a TripAdvisor user
601284699.reviewBody: Una playa tan limpia, sin urbanizaci\u00f3n y cerca de Acapulco. Nos hospedamos ah\u00ed unos d\u00edas y fuimos muy felices. De un lado la laguna y del otro su hermosa playa. Sin vendedores que te acosen y sin tanta gente. Incre\u00edble

597044612.name: Tour Barra de Coyuca
597044612.author: a TripAdvisor user
597044612.reviewBody: Buena relaci\u00f3n con el precio. El agua de la laguna es calentita y no est\u00e1 nada profunda.. excelente para ir con ni\u00f1os.

514044130.name: Buena comida y muy tranquili
514044130.author: a TripAdvisor user
514044130.reviewBody: Est\u00e1 visita fue con toda la familia. Nos abord\u00f3 una persona desde que nos acercamos a la zona de la barra y nos indic\u00f3 donde estacionarnos en la sombra. Nos llev\u00f3 en lancha a una enramada casi al final de la barra. La enramada estaba vac\u00eda y no lleg\u00f3 m\u00e1s gente en todo el d\u00eda lo que para nosotros fue grandioso. El servicio fue excelente. Pedimos un huachinango de 3 kilos a la talla con tortillas hechas a mano, ensalada y arroz el cual estuvo riqu\u00edsimo. Pasamos el d\u00eda en la hamaca y jugando con el kayak que llevamos. \n\nDebido a que la barra estaba abierta y hab\u00eda agua salada en la laguna, hab\u00eda peces muertos haciendo que en algunos lugares el olor fuera terrible. El lado de la playa estaba muy sucio debido a que hubo tempestad la noche anterior y la apertura de la barra. El agua de la laguna estaba muy turbia.

472252785.name: \u00a1Genial!
472252785.author: a TripAdvisor user
472252785.reviewBody:
Fuimos exactamente a un pueblo llamado Espinalillo, de ahí la playa esta a unos 10 minutos en coche. Por ser temporada baja casi no había gente pero los restaurantes/clubs de playa siguen prestando servicio. Nosotros llegamos a una casa, aunque sí hay algunos hotelitos. 

Les recomiendo el Restaurante Cristina, es una palapa muy rústica, con mesas y hamacas en la arena, tiene una alberca pequeña y chapoteadero. Los camarones con coco, las pescadillas, el aguachile de camarón, el pulpo, las tiritas de pescado están deliciosas.

Hay otro que se llama Nautilus, ese tiene dos albercas cloradas y la comida también esta bien. 

Es mar abierto, las olas llegan con fuerza, la playa es muy limpia y se ven unos atardeceres hermosos.

447616474.name: un lugar hermoso donde la laguna y el mar se unen
447616474.author: a TripAdvisor user
447616474.reviewBody: . Es un lugar hermoso donde hay  laguna y mar, el mar es medio fuerte, pero esta buen\u00edsimo el lugar, sin duda hay que ir. Comimos ah\u00ed, que hay varias barras para comer y despu\u00e9s hicimos un paseo por la laguna con uno de los lugare\u00f1os de ah\u00ed que estuvo buen\u00edsimos nos pusieron barro en la cara la pase de 10. lo super recomiendo.

418226054.name: Rustico y agradable.
418226054.author: a TripAdvisor user
418226054.reviewBody: Para los amantes de lugares t\u00edpicos y originales, la barra de coyuca ofrece una alternativa muy fresca, limpia y tradicional. Sin llegar a estar llena de gente en temporada, la atenci\u00f3n es aceptable. Sin muchos lujos pero la estancia agradable est\u00e1 garantizada. Hay cuartos para quedarse algunos d\u00edas (generamente sin aire acondicionado)y varios restaurantes de mariscos y comida t\u00edpica. El repelente para mosquitos y el bronceador no deben faltar. El acceso a la laguna y al mar lo hace un sitio especial.

655622920.name: A nice hike
655622920.author: a TripAdvisor user
655622920.reviewBody: First off, this is not a place for anyone with mobility issues. Many steps and rutted paths. It\'s like hiking in a forest with plants and trees labeled with names and country of origin, a few small water features.  Very few flowering plants (this may have been the time of year). Overall an enjoyable 2 hours. No need for a repeat visit. Admission 40 pesos.

itemReviewed.name: Acapulco Botanical Garden (Jardin Botanico de Acapulco)

address.streetAddress: Universidad Loyola del Pacifico Av. Heróico Colegio Militar s/n

638378769.name: For plant lovers
638378769.author: a TripAdvisor user
638378769.reviewBody: Not for everyone as during certain times of the year it can be quite low key but this is a very nice garden of tropical plants which at time have considerable blooms. The location above Acapulco also has great views of the bay. Recommend a morning visit as afternoon can get a bit warm and there are lots of stairs.

itemReviewed.name: Acapulco Botanical Garden (Jardin Botanico de Acapulco)

address.streetAddress: Universidad Loyola del Pacifico Av. Heróico Colegio Militar s/n

549379601.name: Peace in a frantic City
549379601.author: a TripAdvisor user
549379601.reviewBody: This is a fantastic spot to get away from the frantic City. A well planned garden with many native plants. A free English self guided tour is available to help explain the origins and uses of the plants. The tranquil location is cooled by a cascading stream and many water features flowing over granite boulders. Well worth a visit.

itemReviewed.name: Acapulco Botanical Garden (Jardin Botanico de Acapulco)

address.streetAddress: Universidad Loyola del Pacifico Av. Heróico Colegio Militar s/n

542840191.name: Nice Trails
542840191.author: a TripAdvisor user
542840191.reviewBody: We enjoyed visiting this Garden. Had nice trails to walk on up the hill to see different fauna and flora. Ran into a Local Biologist that worked there and he showed us some interesting points in the Garden. It was well laid out. Not as much blooming in March there.

itemReviewed.name: Acapulco Botanical Garden (Jardin Botanico de Acapulco)

address.streetAddress: Universidad Loyola del Pacifico Av. Heróico Colegio Militar s/n

541877319.name: It\'s Amazing
541877319.author: a TripAdvisor user
541877319.reviewBody: If you love nature and you are worried about our planet well there are a lots of thing you can see there, like what are they doing to preserve our envoriment, the diferent kind of plants we have

itemReviewed.name: Acapulco Botanical Garden (Jardin Botanico de Acapulco)

address.streetAddress: Universidad Loyola del Pacifico Av. Heróico Colegio Militar s/n

540160184.name: wife loved it
540160184.author: a TripAdvisor user
540160184.reviewBody: find a guy thing to do or just wait outside more for the flower growing crowd nothing very fun or exciting

itemReviewed.name: Acapulco Botanical Garden (Jardin Botanico de Acapulco)

address.streetAddress: Universidad Loyola del Pacifico Av. Heróico Colegio Militar s/n

466536419.name: Ok For a Visit
466536419.author: a TripAdvisor user
466536419.reviewBody: This botanical garden is series of paths that zig zag up a steep hill. The plants are well marked with the botanical names plus the Spanish common names. Nothing is in English but you can figure it out. What I liked most was the HUGE boulders. There is a short trail up the hill beyond the gardens. The trees provide much needed shade. Although there isn\'t a lot to see it is worth a stop.

itemReviewed.name: Acapulco Botanical Garden (Jardin Botanico de Acapulco)

address.streetAddress: Universidad Loyola del Pacifico Av. Heróico Colegio Militar s/n

457743905.name: Run down
457743905.author: a TripAdvisor user
457743905.reviewBody: it may be that February is not a good time to go to the botanic gardens as not much to see really it was like and very hot. It looked to me like the place was run down and in disrepair. I\'ve seen the pictures on TripAdvisor and they look nice but the first week of February 2017 it does not look like those pictures at all.

itemReviewed.name: Acapulco Botanical Garden (Jardin Botanico de Acapulco)

address.streetAddress: Universidad Loyola del Pacifico Av. Heróico Colegio Militar s/n

451263643.name: Away from chaos and heat
451263643.author: a TripAdvisor user
451263643.reviewBody: You can feel like being in an oasis, delicious perfume from flowers, beautiful view of Acapulco from the hill. Volunteers are very kind and helpful, show you the way and a video is provided. Entrance fee very cheap.

itemReviewed.name: Acapulco Botanical Garden (Jardin Botanico de Acapulco)

address.streetAddress: Universidad Loyola del Pacifico Av. Heróico Colegio Militar s/n

436371412.name: excellent venve
436371412.author: a TripAdvisor user
436371412.reviewBody: The venue is full of wonderful surprises the site is a very well layed out and well planned. The plants colours and frogs more than you would ever think Mexico could offer. Well done Mexico

itemReviewed.name: Acapulco Botanical Garden (Jardin Botanico de Acapulco)

address.streetAddress: Universidad Loyola del Pacifico Av. Heróico Colegio Militar s/n

410632896.name: Amazing garden!
410632896.author: a TripAdvisor user
410632896.reviewBody: A must see in Acapulco! Such a wonderful variety of plants in a natural setting. Gorgeous views of the water. Important for biodiversity conservation. Or just a beautiful stroll for anyone wanting to take in natural scenery.

itemReviewed.name: Acapulco Botanical Garden (Jardin Botanico de Acapulco)

address.streetAddress: Universidad Loyola del Pacifico Av. Heróico Colegio Militar s/n

398882088.name: Beautiful, well-kept, lush tropical garden
398882088.author: a TripAdvisor user
398882088.reviewBody: The privately-financed Acapulco Botanical Garden offers a beautiful 30 minute walk among tropical plants from across the world, lily-covered ponds, jungle trees, and dense vegetation--all perfectly labeled and kept while preserving the sensation of being in a natural reserve. The site includes a bird watching platform, picnic tables, and souvenir store. Very accesible from the "scenic" road and worthwhile for adults and children alike.

itemReviewed.name: Acapulco Botanical Garden (Jardin Botanico de Acapulco)

address.streetAddress: Universidad Loyola del Pacifico Av. Heróico Colegio Militar s/n

390448707.name: I could have stayed all day.
390448707.author: a TripAdvisor user
390448707.reviewBody: This is the kind of place that you want to have brought a sack lunch. Quiet and peaceful. Beautiful flora.

itemReviewed.name: Acapulco Botanical Garden (Jardin Botanico de Acapulco)

address.streetAddress: Universidad Loyola del Pacifico Av. Heróico Colegio Militar s/n

374966517.name: An education on paradise
374966517.author: a TripAdvisor user
374966517.reviewBody: I spent about an hour today at the Acapulco Jardin Botanico on the campus of Loyola University of the Pacific. I wish Ihad budgeted more time because the tour was amazing and I was sorry to have had to cut it a little short. There is a four minute video in both English and Spanish that tells the story of a local garden club that worked hard to create this gorgeous retreat so all can learn more about this regions tropical plants. It has a wide variety of native plants as well as plants brought to the region by explorers including the Spanish and Filipinos. Wear comfortable shoes, bring ice water and be prepared for a gentle hike.

itemReviewed.name: Acapulco Botanical Garden (Jardin Botanico de Acapulco)

address.streetAddress: Universidad Loyola del Pacifico Av. Heróico Colegio Militar s/n

371620129.name: Botanical Garden
371620129.author: a TripAdvisor user
371620129.reviewBody: Not only were the variety of plants interesting, but the guide was very knowledgeable with the history of the many different plants.

itemReviewed.name: Acapulco Botanical Garden (Jardin Botanico de Acapulco)

address.streetAddress: Universidad Loyola del Pacifico Av. Heróico Colegio Militar s/n

365832328.name: Beautiful flowers and lots of history about the plants is given during the tour.
365832328.author: a TripAdvisor user
365832328.reviewBody: We enjoyed this tour a lot...things really great things to see.  Get there early to avoid the rush as many groups come and you need to wait for a guide.

itemReviewed.name: Acapulco Botanical Garden (Jardin Botanico de Acapulco)

address.streetAddress: Universidad Loyola del Pacifico Av. Heróico Colegio Militar s/n

363398269.name: What an amazing garden!
363398269.author: a TripAdvisor user
363398269.reviewBody: A must see attraction in the making. We could have spent hours viewing the fauna and enjoying the warm breezes.  What a delight to the senses!

itemReviewed.name: Acapulco Botanical Garden (Jardin Botanico de Acapulco)

address.streetAddress: Universidad Loyola del Pacifico Av. Heróico Colegio Militar s/n

347605550.name: Great cardio workout
347605550.author: a TripAdvisor user
347605550.reviewBody: Located on the grounds of Loyola university (no relation to the Loyola in USA) it is comprised of mostly trees and plants brought to the region many years ago by explorers. Not much of a view of the bay. It\'s well done and I beautiful, but mostly just a green natural habitat. If your expecting Longwood Gardens you\'ll be disappointed.

itemReviewed.name: Acapulco Botanical Garden (Jardin Botanico de Acapulco)

address.streetAddress: Universidad Loyola del Pacifico Av. Heróico Colegio Militar s/n

347549299.name: Sights
347549299.author: a TripAdvisor user
347549299.reviewBody: My driver took me here and it was absolutely beautiful.  Do not miss this spot. The vegetation is fantastic as are the people.  I really enjoy visiting this garden.

itemReviewed.name: Acapulco Botanical Garden (Jardin Botanico de Acapulco)

address.streetAddress: Universidad Loyola del Pacifico Av. Heróico Colegio Militar s/n

346426708.name: Should be seen if you have time to kill
346426708.author: a TripAdvisor user
346426708.reviewBody: The idea of this place is very good however the conviction is not as good. Off the beaten track so be sure to ask your taxi driver to wait if you are not driving. An hour will be more then enough time. I think I may have visited out of season as there was not a person around, not even someone to pay your 30 pesos per person . I think 30 pesos is quite expensive for what it is however the monies go towards the up keep and preservation so I guess this is a good thing. I suppose the more people that visit the better it will get as it makes more money.

itemReviewed.name: Acapulco Botanical Garden (Jardin Botanico de Acapulco)

address.streetAddress: Universidad Loyola del Pacifico Av. Heróico Colegio Militar s/n

345689719.name: peaceful location
345689719.author: a TripAdvisor user
345689719.reviewBody: Ok for a quiet peaceful walk and a chance to get out of the sun. Vast selection of different species.  However, this is not easy to get to or from, the shop and cafe look rarely open and we couldn\'t find any one to pay our entrance fee to. Would I visit here again, probably not. Would I recommended to others, probably if you have an hour of time to kill and are confident you could make your own way there and back. Shame as its a great idea.

itemReviewed.name: Acapulco Botanical Garden (Jardin Botanico de Acapulco)

address.streetAddress: Universidad Loyola del Pacifico Av. Heróico Colegio Militar s/n

341041010.name: Very nice peaceful, shaded walk
341041010.author: a TripAdvisor user
341041010.reviewBody: In January there is not much blooming, not none, but not a lot.  On the other hand it is somewhat difficult to a peaceful, shaded walk in Acapulco.  This is it.   With lots of benches along the way, to sit, stop, read a little.  The plants are also very well labeled.

itemReviewed.name: Acapulco Botanical Garden (Jardin Botanico de Acapulco)

address.streetAddress: Universidad Loyola del Pacifico Av. Heróico Colegio Militar s/n

333363284.name: Exspected More
333363284.author: a TripAdvisor user
333363284.reviewBody: Not very many flowers do to the area being very shaded. There is a very nice view from the top. Take your bug spray!

itemReviewed.name: Acapulco Botanical Garden (Jardin Botanico de Acapulco)

address.streetAddress: Universidad Loyola del Pacifico Av. Heróico Colegio Militar s/n

323785109.name: A vast array of impressive Mexican native plants in an inspirational setting
323785109.author: a TripAdvisor user
323785109.reviewBody: Make sure you see the Palo Morado, an incredible tree whose wood is of such amazing quality that it has now been over-collected from the local forests and highly endangered.

itemReviewed.name: Acapulco Botanical Garden (Jardin Botanico de Acapulco)

address.streetAddress: Universidad Loyola del Pacifico Av. Heróico Colegio Militar s/n

268938012.name: Amazing Gardens!!
268938012.author: a TripAdvisor user
268938012.reviewBody: Wish we had more time here...the variety of palms, plants ,flowers....so very lovely and all on a college campus!!!

itemReviewed.name: Acapulco Botanical Garden (Jardin Botanico de Acapulco)

address.streetAddress: Universidad Loyola del Pacifico Av. Heróico Colegio Militar s/n

258434614.name: Very Enjoyable
258434614.author: a TripAdvisor user
258434614.reviewBody: We found out by accident there is a collectivo taxi from the junction near Wal Mart that goes right passed the Garden\'s entrance for 14 pesos.  Admission to the Gardens is 30 pesos but free on Sunday. I was surprised at how well maintained the Botanical Gardens were considering a general lack of tourists.  There was no brochure or English signs but they have a display board with a map that you can orient yourself on. The Gardens are all uphill from where the taxi drops you but most of the trails are paved and have steps.  There are different areas for grouped types of plants. Also several small ponds and a waterfall.  In the center is a small store with drinks and an amphitheater. There is also a nice viewing platform for views of the city. The Gardens are quite beautiful and well laid out and definitely worth a visit. The top portion of the area is called the Adventure Zone and only has some vague dirt paths in the natural forest.  There are still some marked plants but it is probably not worth all the effort of climbing over rocks and brushing away spider webs compared to the lower portions of the garden.

itemReviewed.name: Acapulco Botanical Garden (Jardin Botanico de Acapulco)

address.streetAddress: Universidad Loyola del Pacifico Av. Heróico Colegio Militar s/n

256506543.name: First time there
256506543.author: a TripAdvisor user
256506543.reviewBody: Finally made it here, it was beautiful.  Lots of plants and lots of steps.  Have always wanted to go hera and finally did it and it was well worth the look

itemReviewed.name: Acapulco Botanical Garden (Jardin Botanico de Acapulco)

address.streetAddress: Universidad Loyola del Pacifico Av. Heróico Colegio Militar s/n

249041526.name: Could have been a nice botanical garden, but...
249041526.author: a TripAdvisor user
249041526.reviewBody: Yes, the organizers placed info cards on the plants, but they are all in spanish (no english translations for non-spanish speaking tourists).  They do not offer guided tours, their small amphitheater is not accessible during our visit (a lady there mentioned that it\'s under repair).\n\nThe 30 mexican pesos charge for me is a bit too steep for what they offer.

itemReviewed.name: Acapulco Botanical Garden (Jardin Botanico de Acapulco)

address.streetAddress: Universidad Loyola del Pacifico Av. Heróico Colegio Militar s/n

233270948.name: Charming.
233270948.author: a TripAdvisor user
233270948.reviewBody: This is a beatiful place.  We love gardens and garden shows, so we were delighted to come here.  It\'s located near the college, it\'s not very big but it\'s free, they just ask for a small donation. I think $2 per person.

itemReviewed.name: Acapulco Botanical Garden (Jardin Botanico de Acapulco)

address.streetAddress: Universidad Loyola del Pacifico Av. Heróico Colegio Militar s/n

210404383.name: Worth a visit!
210404383.author: a TripAdvisor user
210404383.reviewBody: The Botanical garden was a pleasant surprise for us.  Beautifully kept, it harbors a very nice collection of mostly indigenous plants and trees.  Not extremely large, so the visit takes about an hour.

itemReviewed.name: Acapulco Botanical Garden (Jardin Botanico de Acapulco)

address.streetAddress: Universidad Loyola del Pacifico Av. Heróico Colegio Militar s/n

127310580.name: Must improve to make it worth the time
127310580.author: a TripAdvisor user
127310580.reviewBody: The place is great, but must have more amenities and care. It may become a fantastic place to visit with little improvment

itemReviewed.name: Acapulco Botanical Garden (Jardin Botanico de Acapulco)

address.streetAddress: Universidad Loyola del Pacifico Av. Heróico Colegio Militar s/n

6616447.name: Charming and tranquil
6616447.author: a TripAdvisor user
6616447.reviewBody:
In Jan. 2007, I visited the Esther Pliego de Salinas Jardín Botánico near the grounds of Loyola University. (One entrance is from the university, and another is up the hill.). They are open sunrise to sunset, and admission is U.S. $3. The taxi driver apparently doesn’t take people here much, because he had to check the location with an older driver, but he found it easily. He was happy to wait for us. 

The garden is still being developed, but it is already lovely. There are walking trails, lily ponds, orchids, and many lovely flowers. All the plants are clearly labeled and nicely displayed. You can learn how they were used. There are meditation areas, a small ampitheater for performances, and streams.

We strolled along the paths and saw lots of birds, including orange-fronted parakeets feeding in large noisy flocks, caciques, white-throated magpie jays with their fancy crescent head-bobbles, and tropical kingbirds. This charming garden was a relaxing change from the beach.

itemReviewed.name: Acapulco Botanical Garden (Jardin Botanico de Acapulco)

address.streetAddress: Universidad Loyola del Pacifico Av. Heróico Colegio Militar s/n

653230100.name: Picturesque
653230100.author: a TripAdvisor user
653230100.reviewBody:
If you plan on visiting the divers at La Quabrada prior to that you MUST stop at the Sinfonia for an amazing sunset!!

On this Sunday evening no fewer then 100 people we scattered around the amphitheater for about 30 minutes awaiting the sunset. 

A young lady selling ice cream at the top of the landing for about 15 peso each some in our group had some nice coconut ice cream cones said it was delicious. 

As we waited the Bonanza and Acarey booze cruise boats chugged by to see Quebrada!! Both were packed with tourists. 

This was a stop prior to dining at the old Casablanca hotel a place called Ciro's Skybar worth a visit when down here or just plan it. Great part of the city.

address.streetAddress: La Pinzona 100 metros despues de La Quebrada

565685901.name: Beautiful View
565685901.author: a TripAdvisor user
565685901.reviewBody: Just around the curve from the La Quebrada, a concert hall hanging on a cliffside. You\'ll see lots of pics of famous folks that frequented the area back in the 50s. The sunset is gorgeous here but I understand it isn\'t necessarily the best/safest place to hang out in the evening

address.streetAddress: La Pinzona 100 metros despues de La Quebrada

559086907.name: It is one of the nicest places on Pacific coast
559086907.author: a TripAdvisor user
559086907.reviewBody: It is must see attraction when in Acapulco. Curvy road hung on the cliff overlooking the ocean. Beautiful amphitheater right above crushing waves, pictures of actors, musicians etc. Just gorgeous spot. However, one big problem is garbage, a lot of garbage in the morning. A guy in the hotel said that this is the largest bar in the world. Nevertheless, there should be way more garbage cans and police making sure people deposit garbage in them. It is a sad situation that such a beautiful place is full of garbage.

address.streetAddress: La Pinzona 100 metros despues de La Quebrada

500077322.name: What a view....
500077322.author: a TripAdvisor user
500077322.reviewBody: A concert Hall with a Magnificent view!!!!\n\nJust near La Quebrada, perfect for a sunset view. Do not miss this view!

address.streetAddress: La Pinzona 100 metros despues de La Quebrada

473244405.name: Picture Perfect Sunset & Views From Here!!
473244405.author: a TripAdvisor user
473244405.reviewBody: Sinfonia Del Mar is a must see attraction while you are in Acapulco! The sunset from here is amazing! The tour boats cruise by here every day to show the tourist the beauty of this location! I find it is best to arrive here about an hour before sunset so that you can enjoy the other views like the cliffs as well. \nThe views here are romantic and you will find that the locals also come here to court their girlfriends and enjoy the beauty here as well. \nBring some snacks and water, sit back and enjoy.

address.streetAddress: La Pinzona 100 metros despues de La Quebrada

322971379.name: Sinfonia Del Mar (Symphony of the Sea), Acapulco
322971379.author: a TripAdvisor user
322971379.reviewBody: This outdoor amphitheater, located on the Pacific Ocean in Acapulco near La Quebrada (the Cliff Divers) is a beautiful location to enjoy a sunset.  The beauty of the ocean, with the prevailing breezes, makes this an acoustical wonder, enhancing the sound of the performers and the breeze blows the sound into the audience.  There is also a beautiful sculpture by Marco Rivero of "The Mermaid and The Dolphin" at the top of the amphitheater (next to the parking area).

address.streetAddress: La Pinzona 100 metros despues de La Quebrada

250996928.name: Relaxing views
250996928.author: a TripAdvisor user
250996928.reviewBody: Very romantic views.  Went there with my husband after a day in the beach, it is very relaxing watching the sunset.  The downside is there are mostly locals there trying to look up.  But views are very nice relaxing.

address.streetAddress: La Pinzona 100 metros despues de La Quebrada

209615155.name: The sunset
209615155.author: a TripAdvisor user
209615155.reviewBody: Definitely worth taking a drink and some snacks and just sit there looking at the sunset. I do\'t know if it\'s 100% safe for foreign tourists, we were there with a local friend and we felt fully comfortable and safe. The view - stunning!

address.streetAddress: La Pinzona 100 metros despues de La Quebrada

196048025.name: 4 of 5
196048025.author: a TripAdvisor user
196048025.reviewBody:
The view from the sinfonia is spectacular and at sunset extra special. They did a nicejob designing it but the city doesn't do much upkeep unfortunately. 

Like many of the reviews before locals are allowed to gather and leave trash all over especially over the walls where it is tough to clean up. The only draw back to this terrific location. 

The sunset hour is what makes this special and the certain Friday nights when there are shows here.

address.streetAddress: La Pinzona 100 metros despues de La Quebrada

159454269.name: A TRUE HARMONIOUS MELANGE OF BEAUTY!
159454269.author: a TripAdvisor user
159454269.reviewBody:
It is actually called "Sinfonia del Mar" and I remember as a child this was the place to go and watch the sunset, presence some local shows and dance performances (which I was at some time part of) and see the couples become romantic and some groups of comers to drink away their juvenile joy and their more romantic states of sadness.

However it is, Sinfonia del Mar is a place where the Pacific Ocean, the Sun and the Earth join together to inspire us for contemplation and meditation, as well. 

It is a place where one feel free to be creative along with nature to participate with the tunes we provide to make a simphony full of beauty.

address.streetAddress: La Pinzona 100 metros despues de La Quebrada

151619781.name: Acapulco Symphony gives free concerts
151619781.author: a TripAdvisor user
151619781.reviewBody: We love when we can attend the Friday night concerts.  We were very sad this year that the concerts were starting in February right after we left.

address.streetAddress: La Pinzona 100 metros despues de La Quebrada

127317274.name: could be better
127317274.author: a TripAdvisor user
127317274.reviewBody: The place is awesome, but it is dirty and sometimes the locals go there to get drunk in the parking lot.

address.streetAddress: La Pinzona 100 metros despues de La Quebrada

102944051.name: "The best things in life are free"
102944051.author: a TripAdvisor user
102944051.reviewBody: As has been said in word and song, "The best things in life are free".  And so it is with La Sinfonia.  How fitting it is that Acapulco, with such legendary sunsets, has a special place to witness those sunsets, in semi-circular, coliseum style seating facing the Pacific Ocean to the west.  Both the seating and the sunset are free.  Just a 5 minute uphill taxi ride from the zocalo.

address.streetAddress: La Pinzona 100 metros despues de La Quebrada

68538942.name: The place for the perfect sunset
68538942.author: a TripAdvisor user
68538942.reviewBody: A great place to sit and relax while watching one of Acapulco\'s picture perfect sunsets. \n    An open air theater with many rows of seats to relax and take pictures of the unobstructed view of the Pacific and La Quebrada. Worth visiting while taking in the Cliff diver show.

address.streetAddress: La Pinzona 100 metros despues de La Quebrada

479837652.name: Not open to the public
479837652.author: a TripAdvisor user
479837652.reviewBody: If you are lucky enough to be a member, or be invited by a member, this is a very pleasant place to have a meal or a couple of drinks before or after going for a sail or a cruise. The restaurant is extremely well run, the food excellent and the staff friendly and helpful.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman 222 Fraccionamiento Las Playas

456554058.name: Members only and reciprocal members only
456554058.author: a TripAdvisor user
456554058.reviewBody: This is a great private Yate club..Everyone is so friendly and helpful. They have added a new massage , body and facial treatment, gym to the club...Wow!! 5 star. The Olympic pool is wonderful. The beer is always ice cold. The menu has something for everyone.Yum! Yum! Or just sit down under the Terezza by the water the waiter will serve you with complementary peanuts or snack of the day. We enjoy watching the sail boats and Yates coming and going. Peace and tranquillity awaits you here at the Club de Yates Yes they have a small gift shop. We always enjoy the club sandwich with french frys...Yum!!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman 222 Fraccionamiento Las Playas

338290533.name: Many times
338290533.author: a TripAdvisor user
338290533.reviewBody: Have a friend with a boat, so go many times. Had New Years Eve dinner buffet there before going on the boat. Buffet was unbelievable. Any food you can think of. Very g Great service.ood.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman 222 Fraccionamiento Las Playas

306098678.name: Time away from the beach
306098678.author: a TripAdvisor user
306098678.reviewBody: Take away some time from the Beach and enjoy this beautiful place with yatchs from all sizes and can even rent one for fun! \nIts a beautiful place to visit with local food vendors.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman 222 Fraccionamiento Las Playas

272596265.name: Great Place.
272596265.author: a TripAdvisor user
272596265.reviewBody: My friend took me into the Restaurant after a day of fishing. I had a club sandwich which was very good. Price was a little high but your eating at the Marina. Staff was great, nice open air eating with a cover so your in shade, nice view of all the boats.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman 222 Fraccionamiento Las Playas

266647383.name: Great setting, marginal food.
266647383.author: a TripAdvisor user
266647383.reviewBody: Loved the setting overlooking the marina and boats.  The food was just okay.  I ordered the Coconut Shrimp and it was better than what everyone else had ordered.  Overall, just okay.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman 222 Fraccionamiento Las Playas

194445174.name: "Not open to the public. Private and Reciprocal Yacht Club"
194445174.author: a TripAdvisor user
194445174.reviewBody: This is a great slice of Acapulco Paradise. Quite, relaxing a great menu with seletions wonderfluly prepared.  The Club has a great Olympic swiming pool.  Soon the Club will have a world class spa and exerise gym that is being built as I type. I stopped at their boutique to find they have a nice selection of nautical items. The staff remained the same with a few new hires.  Alejandro checked us into the club he was very helpful and curteous.  The Yachts and night view of Acapulco are truly wonderful.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman 222 Fraccionamiento Las Playas

189849269.name: GOOD YACHT CLUB "
189849269.author: a TripAdvisor user
189849269.reviewBody: Fantastic day where we rent a yacht named Bonanza, with inclusive drinks .We spent all the afternoon and was a pleasant experience.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman 222 Fraccionamiento Las Playas

124387266.name: Not open to public. Private and Reciprocal Yacht Club
124387266.author: a TripAdvisor user
124387266.reviewBody: We are reciprocal members.  The food is excellent the drinks are wonderful and the staff are very friendly. Great pool, wonderful views of Acapulco and of course the Fabulous yachts.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Costera Miguel Aleman 222 Fraccionamiento Las Playas

672187404.name: Beautiful part of Acapulco
672187404.author: a TripAdvisor user
672187404.reviewBody: This is a wonderful part of Acapulco that is worth the visit. Just don\'t try to cross the street without a police crossing guard. Drivers are fast and they stop for no one. When you do get across, there are a lot of shopping areas geared to tourists and locals. Well worth spending a few hours. But be warned that this area constitutes most of the Acapulco shopping ground. While several kilometers long, you will have seen it all in a day or two.\n\nDon\'t fall for the hotel "sight-seeing tours", they will eventually take you to the "Silver Museum" which is a shopping trap for tourists. The "silver" is not all silver as my wife found out after purchasing some and they will stall you there until you buy something. It is obvious that that the guides are paid off by the "Museum".

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

665140191.name: Original plaza in the old part of Acapulco
665140191.author: a TripAdvisor user
665140191.reviewBody: The Alvaro Plaza is the main plaza in Zocalo the original old part of Acapulco. The local people gather here at night and the music starts. There are some wonderful large Banyan Tree with immense root systems here. There is also the impressive main Cathedral of Acapulco at the top of the plaza. The plaza is not large and is rather sedate during the day. \nThere are lots of shops surrounding the plaza with many selling religious artefacts. Worth a night time visit.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

648046751.name: Can\'t miss attraction in the center of Acapulco
648046751.author: a TripAdvisor user
648046751.reviewBody: Located across the street frome the Bay cruise boat dock, lively center wirh beautiful old Banyon trees, local vendors, & restaurants\n

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

645367105.name: Fun to walk around at night
645367105.author: a TripAdvisor user
645367105.reviewBody: We were there from Thanksgiving to New Years.  The Zocalo was such a fun/busy place to walk around at night ... so many lights and decorations, music playing everywhere.  Lots of restaurants to choose from too.  Tons of vendors set up tables in the evenings so there\'s lots to see/shop/eat while browsing.  Love how festive it was during Our Lady of Guadalupe week, Christmas and New Years ... actually the whole month of Dec. was decorated, busy, and very festive.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

625140327.name: What\u2019s a city without a town square
625140327.author: a TripAdvisor user
625140327.reviewBody: In order to get a real flavor of Mexico and Acapulco, find the main Zocalo or town square.  Local culture hits you right in the face.  Local merchants display their wares and its a good place to souvenir shop.  Don\u2019t forget to bargain.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

599617311.name: Mercadito/church/casa de Los abuelos
599617311.author: a TripAdvisor user
599617311.reviewBody: Was nice to wait inside the ac and drink a beer while we wait for the boat to go.. the church have a unique architecture. :)

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

565146372.name: Central
565146372.author: a TripAdvisor user
565146372.reviewBody: This is supposedly the centre of town and it takes around 20 minutes to walk from the cruise ship terminal. You cannot miss the cathedral. When we were there the police band were playing. I was not sure whether to be reassured that all the band members carried rifles, or whether to be concerned that they were needed......  There are a few shops also in this area.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

564439287.name: Fun place for photographs
564439287.author: a TripAdvisor user
564439287.reviewBody: I was in Acapulco for New Year\'s and spent an enjoyable late afternoon here. Fun place to take snapshots of vendors, food, etc.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

559478176.name: not so good anymore
559478176.author: a TripAdvisor user
559478176.reviewBody: Ive been to the zocalo many times but they recently renovated it and destroyed a lot of the natural beauty such as removing a lot of the old trees there.Its still a nice place to visit but not like before.There are still stores and restaurants there and not so many vendors anymore.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

551910015.name: You want even know what is this
551910015.author: a TripAdvisor user
551910015.reviewBody: There is a cathedral, which can\'t be seen from distance as there are so many trees covering it. Few,  very few restaurants but so many street sellers. Its crowded with people selling the regular non-interesting things

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

528616241.name: Great local place
528616241.author: a TripAdvisor user
528616241.reviewBody: Great way to get a sense of the local culture. Local vendors selling all sorts of goods and great place to just sit and get a feel for Acapulco.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

480730424.name: Try not to miss the Friday night dancing!
480730424.author: a TripAdvisor user
480730424.reviewBody: If you are looking for souvenirs and a little bit of local culture, this is a nice place. Plenty of shade to sit and people-watch. Two ice cream shops and lots of vendors selling treats. Friday evenings from 6-8 live orchestra with ball room dancing and the cutest elderly dancers around.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

474988660.name: Beautiful Downtown Gathering Spot
474988660.author: a TripAdvisor user
474988660.reviewBody: Centrally located in main Acapulco the Zocalo is an absolute must see place here. Top of the line restaurants with outdoor patio seating available. Souvenir shops very close by. Great Service!

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

456446551.name: Zocalo nice place to visit
456446551.author: a TripAdvisor user
456446551.reviewBody: The zocalo is a central place where you can go for shopping, food, buy jewells and all kind of stuf.\nThere\'s always show with clowns and jugglers.\nThe Italian restaurant serves quality food, get there early at dinner because there is always a line up.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

439400226.name: Colorful locals and flavors!
439400226.author: a TripAdvisor user
439400226.reviewBody: Friendly locals selling their wares (fabrics, purses, arts & woodsy decor, you name it...) and colorful flavors of a huge variety of food made with local spices, traditions and care!  One of my favorite non-structured afternoons in Mexico ~ strolling along the Zocalo...\n\nOh, and hey, how can you NOT smile when you say the world Zocalo?!?  Doesn\'t the word just invite a grin?  :)

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

436467023.name: Vacation
436467023.author: a TripAdvisor user
436467023.reviewBody: This is the center of town open outdoor restaurants lots of vendors for souvenirs The Fishery is just right across the street from the Zocalo

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

389222797.name: Acapulco Memories
389222797.author: a TripAdvisor user
389222797.reviewBody: The Church in Zocalo, The Chaple of Peace , and so many beautiful beaches !!!! \nThere is so much hystory in Acapulco !!! I miss the many friends that I have made .

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

382457967.name: Every week-end
382457967.author: a TripAdvisor user
382457967.reviewBody: We live in Acapulco all winter so we enjoy going to the Zocalo for its boutiques, its restaurants and its live music and flea market. You can just sit there and look at people walking or dancing. There are 2 great restaurants, Mi Piaci and D\'Raquel. We go at least twice a week. Do go to the cathedral especialy at Christmas time, their Christmas crib decoration is realy worth the detour.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

366073881.name: Zocalo in center
366073881.author: a TripAdvisor user
366073881.reviewBody: Years ago we loved to go to the Zocalo at night and watch the children with their parents strolling and meeting their neighbors, the old men playing checkers; like Old Havana. Very local and very friendly. Beautiful old church for the fisherman of the Bay.\nBut now the tourism has overtaken the Zocalo, and it is no longer the social center it always was, for centuries! Now it is hard to walk for the souvenir vendor stalls, all selling the same crap, garbage strewn and stinking everywhere, hawkers grabbing your arm. Don\'t be fooled by the guys who show you a badge that they work for the government tourism bureau. They will lead you miles out of your way to show you more souvenir stalls run they their cousins, or restaurants with bad food, where they get a cut of your meal. It is relatively safe during the day, but I wouldn\'t recommend an evening stroll there.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

365701355.name: The local authorities need to do something.
365701355.author: a TripAdvisor user
365701355.reviewBody: Acapulco\'s Zocalo  was never one of the best in Mexico but it has some beautiful huge old trees and it used to have a charming bandstand that some idiot saw fit to demolish during the remodelling. The remodelling has not improved anything as it seems to have been left only half finished. The Zocalo continues to be mostly dirty and smelly with street vendors selling tchatchkes and food. The Canadians seem to like it a lot and there are a couple of quite good cheap restaurants where it\'s pleasant to sit and watch the world go by.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

355730425.name: downtown
355730425.author: a TripAdvisor user
355730425.reviewBody: have been there, love the locals, so much to see, so much culture, and local fare, fantastic, out of the tourist trap.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

353650932.name: Authentic Mexico
353650932.author: a TripAdvisor user
353650932.reviewBody: This is a must see, lots of shops, restaurants and a church. Recently remodeled. Try the rib place or Mi Piace for a meal,

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

351360711.name: They have destroyed it,  what a mess!!!
351360711.author: a TripAdvisor user
351360711.reviewBody:
After coming to Acapulco for over 35 years, what a disappointment it was to see the new zocalo.  They ripped out the fountains and the gazebo and all of the benches replacing them with fewer benches.  Also, there is very little shade now because they took out some trees.  The replaced the fountains with a spray park  which already doesn't  work.  The new tiles the put down are already cracking.   The flea market has taken over the zocalo.  The zocalo used to be a great place to people watch, but, now, if you are sitting in MI Piaci all you can see is the backs of the vendors.

Again, what a disappointment!!!!

Wish they would have left it the way it was...

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

349641641.name: Work still to be done IMO
349641641.author: a TripAdvisor user
349641641.reviewBody: Still a place to see the sites and culture the new remodel falls short of what this location is to be about.  A few local vendors are nice but it is over the top now. \n\nThe replacement of the gazebo for the monstrosity that is there now is mind-boggling.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

349001473.name: Zocalo in Acapulco
349001473.author: a TripAdvisor user
349001473.reviewBody: I wanted to see the zocalo, so i walked there from the cruise terminal. It was interesting to see all the vendors, the colorful displays of goods, and all the people walking around enjoying themselves on a sunny afternoon.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

348089539.name: nice place for gathering
348089539.author: a TripAdvisor user
348089539.reviewBody: a bit small but good for gatherings lots of vender selling lots a good things for good prices also a very nice church to go in and have a prayer

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

343689391.name: Nice place for family gatherings
343689391.author: a TripAdvisor user
343689391.reviewBody: Nice place to meet with friends and family. Lots of vendors selling snack foods and souvenirs. There are nice restaurants. Got to see the International Festival of Mariachi\'s performing in the square.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

342843083.name: Lively spot for street vendors and artists
342843083.author: a TripAdvisor user
342843083.reviewBody: The Zocalo is next to the cathedral. Lots of street vendors selling food and Mexican art/tourist curios etc. Not bad for a short walk around.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

340741688.name: Fun
340741688.author: a TripAdvisor user
340741688.reviewBody: Gone many times. Just finished remodeling it. Doesn\'t have the gazebo any more. Lots of shopping. Has lots of nice restaurants. Always go for Halloween to see the local children in costume.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

339553968.name: Do some shopping
339553968.author: a TripAdvisor user
339553968.reviewBody: There are several shopping centres around Zocalo. Certainly there are plenty of places to eat. I was told there is a bookstore where it is possible to buy a postcard, but I didn\'t find it. It\'s hard to send a postcard from Acapulco.\nBe very careful on the roads - nobody follows the rules.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

336823058.name: Great for touristy shopping and food.
336823058.author: a TripAdvisor user
336823058.reviewBody: Great area to wander around in.  Felt very safe with the army and police on practically every corner.  Lovely area to buy some touristy sort of things and great variety of inexpensive yummy food!

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

334598972.name: Large historic square
334598972.author: a TripAdvisor user
334598972.reviewBody: It is interesting to walk around the square and look at historic buildings and people who spend time there. A good place to start exploring Mexico City!

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

325131515.name: Lots of Action, Great View of the Bay & Good Food
325131515.author: a TripAdvisor user
325131515.reviewBody: The Zocalo is based in the main square of Acapulco where you will find a beautiful historical Cathedral. There are lots of shops and vendors in the square along with some very good restaurants at a very reasonable price.  It has received a major face lift and it is 95% complete.  They added 3 areas where water shoots up from the ground and it is beautifully lit up in the night time.  The kids have a blast playing in the water as well as some adults while the parents sit around and chat amongst each other.  It makes a nice place to get together.  Also the boat that tours the bay is right across the street and the cliff divers are very close by which makes the Zocalo an ideal place to visit.  A must see while you are in Acapulco!!

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

323785464.name: Typical Mexican Zocalo
323785464.author: a TripAdvisor user
323785464.reviewBody: While a zocalo is always a great place to check out the local scene in any Mexican city/town, this one is getting a bit too commercialized for it to deserve more than an average rating.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

315681353.name: ZOCALO
315681353.author: a TripAdvisor user
315681353.reviewBody: We had to walk the the park to get to the Cathedral a while back, lots of stalls and people, a lovely Rotunda, noticed the Rotundas through all of Mexico.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

296689443.name: Pretty Place
296689443.author: a TripAdvisor user
296689443.reviewBody: This place was really nice. Very pretty and lots to see. Lots of tourists around and good food! Worth visiting if your in Mexico.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

290055098.name: The old Historical Center of Acapulco - Worth a Visit
290055098.author: a TripAdvisor user
290055098.reviewBody: The old historic centre of Acapulco, based on the main square or Zocalo with its unusually decorated Cathedral, has become rather run-down over the last couple of decades and many of the area\'s cheap hotels (catering to Mexicans of modest means) have closed down.  But in the last eighteen months the city administration with help from historical and architectural researchers and from Mr Carlos Slim (Mexico\'s richest man!), have begun historical repairs and restoration along with a remodelling  designed to lure visitors back to the old town and away from the beaches to the south and southeast. there\'s still work to be done but the Z\u00f3calo is already a more attractive place to visit. Most foreign tourists do not spend any time in this area and thats a pity as some of the best and cheapest restaurants in Acapulco are located here or within two or three blocks from the Z\u00f3calo. Definitely worth a visit and its perfectly safe.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

282920691.name: Breeze Walk
282920691.author: a TripAdvisor user
282920691.reviewBody: El Zocalo is a a big market place filled with local vendors and you can find close to everything from food, clothing, shoes, sovenirs and it lights up beautifully during the evening. You can take a walk and the breeze of the palms are a great refresher.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

277760956.name: Acapulco
277760956.author: a TripAdvisor user
277760956.reviewBody: Its good to be there once.Nightlife,drinks,cruises,water sports what else you need on a holiday..\nWent there with my friends on a small trip for 4 days.Stayed in Los Flamingos.In peak season . the place is crowded with locals.you can hire taxi or can take a bus to go from one place to another,

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

276180929.name: Lots to see & do
276180929.author: a TripAdvisor user
276180929.reviewBody: The Zocalo was one of the first places visited when I came to Acapulco in 1998. It was just a short walk from Etel Suites & part of the reason we enjoy staying there. There is always something going on....mimes put on shows for the children....dancing sometimes....a flea market. & music. Several restaurants, Mi Piaci & Raquel\'s are two of our favorites. Love watching. the Mexican people enjoying it. To us, this is where it\'s at in Acapolco!

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

274677578.name: Zocalo Has A Face Lift
274677578.author: a TripAdvisor user
274677578.reviewBody: They are still working on the Zocalo but it has a new look. They continue to remodel it, new walk ways, new fountains all the buildings facing the zocalo all now look the same.I you want a nice inexpensive dinner and people watch the locals you can kill a few hours in the zocalo. At the night the local Indians set up their tables with all their arts and crafts and you can stroll at your leisure. Just across the street you can hop of the boat that will take you for a cruise around the bay or just stroll and walk the pier.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

274370166.name: The whole view of the Malecon, Zocalo, and The Picturesque view from T Mountains.
274370166.author: a TripAdvisor user
274370166.reviewBody: I can only describe this Port as one of the best from It\'s Natural Beauty, history, and The People\'s Culture, who come out decent like any other human been to work and Welcome you with a Great Smile like It\'s Ancestors. After all they represent the richness of the Indian of The Americas...Mixed with European too... Like La Malinche The First Embassy Woman who translated to Hernan Cortez in difference Dialets ViVA MEXICO Y ViVA ACAPULCO Y ACUERDATE DE ACAPULCO, MARIA BONITA

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

259450027.name: Total filth
259450027.author: a TripAdvisor user
259450027.reviewBody: First time back after 10 years, I cant say it will ever improve, even with the restorations being done.I agree with Luis m. Review. Its is actually depressing\n.. It seems they are in Such. A rut.and dont have the desire for Change.the other thing we have notice is when things are slow,the priced go up,mexico is not cheap. The one great thing is the incredible weather. I suggest find \u00e5 nice resort

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

256506856.name: What a mess
256506856.author: a TripAdvisor user
256506856.reviewBody: The Zocalo is a mess this year.  The Gazebo has been ripped down,  you can\'t sit outside at Mi Piacia.  All the center part is blocked off for reconstructionl  Hopefully next year it will be back to normal or better

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

256387589.name: Agressive vendors setting up tables everywhere
256387589.author: a TripAdvisor user
256387589.reviewBody: Since there are no more city police, all the villagers are setting up tents and tables, leaving you very little room to walk.  I was there in june and this February,  it got even worse in the last month.  Saw a few scruffs between vendors snd tourists,  the locals all know that there are now only Federal Police, and these dont patrol the Zocalo and Cathedral grounds.  Simply too dangerous anymore!

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

255895847.name: very run down
255895847.author: a TripAdvisor user
255895847.reviewBody: it looks like they are trying to revive the area, but it is incredibly rundown and there really isn\'t much to see.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

255234999.name: Great for people watching.
255234999.author: a TripAdvisor user
255234999.reviewBody: The Zocalo has a lot of vendors, little shops, restaurants and my favorite is the little taco stands (that\'s why I go) set up on the side walk. We had 5 beef tacos and a grape drink for 40 pesos.\nIt is worth visiting.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

255115279.name: Local Flavor - Lively plaza with multiple local vendors
255115279.author: a TripAdvisor user
255115279.reviewBody:
The Plaza is teaming with vendors offering small to large souvenirs, as well as multiple food vendors with fresh local snacks, all very inexpensive. 

This plaza hosts a very impressive Cathedral De Acapulco is wonderful to experience in person. You can see the combination of local's participating in their services, as well as spending time in the plaza (Zocalo).  

If you don't want local flavor or to see the 'non-resort' side of Acapulco, then avoid this location.  Otherwise, you'll enjoy it.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

253969708.name: GREAT RESTERAUNTS IN SQUARE
253969708.author: a TripAdvisor user
253969708.reviewBody: This is a square in the old section w/BEAUTIFUL Church. There\'s a coup[kle local resteraunts I frequent there, one especially MI Picia (sp). It\'s an Italian resteraunt run by local owner thats NOT a tourist trap Fantastic food and prices are great!! Been coming here now for 3o years in a row and if you saw my stomach you\'d know my reviews are for real, some you won\'t see listed by trip advosr because I mainly go where locals do...REAL MEXICAN and LOW prices...that\'s how afford to come here for a month!! AND AGAIN, as with my other reviews this morning....ACAPULCO IS SAFE!!!

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

247475081.name: Shopping
247475081.author: a TripAdvisor user
247475081.reviewBody: We spent quite a bit of time in the area,looking at the architecture and feeling the hum of activity there. We went to the artisans market to shop, was a pleasant experience

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

246633512.name: Always in Transition
246633512.author: a TripAdvisor user
246633512.reviewBody: This is heart of Acapulco where the main Catholic church is located. The Zocalo (main square) is surrounded by shops and outdoor restaurants, families with kids, tourists from cruise ships, Lively vendors walk around as one stop shops selling everything from helium balloons and bubble gum for the kids, mementos for tourists, to cigarettes. There seems to be an element of young guys look on the look for older guys, but no blatant prostitution is going on and it\'s just a part of the mix. Although the Zocalo is more locally-oriented than the main tourist drag, it still is heavily patrolled and feels safe. This is where you go for a taste of the old Acapulco.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

244631673.name: Not surprised on this one
244631673.author: a TripAdvisor user
244631673.reviewBody: I guess its because it was remodeling i wasn\'t able to fully explore it but the surroundings need to be remodel as well, place its really given up. I would avoid it myself next time

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

236936766.name: Nice plaza
236936766.author: a TripAdvisor user
236936766.reviewBody: Nice plaza for really cheap souvenir shopping! Quite centric place, from here I took a boat around the island called El Acarey with drinks included in price!

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

229501008.name: no engish
229501008.author: a TripAdvisor user
229501008.reviewBody: we walked around and found that all vedors spoke only spanish so i couldnt even ask for a bigger size. it was fustrating because i love to  shop. there were beggers on the streets and it smelled of pee. the wollworths was the highlight of the trip. great store.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

223512348.name: shopping
223512348.author: a TripAdvisor user
223512348.reviewBody: The zocalo is a market, you can bargain with them they\'re pretty\nfriendly people\nYou can get anything here, food, clothes, souveniers, but watch out for knock offs

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

222776236.name: Fallen Beauty
222776236.author: a TripAdvisor user
222776236.reviewBody: This WAS a nice spot. Old Acapulco. Now littered with homeless and reaks of urine and foul odours .sad it WAS nice .

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

209614853.name: Not much to look for
209614853.author: a TripAdvisor user
209614853.reviewBody: If you go to Acapulco to look for some historical or cultural places, this is not one of them, there\'s not much to do or see there.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

205470845.name: We both love the Zocalo. If you are in Aca you must visit at Christmas and easter..it is beautiful!
205470845.author: a TripAdvisor user
205470845.reviewBody: There was nothing to dislike, you have the beautiful Cathedral and all the venders and the fabulous restaurants esp. the Mia Piaci

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

200579396.name: MUY Bueno
200579396.author: a TripAdvisor user
200579396.reviewBody: Each year when I visit Mexico, I visit the Zocalo! Nothings says ACAPULCO better than the entire downtown experience of food, shopping, architecture, and people! It\'s a quick trip from my hotel via Mexican fun bus! Gotta love the entire cultural experience!\nDon\'t miss it!

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

200537882.name: Worst zocalo in Mexico
200537882.author: a TripAdvisor user
200537882.reviewBody: I have been to more than 10 Mexico cities and towns and this is the worst zocalo in Mexico.  It isn\'t clean, it has only a few people hanging out and very little character.  A major disappointment.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

198287964.name: It\'s charming
198287964.author: a TripAdvisor user
198287964.reviewBody: It can be a great place to propose for dates and if your just there for a visit it\'s a good picture shooting place.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

195561616.name: Zocalo means old downtown....
195561616.author: a TripAdvisor user
195561616.reviewBody: great place to walk around, the Cathedral always filled with worshippers.. the clowns put on a show in the early evening for the children, buy local foods from the carts, a great meal will be about 3 dollars..   Just allow yourself to float into it.. very nice, AND SAFE....

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

194079779.name: OK but only church is special
194079779.author: a TripAdvisor user
194079779.reviewBody: Not as large as other typical Zocalos in Mexico. Church is very unusual--never saw a tower on a church that looked like a IBM with a satellite on top ready for launching

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

193905401.name: shopping at zocalo
193905401.author: a TripAdvisor user
193905401.reviewBody: liked to shop around little stalls selling local craft, seashells and food. nice place to pick up tee shirts, sea shells and tinkets.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

192684624.name: Amazing place!
192684624.author: a TripAdvisor user
192684624.reviewBody: This is a great place to mingle with the locals, and enjoy the food and sites. The people are kind, hard-working and helpful, and delighted to practice their English on the tourists.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

190943360.name: Zocolo
190943360.author: a TripAdvisor user
190943360.reviewBody: This a very pleasant relaxing market in old downtown. Enjoy the authentic Mexican food, shop, or just sit down and enjoy the scenery and people.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

159453294.name: A SMALL PIECE OF HEAVEN TO REMEMBER
159453294.author: a TripAdvisor user
159453294.reviewBody: With the old big trees as  cornerstones, the shoeshine cubicles surrounding it, the beautiful and recently restored kiosk in the middle of it, and the local vendors selling arts, hand-made clothing and delicious Mexican snacks, this place is just like an old picture of Colonial Mexico.\n\nIt has an atmosphere of tranquility and quiet where you can easily sit and have a chat with a friend and enjoy some "Esquites" with chilli powder and real cheese while you dream away into the past !

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

159453293.name: A SMALL PIECE OF HEAVEN TO REMEMBER
159453293.author: a TripAdvisor user
159453293.reviewBody: With the old big trees as  cornerstones, the shoeshine cubicles surrounding it, the beautiful and recently restored kiosk in the middle of it, and the local vendors selling arts, hand-made clothing and delicious Mexican snacks, this place is just like an old picture of Colonial Mexico.\n\nIt has an atmosphere of tranquility and quiet where you can easily sit and have a chat with a friend and enjoy some "Esquites" with chilli powder and real cheese while you dream away into the past !

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

158753647.name: old, dirty
158753647.author: a TripAdvisor user
158753647.reviewBody: Not nice!!! Frightening, dirty, apart of the port, nothing interesting to see..I didn\'t like it at all

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

155966961.name: Downtown!
155966961.author: a TripAdvisor user
155966961.reviewBody: Lots of great eating places. Fun to shop on weekends with vendors set up thru out the area. Beautiful church to visit.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

155192745.name: Busy slice of Mexican life
155192745.author: a TripAdvisor user
155192745.reviewBody: We visited here twice to find the plaza full of regular Mexican people.  Nice place to sit and people-watch.   Ventured off a few blocks and found a man on the street typing letters (for the illiterate?).  Open air flee market nearby but full of tourist junk.  Many people wanting you to follow them to some "good deal"; annoying but easily showed away.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

154341052.name: An oasis of calm or a bustling family place.
154341052.author: a TripAdvisor user
154341052.reviewBody: Depending on when you go to the Zocalo you can find either calm and shade or a festival atmosphere.  Mornings at the Zocalo (a favourite place for breakfast with many restaurants to choose from) is calm and cool.  Lots of shade trees.  Sunday evening is a family gathering place with lots of laughing children and bright baloons.  The Cathederal here is a must see as well.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

153092222.name: Zocalo Visit
153092222.author: a TripAdvisor user
153092222.reviewBody: Always a good place to stroll and enjoys the sounds and sights of Acapulco Like the Church and the cafes where you can sit and relax

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

151659029.name: MEXICO
151659029.author: a TripAdvisor user
151659029.reviewBody: I love the Zocalo in Acapulco always somthing going on a band, a show or even a political ralley. To me that\'s what Acapulco is all about  RELAX AND ENJOY AMIGOS

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

151620210.name: Visiting the old town square
151620210.author: a TripAdvisor user
151620210.reviewBody:
