The Zocalo is the name for the Main Square in the old town.  

It takes about 90 minutes to leisurely walk there from the Hotel Acapulco Malibu (or you can take a bus for 6 pesos).

My husband and I like to walk there and work up an appetite so we can eat the delicious thin-crust pizza at the Slice of Pizza restaurant on the right as you face the old, small Catholic Church (which you MUST visit the inside)

With our stomach full of pizza, we usually take a local bus back to the hotel (which will stop in front of the Malibu if you tell the driver, even though there is no official bus stop there.   The buses will even pick you up at a non-stop, if you flag them down.)

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

150272221.name: Charming
150272221.author: a TripAdvisor user
150272221.reviewBody: Great little square with lost of vendors and a beautiful Church!  A great place to sit and people watch!

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

149993571.name: typical Mexican
149993571.author: a TripAdvisor user
149993571.reviewBody: we spent a while at the cathedral and the zocalo. it was good to see how natives live.  lots of traffic, but worth to seat there, realx and see people pass by.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

148285026.name: Where the locals go
148285026.author: a TripAdvisor user
148285026.reviewBody: This place is a true taste of the average folks in Acapulco.  The sights are interesting.  Ice cream and other local cuisine is available as well as bargain keep sakes.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

148245469.name: great quiet area
148245469.author: a TripAdvisor user
148245469.reviewBody: great area, i had just arrived in the area for mexico city and it was a nice change slower pace but everything was really close by. within walking distance there is places to eat, places to drink, and the beach with alot of vendors.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

147406712.name: Stay away from here!
147406712.author: a TripAdvisor user
147406712.reviewBody: Dirty horrible place at night with armed Federales in attendance! Did not like the place by night at all.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

145077374.name: Good for an hour or two
145077374.author: a TripAdvisor user
145077374.reviewBody:
We were staying in Acapulco for four nights. After watching the Cliff Divers we headed to the Zocalo to stroll around a bit.

Compared to Zocalos in other cities (like Merida or Veracruz) this one is quite a bit more quiet. It has a very green center with lots of trees and shade. It's surrounded by lots of shops and restaurants.
It's nice to have a good, relaxing time and to sit down and chill out a bit. You can really take your time looking at the shops...vendors here are quite laid back and won't hassle you.
Try some of the street food here. It's authentic and inexpensive. There's also a place called Michoacana selling good drinks and ice cream (try the Horchata - one of the best we had on our trip).
It might not be Mexico's best and greatest Zocalo. But it's fun for an hour or two. If you get enough of the beach and want to have a walk, this place is a very decent option.

Wanna know more about my trips? Check my profile where you'll also find my website with more info about my travels.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

145075499.name: Take time to visit
145075499.author: a TripAdvisor user
145075499.reviewBody: If you are wanting to experience the culture of Acapulco, visit the Zocalo.  I usually go to one of the restaurants that surround the area.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

144143490.name: attractions
144143490.author: a TripAdvisor user
144143490.reviewBody: the attractions were outstanding, the vendors had great things for sale they have a place to drop off your dirty laundry to be cleaned and pressed great variety of food and a great church

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

136862170.name: absolutly worth the money!  MUST TRY!
136862170.author: a TripAdvisor user
136862170.reviewBody: Love this place worth the walk from amazing breakfast & dinner.  When I leave Acapulco, this is one place I indeed miss!  Service food and value are all perfect.  Excellent quality food and the best value in the city!

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

130876751.name: We love the Zocolo
130876751.author: a TripAdvisor user
130876751.reviewBody: Old downtown Acapulco. We went there to have lunch and enjoyed the meal. I do not remember the name of the little rest. there but the staff was attentive and the food was good. There was a young man there making flowers and crickets out of palm leaves and it was the most intersting thing we saw on our three days there.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

129857703.name: meny people to crowded round
129857703.author: a TripAdvisor user
129857703.reviewBody: very popular place for local sellers and local birds, very noisy square of Acapulco, in time of my visit people hold Catholic ceremony and many people were there

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

128294790.name: Charming Center of  town
128294790.author: a TripAdvisor user
128294790.reviewBody: The vendors, cafes and restaurants surround the heart of the town. The marina is in front of the area and is a must see for visitors.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

127314978.name: It\'s a pitty
127314978.author: a TripAdvisor user
127314978.reviewBody: All the surroundings are full of poor people. Lack of maintenance. Dirty, a lot of poor stores.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

126800190.name: zocalo
126800190.author: a TripAdvisor user
126800190.reviewBody: This is a nice plaza, with a few cafes and shops where the locals gather.  At the far end is a lovely cathedral.  There is also a market where you can purchase handicrafts.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

126586716.name: nothing to do and dangerous
126586716.author: a TripAdvisor user
126586716.reviewBody: be careful in the city center, stay in the tourist areas and the hotel. do not venture yourself in this city, it\'s really ugly, poor and dangerous

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

125800185.name: Nice night out and Dinner
125800185.author: a TripAdvisor user
125800185.reviewBody: After 11 years of visiting Acapulco we finally went to the Zocalo.\nHad an excellent meal at the Italian restaurant and were entertained along the walk throughout the area later. No hassles and lots to see, shop , and do.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

123577572.name: Street market
123577572.author: a TripAdvisor user
123577572.reviewBody: Just go and see real life of Acapulco! You can make here a shortcut to Quebrada ocean front from a bus

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

123438971.name: A must to visit.
123438971.author: a TripAdvisor user
123438971.reviewBody: The best day to visit is Sunday, that is family day, and man vendors ar out selling.  If you want it quieter, go any other time.  It is a must see.  I go every year.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

123126518.name: What Mexico is!
123126518.author: a TripAdvisor user
123126518.reviewBody: Come friday nites, locals all over, band and public dancing, very refreshing to see so many people having a great time.\n\nSafe, you got to be kidding me, people and police all over come and relax and be a local one nite!

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

122335060.name: Great Historic People Watching Location
122335060.author: a TripAdvisor user
122335060.reviewBody: Good reasonable priced restaurants try Mi Picia! Safe and clean this is where you see the Mexican peoples from school kids, families Ex Pats and some Tourist

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

121257972.name: This is the playground for locals.
121257972.author: a TripAdvisor user
121257972.reviewBody: And a good experience for tourists too. The place is alive with families on Sunday evenings. A band plays in the kiosk at 5pm and there are a couple of restaurants in the plaza where you can get excellent seafood dishes. All kinds of street vendors congregates in this area, and it\'s touristy because just across the street is where you board the yacht that cruises the bay around, every day at 4:30pm. No better opportunity to embrace the local laid-back and colorful culture!!

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

120619016.name: Historic
120619016.author: a TripAdvisor user
120619016.reviewBody: Wonderful place to experience the heart of Acapulco. You can visit the church, and walk through many walkways to shop or eat.\nThere are a million birds chirping at night. Many locals sitting and relaxing.\nShort walk to Woolworth\'s and the busy traffic area.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

119661738.name: Shopping and sightseeing
119661738.author: a TripAdvisor user
119661738.reviewBody: Thei is a very nice piazza with the Church and the shopping around here is quite an experience.  The vendors are all trying to get your nusiness.  Its fun....

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

11031423.name: The Zocalo a wonderful mexican feel
11031423.author: a TripAdvisor user
11031423.reviewBody: For a very authentic mexican feel a visit to the Zocalo is a must. Its a great place to people watch which also has many local shops at extremely reasonable prices. The restaurants in this area provide great food at great prices a must for all visitors on any trip to Acapulco!!

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

5047264.name: Traditional Heart of Acapulco
5047264.author: a TripAdvisor user
5047264.reviewBody:
zMost cities/towns in Mexico of any appreciable size will have a central square, most frequently referred to as a "Zócalo."  Acapulco's  zócalo, located across the street from the Malecón and Bahia Santa Lucia, is named Plaza Juan Álvarez  - after illustrious state hero Gen. (and later President of Mexico) Juan Álvarez.

The plaza is bordered by the city's Roman Catholic cathedral - Catedral de Nuestra Senora de la Soledad, restaurants, government buildings, sidewalk café's, ice cream shops, small stores, small hotels, news stands, banks and other businesses.  It's a tree-shaded plaza that sees lazy days and busy evenings.  Saturday night's and Sunday's are the times of the week when you'll se most city residents mingling, relaxing, listening to live music, watching clowns perform, and playing with children.

No visit to a Mexican city is complete without a visit to it's Zócalo - and no visit to Acapulco will be complete without a visit to Plaza Juan Álvarez.  I’ve been visiting Acapulco for almost 25-years now, and I enjoy my visits to the plaza more and more as the years advance.

To get to the Plaza just take any bus moving along the Costera with the following words written on the windshield:  Caleta or Base.  And every taxi driver will know where to take you when you say "Zócalo."  The plaza is located a very short walk from the cruise ship terminal, so the many tourists visiting in ships are in for a treat - because it's so close.

address.streetAddress: Costera Miguel Aleman, s/n Frente al Muelle Central

673129793.name: Good to see where it all started
673129793.author: a TripAdvisor user
673129793.reviewBody: We travelled through the old town , it was good to see where it all started and see some of the great homes and hotels built here when Acapulco was probably the Jetset capital of the world. We went to the lovely main town square where there where lots of little shoe shine booths set up and people getting their shoes cleaned, this is very traditional and something you do not see very often anymore.\nAlso there is a lovely bronze statue of a shoe shiner, so this square must have a long history of shiners . Great to see, well worth a visit.

660006451.name: pleasantly surprise
660006451.author: a TripAdvisor user
660006451.reviewBody: I went to Acapulco without any expectations. I went to visit a cousin so this was the purpose of my visit. I loved it! beautiful bay with amazing view. I would go back!

625198685.name: Essential part of the tour
625198685.author: a TripAdvisor user
625198685.reviewBody: One cannot have a complete tour of Acapulco without visiting the old part of the city.  It has character which is missing from the newer glitzier portion.  You can imagine going back in time to a simpler time. Don\u2019t miss it.

581366303.name: Glad to see it but....
581366303.author: a TripAdvisor user
581366303.reviewBody: It\u2019s one of those city names which brings to mind glamour days gone by, and old movies with great stars of the past. We were driven through Acapulco from the dock area. The guide pointed out the many places of interest, including properties once owned by the rich and famous like John Wayne. It was like a trip down memory lane. The trip included the more modern parts of the city too, and there were stops for photo opportunities! Overall, the city looks quite run down, and a bit shabby. We read it wasn\u2019t a safe place to walk about so we stayed with the guide and the other sightseers. We were glad to have seen it, but that was about it. The highlight was the cliff diving show, separately reviewed.

556312821.name: Great culture and down to Earth
556312821.author: a TripAdvisor user
556312821.reviewBody: Enjoyed the local culture and nice rocky landscape and beach. Dove through SDA and had a blast. Thanks Mario!

553827413.name: No surprises, worth a visit
553827413.author: a TripAdvisor user
553827413.reviewBody: Acapulco\'s tourist hayday ended 30 years ago. Many places are in disrepair. That is part of its charm. Also, the US State department has told it\'s citizens to not visit. I\'m a US citizen and I like Acapulco because there are so few Americans. Going to a place that is filled with locals is a treat.\n

551596389.name: Trip back in time
551596389.author: a TripAdvisor user
551596389.reviewBody: It was our first time in Acapulco - and surely we wanted to see as much as possible of the city had to offer.  Our guide - Sebastian Hernandez of acapulcoforall.com - showed us most of the city and told us the history of Acapulco (and it was a lot of it). From visiting the famous part Las Brisas thru historic hotel Los Flamingos to adrenaline driven La Quebrada divers we\u2019ve seen it all - and behind all of it was a colorful stories told by Sebastian. Come and see for yourself - the Old Acapulco is fun.... save yourself a headache of driving - hire a driver like Sebastian...take advantage of tours he has to offer - you will learn a lot of history of Acapulco.

542478578.name: City on the Hills
542478578.author: a TripAdvisor user
542478578.reviewBody: Our driver and guide, Miguel Zequeida (better known as Miguel #4) at acapulcomikehome@live.com.mx gave us the grand tour of the old city and its beauty.  He explained why the city was built on the hills, its history, and how people eventually moved on to the Gold area for the beaches and other areas for the golf courses.  We felt like the city was still very lively and vibrant and represented a true Mexican city.  We stopped at a local place for lunch over the water at a place Miguel #4 said we enjoy and he was right!  Some of the best food ever1

530923338.name: great
530923338.author: a TripAdvisor user
530923338.reviewBody: The place is a throw back to the 1960 0r 1970s in the area has not changed much and that\'s the very best part

521537343.name: Market Area in Old Acapulco
521537343.author: a TripAdvisor user
521537343.reviewBody: We hired a private car and our driver took us to the old markets. Very hot and no real bargains. Our driver stayed with us the entire time.

499002230.name: Sweet Town
499002230.author: a TripAdvisor user
499002230.reviewBody: I stayed at the Zona Hotelera in Acapulco  and took a tour to the Old Acapulco and had the chance to walk around the town and get to know Local life and was impressed and amazed, I want to go back to Acapulco and stay in the old part of town, people are friendly, safe area and  great restaurants around, I liked the Zocalo there and the activities they run.

488243505.name: Shopped and went to the Flamingo Hotel
488243505.author: a TripAdvisor user
488243505.reviewBody: Took a tour with Sebastian from Acapulco for All.  He took us downtown to Old Acapulco for some souvenir shopping and up to the Flamingo Hotel which was once owned by John Wayne.  My expectations was it would have been more impressive if Hollywood stars were staying there, but it still looks like an old 60\'s resort.  The view was amazing though.

483318347.name: Same Same
483318347.author: a TripAdvisor user
483318347.reviewBody: We were disappointed in Old Acapulco.  It is very run down and we found some of the locals very depressing and approached by beggers.  They were no aggressive at all, but just seeing how many there were was disturbing.  We did have excellent very inexpensive food compared to the beach fare.  Touristy shops sold pretty much same same from shop to shop.

452408018.name: Not Much To See
452408018.author: a TripAdvisor user
452408018.reviewBody: Old Acapulco pretty much looks like any other old town in Mexico.  For the price of $ 35 for the tour, you may wish to go somewhere more exciting.

448911288.name: Drove Through On Tour
448911288.author: a TripAdvisor user
448911288.reviewBody: My family wanted to spend some time there, but the Tour did not allow us to do that.  The Fishing boats looked fun and there were many stores. I would encourage you to check it out. We were only in Acapulco two days.

446383522.name: A real taste of old town
446383522.author: a TripAdvisor user
446383522.reviewBody: We enjoyed a very interesting time around old Accopuco,  starting with a hair cut, for 3 us dollars, followed by a fantastic variety of local stalls and shops,  (be aware, a lot don\'t take us dollars, only own currency) , then we found a local bar, for a real nice cold beer, after that, we went to a local cafe for burritos. Well worth taking time out to visit and get a real feel of local life and shops. All at local prices!!

441483323.name: The Entertainment place of Accapulco
441483323.author: a TripAdvisor user
441483323.reviewBody: While visiting Acapulco, you have the beaches during the day, the many and trendy restaurants and at night, well, you have dancing everywhere. Mind your wallet as there are many pick pocket. Never be alone always in groups and definitely more than 2. Unfortunately, the city at night is not very safe

439172475.name: Enjoyable.
439172475.author: a TripAdvisor user
439172475.reviewBody: I enjoyed the taxi ride around town.  Stopped at city center for some silver shopping.  Lots of food options.

437232594.name: Very safe
437232594.author: a TripAdvisor user
437232594.reviewBody: We felt very safe walking around in the neighborhoods at night. There are military, state, and local police that are always out making a presence.

416892696.name: REVIEW OF OLD ACAPULCO
416892696.author: a TripAdvisor user
416892696.reviewBody: I visited Acapulco twice with several friends during my youthful days. Once in 1970 when we drove to Laredo, parked my car in a garage, took a taxi to the Nuevo Laredo airport where we flew to Mexico City for a two-day stay visiting the Pyramid of the Sun, Maximilian Castle, and the National Anthropology Museum. We then caught a bus to Acapulco for a 5 day stay. It was such a beautiful and scenic beach resort. We liked the trip so much that we visited Acapulco again in 1971.

403894448.name: Lots of site seeing
403894448.author: a TripAdvisor user
403894448.reviewBody: Lots of shops and cool things to see. Also some good authentic food. We went to nacho libre wrestling and flee market. We felt safe with all the police around.

390448406.name: Fascinating
390448406.author: a TripAdvisor user
390448406.reviewBody: It was interesting to see how Acapulco has grown. I loved the view from high up on the hill. Also interesting was the reduced humidity up high.

385535338.name: The Zocalo and markets
385535338.author: a TripAdvisor user
385535338.reviewBody: For 25 years we used to enjoy going to the Zocalo in the evenings to watch the old men playing checkers, and the children running around getting to know each other, the parents gossiping. Musicians strolling and playing the old Mexican songs, under some of the oldest trees I have ever seen. Sitting in the terraced cafes for supper of the yummiest authentic Mexican food. No longer. Now you can\'t see the trees or the beautiful cathedral for the noisy hawkers who litter the Plaza with filth and stalls, no more strolling without being accosted by "official" guides who lead you to the worst restaurants and markets because they get kickbacks. No more music,only filth and desperation. Don\'t bother going, it\'s gone. If the administration of Acapulco were smart, they would concentrate on the historical significance of the Old Zocalo, and make it one of the major attractions of the city. It used to be.

382030880.name: Glad I went with private driver
382030880.author: a TripAdvisor user
382030880.reviewBody: The old Acapulco Tour was interesting and glad we went, but the number of army personnel and machine guns in the streets along with the obvious poverty made us a little nervous.  Fortunately, we had engaged a private driver for the whole week and felt safe in his care.

374967023.name: I wish there were more here!
374967023.author: a TripAdvisor user
374967023.reviewBody: I took a quick drive with tour guide Arturo Ramirez Rivera (Crowne Plaza Acapulco connected me -- his company is Aca Tours) and really enjoyed seeing the neighborhoods where the likes of Frank Sinatra used to hang out. I wish there were more restoration. Flamingo Hotel is worth a stop.

365837401.name: What a view!
365837401.author: a TripAdvisor user
365837401.reviewBody: If you enjoy the history of a place and have interest in the architecture of the area, this tour is for you.  So much to see and beautiful scenery, you will really enjoy this tour.

351976289.name: Zocalo has changed
351976289.author: a TripAdvisor user
351976289.reviewBody: Spent one day and two evenings in the Zocalo and Centro areas. Did like the changes on the Zocalo but I find there are now far too many stalls selling trinkets which takes away from the reason for a Zocalo which is to meet and rest.

350928851.name: It was great seeing Old Acapulco. I had no idea there was so  much to see.
350928851.author: a TripAdvisor user
350928851.reviewBody: We had a great tour of Old Acapulco.  Sebastian Hernandez really knows all the details and gives historical background.

348804508.name: Busy, noisy, worth it!
348804508.author: a TripAdvisor user
348804508.reviewBody: If you like hustle and bustle this is your spot.  Imagining what once was is part of the charm.  mid-century houses, some in a state of disrepair block the best views of the sea.  Lots of locals from all social strata enjoying their city with the international and Mexican tourists.  Always fun to see multigenerational families on an outing.

347710007.name: It\'s an experience
347710007.author: a TripAdvisor user
347710007.reviewBody: Night and day are very different experiences, lots of people all the time, shops and vendors by day, party at night. Thanks to all the Police presence we felt safe all the time. They even had armed guards at the gas stations. We didn\'t buy much as most of the items for sale are junk ( not all) be prepared to look through a lot of stuff.

346427286.name: A relaxed feel
346427286.author: a TripAdvisor user
346427286.reviewBody: Acapulco in general is a little left behind in regards to tourism but that is why I am here, to get a real feel and not touristy. Old acapulco has a much more chilled vibe. It\'s nice to walk around and look at what it once was. The only issue is that the majority of places are closed and derelict, there isn\'t really much left to see.

336822606.name: A lot more flavor to this area than modern Acapulco
336822606.author: a TripAdvisor user
336822606.reviewBody: There is definitely more flavor to this area that many other areas in Acapulco which are a lot more modern.  So many great little places to eat and it is really not expensive.

333799350.name: A very busy and interesting place
333799350.author: a TripAdvisor user
333799350.reviewBody: Didn\'t have time to stop and wander around but there were lots of street activities and markets tons of small stores.  The driving was organized chaos.  Very tight but it flowed.  I don\'t think I could drive a car there but virtually all the drivers I saw appeared to be courteous and respectful of each other and of pedestrians.  It would be good to be able to spend a whole day wandering about.

326000883.name: Worth a visit
326000883.author: a TripAdvisor user
326000883.reviewBody: Nice to visit the old areas of Acapulco . No worries at all while walking around . The issues in Acapulco are completely over blown .Dont let them stop you exploring

320545403.name: Old Acapulco has seen better days
320545403.author: a TripAdvisor user
320545403.reviewBody: We toured this part of Acapulco with a private guide. Although it was intersting, the old part of town has seen better days. It was run down and has not been kept up over the years.

296334289.name: Old Acapulco
296334289.author: a TripAdvisor user
296334289.reviewBody: This was part of a day long private tour.  By far my favourite place to be.  The history, the buildings, the cliff views.  Absolutely amazing.  We went to the old hotel where Tarzan stayed.  We went for lunch at casual beach restaurant.

290053359.name: Acapulco is Safe and A Fascinating and Beautiful Place to Visit
290053359.author: a TripAdvisor user
290053359.reviewBody: Acapulco has been getting a lousy press these past six or seven years and not without reason as drug-induced violence has led to a spike in violence and crime. But visitors (and most are local Mexicans from the centre of the country, especially Mexico City) have not been affected and tourists can feel completely safe in this beautiful city. The setting is spectacular and the night time views over the bays are gorgeous. Try eating at one of the many restaurants that are located overlooking the bay. Must visit sites include the divers of La Quebrada; the Fort of San Diego; the few remaining hotels from the golden years of Acapulco (1940-1970) including Los Flamingos (wonderful views over the ocean) and La Boca; the beaches (of which there are nearly twenty - each with its own distinctive character); the old historic centre which is now undergoing historical restoration and remodelling (visit the Z\u00f3calo, for example). Acapulco is no longer as fashionable or popular as newer resort cities and areas  like Puerto Vallarta, Cancun, Los Cabos and the Rivera Maya, but nothing - absolutely nothing - can beat the city\'s spectacular location and views. And the range and quality of dining in Acapulco is also a major attraction.

285070201.name: Cuisine and Culture
285070201.author: a TripAdvisor user
285070201.reviewBody: We tried a cuisine excursion that included chef instruction for  a typical Mexican experience ( at a local hotel ). Quite a lot of fun and meeting new people !

274675986.name: The Old City Is Safe
274675986.author: a TripAdvisor user
274675986.reviewBody: If you don\'t frequent Acapulco I can understand the negative post but I have been going down there for 20 years and I feel more then safe in the old part of the city. I continue to walk through the flea markets, take lunch of the beaten path and continue to love this old city. Common sense and day time adventure and you will be more then safe to roam this city. Yes there are lots of police but you see that all the time now in any Mexican city you go to. If you don\'t go where you probably should not be then you will not find any trouble. No different then staying of  the East side of Detroit or the South side of Chicago.\nGo and enjoy the Jewel of the Pacific.

274498818.name: This city is showing its age, and Police everywhere
274498818.author: a TripAdvisor user
274498818.reviewBody: We were on a cruise ship that came into port for the day.   We did NOT feel safe in this city.  I am a world traveler and seen lots of cities, villages, countries and areas, but the old world charm is gone from this city.  Lots of garbage, poverty and beggars.  During the tour around the city we saw about one hundred or more police cars.  There are federal police with black  pick up trucks with machine guns mounted on the front hood, then two to four police standing in the back of the truck in camo clothing and carrying more machine guns.  These were federal police.  There were city police too in unmarked police cars.  I would never rush back to Acapulco again. I love Mexico, but this area was a complete disappointment!  We saw lots of old run down homes that the Rat pack lived in Frank Sinatra, and others from that time...no improvements have been done to any of their buildings.  Obviously the drug trade, and other illegal stuff is happening here and tourists are staying away and yes please stay away...   We saw the cliff divers which was interesting of course.  But the tour around the old part of town is awful.   I have never given a city, attraction such a low grade ever on trip advisor,  we won\'t be back - it scared us being here no thanks!

271862237.name: Old Acapulco- Dreams of Past Years
271862237.author: a TripAdvisor user
271862237.reviewBody: No tour of Acapulco would right without seeing this area. It reflects a time gone buy. Where old time celebrities stayed and partied. For instance the Flamingo Hotel, once a vibrant hideout for special guests, now is primarily used by Mexican vacationers. It was once owned by John Wayne who had his friends stay there. There are many pictures of him and other celebrities that adorn the entry Wall. You can go there and sit outside, have a drink in a relaxed and quiet atmosphere.

270438166.name: COME FLY WITH ME
270438166.author: a TripAdvisor user
270438166.reviewBody: Did you know that Frank Sinatra and the Rat Pack played in Acapulco Bay?  All around Old Acapulco we were reminded of the times the Rat Pack would party at the Casino. Had a wonderful meal at SU CASA, very romantic and a great view of the city. Not to be missed.

268406194.name: Showing its Age
268406194.author: a TripAdvisor user
268406194.reviewBody: Acapulco is largely living in its past.  I still remember as a teen visiting Acapulco 60 years ago, marveling at the divers, and the glitz of the hotels.  Its now quite faded, still there, but in need of refurbishment.

265051047.name: Good busy place
265051047.author: a TripAdvisor user
265051047.reviewBody: If you go in the month of august  you will find crowded.because of locals comes to local beaches.It is full of people

263799383.name: Yuk
263799383.author: a TripAdvisor user
263799383.reviewBody: Not to be mean....but it is old and crowded and dirty and not relaxing.  On the other hand, i am over 50\ud83d\ude33

262662249.name: Great History
262662249.author: a TripAdvisor user
262662249.reviewBody: Wonderful sites to see.   The Flamingo hotel, silver shops and market are an adventure.  Also check out the cliff divers and the chapel on the hill.

258867706.name: A Delightful Learning Experience.
258867706.author: a TripAdvisor user
258867706.reviewBody: While on a recent Norwegian STAR cruise, we chose excursion ACAS1011: Highlights, Shopping, and the La Quebrada Cliff Divers, a 5 hour Acapulco tour.Very interesting bus tour through Old Acapulco to La Quebrada to view the 7 cliff divers. We chose a viewing location nearly on eye level to the little blue shrines from which the divers congregate at the 135 foot height. This was a perfect location to record the divers climb the rock face from the waterline to the shrines at the pinnacle. From there I was able to record each of the dives, even the one that involved three men diving simultaneously--from the moment of the dive all the way to splashdown. NOTE: one can climb down (and back up) nearly 75 feet to a closer viewing position, but it honestly isn\'t necessary. Our GoPro and 400mm Canon photos are fantastic. After the show, we remained for 30 minutes at a silver shop. NOTE: when purchasing silver make sure each piece is stamped .925 or you\'ll get less than \'pure\' silver.  We then proceeded to Johnny (Tarzan) Weissmuller\'s home and his former Las Flamingos Hotel on what we were told is the highest cliff in Acapulco. Today rooms are available to tourists. We were provided free beer, soft drinks, and use of rest rooms. Although we did not stop, we drove east to the Diamante (new Acapulco); Javier, our local guide, provided lively narrative filled with past and present information about his beloved Acapulco. Those who chose accompanied Javier to the Museo Historico de Acapulco at Fuerte de San Diego.  This is a must for history buffs. The 16th century fort, in the shape of a perfect pentagram, now serves to detail Acapulco\'s lineage from it ealiest Indian inhapitants to the nation\'s independence from Spain in 1821. As far as news reports of lawlessness, let me tell you first hand. we NEVER saw any problems in the tourists areas, in fact, the locals were very courteous to us at every venue!

258265073.name: Nice buzz and lots of activity, but a bit degraded and some hit or miss food stalls and restaurants surrounding it.
258265073.author: a TripAdvisor user
258265073.reviewBody: Went to the Zocalo on our one night in Acapulco after watching the cliff divers. Strolled around for an hour or more. Ate in a "never again" restaurant right off the square which shouldn\'t be the case around the main Zocalo. Cockroaches on the wall while your eating, touching your leg - laugh or cry situation. We left quickly and got some desert and icecream around the zocalo. Again the icecream shop on the Zocalo really disappointed as did one of the stalls selling waffles/crepes with dulce de leche. We just about enjoyed the buzz but the square is very poorly kept and run down. Had a bird do the business on us to finish it off!

257281450.name: Sergio\'s city tour
257281450.author: a TripAdvisor user
257281450.reviewBody: Be sure to get Sergio for your city tour - he was excellent!  Very gracious and informative and speaks fluent English.  We had a great time and learned a lot!

253966048.name: ALL LIES...take it from ME
253966048.author: a TripAdvisor user
253966048.reviewBody: I\'m here in Acapulco for the 30th year...IN A ROW! It\';s such a shame the US news and others talk about how dangerous it is here. Well, let me tell you first hand. I have NEVER seen any problems in the tourists areas! The only problem so far is their teachers, union of course, striking by blocking some of the roads. Other then that I\'ve gone EVERYWHERE with no problems or fears. One of the news articles said population 400,000+ and divided that with deaths, 800, and came up with #3 most dangerous cities....WRONG (sounds like obummer stats) Population of Acapulco is actually way over 2 million...now divide and then think of Chicago/Washington DC!!! Where would you want to go. If you were to get REAL figures you\'d find out ACAPULCO is safer then cancun!!\nLOVE it here and feel SO sorry for all the people that make their living from tourists, wish Mexican Gov\'t would help more with advertisng and tourists/cruise ships would return....SO many of you missing a BEAUTIFUL place!!! Available anytime for questions....d e anw al @ a  o l. c o m....I wish you all were here, weather is like movie Ground Hog Day, same everyday :-) I got here Feb 3 and staying till Feb 23. God willing I\'ll be back next year again...proimo anos

250771934.name: outback tour
250771934.author: a TripAdvisor user
250771934.reviewBody: Took this tour through hotel and it was a waste of money.  It was an experience though to see how locals live

249767449.name: Acapulco needs a face lift in the middle of town
249767449.author: a TripAdvisor user
249767449.reviewBody: The entire stretch along the middle of the bay is old, tired, dirty, and congested, and it desperately  needs an overhaul. The hotels cannot charge much because the area is unpleasant. Go to the Las Brisas area on the south end if you want a nicer part of Acapulco. \nOld Acapulco is depressing. Lots of poor people selling tourist junk. My fiancee is Mexican and we love lots of small Mexican towns, even if they are poor, but we find this part of town to be uninteresting. Someone needs a vision and leadership so that this can be overhauled.

247698909.name: The real thing
247698909.author: a TripAdvisor user
247698909.reviewBody: it\'s a bit run down but bustling and colorful. One part flash back to the classic definition of "vacation" and another part adventure.

247394272.name: Yes, it\'s old
247394272.author: a TripAdvisor user
247394272.reviewBody: Once again, seeing the old town is interesting, and the mazes of flea markets a must, but it gets old (no pun intended) pretty quickly.

242024224.name: Succh a grand city.
242024224.author: a TripAdvisor user
242024224.reviewBody: Loved watching the cliff divers at night.  Unbelievable sight to behold.  Great city tat was clearly an elegant city authentic MEXICAN FOOD FROM THE COASTAL regions of Mexico.

241420144.name: No longer the way it was.
241420144.author: a TripAdvisor user
241420144.reviewBody: The old section of Acapulco has the obligatory high rise hotels but the main thoroughfare is choked with cheap eateries and every other kind of tourist trap business you can imagine.  I would never want to stay here.

239419879.name: An unforgettable experience
239419879.author: a TripAdvisor user
239419879.reviewBody: Enjoy the view of the Pacific Ocean ..... Take a  walk , explore the city , discover tradition ......eat drink ......huge lemonades  spicy food .... Lovely people who take their time to help you,  teach  you ..... mexican life ..... Take a boat trip ....  .....

227522915.name: not the same
227522915.author: a TripAdvisor user
227522915.reviewBody: We have been several times over the years.  Loved it.  Did a tour last year.  Not impressed.  We would not recommend.  Told friends and they were so disappointed.  We have fond memories but would not do again.

223536100.name: Tour by Van, guide: Rudy Acapulco
223536100.author: a TripAdvisor user
223536100.reviewBody: We visited the market, and saw the interesting things that were there that we didn\'t see in US, like the superstitious stuff that were sold there. Although they sold fresh beautiful flowers, and many tropical fruits that I didn\'t see in US. Our guide kept explaining what they were. We saw some interesting looking old buildings.

222785908.name: Bumping this up!!
222785908.author: a TripAdvisor user
222785908.reviewBody: Up until recently, this part of Acapulco has been neglected and deteriorating. The gov\'t has since poured money into it to revitalize and I felt the image is now quite acceptable and worth a visit. More work needed but good to know the gov\'t is on the right track bring life back to old Acapulco otherwise the focus will be completely shifted to the Diamond (Diamante) area that\'s further south past the Golden area.

220983682.name: avoid
220983682.author: a TripAdvisor user
220983682.reviewBody: not much to see, stay in the newest part of the city. The city center is old and underinvested for years.

200574592.name: new memories from OLD
200574592.author: a TripAdvisor user
200574592.reviewBody: Loved visiting OLD ACAPULCO via bus tour. The stop at the Cathedral downtown afforded many photos of the interior. The blue and gold vibrant colors encompassed the statues, many which might appear "scary" and sacriligious to the American born.The overall downtown area is a sight not to be missed, from the vast array of stores to the huge slices of New York style pizza at the Zocalo!

200396544.name: Some good areas some not so good.
200396544.author: a TripAdvisor user
200396544.reviewBody: We toured this area with a guide, recommended. We ate at the place that was a staying place for many a Hollywood celebrity. John Wayne, Red Skelton etc., it was older but cool to imagine those folks hanging out there. Can\'t remember the name of it however, the food wasn\'t that stellar anyway. It did have a great ocean view though.

199987732.name: That\'s where our hotel is located
199987732.author: a TripAdvisor user
199987732.reviewBody: Went there almost every day.  Flea Market every weekend.  Lots of stuff to buy and good prices.  Always very busy on weekendsl

196216148.name: Spectacular!!
196216148.author: a TripAdvisor user
196216148.reviewBody: Great history,  Make sure you do it with Benjamin Alarcon.  He\'s the best Licensed Tour Guide.  Gotta visit the Chapel to see the awesome views of the Old City.  You will also see the homes of Hollywood\'s celebs!

196046820.name: Old time Acapulco a must visit
196046820.author: a TripAdvisor user
196046820.reviewBody:
Yes it's old and rustic and in certain parts dirty but old/traditional Acapulco is a must visit when visiting this city. 

Starting with centro/Zocalo where you have the cathedral built back in the 60's as a backdrop for a movie you have restaurants and shops and families gathering in the evenings for shows or other musical venues. 

Purchase you souvineers here at a fraction of what you will pay in other parts of town. 

After the zocalo hop a bus to Playa Caleta and sample the local foods and people who visit here in wide numbers daily. The restaurant La Cabana is widely visited by snowbirds and tourists alike and serves up some terrific seafood. 

Now hop a cab and head up the hill to the hotel Los Flamingos. This is where it all began back in the late 40's and 50's when the hotel was owned by many from hollywood especially John Wayne and Johnny Weissmueller. The hotels view is 2nd to none with an unobstructed view of the pacific. In the winter months if your fortunate you can see whales from the patio while sipping on their wonderful and potent margaritas. 

The hotel has seen better days but it makes you imagine just what it was like when all the big time celebrities were there. There is a wall of fame there and they have pictures of anyone who has been there. Most recently Halle berry and John Travolta have visited this city. 

Acapulco is making a comeback slowly but surely 2014 was a rebound year for sure.

192379867.name: Hotel Los Flamingos
192379867.author: a TripAdvisor user
192379867.reviewBody: Our driver took us here for a sunset view prior to the La Quebrada cliff divers viewing from the La Perla Restaurant.  Flamingos is an old one story lodging, gift shop, bar & restaurant right next to Johnny Weismuller\'s former residence.  It sits above the ocean with an unobstructive sunset view.  Off-season made for ample seating in the patio lounge area.  It is quaint, small and very peaceful.

191773738.name: Got to see!!!
191773738.author: a TripAdvisor user
191773738.reviewBody: Get to the old cathedral, huge park, and the very heart of Acapulco.  Lots of restaurants, mostly filled with Canadians staying for the winter.  Very safe to walk around.  Clowns often person in the central area, and crowds of several hundred people may come.

190600308.name: the best part
190600308.author: a TripAdvisor user
190600308.reviewBody: take a tour of the old Acapulco and mate stop and buy a place :)\nyou have quite a few 1950 hotels and houses.

188574439.name: Beautiful!
188574439.author: a TripAdvisor user
188574439.reviewBody: First of all, If you are from the united states, Do not try to drive yourself!!  Get a driver.  Senor Baldo Gomez.  Very reasonable and he is eager to show you the things you want to see not the stuff the tourism bureau wants you to see.  My family and I felt very safe. We cannot wait to go back and see more!!!!

181330612.name: STAY AWAY!
181330612.author: a TripAdvisor user
181330612.reviewBody: Please rethink your desire to visit Acapulco right now. It is dangerous and the Policia are corrupt. We were pulled over by two uniformed police officers in their police car and shook down for our cash. It was noon on a Thursday afternoon. A horrifying experience. They trumped up charges that we drove through a yellow light and nearly ran over lots of pedestrians! Such liars! The fine was $8,000 pesos! I have visited all over Mexico since I was 5 years old (for 50 years) and I will not go back any time soon. When we share this story with others, everyone has their own nightmare story to share.  So sad. Mexico was an awesome place to visit. No more. Not in the immediate future ~ if at all. They need to clean up their act first.

178116390.name: Interesting
178116390.author: a TripAdvisor user
178116390.reviewBody: If you go to Acapulco you have to visit the old Acapulco to hepl you understand how much Acapulco has changed and why?\nLovely!

176178062.name: Friendly, safe and great seafood
176178062.author: a TripAdvisor user
176178062.reviewBody: A must go, all there are very friendly and eating frsh fish a must an much cheaper, barato, then at a tourist resteraunt

175313532.name: Isla Montosa
175313532.author: a TripAdvisor user
175313532.reviewBody: You have to go to Barra Vieja and take a boat ride to the island. Go and meet with Aldegundo Estevez for the very best mezcal and red snapper cooked the local way . The views of the lagoon as well as the food and drinks will make you have a true feeling you are in paradise

171755619.name: We felt very safe
171755619.author: a TripAdvisor user
171755619.reviewBody: The drive through the old Acapulco was like taking a trip back in time. Interesting to see the shops and visited the Silver Mine and Shop.

161103017.name: Shopping in Old Alcapulco
161103017.author: a TripAdvisor user
161103017.reviewBody: A wonderful stop on your visit, the shops are plentiful and numerous bargains. The merchants are very friendly and love to barter. An opportunity to view the many fine handcrafted goods and wears of the people of Mexico.

157435839.name: Going Local, down in Acapulco!
157435839.author: a TripAdvisor user
157435839.reviewBody:
We were due in here at 12 noon, by sea, but in calm water, the pilot fell off his boat between that and ours, and had to be fished out and hospitalised with two broken ribs!   This caused a delay of 90 minutes until a fresh pilot could be found.  This worked to our advantage because we did not sail until 22.00 instead of the planned 17.30, for which we were most grateful.  

They are currently rebuilding a new cruise terminal, so the approach to the old town was fraught with diggers, cranes, and holes in the road.  However we managed to reach the old town and walked round the market district, taking in the shops and street vendors, before finding an Internet café for US$1 for one hour!  We took a cab to a cafe right round the bay on top of a promontory with a very good view of the whole bay and our ship.  We had been recommended to visit Senor Frog’s bar but at 5.45pm it was dead.  This seemed to sum up Acapulco, where several other bars to which we had been recommended had closed down due to lack of business.  The local taxis are mainly old style VW beetles, in varying states of decrepitude.  Ours was no exception.  The driver said it dated from 1992, but its rust and lack of power on the hills suggested maybe 1972!   

We finished the day in Acapulco by going to Quebrada to see the divers who have one performance around 1 pm, and three shows later at night in the dark.  They charge 40 pesos (USD4) to watch the performance, paid in advance to a guy selling tickets.  People dispersed when the ticket seller came round. Our vantage point was a public viewing area built on one side of the small bay where the divers jump from a different side.  There was piped music and a Spanish commentary.  The youngest diver was 7 years old, about which his proud grandmother, who was standing next to us, informed us.  They dive from three different stages from the cliff, and reach these by climbing up the cliff face from the sea.  Although being told the performance would be at 7pm, then 7.20pm, the show actually started at 7.40pm.  This performance is quite impressive, not least because of the height of the cliffs from which they jump, but also due to the narrow gap between the cliffs into the sea.

Overall, Acapulco disappointed.  The fact that this had once been the resort of the great and the good was remarkable, until one remembers we are talking about the 1950’s and 1960’s, and time moves on. This was no glitzy resort but bore the hallmarks of a tourist destination from which the tourists (foreign, at least) had gone.  This is perhaps a shame because at no time did we feel threatened or intimidated.  What was surprising was how few locals had any command of the English language

154503536.name: Sunny Acapulco!!
154503536.author: a TripAdvisor user
154503536.reviewBody:
I just came back from acapulco yesterday! For my sisters wedding!  At (la Campernerio villa)!!!!!! we went with over 50 people! and I have to say the city it self was amazing!! so much to do!! and Safe!!! we walked around off our hotel (crown Plaza) almost everynight!! we went to the corners store (oxxo) ice cream stores! little salsa bars on the main strip, the best food is OFF the Resort or Hotel!! hands down you will get your authentic food OFF the resort!!we went to Barba Roja's!! Fantastic resturaunt right on the main strip! La playita- also another amazing beach resturant off the main srtip!! faboulous food!! seafood! red snapper, jumbo shrimp! tacos!! and much more!! both a must see!!!!! 

we also went out to 2 nightclubs! alot of fun!! the night life atmosphere in Acapulco is incredible!! one was called LOVE  great music a mix of everything, this nightclub is one of the most expensive ones in Acapulco roughly 40 cover but worth it!! the veiw is breathtaking!,  next to BABYO'S!  The other one was call MANDALA again very nice atmosphere!! they even had white chiffon drapping in the bathrooms on every wall! very elegant fun and safe!!! i cant stress enough that we all felt safe, and I believe if you go looking for trouble you will find it ANYWHERE!!!! 

We took taxis everywhere, all of them spoke english, were very kind and helpful! fast drivers lol but its said that Acapulco has less accidents then all of Ontario!! 

The weather is always guarenteed!!!! Hense its Famous Name SUNNY ACAPULCO! the beaches are beautiful!! life gaurds out everyday! the ocean is one of the stronger oceans but very "swimable" yes there are venders on the beach, they come up to you and ask if you want to buy what there are selling, usually nice things, bathing suits,sungalsses, silver, and all you have to say is "yes or no thank you! not a big deal. 

Tipping in Acapulco, 15%!! anywhere!! it is the same like here. they work just as hard or harder for that matter! 

 Old Town Acapulco is where you want to stay to experience the Famous Sunny Acapulco!! 
there is so much to see and do here!! you wont be at your hotel or resort much!! go off experience!! 
must see places that I know off..
The main Strip- La Costera
Barba Rojas- Reasturant/dancing
La Playita- beach resturant
Flea market!!! 
The Ocean!!
Ci Ci 's -wave pool!
professional Golf coures
Roquetta island!! you take a glass bottom boat over to the island, about a 10 min boat ride from the marina. theres small resturants on the island, very calm waters, boats come back and forth to go back all the time. must see!!
The horse carriage rides!! you'll see! only in Acapulco!!
Baikal- 5 star platinum award winning resturant-
the night clubs!! Babyo's ,Love, Mandala, Paladium!! many mant more!! just ask the taxi cab what is good that night and what your looking for!! 
Senor Frogs The Reall one!! 

I hope you get a chance to experience Acapulco Mexico and have a faboulous trip as we did!!
Adios!!

If you used to go to Acapulco and loved it! you will feel the same when you go back!! If you have never been you are in for a treat!!!!

154342042.name: My place
154342042.author: a TripAdvisor user
154342042.reviewBody: This is where you will find the Gran Mercado and lots of other great place for shopping for local goods.  One of my first stops in Acapulco each year is Wadi where I purchase fresh ground coffee roasted to my personal taste.

125077149.name: An old time view of the town
125077149.author: a TripAdvisor user
125077149.reviewBody: our taxi driver, and tour guide (certified) Baldo, took us on this wonderful tour of the city including the old town. The true local Acapulco is rift with history, stories, and the true city view. It was very interesting to hear the stories of the town as it grew up. Baldo is full of fantastic information, and the true Acapulco is a memory that we will keep with us, UNTIL we return again.

124440510.name: This is heaven!!
124440510.author: a TripAdvisor user
124440510.reviewBody: Only place you can go in the winter, that the weather is guarenteed. Reasonably priced, great service!  Very friendly, "old" town Mexico, we stay on the beach in this area.

123655237.name: Acapulco, Mexico
123655237.author: a TripAdvisor user
123655237.reviewBody:
The area is very dirty and not comfortable.  People offered to give us a tour and wouldn't take no for an answer.  They were very persistent and followed us until we were firm.

We did walk to see the cliff divers.  The walk itself was long, hot and through some rough looking areas.  In addition, the walk includes steep hills.  Better to take a taxi if you go on your own.  However, we were happy we went to see the divers on our own because we were able to go in the morning.  I heard that some people booked the excursion and the divers had already begun their dives.  I'm not sure about the accuracy of this.

The heat was intense so be sure to bring water.

The divers put on a wonderful show.  

This is not a port that we want to go back to.  It's not the dream spot that it was years ago.

122048495.name: Old and Beautiful
122048495.author: a TripAdvisor user
122048495.reviewBody: Great old buildings winding streets for a nice wlking adventure

121679710.name: Take it or leave it
121679710.author: a TripAdvisor user
121679710.reviewBody: The flea market isn\'t worth it - they just hassle you to buy somethig, but the rest is fine

119966701.name: It\'s Safer than you read !!!!!
119966701.author: a TripAdvisor user
119966701.reviewBody:
We had our first trip to Acapulco Oct 24-30. It was Beautiful ! and we felt safe.!
The vendors on the beaches were appreciative of our presence and were not too aggressive. The Federal police are everywhere- on motorcycles, in the air, boats, trucks and cars. But even they were friendly, welcoming us and our business.
We went to see the cliff diving twice. Ate at El Perla. Food was okay, service should have been better, but the view is fantastic.
The violence and drug activity is not in town. The police & local business people have tried to keep that from happening. The towns people arfe taking their city back.
Please Assist Them- take a vacation to the Pearl of Mexico = ACAPULCO

116318975.name: Need a Safe driver in Acapulco?  Call him, Speaks perfect English!
116318975.author: a TripAdvisor user
116318975.reviewBody: My husband, his sister, her two sons and I had a wonderful & safe time because of Roberto Alarcon.  From the time we got our luggages and passes through customs,  guess what, Roberto was there!  It was amazing, boy did we feel welcome to Acapulco the Mexican way.  My husband emailed Roberto to robertoairey@yahoo.com.mx and was in touch with him right before we left the US with how many was in our family.  Just like Roberto said, he will be there outside of the terminal door.  We gave him a description of our family and he greeted us with a jubilant smile.  My sister in-law was so impressed with how professional he was.  He will work with you as you plan out the week of your visit.  His prices are well worth it and he was an honest man.  We especially LOVED the jungle tour in the Mangroves and dinner on the local beach eating fresh caught Red Snapper.  It was great seeing how and where the locals lived and the wild life that I never knew existed in Acapulco.  Just in case if you wanted to know we stayed at the Grand Mayan.

115426749.name: Roberto Alarcon
115426749.author: a TripAdvisor user
115426749.reviewBody: call this guy an you can see anything in and around Acapulco from great fish to rattle Snake and the snake is great in a little old mexican town and they cook aa lot of different things on and open fire in a killer sauce. Ask reberto about Tamales as they were great on the road side stop. and would you know no one got sick from eating any place he took us and some are really not some place you would go or know about with out him. He is the best and we have been there for the last 4 years or so and would never go with out calling him should i say email him he will return you mail very fast. he did work in the US for many years. bit loved Acapulco and had to get back and well he know every place to go even if you do not know where to go let him pick the place bet you will love the place.

82671073.name: Awesome to experience
82671073.author: a TripAdvisor user
82671073.reviewBody: If you go to Acapulco, spend time in Old Acapulco....La Quebrada (cliff divers) was so exciting and Fort San Diego had some interesting old sights (plus pop and water for 5cents). Zocalo had some great shopping sites and great restaurants with cold beer and real Mexican food.
